reviews.text: We arrived from our cruise ship and the scene in front of us of the facade of multicoloured buildings was very impressive.When we got up close an indeed ventured up some of their side lanes the character of the buildings and the different elements to each building became apparent.

reviews.title: Must have Photo!
reviews.text: Bryggen is a smallpart of Bergen. Founded by the Hanse, the historic German trader society. In the small colourful houses are shops and restaurants and lot things to buy for tourists.

reviews.title: Charming Renovated/Replaced Historic Buildings - Get the Tour!
reviews.text: How do you describe door entries left leaning after a WW II bomb went off, or stairways that are so warped and bent that you wonder how they are still standing and tourists are still using them? This area is steeped in history, and begs for the details imparted in the Bryggen Museum walking tour. And, if you can get beyond the "all the same, really" souvenir shops, there are some outstanding local artists housed in the alleys between the historic trade houses. Enjoy!

reviews.title: TRULY HOME TO ICONIC PHOTOS
reviews.text:
The old town wharf buildings are original, colorful, and iconic. The three blocks, have been converted to pubs, restaurants and gift shops, 
On a good day their outdoor, seaside cafes present a great opportunity to relax with a cold beer, wine, or soft drink.
Beware of Cruise Ship days!
This area alone represents the main reason most will visit Bergen.

reviews.title: So interesting!
reviews.text: We had a local guide walk us through this area and give us great information.  Now they are in the process of rebuilding the buildings as they are sinking.  They are being rebuilt in the same manner which they were originally built.  Many different kinds of shops are in the buildings now.  It is a busy area but fun to walk around.

reviews.title: The best part of Bergen
reviews.text:
Certainly a place not to miss, quite unique.

There are upstairs bits too, be sure not to miss them but the stairs are steep.

reviews.title: Love this Area!
reviews.text: This was a second visit to Bergen for us and, as before, it did not disappoint.  The wharf area is a wonderful place to wander.  Old historic buildings, museums, shopping, food, and a wonderful view of the entire area.  If you are in Bergen, give yourself a a couple of hours (at least) to wander around this wonderful area.  You won't be disappointed.

reviews.title: Quaint and picturesque, full of life!
reviews.text: We travelled to Norway with our 12 year old grandson and our time in Bergen was limited, but we all enjoyed walking along this wharf, admiring the buildings.     We wanted to take him upto the Bergenhus Fortress and Museum, what a disappointment that it was already too late after our NIN day and upto Floibanen Funicular.   Our grandson fell in love with the Bryggen house models and bought quite a few for his collection.

reviews.title: Old Norway
reviews.text: Very Quaint, liked the old buildings , transported you to a different age, plenty of opportunity to buy gifts and knick knacks, might be a little difficult for the less abled as lots of tricky stairs in shops , but the outside is very pleasant with places to sit and chat restaurants in the area and toilets.

reviews.title: Hanseatic museum and wharf
reviews.text: Must cruise through the area. Hanseatic museum is awesome walk back through time. My suggestion when they pass the cod around do not sniff it... it will linger a bit...Also the Unicorn restaurant has amazing local food and is very unassuming. Recommended to us by a local. Just of the Wharf is a delicious Pasty shop and a great coffee tea and beer bar where locals handle out and chat and play games. I got whooped at backgammon but it was fun

reviews.title: Story book
reviews.text: Beautiful place, very good shopping a unesco hertiage site where you can spend a few hours browsing through the shops, having coffee.

reviews.title: Travel in history
reviews.text: Beautiful Bryggen is worth a visit even though it is often crowded with tourist groups. Be sure to walk down the narrow hallways to explore all the old wooden buildings. There are several restaurants and shops.

reviews.title: Pretty harbour
reviews.text: Bergens historic centre is a beautiful place, with colourful timber buildings tumbling down the hill to the sea. Relax and enjoy

reviews.title: Lovely atmosphere
reviews.text: The old buildings are a joy to watch. But take of of the timing as it's abviously often very crowded with tourists and cruise ships

reviews.title: Late afternoon visit is quieter when cruise ships in town
reviews.text: Of course, a must see/do if in Bergen but if possible, try to time your stroll around either v early or later in the day when the cruise tourists return to their ship.  Lots of souvenir shops selling overpriced stuff - we only looked in 1 or 2...anything of reasonable quality seemed ridiculously expensive.  We found the parks, historic walks and museums a short distance away from the waterfront more interesting and informative.  The seafood market is so popular (again expensive) but again better prices, like most towns/cities, a few blocks away.

reviews.title: Old Hanse feeling
reviews.text: You can walk along the Hanse quarter with narrow streets and old wooden houses. There is also a hanseatic museum with excellent exhibition. Tip: take the guided tour through Bryggen.

reviews.title: nice!
reviews.text: nice old section of Bergen most buildings from around 1703.the many tourist shops in these buildings are quite expensive as you would expect.

reviews.title: Old historic houses
reviews.text: Easy to walk round and historically interesting to learn about the Hanseatic league. The houses are cute and wooden and many are now shops, bars or restaurants. Very photogenic area.

reviews.title: Love the charm and history - very touristy
reviews.text: Its a wonderful walk down the alleys of history and see the old fishermen houses. Its definitely worth spending a couple of hours after a stroll along the harbor.

reviews.title: Great walkable area
reviews.text: Worth your time for both the history as well as the architecture. We used a self-guided walking tour which worked well

reviews.title: Incredible history
reviews.text: What a fabulous place to wander - down the little lanes between these historic buildings. We just loved it!

reviews.title: Too touristy
reviews.text: The collection of buildings along the wharf is aesthetically appealing, but is ruined by its commercialism.  The area is crowded and overly touristy, with most of the buildings housing shops selling the same tired souvenirs.

reviews.title: All happening here
reviews.text: Funicular to mountain top view, fish market, hanseatic museum, Burger King Mcdonald all with in 5 minutes from this. Great gathering of all the languages, Chinese to English to Spanish.

reviews.title: Neat area, check out the Hanseatic museum, lots of cool shops
reviews.text: Make sure to go down the alleys for the best shops - furs and hides, art, woolen goods, etc. Also plenty of souvenier shops. Make sure to visit the Hanseatic museum to learn the history of the Bryggen.

reviews.title: Lots of shops
reviews.text: Walking along the Bryggen Hanseatic Wharf is well worth doing while you're in Bergen - it's free, there's lots to see, and the colorful buildings are charming.  We really enjoyed the fish market.  The area can be very crowded if there are several ships in port, so be forewarned.  I don't care about shopping so can't comment on the quality of the stores, but can say there are a lot of them.

reviews.title: Walk and mobility scooter ride in the Bryggen area.
reviews.text:
This is a great place to visit - only a few minutes from where the cruise ships dock. If you keep to the waterside the cobbles are not so bad but over near the shops they are very bumpy and lots of the shops are inaccessible to scooters.
I love the back pathways with the wooden houses. There are places to have a drink outside. We had wonderful weather when we were there. But good idea to take a waterproof.
The houses have various wooden carvings outside and also plaques showing the guilds belonged to. This is a Hanseatic League port and steeped in History. I have included some pictures of the narrow walkways.  
This is such an Interesting town to visit. The funicular is signposted.  There are very long waits when, say, five ships are in like they were the day we visited The walk up to the top is strenuous, but worth the effort.

reviews.title: Great place to stroll...
reviews.text: Colorful wooden houses (you've surely seen in photographs) line the Main Street at the Bryggen Wharf. There are lots of shops, restaurants, and people roaming and enjoying the boats that dock at the sea. There's a fish market, the Hanseatic Museum (worth it!), and the funicular is quite close by. There is even a McDonalds and Starbucks for those who can't do without it. You'll see lots of young people running, biking, and blading in the area. It's a wonderful place to spend the day. The architecture is old and wooden- you wonder how it is still standing. A lovely place.

reviews.title: Beautiful walk
reviews.text: It's lovely to get a drink and chill by some of the bars/cafes here. The view is really gorgeous. This is the heart of Bergen city, so you must check it out!

reviews.title: A glimpse of Bergen's Colorful Past
reviews.text: We walked through Bryggen every day that we were visiting Bergen in June 2018. In many ways it is the heart of the city and a reflection of its historic roots. The Bryggen Walking Tour that we took was very helpful to understanding the significance of what we were seeing. The restoration of historic buildings is impressive, as is the determination to retain the city's historic identity. The many restaurants and shops also make this a lively area both in the day and in the evening. However, when large cruise ships dock nearby, the area can become crowded with tour groups.

reviews.title: Explore on foot
reviews.text:
Visited here whilst on a Fred Olsen cruise - did our own thing on foot 

Make sure you allow a couple of hours as to wind your way through all the narrow passages and alleyways and explore all the shops and museums 

Nearby is the fish market - which is also worth a visit - sample everything on offer salmon, whale, caviar etc

reviews.title: A touristy feel for the old town
reviews.text:
Bryggen has been restored to what feels like a snippet straight out of the history books.   There are shops and pubs built into these old structures, and it makes for an enjoyable couple of hours.  It's kind of like spending a couple of hours in a historically reconstructed shopping mall.   

There are just a couple of spots in this district that can bring you back.  For example, you'll find Tracteursted Resturaunt all the way to the back, and even just stepping into the hallway to use their restrooms gives you a bit of the original feel.    And the Theta Museum give the cramped feel as if you're in the resistance from early last century.  But otherwise, it's as if you're in a historic shopping mall.

Actually, you would have seen a model of this if you ever went to Disney's Epcot.  Their Norway exhibit was meant to look like Bryggens.   While the real Bryggens is, of course, much more impactful - it's hard to learn more from it than from visiting Epcot.

We found the Bryggens Museum (a modern building just in front of St. Mary's) to, on the other hand, be a wealth of knowledge, and it has pilings from the original district.   Better yet, find your way to the Old Bergen Museum a couple kilometers north of the city, and its buildings as well as actors are designed to make you feel as if you fell back in time a couple hundred years.   If you have just a little time to spend in town and are interested in history, find your way to these two museums.

reviews.title: Good, but very busy
reviews.text: If you are in Bergen it's worth seeing, however there are loads of cruise ship tourists there and it makes it difficult to walk around. The Wharf is very pretty though and worth checking out.

reviews.title: Where you as a tourist will join all the other tourists
reviews.text: It's picturesque and THE tourist spot in Bergen...so jump on in and enjoy the views and the tourist shops.

reviews.title: Nice view and open air market
reviews.text: You can pass your lunch time here. Nice cruise boats, motor boats and sailboats are docked here. You can get your lunch here made in front of you from fresh sea products. You can also buy whale, deer and moose sausages in the market.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Very unique place with beautiful architecture makes Hanseatic Wharf main tourist attraction. I was disappointed to see so many gift shops occupying these beautiful houses. It is worth to check out alleys between these colorful houses.

reviews.title: Interesting historic remnants
reviews.text: This is a collection of centuries old buildings that are interesting if you are into history. Although the street frontage is interesting (the buildings are no longer even vaguely square), the real jewels are found by walking back into the collection.

reviews.title: Fascinating area best experienced with a guide
reviews.text: Choose your time to visit this fascinating group of shops, houses and laneways. This is a very busy tourist area and a target for cruise ship passengers who disembark not far away. Go early in the morning or in the late afternoon. If possible go with a guide as, if you are like me, you would not know much about the Hanseatic merchants who created this area. Without the history one would not fully appreciate what there is to see.

reviews.title: Charming harbour with colourful old wooden buildings
reviews.text: Row upon row of crooked wooden merchant buildings line the harbour in Bergen. Picture perfect .The city was an important trade route for hundreds of years.  I wasn’t familiar with the history of the Hanseatic Merchants but found this all very interesting.  We took a 2-hour guided tour to bring us up to speed. The winding alleyways and historic buildings – a glimpse into a bygone era. There are some nice shops to explore as well.  TIP: if you want a great photo spot go directly across the harbour where the ferry boats leave from

reviews.title: Fascinating, Fun and Educational
reviews.text: How this wonderful setting has been preserved, knowing it is the nth rebuild, is beyond me.  The old jam-packed wooden structures are ripe for fire danger as all the talk by guides of the Bergen fire serves hint. Bergen is a must-see world city and this specific grouping is on the list.

reviews.title: Like walking into the past
reviews.text: Historic city walk in Bryggen.  This was a highlight of our trip to Norway.  Narrow alleys with hidden shops and historic markers.

reviews.title: Heart of town
reviews.text: You simply have to visit this place while in Bergen...right at the centre of town you can walk around it with all the colourful buildings lining along plus some ongoing construction work...you will find cafes, restaurants, nightclubs, shops...list just goes on. Very picturesque place.

reviews.title: The Hanseatic Wharf is a lovely area in which to Stroll
reviews.text: I do seem to remember strolling along the Hanseatic Wharf in Bergen, wondering what had changed since our last visit.

reviews.title: Fish market, eateries and shops, Fun area to explore
reviews.text: Hope you like the smell of Fish, but its all about the fish, and some Reindeer or Moose sausage as well!! Lots of seafood options, lots of photo opportunities. The residential area is also great to walk around and learn about how they live. THe shops are amazing and not cheap. Great souvenir opportunities, I did find a cheap discounted souvenir shop on a side street (the large clear sign advertising it on the main drag led me there ) and I found lots  of discounted souvenirs for those back home. We went on a nice weather day, which helped us stroll around leisurely. There are shops with Moose heads mounted by their doors. You can spend a day or more exploring if thats your thing, we were there a few hours and thoroughly enjoyed it. Brought another dimension to our Norway trip.

reviews.title: Picturesque Bergen
reviews.text: This if the area that Bergen is famous for and a must for every visitor.  The old colorful wooden buildings are historic and it is a must to wander through the alleyways into the back of them

reviews.title: A piece of history
reviews.text:
Beautifully preserved buildings on the dock. Wander through and see the way folks lived 200 years ago. 
Better yet, go to the Bryggen museum and book a tour of the area - NOT listed on TA.

reviews.title: Beautiful old buildings!
reviews.text: Nice area to stroll and have a cup of coffee and perhaps a fresh pastry.  The shops are aimed toward tourists but have some beautiful sweaters.

reviews.title: Beautiful iconic location.
reviews.text: World Heritage site.  Stunning location.  Expensive so take lots Norwegian Krone if shopping.  Euro generally not accepted but credit cards welcome.  If visiting various cruise ports recommend Cruise pass Norway for discounts benefits card in cruise ports.  Weather changeable so dress for all eventualities.

reviews.title: Pretty and Fun
reviews.text: The Bryggen Wharf meets you as you arrive in Bergen if you arrive on a cruise. It is a great introduction. The area is colorful, historic, and fun. There are plenty of places to eat and souvenir shops. Many of the shops offer the same things for purchase, but some offer climate appropriate clothing featuring local styles as well. You can spend as much time as you want there, but an hour or two should do it unless you are dining and shopping. The area also offers great views of the harbor and is in close proximity to the Fish Market.

reviews.title: Go there yes go
reviews.text:
From distance you will think of Nyhavn in Copenhagen and they are from the Hanseatic time actually related, nice.
Bit tourist trap yes, but it is so cool to see the small wood alleys and the stairs up and down like a labyrinth, then on the bottom level on backside there is lots of cute craft shops so all in all you don´t mind the trap bit.  
Is absolutely a nice visit, go there.

reviews.title: Tourist-ridden But Charming
reviews.text:
I'm a tourist in this town.  No escaping that fact.  There are many, MANY other tourists here as well.  That makes things crowded and noisy, and not as relaxed as one might wish.  No escaping those facts either.  There are the usual "chic" and "cute" and overpriced shops, tours, and attractions.  That said...

Bryggen is a visually wonderful slice of history that has been remarkably well-preserved and honored.  The buildings and alleys and streets all retain the sense of 16th century life-- wood showing the effects of Norwegian weather or rails  shiny from how many hands? Uneven floors in crowded houses that were also used for offices. Original nails and bolts. And, of course, the water and the boats and ships and kayaks.  Merchants doing business (well, OK, the t-shirts and crocheted moose baby booties might not be just like the "old days" may be pushing the envelope of authenticity, but still....)

Several museums in the area add to the richness of the visitors experience; we especially enjoyed the Hanseatic Museum (Be sure to take the guided tour that's available with the visit at no extra charge-- it's brief, but very interesting and helpful.)

reviews.title: It's in the Center Of Bergen & You Won't Miss It
reviews.text: This is the center of everything here in Bergen, building, shops, tourist junk store and so much more. The photo opportunities are fantastic. No matter what side of the harbor you're on there is something to see. You'll find restaurants, artist and art shops and ships big and small. Water taxi's going in a few different directions. It's a gorgeous picturesque area and you will want to see it.

reviews.title: Cosy area. Mostly tourist shops
reviews.text: The area itself is really cosy. Lots of old beautiful buildings. It is not big and centrally located so take half and hour or so to check it out. The shops are mostly tourist shops

reviews.title: A time travel to the past
reviews.text: I walked through the narrow lanes between the Bryggen wooden houses: the intense smell of wood, the wooden stairs and ancient merchants houses are all great. This is the only surviving Hanseatic building area in Europe. Some old houses are indeed tilted. Most of these ancient houses are now nice shops of local craftsmen. The atmosphere reminds absolutely of an ancient past of merchants and stockfish trading.

reviews.title: Must visit this neighborhood
reviews.text: We came here after going up the funicular to the mountain and after visiting St Mary’s church. The beautiful houses here were turned into amazingly big shops for local artists, coffee shops and restaurants. Some of the houses are still being Renovated. It was a beautiful place to visit.

reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.text: Everything you could want from an attraction.  Natural and architectural beauty, local food and customs.  So many stores and restaurants.  And everything wonderfully maintained and carefully staffed.

reviews.title: Totally amazing!!
reviews.text:
Stunning
Amazing
So peaceful and we just walked through the ancient timber streets. You could almost just feel the history!!

reviews.title: Need time here
reviews.text: This is one of Bergen's hidden treasures.  I had no idea there were so many little shops behind and within the buildings!  Found it very quaint and unique.  Was well worth the time.

reviews.title: Historic shopping district in downtown Bergen. Very enjoyable for a leisurely stroll.
reviews.text: This is the historic shopping district in Bergen.  All original (some rebuilt after a fire).  Enjoy a leisurely stroll through history and take advantage of shops offering authentic Norwegian items (knit sweaters, fashionable fur hats for women, etc.).  There are many coffee shops and eateries serving authentic Norwegian food. A must-do while in Bergen.  Always take an umbrella, as Bergen is notorious for rain!

reviews.title: Lots of Construction
reviews.text: The buildings are unique in that they are leaning somewhat in places and some of the stairways are very interesting to say the least. Several of the buildings have construction going on to make them safer.  The fish market is unique and the two dinners we had were excellent.  The seafood is fresh every day.

reviews.title: History is calling
reviews.text:
I was there on a wonderful sunny day, after two days of raining cats and dogs. 
It’s absolutely a must see in Bergen! The old houses are so colorful and you’re allowed to get in and just look around. Some of the houses are shops. There selling everything (clothes, food, jewelry). There are a lot of tour guards which are able to speak in every language you can imagine. I was sitting in a garden behind the houses and I was lucky because a German guard stopped right next to me telling his group everything about Bryggens history :D  
Of course there are many tourists dependent on day and weather.

reviews.title: Spend a little time or spend an entire evening
reviews.text: The area has so many neat restaurants, buildings, shops, and the fish market. It is a great place to wrap up the day. The menus all seemed similar and so was the view, so it was hard to choose a restaurant. But the highlight was not the food as much as the ambiance and the opportunity to people watch.

reviews.title: Bryggen Hanseatic Wharf, Bergen
reviews.text:
This is definitely a non-smoking attraction because everything is made of wood! Our guide told us a story of a tourist who was fined the equivalent of €35,000 for smoking with the grounds - he could have destroyed and UNESCO site and the most historic part of the city.

Our guide also told us the history of the place, and about it being set up as a trading post for, among other things fish and especially cod, by the (German) Hanseatic League. It was also a place restricted to men and boys only - many teenagers would come to Bergen to work for the League (and work only) for a few years, by which time they had business experience and had earned/saved enough money to return and get married.

The buildings are still the original ones which we built after the great fire in 1702 which destroyed pretty much all of the city and are still in remarkably good condition, and from the front, along the harbour front you can see the different colours on the what are now shop- and restaurant-fronts, built in the distinctive 'tall, thin and pointy' architectural style.

Well worth a visit!

reviews.title: Great history, really cool spot!
reviews.text:
UNESCO world heritage site and really cool to walk through the buildings. The shops seem to be a tourist trap, but still great to see the famous row of houses from the harbor and walk the alleyways. 

Still a must see while in Bergen but you won’t necessarily have to spend a ton of time here.

reviews.title: Interesting trading history
reviews.text: This is an interesting site as an early international trading place. The place is very busy as Bergen has a lot of tourist for the size of the city.

reviews.title: Great Historical Insights into early Bergen
reviews.text: We hadn’t heard of this, prior to visiting. It was really good. It is amazing to actually be in buildings that were built 500-600 years ago! The Museum takes you back to a time when things were very hard, but very predictable in many ways. An impressive assortment of life ‘back then’

reviews.title: Great place to visit
reviews.text: Really nice place to visit. Visited end of July with family and was very pleasant. Plenty of shops to go in and also a lovely view of the harbour. Worth a visit.

reviews.title: Very pretty but busy in summer
reviews.text: We visited in August and it’s very full of tourists from all over. Despite it being so busy it’s very picturesque and the quality of the restaurants we used locally was very good.

reviews.title: A walk in the past
reviews.text: Bergen is an extremely beautiful city and the Hanseatic wharves definitely one of the best places to walk and see.

reviews.title: Picturesque and colorful, but too crowded and too touristy
reviews.text: It is hard to miss this area if you are visiting Bergen on a cruise.  We walked from the port and by the time we got the wharf we could begin to see the crowds.  It was a beautiful sunny day in June and I was told by a shopkeeper that it was not crowded compared to July or August.  Shocking considering that by the time we left by mid afternoon the streets and narrow alleys where some of the shops are, were difficult to navigate due to the crowds.  There are some good photo ops of the colorful facades of the old warehouses and there are lots of shops but I agree with some reviewers that the shops don't have interesting or affordable souvenirs and many items are not made in Norway anymore.  The restaurants while abundant were also pretty expensive to try to sample food in any of them.  The fish market nearby is interesting but equally expensive.  You will have to pass through this area if you are going to the tourism office.

name: Mount Floyen and the Funicular (Floibanen)
ranking_subcategory: #1 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #1 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #1 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: Fløyen is a must do while in Bergen. Fløibanen, the funicular brings you up the hillside, from Bergen city centre to the top of the mountain in 6 minutes. At Mount Fløyen you will find beautiful views of Bergen, the nearby islands, fjords and mountains surrounding Bergen. Fløyen is a great destination for hiking, mountain biking and soft adventures. We are surrounded by hillsides, mountains, forests, nice little lakes and numerous trails. We offer daily guided hikes “Hiking Mount Fløyen" and Mountain bike rental from mid June until mid August. We love children, and the children love Fløyen. Let the kids explore our playground, Fløysletten climbing playground, the Troll forest. Try out canoe paddling at lake Skomakerdiket (mid June - mid August), feel the adrenalin rush in FløyenKids ziplinepark and get at kiss from our lovely goats at Fløyen. Fløistuen shop and cafè have souvenirs, perfect gifts and memories from Bergen and Norway. We offer local food as “Fløyenbollen", the cinnamon-bun and our organic soup “Fløyensuppen". Fløien Folkerestaurant is open daily from May until September.

offer_list.title: Bergen Classic. Hiking from Mount Ulriken to Mt Floyen. Vidden trail.
Mountain Bike Rental at Mount Floyen
Walking tours
Best of Bergen view - Hiking with mountain guide
Plant A Tree Tour

reviews.title: The funicular is just the beginning
reviews.text:
I regret going up late in the evening, just thinking to take pictures of sunset. After taking more than 100 from foothill to hill-tops and at different spots on the mountain, I realised the designer had more to offer. Mount Floyen has more to explore, for kids, adults, friends, lovers, and family. The playgrounds are interesting and challenging, with short trails that leads to unexpected territories. On our way down hill, there was a sports ground with trampoline, tracks, work out equipment. And there are majestic villas commanding stunning views of the harbour and the city. The journey from the top to the bottom, looking at different houses, apartments, sheds, bungalows, it seems like a study of the city itself.

The lift of the funicular is, therefore, only a humble beginning of the journey.

reviews.title: Spectacular view
reviews.text: worth taking this trip the view from the top is spectacular. But buy your ticket before you go otherwise you will be waiting in a huge queue before you then queue for the funicular

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Highly recommend going. Take the tram up and walk down it's amazing. I would say go early but we went at 10am and walked in. But at 1pm the queue was down the hill. At the top, walk to the lake, see the goats and see the view.

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Great view from the top. Do not miss. Big lines for tickets and then bug lines to enter. Better buy ticket online. We did with phone while waiting on line to enter.

reviews.title: Spectacular views from the top of  Mount Floyen
reviews.text:
We were on an organised excursion from our ship. Sapphire Princess.
We were taken by coach to the funicular station.
As we started our smooth ascent we were amazed when we passed through a great bank of mist and on arriving at the top it was like being up in an aeroplane looking down on the mist below.
However the mist started to clear and we were in the sunshine.
We had a walk around the area and were surprised at what was on offer up there.
Mountain Biking,zip wire, a large play area with rides but I wouldn’t say it was suitable for the very young.
We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

reviews.title: Great view of the city area and around
reviews.text: We  almost missed doing this trip as the queue was very long in the morning with so many cruise ships in. we just spent time around the harbour and sea food market.  Later when we decide to return to the ship noticed the long queue were no longer so we took the short trip up there and really would have been very disappointed to have missed this one.  Wonderful views of the city and around. A few cafes free toilets if you have time various walking tours. Go later in the day when its quiet.

reviews.title: WONDERVIEWS OF THE FJORD AND CITY OF BERGEN
reviews.text: It takes only 3 minutes to climb and during the ascent you can see the beautiful landscape that expands as you climb and discover the infinity of the landscape that reaches the sea

reviews.title: Nice view on a clear day
reviews.text:
The attraction here is the view, so make sure you go on a clear day.

There is a restaurant, a souvenir shop and some goats at the top, all nicely arranged for tourists ;-)

reviews.title: Fantastic scenery.
reviews.text: It is worth buying the funicular ticket in advance from the tourist information centre to avoid queuing at the funicular. We took the funicular up to Floyen and the views were stunning. However we continued on and took the trail up to Brushytten which meant you quickly got away from the crowds. We continued on to Fjellhytten where it was incredibly peaceful and had the most stunning views. From there, after a picnic, we walked back down to Bergen city centre. Well worth the walk, amazing!

reviews.title: We Chose to Walk!
reviews.text: We chose to hike rather than take the funicular. It was steep, requiring some fitness and tenacity, but very enjoyable and short, about 2-3 kilometers. Along the path were great views, lovely wildflowers, and occasional mossy and ferny streams. Once we arrived at the top, there were the crowds that rode the funicular, admiring the view and buying Norway tchotchkes. One  could then ride the funicular down, but we chose to walk.

reviews.title: Best place to experience scenic view of Bergen
reviews.text: Don't miss this place if you visit Bergen. You will get chance to view all beautiful scenic views of the city.

reviews.title: Incredible views and lots of great paths around
reviews.text:
Reasonable price to get up, although the queue took 25 mins in the morning (9-10am). 
Great ice cream stand at the top, and I would recommend walking along to the other viewpoint Sandviksplein (45min each way)

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: Visit early to avoid lines. Or later like 7.  You can also go for sunset but long lines. I'd imagine it is beautiful.  Calm and nice up there.  Be careful walking bc steps around are very similar in color so easy to trip!

reviews.title: Great Attraction
reviews.text:
Last time we were in Bergen the queue was to long to take the trip. This time I pre-booked the tickets and got there for 9am. We walked straight on. When we came back down the queue was horrendous, so the morale is book tickets and go early.

Its a 5 minute ride, but the views at the top are awesome. A great experience and probably the No1 attraction in Bergen

reviews.title: Spectacular Views from furnicular and Mount floyen
reviews.text: It was hidden so hard to find but the ride up the mountain was fun. Once up on the mountain, the walk around the top was lovely. I enjoyed sitting in the cafe and having lunch with the beautiful views. The ride down was a little scary cause the furinicular stop had a gap, so could see down all of sudden, but if heights don’t bother you, then it won’t stress you like I did. Still worth the ride for the best views in Bergen.

reviews.title: Amazing - a Must if in Bergen!
reviews.text: The view from Mount Floyen has to be seen - absolutely stunning! We pre-booked the funicular online and jumped the worst of the queue. Spent 2-3 hours at the top - it’s great for walking, we took a free 15 minute canoe ride on the lake, sat and fed the friendly ducks in the sunshine for ages (take some bread with you!) and enjoyed a cold drink and an ice cream before walking back down to the city.

reviews.title: Best view of Bergen!
reviews.text: We lucked out and had a clearing of the storm clouds and got up to the top for a beautiful sunset (and beer from the restaurant up top!). The iPhone app was easy to download and we bought tickets that are good for any time over two days, allowing us to avoid any line at the ticket window...def recommend during the busy tourist season.

reviews.title: an amazing trip up the mountain
reviews.text: Again another wonder spectacular cruise to Bergen.  Really the scenery is fantastic.  Today had a little bit of a walk into the centre of Bergen, not unpleasant but our cruise ship could not dock as close to the town centre as in other places.  Decided to go for the Funicular first, then take our time doing other things.  This is extremely popular and the queue is always long but time passes quickly and it is surprising just how many fit into the cabin.  The have a lift installed for disability access and for strollers.  Due to the number in the cabin did not get a great view on the way up or down but at the top, magnificent.  There are toilets, cafe, shop and plenty of places to just sit and enjoy the views.  Worth a visit no matter the age.

reviews.title: Beautiful view of Bergen
reviews.text: I highly recommend this activity if you're traveling with family. The ride to the top is truly a once in a lifetime experience. We took the ride at sunset so the lighting was tricky. I recommend going 1 or 2 hours before sunset. The facility closes at 11pm. Great experience!

reviews.title: Awesome views of the Bergen city from the top.
reviews.text: This is a must place to visit if you are travelling to Bergen. The funicalar going up/down is a nice experience. Once you reach the top, you have beautiful views of the city.

reviews.title: Nice view in the city centre
reviews.text:
Nice view in the city centre. Lots of Fun things to do on top. Perfect for families.  

Do some research beforehand so you know all the exciting things you can do up there.

Canoing, zip-lining, play ground, eat, relax, walk down to the city center, say hello to the goats ++++++++++++

reviews.title: Fantastic views of the area at the top.
reviews.text:
Go early! Miss the queues.
A short but pleasant trip up the mountain on the modern funicular. There is much to do at the top; walks, children's playground, decent coffee, but most of all fantastic views of the city and its environs. Lovely scenery and many photo opportunities.
Friendly goats meander around and enjoy the people taking photos - clearly goats with egos!

reviews.title: Excellent Staff.
reviews.text:
I bought my tickets online months before my visit so that I wouldn’t have to wait too long. 
When we got there the queues were huge. 
As I have limited mobility we decided not to bother but one of the staff realised what was happening and moved us straight through and onto the funicular. This was so kind of them and allowed me to visit a truly wonderful place. 
It’s clean, efficient and a really lovely ride up the mountain. They get lots of people into each carriage and the ride is just a few minutes. 
Once up there you can see for miles. There’s cafes and toilets. A play area. Viewing platforms and, if you’re able, gorgeous walks. 
The staff are a credit to them. 
Don’t miss it if you’re in Bergen.

reviews.title: Fun few hours
reviews.text: Don't go in the morning when the cruse ships are in town.  Great views from the top. I didn't know Bergen was so large as we stayed near the old town.

reviews.title: Beautiful views and lovely hikes.
reviews.text: This was the highlight of our day trips in Bergen.  The views are beautiful and there are good hiking paths.  There are also goats at the top!

reviews.title: Wonderful view
reviews.text: We took the funicular uphill and walked down. Easy hour walk with nice views also on the way. There is a panorama viewpoint and a small cafe/restaurant and you can take a picture with the goats that are up there for some reason. Totally would recommend!

reviews.title: Very touristy
reviews.text: There are litterally tons of tourists for this attraction. And many of them are rude and push to get out of the funicular. Be careful because there are 2 lines for the funicular: one for large groups and one for the rest of us. We didn't know and waited in the wrong line for half an hour before noticing (it's displayed too far inside the line, it should be written outside). The ride in the funicular is not great because they let too many people in at the same time. There are a very few seats if it's a concern to you. You cannot see anything while in the funicular (dont' expect a view). The view is at the top, but the edge is so crowded with tourists that it's difficult to really enjoy it. There is a lot to do at the top, like a small lake and many hikes. The souvenirs store has good stuff though. I prefered Ulriken.

reviews.title: Family holiday cruise to norway
reviews.text: Went to bergen, such a wonderful place, lots to see and do, the most wonderful views from the viewing point at the top of the funicular, total panoramic views were  outstanding, ride up takes a few minutes, steep enjoyable journey, few stops on the way as its a service for locals to.. Large queues to get on but we got a fast pass.. Worth the wait... Shops and cafe at the top.. You won't be disappointed with the views

reviews.title: Pretty crowded but great views
reviews.text: There was a bit of a wait for the funnicular, but once you get up there it's really nice. You can walk a short distance through the woods to a beautiful lake. Definitely buy tickets online to skip that line at least. I was able to just buy tickets on my phone right outside.

reviews.title: Good, But All Too Brief Trip
reviews.text:
My acquaintances will tell you I have never met a rail based trip I didn't love.  The 
Mount Floyen Funicular is not an exception.  Unfortunately due to the free time limits associated with our tour group we could only ride up, take a few pictures and then catch the same cars back down. 

I have been on several funiculars before, but this one was unusual for me in several respects.  First the line was not straight.  It curved several times on the way up. It was interesting to observe how the rails and cable guides were slanted to allow for these curves.  Second there were several intermediate stops. In thinking about it, there is no reason not to have intermediate stops, I have just never seen them before.

It was a very enjoyable ride, the view was terrific, however I strongly recommend you allow more than 30 minutes for the excursion.

reviews.title: Top of Bergen
reviews.text:
We thoroughly enjoyed the trip to the top of the mountain to view the city of Bergen the port and surrounding fjord. The view was spectacular!  I would recommend purchasing the tram tickets online ahead of your visit to avoid the long line for tickets at the gate. Our queue time was approximately twenty minutes and I would estimate at least one hour if you don't have tickets ahead of time.
We also had a baby in a stroller but not to worry because the tram accommodates both wheelchairs and strollers.
The facilities at the top included a gift shop, restaurant, childrens play area, goat petting, and numerous tiered viewing areas. It was wonderful.

reviews.title: Short ride, great city views
reviews.text:
We arrived at about 9:45 a.m. and there was almost no wait to buy tickets.  

The trip takes only maybe 5 minutes.  There is only one car in each direction, and they get filled pretty full.  There are seats and standing room.  There are steps to climb, and at the top they are steep to go back down, so you need to be pretty mobile to do this.  

We didn’t try the cafe at the top where there is also a gift shop.  

Although the top isn’t very high, the great views make this trip worthwhile.

reviews.title: Spectacular view!
reviews.text: A definite site to see. We had a traditional Norwegian lunch and then walked around the corner to take the funicular up the mountain. We went in the afternoon when the crowds were not too big. We walked right on. The day was clear and crisp and the view stunning. Practically 360 views of the harbor and city of Bergen below. Be sure to walk around the side and back and pet the goats and animals they have around. If you are in town, this is must do.

reviews.title: absolutely nice panorama above the Bergen city
reviews.text:
The view (in the morning to get the right sun irradiation) is fabulous.
The tramway journey itself is interesting also but no more than in others places around the world.
Prefer the early morning before the cruise ships visitors are still on their board! After that it's crownded.

reviews.title: Nice hiking as well as views
reviews.text: Good hiking options in addition to the views. Can't visit Bergen without seeing this view. Be prepared for rain when taking one of the longer hikes - can get caught out easily (like we did)!

reviews.title: Gorgeous! Wonderful Visit!
reviews.text:
What a wonderful day out! I had the pleasure of staying in Bergen for a few days last year for my birthday and this was the first thing we did... My 7 year old son and I loved taking the Funicular up/down.... exploring the Troll Forest.. the children's playgrounds....hiking...and of course...the VIEWS!.... We spent an entire day/evening here...and we can't wait to visit Bergen again.... I can only imagine how beautiful this is in the winter.. but for me.... I'll enjoy it in the spring and summer :)

A MUST SEE/DO for all visitors to Bergen!

reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.text: We walked to Floyen after dinner on our first night in Bergen, which probably wasn’t the best idea on a full stomach. But the view at the top was breathtaking on a sunny summer evening and the sense of achievement was huge. The beer at the top was also a great reward and yoga class quite a surprise!

reviews.title: Breathtaking Evening City Views
reviews.text:
Experienced Mt. Floyen two ways:  funicular and segway.  Both didn't disappoint.  A word of advice, go early or go later as the cruise ships come to Bergen and the lines were very long.  We avoided the place during the afternoon and walked right up after 6PM (cruise ships leave at 6:30PM).  No problem at all seating and the views up were awesome.  Another way was the Bergen at Night Segway tour.  We took the segways up and down the paths of the mount, an exciting, unique way to experience the views.  
Do the short hike to the lake or enjoy the views while you kids play on the playground.  It is definitely the starting point for several hikes, if you want to do that as well.  The summer sunset was spectacular from up there.

reviews.title: fantastic Panoramic view
reviews.text: Having arrived into Bergen on a cruise , we booked an excursion for the funicular , but you do not need to do this . You can walk from the ship to the main street where there are shops & bars , and a little further on is the station where the funicular is located . It is worth pre-buying the tickets as the queue for buying them on the day was really long .A useful link is floyen.no/ea and costs the equivalent of approx. GBP10 . The view at the top is amazing , and there are several facilities at the top for drinks , ice cream , food & souvenirs .

reviews.title: Funicular to the Top
reviews.text:
If you want to avoid long ques go early AM. The Funicular takes you up and down, set in front on way down. Good views down onto Bergen and the Fjord. It can get very crowded even though we went early AM. Restaurants and free bathrooms at the top. We did take a short walk to the lake.

Opens up at 8AM, discount for children

reviews.title: Good place to see
reviews.text:
Offer very nice views over Bergen and lots of walking trails and activities for kids 
Going up the mountain for cable car could be busy sometimes

reviews.title: Very Enjoyable
reviews.text: The funicular is only a few blocks from the fish market in Bergen - easy to walk to from many local hotels.  The ticket line can be very long - best to go late afternoon when t he cruise ship tourists have to return to their boats.  We went about 4:30PM and the lines were reasonable.  The ride is only about 10 minutes each way.  Very smooth.  Views at top are spectacular - can sometimes see to the North Sea.  Food, restrooms, goats, nice hiking.  We did not hike and we made it up and down and enjoyed the views in about an hour.

reviews.title: Went up 2x on a single day
reviews.text:
Timing is everything! Don’t try to go when all the cruises ship ppl are getting off, the line could get ridiculously long. I went first around 1 pm, the line wasn’t bad just outside the ticket booth. And again around 6pm there was like nobody there lol. 

I decided to go again b/c the weather was better (:

reviews.title: Crowded
reviews.text: The views from the top are great.  But getting there was a bit frustrating. It was very crowded and people were being really pushy.  It would be nice if the staff had some sort of a system for queuing.  When we finally got to the boarding area, I found it to be even a little dangerous as there is no gate to stop people from falling onto the tracks.  My suggestion to future travelers is to get to the boarding area, wait for the pushy people to make it through and then be first in line for the next funicular.

reviews.title: Excellent ride and good location to view Bergen from top
reviews.text:
It was really memorable ride in funicular to Mount Floyen.we googled the place from where the ride starts,reached there and there we found a queue.Here, people who booked ticket on line had express entry.We had enough time and it didn’t take more time to reach booking window.The tickets was NOk125/$15.
I chose to sit in back during going up and down,opposite driver seat,so that we can view the Bergen without any obstruction.
The view from top is awesome.you can have icecream and sit and enjoy the view.There is a play area for children,good trek for a walk in woods.
Good place to spend time with excellent view.

reviews.title: We took the funicular up to the top of mount flloyen. Beautiful view of Bergen
reviews.text: Quite easy to find the entrance to the funicular not far from the harbour up a street to the left.  there was only a small queue. So after getting our ticket , we climbed in the gondola and in a few minutes we got to the top. We view is spectacular and we had a good clear day.and you can walk to different places to see everything There is a shop With a variety of things , cafe and a huge troll that we had photos taken with . A very good outing , really liked  Bergen

reviews.title: Excellent view
reviews.text:
The view you get from the top of mountain of the city is breathtaking.
We took the funicular to the top of the mountain and walked the way down.
There is a beautiful lake on the top of the mountain.
A must visit

reviews.title: Great but you can go up walking and no views inside cabin
reviews.text: Great way To get up if you don't want to walk. Long wait so better to buy prepaid tickets. Infantilizing film to tell you how To board

reviews.title: Fabulous Views
reviews.text: We took the funicular up the mountain, and hiked down. It was a beautiful place and while it's a long way down (I have a bad knee) it wasn't too strenuous. It offered beautiful views and many pretty places to stop and rest. At the top there are several different hikes that can be taken, depending on the time you have and your fitness level.

reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.text: Amazing views and even better if you walk a little further from the viewing platform and climb a little higher to see right over the city of Bergen to the islands beyond. Plan your trip early or late in the day to avoid the hordes that descend from the massive cruise ships between 10.00 and 4.00

reviews.title: Beautiful view and delicious hot chocolate!
reviews.text: We took the funicular to the top of Mount Floien on a rather cool and rainy day but the views were still absolutely amazing!  Everything we expected when visiting Bergen with the bonus of some of the best hot chocolate I’ve ever had from the café at the summit.

reviews.title: Careful if you buy your ticket online
reviews.text:
because when you present the QR code to get on the tram, going up the hill you have to go through either the turnstile on the far left or far right; the two in the middle require a paper ticket (not a printed QR code.  Inexplicably, there’s no signage to explain this and it causes massive confusion at the turnstiles. Coming down the hill, use the turnstile on the far left. 

And yes, this is well worth it - really beautiful views in a city otherwise somewhat devoid of charm.

reviews.title: Absolute Must when in Bergen.
reviews.text: Return for 125Nkr or 65Nkr if you have the Bergen Card. This is a busy place with long queues at times, so it’s a good idea to have a plan B, and come back later in the day if the queue is too long. Have your camera ready on the ride up for some good shots of Bergen town. At the top there are amazing views of Bergen and area, cafeteria, souvenir shop and a restaurant. From here you can go on walks or even walk back down to town. The queue to go back down is just as long as the one to come up. Don’t be fooled by a short queue at the bottom! If you’re on a tight schedule you should bare this in mind.

reviews.title: Go Early
reviews.text:
We were on a tour and started up between 830-9 am. The views are amazing in many directions and at that time of day, immediately boarded and pretty empty at top. We hiked further up a couple hours. Well maintained trails and well marked. 

By the time we returned to funicular, about noon, it was much more difficult to maneuver around and getting pictures would have been more challenging. When we entered station for ride back down, thought we might have to wait, but they track how many allowed through turnstiles and the cars hold a lot of people. 

Would not have wanted to be going up at noon, though. I would guess line was queued for a hour or more on a Monday.

reviews.title: Beautiful scenic view of the City and fiord
reviews.text: Easy to catch he train to go to the top. 7 minute smooth ride. Trains come every 12 minutes. Good wash room facility at the top. Excellent spots to take pictures from

reviews.title: Great ride up and down and stunning view
reviews.text: Admittedly the day could not have been better when we visited Bergen city. The funicular is rather expensive for a 3 minute drive each way, but the view - wow! All parts of the city not hidden by any of the six other mountains surrounding Bergen, the busy harbor with cruise ships and Hurtigruten, which is the coastal ship connection, the Bryggen, which is on the UN World Heritage list, fjords, islands. Absolutely fantastic and is a must on a trip to Bergen. (Weather permitting)

reviews.title: Favorite Easy Activity for Entire Family - Great views beautiful hike
reviews.text: Recommend late afternoon  early evening. when lines are shorter.  There are two trams & our wait was 10 mins.  FYI there are only 5-8 seats per section most people stand. Trip approximately 8 minute ride up the hill. Views are amazing with lots of spots to take pictures.  Restaurant, restrooms & kids playground at top.  Gorgeous 3k walk back to town. Very wide easy trail back to town.  Our favorite part of the experience.

reviews.title: Great views and plenty to see/do at the top
reviews.text: We ended up queuing for around an hour to get onto the funicular (so worth booking in advance if you can) - the journey up takes around 5-10 minutes and has steep gradient (I think it was 1:26) which gives you a great trip up the mountainside. At the top is a very expensive cafe/restaurant (take a picnic if you can) but stunning views over the city of Bergen. There are plenty of hiking trails, the obligatory scattering of trolls and plenty of things to entertain the kids (play parks, ziplines and a mini go-ape type affair).

reviews.title: Views
reviews.text: Firstly come in the afternoon as there’s no queues l, not like the mornings. The views are spectacular when you reach the top it’s breathtaking, once here you can hire bikes, also a nice lake and it’s free to hire a canoe, there’s walking trails we spent a few hours here, today it’s sunny and quite warm so the views you can see for miles. The cost for two adults 250 mil about £25 return for 2.

reviews.title: A great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Chose a clear day and you will get a good view of Bergen. But it is probably best to avoid days when there are a number of cruise ships in port. and the queues can be long.

reviews.title: Nice View
reviews.text: Catch the funicular to the top to see some amazing views of Bergen. Definitely a must! Reasonable price.

reviews.title: Make sure you go on a clear day!
reviews.text:
Great view from the top and a nice area to walk around with restaurant, toilets, gift shop etc. 
the train is expensive but so is everything in Norway!! You can hike up for free if you don’t want to pay :)

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text:
We went about 8 pm, no wait , convenient ride. Views good, trails in forest and good ice cream.
Walked back down, good to have a map because different routes but keep going downhill and it will work.

reviews.title: Beautiful vuees
reviews.text: Fun ride up in the funicular. Then at the top, there are beautiful views of the city. There is a pretty lake up there for kayaking. You can ride a bicycle or walk around. They even have a troll forest. Ride down equally as cool!

reviews.title: Great Views of Bergen and Surrounding Areas
reviews.text: If you have an hour or two to spare during your visit to Bergen, this makes for a pleasant trip.  The ride up to Mount Floyen is only a few minutes, but it is amazing the view one gets from the top.

reviews.title: Brilliant views
reviews.text: This site is terrific. Although the main focus would be the viewing of the city it has many other features. A great little troll park and a fantastic play area for children. The ride up on the Funicular is spectacular. A great vantage point for viewing everywhere in the city below.  If you like photography this is a beautiful spot. Go after the cruise ships leave at about four to five pm.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text:
Enjoyed the experience but really crowded with 3 ships in port.
View at top excellent on a fine day. Kids playground & zip line plus walking trails.

reviews.title: Fantastic views
reviews.text: We arrived at 9.30 am and walked straight on, having booked tickets through a mobile app. Very easy. Long queues when we were at the bottom again at about 1pm. The walks, scenery and views at the top are excellent. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Bergen furnicular
reviews.text:
One of the tourist attraction in Bergen. Take furnicula up to 5 minutes. And capacity up to 50 persons. They have 2 furnicular red and blue color.

At the top, you can see the view of bergen. Its spectacular view. 

And also it has souvenir shop, cafe. 

After finish you can visit old brygen. 2 minutes walk from the furnicular.

Its a must to visit the floibanen

reviews.title: Worthwhile funicular to overlook of Bergen harbor
reviews.text: Sedate but fairly quick trip via funicular to the plateau atop Mt Floien. Nice view. Gift shop. Playground for the youngsters. Some hiking trails.

reviews.title: The best view
reviews.text: A funicular ride up to the top in about 5 minutes, was beautiful and the views over Bergen, magical. We had a canoe on the lake for free, zipline for kids and playground, cafe, souvenirs and hiking trails. Takes about 45 moniutes to hike down or just funicular both ways, We spent a few hours up there. Go early as the queues are crazy, or prebuy your ticket to skip the queue.

reviews.title: Fun and not too scary
reviews.text: This is the excursion for people who want to see the view from the mountain tops without a cable car ride. From just a short walk from the wharf/fish market, this little train whisks you up the mountain in no time. There are great views from the top as well as a nice restaurant, shop, and hiking trails.

reviews.title: Great Tide and Excellent View
reviews.text: The funicular ride in Bergen was great.  If you want to take video like we did, sit in the first seat in the first car.  It’s rather impressive seeing the altitude quickly change and the view as you approach the top is impressive.  Save some time to walk the grounds on top as well as the view looking down on Bergen.  And don’t forget to take your picture with the large troll!  There is food, drink, and the inevitable souvenirs at the top.

reviews.title: What’s not to love
reviews.text: lots of people but a beautiful view and even more walks. Walk down from the top would be my tip. you will walk through a forest, see some beautiful houses and even an outdoor public swimming pool

reviews.title: Superb view
reviews.text: Surprisingly there was a breakdown in service in the morning. But we could go later in the afternoon. Precious time was wasted, though. The view was breathtaking.

reviews.title: Away we go
reviews.text: Unseasonably cool & rainy evening but we still enjoyed. Had hoped to walk down but weather didn't cooperate. Views awesome, worth the time & $$.

reviews.title: nice, beuatiful view.. but long wait
reviews.text: really a nice ride on the funicular.. on top the view is excellent. Only thing is the long wait, and frustrating is they let all the groups go ahead.

reviews.title: Great view of city
reviews.text: Took the funicular to this view point and hiked the trails up above.  We got a little bit of sunshine in-between the rain and it was beautiful!

reviews.title: Ride to the top
reviews.text: A must when in Bergen. Order your tickets on line for a shorter wait to board. The views  on the ride up/down are great and from the top are well worth the $12. There's a cafe, a playground for the kids, some goats to pet. One can also rent mountain bikes to cruise around the paths.

reviews.title: Nice ride with Great view
reviews.text: The trip was just a little bit exciting, but not as scary as I expected. Recommend to avoid the cruise ship rush hours. Timing it with one hour before sunset if possible is preferred for some really nice pictures. Avoid cloudy weather.

reviews.title: Super! Even on a Cloudy Evening!
reviews.text:
Took the funicular to the top of Mount Floyen in the evening as we only had a couple of days in Bergen and the weather forecast was not good for the next day.

Even with the overcast sky it was still a wonderful ride with stunning views.

At the top we visited the restaurant and had coffee and a cake which was also super.

We opted to walk down and took the well marked pathway that led down the mountain and through the houses before arriving in the city centre.

Fantastic and a Must do experience whatever the weather.

reviews.title: Great experience on a sunny day
reviews.text:
Really the best thing to do in Bergen. 
On a sunny day there is no better way to see beautiful Bergen. Importantly buy your tickets online for faster entry. 
Up the top there are walking trails and a beautiful lake. Loads of picnics happening. Restaurants and cafes.

reviews.title: the view is as good as you can get without being on the top of Fiord.
reviews.text: The ride up is fun, unless you are afraid of heights...we were not so lucky with the weather as it was really cloudy and cool....but still worth it

reviews.title: A must in Bergen
reviews.text:
A visit at Bergen is not complete without the funicular en the mountain.
The cable car is worth but as others elsewhere. The view over the city Bergen and the harbour is beautiful! We went on foot to earth and not with the little train. That is a wonderful walk of 1.5 hours. Good trails and not too heavy

reviews.title: On a clear day....
reviews.text: Wait until the mist clears and then go up for a fantastic view of the city. Bonus sight is some very friendly goats at top. Children will love them.

reviews.title: Bergen views
reviews.text: This is about £12 to go on the train up to the Mountain. Very popular. Short ride  (remember to keep your ticket as need it on the way back ) . Wonderful views at the top of Bergen and the Fjords. Can then do lots of different walks and trails from here . Very fresh pure air and by a lake.. Little cafe for drinks and pastries. Activities for children and adventure grounds . Saw friendly goats. A real mountain scene. Beautiful trees and forest areas. Worth a trip.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Great after a fabulous walk up the mountains. Friendly staff great view even if a bit pricey, well worth the visit

reviews.title: Wonderful views and more!
reviews.text: You can hike up the mountain or take the funicular to the top of Mt. Fløyen.  At the top, there is a very nice view of Bergen, a playground for children, a small lake that has free canoeing and access to other hiking trails.  It’s great on a clear day.  Cruise ships arrive in Bergen often, I would try to visit the funicular before or after the cruise visitors visit as the lines got very long.

reviews.title: Real treat!
reviews.text: The train-ride up was very reasonable.  I think 30 Euros for the 6 of us.  There’s a great view at the top and then we took a nice relaxed walk back down.  Definitely a top choice if you are in Bergen.

reviews.title: Beautiful views, great hikes
reviews.text: What a wonderful way to see the city. Plus great hiking trails away from the crowds. We enjoyed the view, people watching and lovely time in the woods. Families with children will find lots of adventures.

reviews.title: Great views from the top
reviews.text:
I think this is a must when visiting Bergen. 
You get great views of the entire city from the top. 

The lift tickets are not too expensive either, of course as per this expensive country.

reviews.title: Fantastic View
reviews.text: We took the Funicular up Mount Floyen and the view of Bergen and the surrounding are was FANTASTIC. You can hike at the top or just sit and enjoy the day. Playground are available for children and various other activities.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.text: This is the stand-out of our visit to Bergen.  The tram ride up was fun, but then we had spectacular views of the town and the sea.  We bought a couple of beers and found a place to sit and gaze at the beauty.

reviews.title: The Peak. Truly Belvedere
reviews.text:
It’s a Must Visit when in town to see most city from above. Although not much to see as the sky was cloudy and snowy.
Making a Snowman is an exciting thing. Thank God my red scarf is useful. 
Should go back again here in Summer !

reviews.title: Escape the crowds to a mountaintop forest
reviews.text:
The funicular ride to the top of the mountain is a "must do" in Bergen, especially if you need a quiet escape from the crowds of Bryggen and the city center. I bought a ticket only to ride up, then walked down. The panoramic views from the top are spectacular. A quiet paved track then leads you back down, a lovely walk through the forest and wild flowers, birdsong and trickling streams. Eventually you enter a lovely residential neighbourhood, zigzagging down and down until you are back in Bryggen. This walk takes 45 minutes, but there are many places to stop and sit and enjoy the views to extend your quiet escape.

One of the few reasonably priced things to do in Norway!

reviews.title: This is one you need to do
reviews.text: Had a great day to do the funicular. The weather was very mild and skies were clear and that is a little rare in Norway. Gives you a great view of the area and is worth your time to do.

reviews.title: Fun Ride to Top of the City
reviews.text: A charming ride to the upper levels with wonderful views and pleasant walking areas around a small lake. Restaurant and coffee shops, with views of lower Bergen and harbor. Beautiful!

reviews.title: Beautiful Panoramic views
reviews.text:
Ride to the top of Mount Floyen was smooth and very scenic.  Cost is not bad at all.  We bought a one way and walked back down.  It took about 45mins or so, of course, depending on your speed...really enjoyed walking back down. The pathways to walk back down are well maintained and extremely safe.  It brings you right back to where you purchased the ticket.   Beautiful panoramic views from the top of the mountain...not to be missed.  The line up to buy ticket moved quickly, while waiting you can use the free WIFI, which is available outside the ticket office as well as inside while waiting to board the funicular.  

There is a nice restaurant at the top where you can purchase something to eat or drink or just to use the facilities.  For animal lovers, there are "pet" goats wondering around up there, just hanging around to take pictures with all "us tourists."  which I did, of course:-)  

If you are looking for an activity while up there, you can do some hiking, zip lining and bike riding.  Yes, there is a bike rental shop at the top.  Most interesting, there is a kindergarten at the top of the mountain.  We saw and spoke to the teachers who said that they come up and go back down everyday with the kids.  

If on a cruise, here are directions to get there.  Walk out of the port, take a right, pass the sightseeing buses, there is also a sign-post pointing to "Sentrum" i.e city centre.  Once you get to a fork in the road, stay to the right.  You could go left but that would take you towards the fortress, although if you continue in that direction you would eventually get to the Floibanen (Funicular).  Okay, so stay to right after you pass the buses and you will eventually end up with the Fish Market on your right and the Funicular on the left.  If you go to the fish market, then to get to funicular you just walk straight ahead to the two big buildings on the corner, one of which says: Ann Madam."  Walk up the street between the two building and you will see the Funicular, pic attached.  

There are beautiful historic building, restaurant, bars and lots of other stuff around the city centre to explore and enjoy.

reviews.title: Beautiful scenery
reviews.text: The ride is fun and the scenery is beyond compare.  At the top there are hikes, biking, zip lines and more.

reviews.title: Wonderful Views
reviews.text: Worthwhile ride up the mountain to get a wide view of Bergen and surrounding area. Opted to walk back down the 2 mile path. Enjoyed the views and variety of plants.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text:
Worth the trip up, the views on a clear day are stunning (or on a clear 30 mins as this is Bergen).
Took the funicular railway up, which was great. We sat at the front on the way back.
Had a short walk around the top and even tried canoeing for a bit in the lake. Very calm and restful.

.A must to do when in Bergen.....
A great view and accesseble for all ages.....
Nice area for hiking to....

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: The Florence is within walking distance of our hotel and buying our tickets from the visitor center helped us avoid standing in the ticket line. The tram runs all the time so no matter how many people were in line, you didn’t wait long.  Views are worth going up for. Restaurant at the top, along with playground if you have children, and hiking trails.

reviews.title: Take the Funicular - amazing views!
reviews.text: You must take this Funicular for the amazing news!  Take an hour or so to spend up at the top, buy and ice cream and sit, relax and take in the view!

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Don't miss out on this when your in the city on a nice day. The view is super and the hiking trails are very good. You can spend the day up there just enjoying the fresh air. Good place to people watch.

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text: Worth the ride to see spectacular views of the city and the harbor. Expect a long wait in line. If you can go after 3 p.m. the cruise ship crowd will have cleared out, and line will be much shorter. Also, be careful if you are traveling with small children or an elderly family members - there was a lot of pushing in the crowd as we boarded and disembarked from the team.

reviews.title: Well worth it
reviews.text:
Great views. Take the walk to the small lake which is only 5 minutes, or so.

Restaurant looks good. Not open eye morning

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: When we arrived in Bergen on a Sunday afternoon there was blue sky and sunshine. We immediately headed for the funicular which is an easy short walk from the harbour. After a brief wait, we rode to the top and enjoyed magnificent views. There was a happy crowd at the top and we felt under no obligation to buy anything beyond our funicular tickets. It is a must do in Bergen - when the weather is nice.

reviews.title: Great views from the top
reviews.text: We were warned that on the day our ship docked, there would be four other liners in port, so it would be likely that queues for the funicular would be in excess of 2 hours. Not for the first time we ignored the doomsayers, and set off for the lower station at about 09:15. Yes, there was a short line, but we only waited for 20 minutes before boarding the funicular. The trip up was fun, and the views from the top were spectacular, showing  Bergen in all its glory. The views, however, were only one reason for taking the trip. There was well maintained trails for people of all abilities, a very nice hotel, and six of the most docile goats I have ever encountered.

reviews.title: Outdoor Fun
reviews.text: My family and I took the funicular up and spent sometime at the top overlooking the city. My boys spent a couple hours playing on the collection or playgrounds, one which is like a giant obstacle course. I recommend to skip the funicular ride back down and opt for one of the trails instead (all downhill of course) with plenty of trees and greenery.

reviews.title: Go after 3 pm!
reviews.text: When the cruise ships are in the lines are long. If you are in for the day go after 3 pm and there are no lines. Single ride is 65 NOK you can walk down on a well marked trail, 3 km, to city center. It can be challenging if you have physical issues. Great views from the top, 1000 ft above the city. Let know if this review helps make up your mind!

reviews.title: Funicular up, Walk down - a great way to experience Bergen!
reviews.text: I love funiculars - and this one is no exception. It's a fun ride up the steep slope of Mt Floyen to a large observation platform at the top, giving you a spectacular view of Bergen. We walked down, which I recommend for those able to do so. The path down is along sloping woodland and then increasingly urban footpaths - from top to bottom was about 30 minutes, and very pleasant.

reviews.title: This is a must for first time visitors to Bergen. All seasons have their charm.
reviews.text: This is a must for all first time visitors to Bergen! This Funicular runs every day, even Christmas. It is also a form of transport for folks who live on this Mountain as well. This is a great place to photograph wonderful pictures of Bergen and the ocean/fjord. Many buy the one-way ticket up and walk down one of the various paths down. There is a nice restaurant and a gift shop at the top. There is a fun playground for younger children, as well as an exercise path for all ages. In the summer there are canoes in the lake for the families with children. The pathways up there are well-marked for those who want long hikes, with some camping if you go far enough. Discounts with the Bergen Card. If the weather is nice this can be done early in the morning or in the afternoon after the museums and shops close. In the winter one can take sleds down the pathways down this mountain area. It is a great place to visit during all seasons - if you want to take pictures make sure you wait for a clear, non-rainy/NON-FOG day. Enjoy!

reviews.title: Fantastic view of the city
reviews.text: Although the weather was quite cloudy we had a fantastic view over the city from the top of the railway.  You could see out to the sea other lakes/fjords.  Very busy but waiting times minimal as the journey is very efficiently organised.

reviews.title: Beutifull view of Bergen
reviews.text: We went there by tram but then it was raining lightly,so could not move around.But then we went to souvnier shop and by theeen rains were reduced but still unclear.There is a beutiful view of Bergen from top.This type of tram and cable is also seen at many places like hongkong.So if somebody has not done earlier is enjoyable.I had done many times elsewhere,so not discouraged or disappointed by rains obstacles for a view,but for first timers it was disappointment.Sunny day is desirable for such activity.But must see attraction

reviews.title: Excellent views to Bergen, romantic paths in the park nearby, tasty ice cream and funny goats to touch
reviews.text: Take one-way ticket to the top and go down by yourselves, if the weather will let you, and you will enjoy by more views of Bergen, such as nice stadium, stainless tube for kids and the pool for gods :) Also, there is small adventure park at the top..

reviews.title: Beautiful View over Bergen while You Relax with a Drink
reviews.text: The Funicular is an easy way to get to the top of Mt Floyen. Stroolers, even pets, can easily get on board. Once on the top, you are rewarded with a sweeping view of Bergen. We relaxed with a drink while sitting outside the restaurant. If youare adventurous, you can go for hikes around the area. Look out for the mountain goats that are near the top. Good fun for all ages.

reviews.title: Bergen must see place
reviews.text: Especially if weather is good. You can walk or go by train. We went up by train and walked down. Easy walk with nice views over Bergen. Recommended

reviews.title: Breath Taking View
reviews.text: Got discounts for the tram rides as we had Bergen Passes. We did not catch the sun while up there but it wasn’t raining either. Nevertheless, the view is still breath taking. There is a playground which kept my kids engaged quite a Long while.

reviews.title: Great View.
reviews.text: Superb view of Bergen, even on a rather grey day. Very busy at the top with some queuing, but worth it.

reviews.title: Buy your tickets online before going
reviews.text:
We were on a cruise ship which docked in Bergen at 7am.

Once we disembark, we walk towards the funicular with our Google map app.

Was on the 2nd ride of the day at 8am. Empty 1st ride came down with around 3 pax.

When we came down around 930am,the queue was super long!

Do buy your tickets online first especially if u are visiting while on a cruise as the ticket office wasn't open when we reached and there was only 1 ticket machine selling tickets.

reviews.title: Nice trip
reviews.text: Very nice and easy trip from the city center to the top of Floyen Mtn. The trip can start from different places, the most common is close to the funicular entrance. You will see some very nice typical Norwegian houses with peculiar architecture. The hike is quite soft, it takes approx 45-60' depending on you of course. At the top you can have more walks choosing the paths that start from the top of Floyen, going deep into the surrounding forest (there is also a small lake). Definitely to try.

reviews.title: Fun little excursion
reviews.text: This was definitely a fun little trip in Bergen.  We enjoyed the funicular ride and the beautiful view at the top.  It was raining and windy when we got there, but still, to see the city, the breaks in the clouds, the sunset peaking through, was breathtaking.  At the top, they have trails and a super cute little park for kids.  We just wish we could have done it on a sunny day!

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: This is really worth a trip if you have the time. Gives you great views over the city of Bergen. Very busy in the morning as there can be up to 4 cruise ships in.

reviews.title: Fun in Floyen
reviews.text: We went up by Funicular and walked down to the base in a cool weather amidst the forest , Up above the hill,the panoramic view of the wonderful Bergen,braced with a light breeze was a great treat to us. Scintillating experience.

reviews.title: Natural Wonderland
