reviews.text: The trip both up and down the mountain in the funicular is quick but has beautiful views. Once at the top there are tons of things to do for the whole family or by yourself. The area around the top of the funicular is busy but doesn’t feel crowded. The playgrounds are cute and fun for kids. The troll forest is so cute, though some of the trolls could do with some TLC. There are several options for food. The lake (pond) has free canoe use. I went up the mountain hiking. The less used hiking trails are not well marked. I found my way, but there were some times I was off course and had to forge my way through to a path. The views from the very top away from everyone were amazing. What a beautiful experience.

reviews.title: Worth the wait for the funicular.
reviews.text: Waited just about an hour in a queue with folk wanting to skip the line ! It was well worth the wait, with amazing views in a very sunny day. We walked down which gave us some exercise.

reviews.title: Go early, amazing views, nice hikes around the summit
reviews.text: We visited on a shore excursion. We left our ship at 9am and found the lines to be really reasonable. We waited about 20 minutes for our ride to the top. Clean and efficient train. We hiked a few short hikes around the summit and enjoyed the goats that are kept in the area. A few adventurous types headed out to a longer hike to a lake and another summit (google mapped it). We headed down. It was rather steep on my old knees, but well paved with benches every few 100 meters.

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Great view of Bergen. Went at 10:30 pm and saw a great sunset. You can get a round trip ticket or walk up and ride down or visa versa. There is a playground for kids.

reviews.title: Train journey
reviews.text: A great journey offering great scenic views of mountains,water falls,magnficent houses next to fjord banks

reviews.title: Well worth spending 30-45 minutes but avoid the queues and buy your ticket before you get there.
reviews.text: Apparently when there are several cruise ships in town at the same time the lines can get incredibly long which is no fun as there is only room for 75 people in the cable car and each trip takes about 10 minutes to the top. If there are clouds and / or visibility is limited in any way then honestly do not bother as the experience will not be worthwhile. The panorama from the top is good but most of the time people will not really know what they are looking at apart from the port area. Book a hop on hop off tour with the funicular price included as this will save you time.

reviews.title: Stunning views
reviews.text: This was a fun thing to do. It goes right to the top of the mountain, making stops for locals, so don't get off too soon.  There are a couple of places up top to get a bite to eat or a drink. If you have kids, they will love the playground.  Don't forget to say hello to the goats!

reviews.title: View worth seeing
reviews.text:
Wow what an experience to use the funicular. It was fast with stations on the way up and down. The views were amazing to see across the city.
At the top there was a park, a viewing area, gift shop, ice cream stall, restaurant and another area of nature that apparently was full of deer. We didn’t have long enough to go this far as on an organised trip.

reviews.title: Lovely view and pretty walk
reviews.text: Really worth the cost to go up. Once there, the view is beautiful. The shops are super expensive even compared to Bergen itself. There is a fab playground for kids, friendly goats to say hello to and a fantastic walk to take in the quiet of the forest. Lovely place to visit and well recommended.

reviews.title: The most popular trip in Bergan
reviews.text: Being the most popular trip it is very busy with almost constant queues, so book online and arrive early. Booking online means you get to join the queue to get on the train quicker, it does by no means eliminate the queuing. Once at the top it is all worthwhile, great views, walks, cafe and the crowds are not that large. The queues to go back down are just the same, so we walked down, about 3k and it took an hour and it was a gentle walk down. If you walk up then I would allow at least 1.5 hours.

reviews.title: A "must see" when you're in Bergen
reviews.text:
Great views, and a nice way to spend a few hours.
The weather wasn't great when we did it, which in some way helped keep the crowd smaller.
It was still really busy though, but not overly so.

There's a big restaurant at the summit, and also a smaller cafe.

Overall, a worthwhile thing to experience.

reviews.title: Top view
reviews.text: It's a beautiful sight going up. Though it ends before you can absorb it all. The walk on top takes you away from the hustle and bustle and into a small forest with a lake. Pretty. Great view of Bergen and beyond!

reviews.title: Large Crowds; Large Views !
reviews.text: As evidenced by the crowds, this is a must see in Bergen.  I would highly recommend buying your tickets in advance.  The restaurant at the top is lovely.  If you are up for a little  hike, the walk down is beautiful!

reviews.title: Do this
reviews.text: Either get the ride up to the top and walk down. It’s about 3km back to the city and of course it’s all down hill on wide pathways through lovely forests with some nice little streams and great views. Or......do it the other way round. Definetly worth it which ever way you go.

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: A shortish queue but well worth it for the views going up and at the top.Well worth booking the tickets in advance . Had a snack up there  - open prawn sandwich & wine  - bit expensive but in line with other places . Don't miss the short walk to the lake

reviews.title: Short and Sweet
reviews.text: This was a very short trip and was a bit crowded, but a cool experience.  We videoed the whole trip to show people at home.  The views at the top were amazing.

reviews.title: Super Brilliant experience
reviews.text:
It was sooo fun going in Floyen Funicular. It’s recommended to sit as the extreme front to get the best pictures and thrill. It’s very safe and have wonderful views. The top offers such and awesome views and breeze. There are ample playground area for kids to play and parents to chill around. There are also brief trek that takes back to city centre in around couple of ours. There are couple of reasonably priced coffee shop at the top.

If you are in Bergen Plz don’t miss it.

reviews.title: Must do when in Bergen
reviews.text: The Funicular up to Mount Floyen takes just a few minutes and the view looking over Bergen id well worth the trip. Once there you can take a walk around to the lake where there is free canoeing or just  enjoy the quiet woodside. For the young at heart and energetic catch the Funicular up and walk the 3.3 kilometres back the city centre.

reviews.title: scandinavia
reviews.text: this is a must do if you are in Bergen - it overlooks the whole of the area and is breathtaking.  the funicular takes you all the way up with magnificent views along the way.  there are mountain goats and trails and a gift shop and a restaurant.  we went in the evening (sun doesn't set til late) so there were no crowds.  the next day you couldn't get near the ticket booth due to crowds.

reviews.title: Must visit if going to Bergen
reviews.text: We had a fast track pass for this, and were glad as queues were long.  We were lucky enough to be entertained by a group of school children who were in the queue singing songs - beautiful.  The views from the top are spectacular, but we were only there five minutes and really dark clouds came over - then lightening following by huge amount of thunder and torrential rain.  We had a coffee in the café and ventured out again as the rain eased off.  Due to the weather we did not attempt a mountain walk. But enjoyed the views and then went back down - which is when the sun decided to come out!

reviews.title: Worth it!
reviews.text: Definitely worth the visit! Loved seeing all the mountain goats and views of the city! Very quick to visit if you’re staying in the city center.

reviews.title: Amazing views from the top and funicular
reviews.text: If you’re adventurous you can hike up or down instead but the funicular is fun. One way funicular rides are available. There is some hiking around the top of mount Floyen as well. There is a lake <0.5 miles away from the funicular plaza. Also a restaurant and gift shop.

reviews.title: Should visit once atleast
reviews.text: Very easy access to the fanicular.easily manageable with toddlers and children.Takes 7-9 minutes to each the top .views are spectacular with a good restaurant.nice playing area for kids and mayb u spot billy goats too

reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.text: We had a short wait for a carriage on the Funicular but there is free WiFi. We went on a glorious sunny day which enhanced the experience but the ride is stunning and at the top the views are sublime from all sides. There is a shop and cafe at the top and 6 nanny goats who are used to lying about and posing. You can then hike off for miles or just sit around to enjoy the view and then either ride or walk back down. There are 2 interim stops as local residents use it as well. If possible when in Bergen this is a must do. The gardens and Rhododendrons on the way up were also glorious.

reviews.title: A must do while in Bergen
reviews.text: A quick ride up the mountain for spectacular views. Don’t miss it. Busy but no lines.  Take your camera.

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.text:
Mt. Fløyen is awesome.  It looms over Bergen and provides excellent views of the city.  There are some trails and parks on top of the mountain, but mainly people go up it for the view.

There is a funicular railway that makes it quick and easy to go up and down the mountain.  We actually started walking up the mountain and decided to just walk all the way to the top.  This was a bit steeper and more strenuous than we imagined.  We did end up riding the funicular down, which was nice.

If you take a partial ride, it is half the price as tickets for the full trip.  There is a station very close to the bottom, which is easy to walk to.  This can work well riding down, but it will not work well riding up as the funicular will be completely full, and you will not be able to board it.  It does get crowded, so go early.

We had a lot of fun exploring Mt. Fløyen.  I only wish we had more time there.

reviews.title: Nice views
reviews.text: Right from down by the waterfront, you can take the funicular to the top where there are plenty of views and nice trails to walk. Food and drink are also available in very pleasant surroundings

reviews.title: The VIEW! And the GOATS!
reviews.text: The view is beautiful, and there are a ton of well maintained trails around the lake and on mount Floyen to explore. Best of all, there were (at the time we visited) six Cashmere mountain goats who are beloved by everyone and can be petted if they're in the mood (they have free range of the whole area, so if they choose to, they can leave). Definitely worth a visit. We didn't eat there, but they have multiple restaurants available. They also have bike rentals.

reviews.title: Helen Campbell
reviews.text:
Loved the ride to the top of the mountain and back down again
Our first visit to Bergen
We had taken the six and a half train journey Oslo to Bergen...exceptional scenery!
We stayed two nights at the Steens Hotel...highly recommended!
I did not know Bergen was such a huge beautiful city

reviews.title: Fantastic view
reviews.text:
The car goes to the top of one of Bergen’s seven mountains and provides a panoramic view of the city and its ports. You can ride both ways or ride one way and walk the other. Two of the four of us decided to ride up and walk the 3.5 km down. The smarter two rode both ways. Great views at the top
but about an hour walk down along a path thru the woods. Yes there are pretty woods, flowers and meandering streams and little waterfalls but it is steep and not an easy walk. We thought we would be going thru the upper town but you only do that towards the end. It is mostly steep trails and since it is Bergen there are usually intermittent showers so be sure you have an umbrella or raincoat with a hood or a rain hat. Not an easy walk and if your plan for the rest of the day is to walk around the city you will be doing that on tired feet and legs with aching quads.

reviews.title: A must have trip while in Bergen
reviews.text: This is a funicular train starts from Bryggen and goes on top of the mountain. from the mountain, one can have a breathtaking view of the city, the shoreline. There are cafes and hotels on the top and not to forget the lake.

reviews.title: Amazing view.
reviews.text:
We were only in Bergen for the day so I bought our tickets online which meant that we were fast tracked on to the Funicular. As soon as we got off our ship we headed straight for it which meant that there were only a few people at the top. The views were wonderful and we could see our ship. There are a few goats at the top but because they have got electronic collars on they are not allowed to wander freely. You can go hiking if you choose but this wasn't an option for us.
Go early if you can because the entrance was crammed when we reached the ground again.

reviews.title: Breath taking
reviews.text: An awesome experience . Very close to Bryggen.  The view from top is breath taking . Would suggest to walk down

reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.text: It’s a quick ride up and a nice view at the top. There’s a playground, a cafe, a restaurant, and al sorts of trails for walking in the woods.

reviews.title: Fun Trip Up and Great View as Reward
reviews.text: The funicular is great fun. Try to get there when the lines are fairly short. You may or may not get a front row seat but don't worry about it. The views from the top are fantastic. There is a restaurant, a separate coffee shop and facilities by the viewing platform, so one can relax and spend as much time as one wishes.

reviews.title: Spectacular but..
reviews.text:
We took the walk up instead as the line was huge. It was easy enough as it’s an easy track and you get high quickly. It’s a good way to take in the view as you go.  When we got there it was raining unfortunately and everyone was running for cover. There was limited shelter for the amount of tourists and the line to the funicular was long and outside in the rain. 
However the view over Bergen is nothing short of spectacular and the ride down was great.

reviews.title: The most wonderful views!
reviews.text:
We visited Bergen and had been told about the funicular.  We decided to do this and go to the top of Mount Floyen.  It was a beautiful day and we could see for miles!  

If you're visiting Bergen, this is a must!  Just beautiful!

reviews.title: Funicular Fun
reviews.text: Enjoyed our ride up and lunch at the restaurant. Excellent views and nice trails to walk on before or after lunch

reviews.title: The Funicular gives you an excellent view of the town
reviews.text: Not only is it fun to ride the funicualar, there are goats at the top - that are quite tame.  We were fortunate to have a clear and sunny day and the views are spectacular.

reviews.title: very nice view of bergen and the harbor
reviews.text: we rode the funicular up mount floyen and the view was quite spectacular. there are nice walking trails, a restaurant and a gift shop. if we were interested in a  nice walk, it would have been great, but we didn't really like the offerings at the restaurant and weren't up to the walking. we did really enjoy the view but there was not much to hold our interest for more than about 45 minutes.

reviews.title: Nice views
reviews.text: The funicular takes you to the top of a tall hill overlooking Bergen and the water. The ride to the top takes about 5 minutes max. Once there the views are nice. The top also has snacks and food. There is a good amount of area to sit and enjoy the view. This is a busy place but the funicular takes 70 people each time and runs continually.

reviews.title: View is very good
reviews.text: It you like views from above, this is a must do. You can walk up the mountain in 1hr , or take the funicular . 125 Nok return, takes about 6 minutes. There is a shop on the top and washrooms. My only advice, come early, I waited only 10 min for the ticket, but when got down, line was down the street, crazy!!!!

reviews.title: What a beautiful view of Bergen from the top of Mount Floyen !
reviews.text: My wife & I went on the floibannen Funicular to the top of Mount Floyen, what an awesome view of the city ! we were fortunate that their wasn't any fog ! Suggest you try & go earlier in the morning to avoid the long lines ! We chose to buy a round trip ticket to save time, but if you are in good physical shape you can walk down !

reviews.title: The number one thing to do in Bergen
reviews.text: Take the funicular to Mt Floyen and enjoy the bird's eyeview of Bergen. There are quite a few activities up at the top. There is a kids corner. You can pet the goats or just walk down to the city in about 45 mins. There is hike from here to Mt Ulriken which is very popular.

reviews.title: Supposedly Highlight
reviews.text:
Visited in June 2018
A supposedly highlight of the trip but as it was a gloomy day (and it rained) on the day of our visit - otherwise, the view would have been spectacular!

reviews.title: Best views over Bergen
reviews.text: We used the Funicular to get to the viewpoint and I strongly advise for it because the other way is steep uphill for about 1 hour. The viewpoint was awesome - lots of stairs to sit and just enjoy. There are also sheep and childrens playground. Lake is about 5 min walk, where you're supposedly able to kayak for free (from end of June). We were there in the beginning of June so didn't have a chance to try it.

reviews.title: Wonderful views
reviews.text: We rode up & walked back down through the woods. The ride was quick & clean, with lovely views on the way up. The landing at the top is huge & you can sit & watch the city below. There are many hiking trails & it’s about 3 km back down.

reviews.title: I just Hopped Off the Hop on Hop off bus to do this
reviews.text: It was a quiet smooth ride... due to my position in the car I did not get good video going up... but once outside...views are amazing,   I went live on FB thanks to WiFi up there and even ate at the restaurant.   Check out the goats too🤪

reviews.title: Great views, good hiking, might have to wait.
reviews.text: We arrived at the base station within an hour of opening and we were able to jump right on. The trip up is fun and the views only get better the higher you go. It was a beautiful sunny day so when we reached the top, WOW!!  Very nice and it gives you a great orientation and Bergen’s relationship to the open ocean. At the top you have restrooms, a cafe, a restaurant (closed in the morning) and a gift shop, which is good too. This is a popular tour group stop, so be prepared for numbers of people. Go early to avoid some of the mid -morning crowds. But this is a must stop when visiting Bergen when the weather is good.

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.text: We went up the funicular on a dull day but thankfully the cloud was clear of the top of the mountain.  The views of the city are great and it is certainly worth doing.

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text: Our first day in Bergen was fine and sunny, do we took advantage and headed up to the peak. Easy to access, a number of options of things to do, worth the visit.

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.text:
Must do in Bergen the train ride is fun and as it goes up the mountain view from train are spectacular. It gets a bit crowded and busy mid day and the wait can be long and tiring. 
Once up on the mountain views are to die for, just hope for a sunny clear day for your visit to be fruitful!!!!

reviews.title: Nature at its finest
reviews.text: What a great place to see water, trees, and good views!  At the top of the mountain is a walking path to a nice lake.

reviews.title: Hike from Ulrikken to Floyen —
reviews.text: Well worth it to hike (or take the cable car) up to Ulrikken overlooking Bergen and then hike the “long hike” (marked at 13 KM but seemed longer) from Ulrikken to Floyen — in particular if the weather accommodates.

reviews.title: Afternoon
reviews.text: Skip the long lines and go in the afternoon  (after 4pm). A view that you don't want to miss. A great place to have ice cream and enjoy the view.

reviews.title: Great view fun ridd
reviews.text: We tried earlier (about 10 AM) but lines were too long (it was Saturday).  We came back at 3 and really no lines.  You can get a taxi right to the funicular and there are benches if you have someone with you that can’t stand for long.  The line moved really pretty fast.  On the top there are several options for snacks.

reviews.title: Nice view but queue was big
reviews.text:
Recommend you pre-pay your tickets which will help with the queue but better still walk up. We didn’t stay long at the top so value for money wasn’t great for us. 
Lovely view over much of the city & beyond to the islands.

reviews.title: Weather great, view outstanding
reviews.text: Our luck held, weather was fantastic. Views superlative with many trails at the top leading to an expanded possibility to explore Mt. Floyen.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Well worth the ride. We took the train up, looked around and got pictures, then went back down on train. You could spend hours up there walking around the mountain. There’s a playground for kids. You can also walk up or down the mountain. The train was beat for us.

reviews.title: So beautiful
reviews.text: The lines are long this time of year but it’s worth it.  The views, the lovely area, the hiking paths - you can spend a whole day here and still think it wasn’t long enough!

reviews.title: A breathtaking view
reviews.text:
The funicular is near the very centre of the city. It is easy to find. Prices are affordable: 9.5 NOK return ticket (around 10 euros), 50 NOK one way (around 5 euros). 
I would recommend one way ticket (by funicular to the top of the hill), and then you can take a nice walk downhill. 
It was a sunny June day, everything was perfect, and the view from the top is amazing: Bergen and the sea, and very calming and relaxing atmosphere up there ...
A walk down the hill takes between 30 and 45 minutes, but we made so many photos... that we spend a little more time.
The road is paved, nature is beautiful, and so many marvelous houses down the road. Everything is green and fresh, the flowers so colorful, birds chirp, sea and clouds...
Just go there :)

reviews.title: Walk it!
reviews.text: It must be tempting to take the funicular but I suggest you walk - it only takes 45 minutes and the views from the trails are fantastic...so take your time, soak it in and reward yourself with an ice cream at the top!

reviews.title: Worth the visit!
reviews.text: On a clear day, you can see the entire city! For the price and ease of access, it is well worth it! If you’re feeling active, there is also a hike that will lead you up to the top (and back down).

reviews.title: Great view of Beautiful Bergen
reviews.text: The funicular ride up to Mt Floyen is worth the wait in line to get an amazing view of the entire Bergen area. The ride goes fairly quickly and smoothly. At the top, there is a small cafe where you can get hot drinks and cafe food, if it’s cool and drizzling like when we were there.

reviews.title: Best wiew in Bergen
reviews.text: You have not realy visited Bergen if you didnt take time to Enjoy the wonderful wiew from the top of mount Fløien. A bit costly and crowded in the tourist season - but worth the money.  This is a trainride you never forget - and the trams comes with a wiew to. On the top you will find a restaurant and nice areas to walk if you want to exercise

reviews.title: Mount Fløyen - worth the view
reviews.text:
My wife and I just spent a number of days in Bergen, and this is a must stop place to go. We went twice, once up and down on the funicular once hiking up and down.

Try to do the funicular on a sunny day if possible, try for early in the morning or later in the afternoon or risk the long long lines that come from cruise ships in port.

The views are spectacular and if you’re in shape, I recommend hiking it.

reviews.title: Great views over the city
reviews.text: Well organised and efficient, we arrived at about 10am and bought tickets at the office for an immediate departure (we waited about 5 minutes for a space on a train). Easy to get on and off, a short walk from the upper station brings you to the viewing areas looking over the city below. There are some cafes and shops at the top of the mountain, with a playground too. It was cold and windy, so dress accordingly! A must do while you're in Bergen.

reviews.title: Brutal run, but view from the top is worth it
reviews.text:
While in Bergen for a conference I went out for a run and as it was such a clear day, decided to run to Floyen, the restaurant at the top of the hill overlooking Bergen as I had eaten there a few years before.

Seemed like a good idea at the time. The first part is quite confusing through the streets with a lot of switchbacks and narrow streets but once clear of the town I just kept heading up. After a combination of steps, tracks and gravel road I made it to the top and got to see Bergen at it’s very best - beautiful sunrise, clear day - fantastic!

Gravity was a big help going down so didn’t take long and I was back in time for a well earned breakfast. From the Scandic Ornen hotel to the top and back was 4.5 miles and about 1200 ft vertical ascent. 

You can take the funicular, walk or even take a taxi to the top but where’s the fun in that!

reviews.title: Great views!
reviews.text: We had decided to take the funicular up and walk down (you can by a one way or round trip ticket). What a fun time we had! We stood in line for our ticket and getting onto the tram for about 30 minutes. We should have been there earlier in the day, but had played around in Bergen. It's a great ride up the mountain! The views are awesome and there are lots of hiking trails, a restaurant, playground and a shop. The hike down the mountain was beautiful and allowed us some great views over the city. It would be very nice to come back and watch the sunset from up there. The tram is open until 11:00 pm every night and opens early in the morning (7.30 or 8.00, depending on the day)

reviews.title: Had to do the tourist thing
reviews.text:
Came to Bergen to meet up with a local friend.  We checked the local scene out as there are hundreds of shops to check out.  Ended up at the Funicular as I read about it, so, 10 of us took it to the top and back.  Fantastic ride, view and everything.  Its about 12.50 per person round trip so there is no way Im hiking to the top.  You can start 
your hiking trek from the top if you like.

reviews.title: Bergen Eagle view
reviews.text:
Not to miss if u visit Bergen, 
Go when sun is setting and if y can , walk Down 3.9 KM Down
Its a nice experience only for Fit and Good walker. At some places down u will require Google maps.

reviews.title: wonderful views to be enjoyed
reviews.text: We were lucky to find only a short queue. Once at the top we took a pleasant walk to and around the lake, followed by a snack & beer overlooking the the town. The views are just superb

reviews.title: See the city.
reviews.text: Great views. Lots of tourists. Not too long a wait. Be sure to walk around once you get to the top. Views are somewhat weather dependent.

reviews.title: A must-do in Bergen
reviews.text:
Commanding views over the city and beautiful walking routes to explore make this very much worth your time.

There's a few shops and places to grab food and coffee at the top of the weather is unfavourable - and it often will be - but the view alone makes the ride worthwhile

reviews.title: A Bergen Highlight  for Hike and Picnic
reviews.text:
Travel by funicular up to the top of Mount Floyen was a Bergen highlight. Buy your one way ticket on-line before you leave and go first thing in the morning to skip the lines. The walk down (vs. funicular) was interesting, scenic, and easy. No way to get lost as you can see the town below the entire walk down.

We took a picnic lunch and opted for the 5k easy hike to a lake a cabin. Warning to other US travelers - what Norway terms an easy hike appropriate for young children just starting to hike turned out to be intermediate/difficult by US standards with boulders to climb, steep ascents, and greater distance (5 miles) than the map indicated. Halfway through the hike was an old building with picnic table and scenic view over Bergen that was the perfect stop.

I recommend you buy a one-way ticket on-line before leaving, pack a picnic, and take one of several hikes once at the top. You'll leave with forever great memories of Bergen. There were clean restrooms available in the funicular building once you get to the top.

reviews.title: Great place for a morning run
reviews.text: I wanted to get a 6-mile run in during my stay in Bergen and my hotel suggested I run to the top of Mt Floyen. There are zig-zag trails that go all the way to the top, and the views are tremendous. Whether you take the funicular or walk/run, it is worth going.

reviews.title: Crowded but a nice view
reviews.text:
I hiked from Ulriken to Floyen during the day and came from Rundemannen down to Floyen. It was so nice to geth there so I could take a pause and buy myself refreshments which were not that expensive. Then it was time to enjoy the view. It was like half of Bergen was up there, but I know why. The view! And I guess it is really easy to get there with the funicular as well if ones comes from the town.

I would recommend going there in the morning or in the evening to avoid the mid-day rush.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Comfortable
reviews.text: This funicular ride is well worth the trip!   I made the trip once on a foggy night and once on a sunny day.  Both were enjoyable and I highly recommend adding this trip to your itinerary!  Once at the top the views (amazing), the gift shop (top notch gifts and ice cream) and the troll photo op should not be missed.  I didn't get a chance to try the restaurant due to time constraints, but the outdoor seating looked like a very nice place to enjoy a meal.  If I ever find myself back in Bergen I will ride to the top of Mount Floyen every time.

reviews.title: Amazing View of the Harbor & Bergen
reviews.text: If the weather is clear, this is a must do!  We put this on our agenda first thing in the morning and waited less than 10 minutes for our trip to the top of Mount Floyen.  We walked the nature path around the pond and explored the "trolls" park.  Great way to begin the day.  Suggest you plan at least an hour for the trip up and down and exploration at the top if you have the physical ability to do so.

reviews.title: What a view
reviews.text: Really wanted to do this trip on the funicular but knew it had to be decent weather to get the great views. We chose a fine morning and because it was good weather there were queues at the station. However the queues were longer if you had to buy your tickets. I had already done this on my phone from the hotel that morning so we were straight in and just queueing for the funicular. A significant saving on time. Good system for getting you on and off the funicular very organised. Only on a short period so not so bad if you don’t get a seat. Once up there is a large open amphitheater to view the vast scene below of Bergen and beyond. So beautiful with the blue skies. We spent a while just looking at the vista along with many others but you didn’t feel crowded. Lots of lovely walks and cycle hire up there too. Children’s play area and the troll forest. We chose to go for a coffee and cake in the restaurant. Large open self service cafe with great views. Whilst in there the weather changed and the mist came down and the views were gone. A must for the view so pick your trip well.

reviews.title: Get high in Bergen
reviews.text:
Weather permitting, this is probably the best view in town. For about $15, that take cable car ride up the mountain. The views from the top are great. So, bring plenty of film. 
The ride only takes about 5 minutes. Each car weighs 12 tons holds a maximum of 80 passengers. The top station is about 1000 ft. above sea level. Enjoy getting high!

reviews.title: Go early or late if the cruise ships are in!
reviews.text:
Stunning views. A pretty ride up and back. And not too crazy on the price (unlike a lot of other things here).
Massive lines in the middle of the day if boats are in.

reviews.title: Impressive view
reviews.text: We stood on line for roughly 35 minutes for the opportunity to ride the tram to the top of Mount Floyen.  Once we reached the

reviews.title: Bergen Funicular
reviews.text: The view from the top is fantastic.  It overlooks the cruise port, the entire city and way beyond that.  It is worth a look.  The crowds waiting to take the ride up can be lengthy, especially if there are cruise ships in port.  Try to go early in the day or keep checking the length of the line.  The line does move fast however.  You can also pre-buy your ticket and avoid waiting in line.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.text: We hit the funicular on a uniquely gorgeous Bergen day, not a cloud in the sky and brilliant sun. The reward at the top was naturally outstanding, the value priceless. We seemed to get in ahead of the heavy crowds coming from our cruise ship. The line moves pretty fast. Each car is accessed by stairs (with no railing which I thought a bit precarious - I do think there's lift assistance for those with limited mobility). The ride up is quite nice, a few minutes, and can be adequately viewed by most everyone in the car. Sit/stand close to the front for best viewing and photos. The top holds an extensive, open set up for lookout points (stairs and ramps are available). Despite the crowds, you can take photos without people in them. Savor your time up there - and don't rush - especially if the weather is extraordinary.  Grab an ice cream from the cafe at the top (a bit pricey, but worth the experience) and just look. A must-do in Bergen.

reviews.title: Lovely, but prepare for the line!
reviews.text: We were lucky to have a warm sunny day. We took the funicular up and hiked down. The line to get a ticket was 45 minutes long, and even if you prepurchase it only allows you to skip the first half of the line. Spectaculae views and lots of trails at the top. Note there is no restaurant that has table service for lunch. Just cafes with sandwiches and hotdogs.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Mount Floyen  is a wonderful place to visit when you’re in Bergen. I took some great pictures of the harbor on my visit! There lots of trials to explore on the top of the mountain!

reviews.title: A delightful visit with fabulous views!
reviews.text: The funicular is near harbor with easy access.  We had a great visit & enjoyed wonderful views from Mount Floyen. There is a restaurant and small gift shop at the top.

reviews.title: Loved it, yes it's touristy but worth it.
reviews.text:
It's touristy but worth it.  The view from the top is well worth the queuing time.  Only 70 passengers at a time so be patient.

Lots of hiking opportunities at the top including some wild(ish) goats.

Views are great.

reviews.title: A short trip to a lovely spot.
reviews.text: Fantastic views of Bergen, but walk a little further from the train, which most people didn’t seem to do, to experience an impressive forest of trees.

reviews.title: Perfect Hiking
reviews.text: Enjoyed the day hiking on the many trails. Worth the cost of the funicular. Bring water on those sunny warm days. The views are spectacular

reviews.title: Wonderful Top City View
reviews.text: A must try experience when in Bergen. Experience the historic Fløybannen so stiff youll 😍 love it and the breathtakingly view is amazing. Make sure its sunny day 🥰😊 check weather forecast 👍😍

reviews.title: Beautiful View of Bergen
reviews.text: We took the funicular to the top for a wonderful view of Bergen! You can see far out to sea and all around the fjord.  We spent over an hour taking photos. The restaurant serves tea, coffee, desserts and light lunches.  We had tea and waited out a short shower. There is a small lake you can hike to or you can continue your hike down the mountain. Oh, and don’t miss the goats!

reviews.title: A Most to Do when in Bergen
reviews.text: Floyen is definitely a must to do when in Bergen. You can enjoy view to the city from the top and in case of bad weather there is a nice cafe/ restaurant for recharge.

reviews.title: Beautiful Trip to Top and View of City - Great walk down
reviews.text:
We visited this on our last visit in the fall.  It is a beautiful trip up on the cable car and the view at the top is the best over the city and harbours.

Early morning it was quiet and as it started to warm up it got busier.  Used extensively by the locals and is fun and lots of activities and hunts for children to do.  The Troll at the top is very sweet.

There are trails down that are maintained and gravelled nicely taking you through some of the neighbourhood up the hill.  Very interesting and a good walk.

Recommend for anyone who likes the outdoors and looking for exercise and fresh air.

reviews.title: Typical tourist
reviews.text: Enjoyed going up in the Funicular to the top of Mt Fløyen. It was raining so unfortunately the view wasn’t perfect. Definitely worth going.

reviews.title: Fun overlook of city
reviews.text: Train was clean and well run. On the way up, we didn't have a seat or a handhold. But the ride was quite smooth. Nice park at the top to explore.

reviews.title: Floibanen
reviews.text: Too long waiting time to get into the carriage. At the lower station and at the top there is only yellow line -the only precaution for people not come close to the edge of the peron. No borders with wall or belt!

reviews.title: A must
reviews.text: A definite don't miss, only takes 6 mins to reach the top. View was brilliant even on an overcast day. Went up at 0900hrs before the crowds which is something I would recommend you do, there were hundreds of people waiting by the time I got back down.

reviews.title: Exciting
reviews.text:
Enjoyed the ride both ways. Also visited lake at the top.
Scenery from top is just fascinating.
Must visit

reviews.title: Bergen Funicular
reviews.text: I think that the top of the city mountain Floien is the most visited place in Bergen both by locals and tourists. Beautiful views. One negative impression connected with LGBT flags on flag polls in front of the entrance to the Funicular. May be this is more logical to place Norwegian national flag there?

reviews.title: Best view of the city
reviews.text: Everyone who visits Bergen should visit Mount Floyen, because this is the most beautiful landscape of the city. After take the floibanen (funicular) it worths spend some time to walk around the area of the little lake.

reviews.title: very very long queues
reviews.text: you travel up steeply to the forests above bergen. great views and good cafes etc.  the grandchildren loved exploring the forest.  unfortunately the 'go-ape' facility was closed.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Great way to see the scope of the city. Carve out time to take a hike. Save a little room for a snack or lunch/dinner. There’s a cafe and restaurant near the observation area.

reviews.title: Spectacular View
reviews.text:
The view at the top was great
The queue to get on the furnicular could be long though so probably best to go as early as possible

reviews.title: Great Funicular Train Ride, views and Park
reviews.text:
This was great fun. A very well organised and run train service to the top of Mount Floyen.

Queues are to be expected as one of the top attractions in Bergen so bear that in mind.

We were lucky, our cruise ship arrived early so we had a quick breakfast and got out as soon as we were able to disembark.

The queue for the funicular wasn't very long for us, perhaps 20-30 minutes and that included a full bus of school children being in front of us.

The price is good for the ride up and the amazing views from the top.

The train has plenty of space for a pushchair and at the top it caters for pushing it around.

You can walk further around to see the wild goats. There is also a children's play park there which our two year old enjoyed.

There is a decent WC at the top with changing facilities.  

From the views you can pretty much see the whole of Bergen so certainly worth a ride.

The train was very regular so there wasn't a long wait to get back down either.

Glad we did this!

reviews.title: Excellent view of Bergen!
reviews.text: Lovely spot at the top of the Funicular here.Safe and fast ride up the mountain.Clean restrooms and fun shop to find gifts. Restaurants available too if you wanted to spend the afternoon.

reviews.title: A must when in Bergen
reviews.text: If you want to see beautiful Bergen from above,  this is the ticket. Nice tram ride up the steep hill to a viewing platform. Overlooking the fjord and city. Has a gift shop and cafe for those interested. Take lots of pictures for your memories.

reviews.title: Excellent views if you don’t mind queuing
reviews.text:
Visited this attraction as part of a shore excursion from a cruise.  The attraction itself is interesting: 875m trip to the top, a good selection of cafes and souvenirs at the summit and excellent views of the city and fjords beyond. 

The downsides: if you buy tickets online or on the app, you will not get on any quicker than those who didn’t.  They have two queues (pre-pay and not) and let an equal number of each in to the train.  So paying up front just ties you in - so when it rains (like it did for us) you cannot escape. 

Secondly, be aware of buying tickets from third parties.  We were told by quiet a few people that they were charged up to twice as much as the ticket price.  So caveat emptor. 

Overall, worth doing when in Bergen.  You will get some good photos of the city.

reviews.title: Feh
reviews.text: This “mountain” is just a hill with a little tram that runs up and down. It offer  give you a nice view of the town and the water but it is really nothing special. In fact the Bergen is nothing special.

reviews.title: Crusing in Bergen
reviews.text:
I visited here as a port of call on P&O Cruises Azura. The Funicular excursion onboard is £50pp (500NOK). We did it on our own, which cost us a 15 min walk from the ship to Fløibanen station and the 95NOK pp (£9.50) for a Return Ticket. If you are over 67years old it’s even cheaper. From what I can tell the only difference in the trip is you don’t walk to the station, you get a coach to take you instead. Doing it this way also means that if there is heavy cloud cover you haven’t wasted your money on not being able to enjoy the views.

Any way, those views – wow aren’t they spectacular, I’ll let the pictures do the talking although they don’t do them the full justice they deserve.

At the top after we had soaked up the views we had a bit of a wander around the woodland at the top and the shops that are on offer, finishing up with a giant cinnamon bun and a cup of tea. A little out of order today we got the trinkets before going back to the ship. 

When we got to the bottom after securing a front row perch on the Funicular we had to track down the Pandora store. Much to mums disappointment they had sold out of all the tourist Pandora charms for Norway. Sounds like an excuse to come back earlier in the season to me #Iona.

From the top we could see a massive pool with fountain and some gardens with a square. So with the wonder that is Apple Maps we tracked it down.

reviews.title: Great funicular.
reviews.text:
This is a good way to get an overview of the city. There is a long wait when cruise ships are in Bergen. We waited until after 3pm and got right onboard. 
Great views of the harbor and a nice 3km (downhill) walk back to the City Centre.

reviews.title: Pay on the day not through fjordtours.com
reviews.text:
I was recently on a P&O cruise at Bergen and wanted to use the Funicular.  I was under the impression that it would be easier and faster to prebook but this was not the case.  As there were two large liners in port there was a long period of waiting.  Two queues formed, one for prebookings and the other for those paying on the day.  No staff were there to tell you which queue you should be in, it was left to you to find out.  We waited at least 45minutes until reaching the ticket office.  I had been instructed to exchange my on-line ticket there and was handed the 6 tickets for my party along with a receipt, showing the price I should have been charged had I just purchased them.  To my amazement the cost was about £12 less than I had paid.

On arrival home I emailed the company asking that the difference be refunded and was told that they fully understood my position but would not be refunding any monies due because they were agents and never said it would be cheaper to buy through them.

My recommendation is that you get there early, avoiding the queues, and pay at the ticket office.

reviews.title: Well worth the scenic hike/funicular ride
reviews.text: A must-do in Bergen for the spectacular view of the city and surrounding fjords.  Can be chilly even in summer, so bring a jacket!

reviews.title: Fløyen ! It's a must by visiting Bergen. Spectacular view !
reviews.text: A trip to Fløyen is a must when you are in Bergen at least for the FIRST time. Exciting way to go with 'Fløybanen'  to the top or you also can walk all the stairs up.  Many people walk or run up and down the stairs often as a time of training . You can walk many different paths on the top of Fløyen.Spectaular view. Not recommended to visit when it's fog or it's raining a lot if you want to have a good view of the whole city and areas around. You can buy ,coffe and some special and  skillingsbollar/cinnamon buns, ice cream,souvenirs. Playground for children. You can also walk a long trip to Ulriken (5-6hours). It's very popular! I went to cinema outside on the top of Fløyen . Sometimes you can have Yoga - classes and dancinglessons as well outside sometimes

reviews.title: Fun!
reviews.text: Funicular was a fun way to get to see excellent views of Bergen.  Crowded wait for 25 minutes in the morning - when we returned after a long lunch there was no line.  Weather changes very quickly and could be very windy.  Nice reception area with fireplace, food and drinks encouraged us to stay at the top hoping for some sun!

reviews.title: A must for panoramic views of the city.
reviews.text: I took the funicular ride to the top of Mount Floyen twice during my recent visit to Bergen. The first time I went up it was mid evening and there were no queues whatsoever. On this occasion I walked back down through the woods near the top and then the beautiful winding streets of colourful houses.  The second time I went up was late morning and there was quite a long queue but as the trains were more frequent than in the evening it moved fairly quickly. The ride in itself is great fun and the views of the city and the surrounding area are spectacular.  Well worth the fare.  I would definitely recommend walking down as there are many interesting sights on the way.

reviews.title: Great walk to the top!
reviews.text: It took us about an hour to walk to the top. It's a great walk - not too hard if you're in decent shape. And lovely views up the top.

reviews.title: Book in advance!
reviews.text: We queued for almost an hour to take the funicular up the mountain and it meant we only had time for a couple minutes at the top. Half way through the queue I realised I should have just booked online when we arrived as the ticketed queue is half the length but by then it was not worth doing. (it'll also save you a couple NOK) The view from the top is amazing and there looked like a lot to do but we did not have time as we had to catch the next car down.

reviews.title: Hike up and take the tram down - You will earn your dessert!
reviews.text: The hike up is step but well worth it.  At the top there are Trolls, and a beautiful view.  We then took the tram down what a fun experience!

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Went up spectacular views of Bergen great fun  the view of the harbor and the country side will knock your socks off the ride is easy on and off

reviews.title: Not to be missed.
reviews.text: Went to Bergen on a holiday with family. My mum had always wanted to go on this so off we went. There is parking nearby and disabled parking right near it. My mum has to walk with a stroller so we were wondering how she would get on. No worries, there is a lift that takes you to a platform and you can stroll on and sit down. The rest of the family had to get in a queue and walk up some stairs, but everything moved quickly. The view from the top is stunning you can see almost right round. Plenty of seating and photo opportunities. There is also a little gift shop, cafe and restaurant. There is also a play park for the children and woodland walks. You could easily spend a few hours there. The only downside was the price. I asked for a concession ticket for my mum. But was told they only sell them out of season. I thought that was a bit unfair. But we still had a great time.

reviews.title: A must if you like walking in the nature
reviews.text: The Floybanan gives you easy acces to a wonderful nature and some marvelous sights over Bergen and the surrounding landscape with the  Atlantic Ocean in the background. From the upper station you can choose between a number of paths leading you through forrest, by lakes and vertical cliffs. As it rains a lot in Norway make your programme in Bergen a flexible one so that you can go there when the weather is clear.

reviews.title: Road trip
reviews.text: Was fun quick, weather wasn't in our favor but nothing anyone could do about that. Would recommend this

reviews.title: I Tried To Walk Up Fløyen
reviews.text:
I got 1/4 the way up and my knees gave out.  I wandered back down to the harbour whilst my son continued hiking up.  I decided I wanted to see the view at the top.  

I took the Fløyenbanen to the top.  It was reasonably priced, and once at the top, we walked to the lake, and there are plenty of hikes you can do from the top.

There is a fantastic viewing platform from the top, along with a cafe, a children’s playground and plenty of signs.

reviews.title: Worth the wait
reviews.text:
There always seems to be a very long queue but it moves quickly. 
Go in the AM if you can. 
The views are spectacular.

reviews.title: Go after 3PM
reviews.text: We took the popular funicular ride.  We arrived about noon on a day when two cruise ships were in town.  The line was incredible!!  Our guide suggested coming after 3PM when the cruise ship passengers will be gone.  We ended going after dinner and got some great (almost sunset) photos from the top.  All in all, I would have been disappointed if I had waited in the long line for a quick trip up and back.  I can only imagine how crowded it would have been on the top, as well.  With  more time, we would have hiked some of the trails at the top.

reviews.title: Easy to find, great trails
reviews.text: Easy to find the funicular, just a block away from Starbucks near Bryggen. There was a long line for tickets but moved fairly quickly. Funicular makes three more stops while going to the top. The conductor assists if anyone needs help with baby strollers, etc. Once at the top, Mt Floyen offers lots of summer activities with many trails. We trekked for about an hour and a half, returned to main cafe and enjoyed refreshments. Great place to leisurely spend a few hours.

reviews.title: Hiking Inside City Limits
reviews.text:
My husband and I opted to hike up to the top of Mount Fløyen and it was obviously that the space was used by many locals for a walk, run, training session, or activity park.  After passing the tram car that climbs the 1hr or so hike in about 15 minutes (and its sizeable line), we had the option of following the winding road or taking intermittent staircases that helped those who lived in the area reach their cozy, tucked-away neighborhoods.  I loved seeing the small knots of where people lived on the mountainside and that was one of my favorite parts of Bergen!

The climb is steep.  The paths are paved for cyclists and to make it easier for people to walk on solid, flat ground.  Just remember that you’re climbed pretty high elevation in a very short amount of time so you’re constantly walking up inclines.  the path was well-shaded and had magnificent views of the city along the way. 

We reached the summit in about an hour and at the top, there are a few local establishments that can offer a small snack and a souvenir to a sit-down meal.  There are public restrooms (no cost) available at the top of the path and there are plenty of lookouts to capture amazing pictures of the view.  We did not pursue the other hiking paths at the top (Next time!).

Walking down from Mt. Fløyen is pretty quick as it’s downhill; it is another hike that you should take slowly to avoid falling forward.  Just know that the native Norwegians and those seemingly training for running events will scoot right on by you.

reviews.title: Buy ticket with the app
reviews.text:
It saves you time. 
I strongly recommend to purchase a one-way ticket to the top and walk down again. 
The view from the top is spectacular and walking down extends and preserves the special experience and gives a gentle return to the city buzz. 

The walk I purely downhill and can be done at any pace. Remember to enjoy the view while walking. 
Well suited for families.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.text: First time in Bergen, and have to say one of the most amazing places in the world.  The Funicular is easy to board, has accessible lanes and easy access into the carriages for those with any mobility issue, there is also seating.  Once on, there are a couple of stops at different levels of the mountain.  Once on top, there are shops, cafes and restaurants, plus activities and the viewing platform on three levels.  The view is spectacular and one of the most stunning I have ever seen and I have travelled extensively.

reviews.title: Stunning views despite the rainy weather
reviews.text: We arrived in Bergen on a cruise ship and decided to do the Funicular first. Big mistake as there were many tour groups from ships doing the same thing. (We happened to walk by later in the day and there wasn’t a line up). Despite this, the line moves pretty quickly and we made it to the top. The views are amazing and there a cafeteria and a gift shop. On a nice sunny and warm day I would recommend grabbing a tea or coffee and sitting to admire the view.

reviews.title: Up, up and away!
reviews.text:
If you are in Bergen for any length of time be sure to purchase your Bergen card as this gives you a discount on the funicular. However we thought it would be unlimited travel on this train but they mark your card when you use it the first time and it is only a one-off discount.

Try and find out when cruise ships are docking because if you coincide with a ship then your queue may be a long one. Late afternoon or early evening are good times to go up as the ships have usually sailed by this time.

Very smooth procedure to get onto the platform having purchased your ticket. Bench seats allow you to admire the incline or the receding view of Bergen.

Fully accessible for disabled visitors.

A must when visiting Bergen

reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
reviews.text: The most gorgeous views of Bergen!!! Beautiful romantic atmosphere a must go if you in Bergen don’t miss this

reviews.title: amazing
reviews.text: go in evening - less crowded and you may even get to see / join a yoga class at sunset! - you can walk around the top and see the goats!

reviews.title: A lot of hills
reviews.text: If you are going to hike from Floyen to Ulriken, then don't walk up the mountain, then go the 9 miles to the other mountain. The walk up and down the mountain is HARD. The walk across the two is much easier.

reviews.title: Lovely views, get there early
reviews.text: Definitely worth a visit, but do get there early as possible, once the group people come it’s very,very busy and queuing forms down the street, great views and if fit a nice walk down(at 60 I’m too old to walk up)

reviews.title: A Must-Do While in Bergen
reviews.text: I would describe this activity as having 3 components: the trip up, the top, and the trip down. For the trip up, take the funicular! You can also walk or run to the top, which many locals apparently do. Up on top you can either enjoy the view and take some pictures, or you can visit the restaurant. We chose the latter and had a late lunch there. The food was very tasty and while you could sit outside, there was a brisk wind, so we sat inside and enjoyed the view and the food from there. On the way down there are two options: take the funicular back down or walk. We walked and it was absolutely delightful. In addition to spectacular views, because we were there in spring, many wildflowers were starting to bloom. It took about 45 minutes to an hour and was easy walking on a wide dirt road. For me, the walk down was the highlight of this activity.

reviews.title: Enjoy the views!
reviews.text: I would normally be the person walking all the way up to the top of this, and back down again, but due to a recent injury I used my Bergen Card to get a discount on a return ticket. This was an excellent place to visit, as others have said, the views are breathtaking. I was lucky enough to visit on a sunny and clear day, and it wasn't even windy up there. I took some fabulous photos, and really enjoyed seeing all the different viewpoints. The tame and mellow mountain goats were a wonderful surprise. So glad that people aren't allowed to feed them, or they'd be very aggressive. There were family-oriented activities as well. Don't miss this chance to see Bergen from up high!

reviews.title: Senior Prices no longer available
reviews.text: When we visited in 2017 we enjoyed a Senior rate on the Funicular. This is not available and everybody pays the adult price of 125Krone return. Still enjoyable if the weather holds out as Bergen renowned for being one of the wettest cities on the continent

reviews.title: Enjoyable way to spend day
reviews.text: Easy to find and navigate. We chose to walk up and down which was a good work out. Path mostly paved switchback with some stair structures. Clearly marked. Recommend for nice hike. At top have cafe, bathrooms and outdoor play area for kids. Cooler so wear layers. Viewing is beautiful

reviews.title: This is a must do in Bergen
reviews.text: This trip is a must do whilst in Bergen. The views from the top are spectacular and you can spend a whole day up here exploring if that's what you want to do. There is a restaurant and shop and you can hire bikes. Great views.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text:
We were lucky to have a fine and mostly sunny day to go up the funicular railway
Very busy as it was a Sunday and 2 cruise ships were in port however as we went late morning it didn’t take long in the queue.
We did buy our tickets beforehand at the Information Centre however there was no sign at the ticket office to say go straight thru if you have a ticket. In a tour group this wouldn’t have been a problem but as a couple we thought we best line up and so this meant an unnecessary delay, we probably could have walked thru but we didn’t want to risk ‘crowd rage’
Up the top the views of Bergen and it’s harbour are great 
If you have kids there are quite a few activities they can do, even a play area for little ones
If you want you can buy a one way ticket and walk downhill 3 klms to the bottom. You can also do this in reverse but it is all uphill.
Food and drink available too

reviews.title: Efficient
reviews.text: Best way to see the city from above if you're short on time, quick ride up and down, there's even a gift shop and cafe at the top. Lines moved quickly. Bought tickets at the hostel we were staying at.

reviews.title: Great views, go early
reviews.text: Must do trip when in Bergen. Choose a dry day if possible and go as early as you can to avoid long queues for tickets then again actually getting into the funicular. Easy ride to the top and stunning views across Bergen with bonus rainbows after the showers

reviews.title: Mount Floyen 4 Hour 9km Hike
reviews.text: Mount Floyen has countless hikes and suites all sort of adventures from beginner to more advanced hikers.

reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.text: One of the highlights of our trip! You should take the tram up and have a glass of wine at the top. There is also a beautiful lake that is a 5min walk away that I highly recommend.

reviews.title: A must do while in BERGEN
reviews.text:
What a beautiful ride to the top of Mount Floyen and the view from the top is amazing!
The smooth ride both ways will calm the most timid traveler. A view that cannot be missed!

reviews.title: Marvelous place
reviews.text: The view from the mountain is breath taking, Just fantastic and great views of Bergen city. The cafe serves excellent drinking chocolate. One should try this essentially. There is a small kids park. If the weather is good we can see many places which are wonderful.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text: Thankfully we arrived fairly early as the queue was massive by the time we got down. Not cheap, but then what is in Norway? Well worth it in our book.

reviews.title: Lovely view
reviews.text: Had a return ticket for the funicular. Amazing views at the top and it was spotless! Expensive cafe at the top but that’s expected in Norway but worth a visit for the views.

reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.text: The funicular ride to Mount Floyen deserves its place as the number 1 ranked attraction in Bergen. The view from the top is amazing!  It’s difficult to put in words how spectacular the views really are. You can see for miles as well as getting great birds eye views of downtown Bergen and the wharf. The ride to the top is only 7 minutes long. We took the funicular up to the top and then walked down on the nice gravel walking path. At the top, in addition to the views there are also a number of walking paths of various lengths. The shortest (just 5 minutes) takes you to a lovely lake on top of the mountain. A must do!

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: We took funicular up and walked down, nice views from top, however we preferred the Mount Ulriken cable car ride and views from Mt Ulriken better.

reviews.title: Wonderful destination
reviews.text: It’s a wonderful destination indeed for everybody who likes nature and breathtaking views. You can walk to the top and enjoy the views on the way to fløyen, and burning all the calories that you ate that day.

reviews.title: Ideal birds eye view of Bergen
reviews.text: The Funicular has been modernized and as in Hong Kong provides on a beautiful day a spectacular view. At the top there are places to eat, drink, take pictures, or go for a peaceful walk. Breathtakingly beautiful!

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text:
We rode the funicular up the mountain and the scenery/views were spectacular. It was a clear, sunny, hot day. We sat down and looked at the fantastic views while eating ice cream. 
We thought the goats were an odd thing to see on the mountain.

reviews.title: Mount Floyen Funicular
reviews.text: The weather was perfect for our visit 22 degrees!. We had pre booked tickets online prior to our cruise so we were able to jump the queue. The carriages run frequently and carry a few passengers. Spectacular views as you ascend the mountain and also from the viewing points once at the top. There are toilets, a gift shop and cafe. Signposts to various walks and activities. We chose to walk to the lake - it was beautiful. We chose to walk back down, to take in all the views (glad we did), our cruise ship looked like a dot. We saw a lot more of the town. Lovely to do if weather is good.

reviews.title: Gorgeous views
reviews.text: Short trip up to a viewpoint with gorgeous views over Bergen. There is also a green area behind, some goats chillaxing, a restaurant and a coffee shop.

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.text: The drive up Mt. Fløyen is really spectacular. From up there you have a fantastic view. Highly recommended. Best in the morning, otherwise you have to be in the queue ...

reviews.title: Sun and snow in early May
reviews.text: We rode up, it was just starting to rain and it was snowing at the top.  So we waited it out with a coffee, there is food at the top.  WE walked down which was nice as the snow melted quickly it was a bit cloudy, but the view is excellent.  Take the trip, round trip if you dont want to walk

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Well worth the trip, some steepish steps to negotiate but there was a lift at the top station. Great views and lovely soft ice cream!

reviews.title: Funicular train to the top of Mt Floyen
reviews.text: Fun place for kids and adults alike. Fabulous views. A great place for pics - if the weather is clear. Great short hikes around the top too.

reviews.title: Fab first view of Bergen
reviews.text: Easy to get to and almost instant impact. Loved the view. If anything the only thing that spoilt it was the cafe at the top. The coffee was cold and foul tasting. Not what yo7 would expect at a tourist destination.

reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.text: Well worth the visit to Mount Floyen and the Funicular!! You can walk around, near a lake, have a pic nic, joking or have a coffee and enjoy the beautiful view

reviews.title: Wonderful views!
reviews.text: Pick a clear day, and the views are amazing from the top! We walked to a couple of the lakes at the top, plenty of trails to follow. Very efficient service to get you to the top!

reviews.title: breathtaking views
reviews.text: This is a must do while in bergen. You can get to the top using the funicular ride which is fast and affordable or you can do one of the trails to the top. The view from the top is amazing and worth it any time of the day.

reviews.title: Must do!
reviews.text: there are nice walking trails at the top, and you can get a pass for unlimited trips up and down for a low price.

reviews.title: Up by Funicular & down on foot
reviews.text: I bought a one way ticket up by funicular and after visiting the lake I walked down following the foot trail. This was a perfect combination that allowed me to enjoy the views without losing my breath

reviews.title: WALK UP or you miss out on the best bit
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend walking up to floyen as the best part is walking through the beautiful fairytale forest and breathing in the fresh mountain air. Obviously the funicular is best if you have mobility issues but for most people the walk up shouldn’t be too strenuous. It’s uphill the whole way but you can take it as slow or fast as you like. We had the best walks of our trip on floyen - there are plenty of little streams, mini waterfalls, cute little signs and cairns created by people along the way

reviews.title: "The High Life"
reviews.text: Come to Bergen,you just gotta go on the funicular,pay single(walk down) or return,choice is yours,a gentile journey up Mt.Floyen to enjoy the MAGNIFICENT views over Bergen,call in a cafe for food,playground for kids,or just head off on a marked trail,in all directions,all these things are up here,oh,nearly forgot the giftshop.A great way to spend as few or as many hours as you want!

reviews.title: Perfect day.  Perfect view.
reviews.text: What a fabulous day.  Overcast and 50 degrees.  Perfect for pictures at the top.  Walked up to ticket counter.  Bought ticket.  Waited 5 min and up we went. Didn't do too much walking around and took the tram back down.  Fabulous view

reviews.title: Morning trip
reviews.text: This place is beautiful Furnacular ride is fun and fast. Amazing views from top. Of Bergen, harbours, mountains . Lovely walk tthrough woods to lake and beyond.  Nice coffee shop kiosks and restaurant.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Since there’s not much to do in the city, this is the only thing I’d recommend. You get a great view, really nice to walk around, see the lake and some fauna and head back. We were lucky enough to get snow in the spring so that was a plus

reviews.title: Great view and worth a visit
reviews.text: Not the cheapest funicular but definitely worth a visit. Especially combing with a walk around the old wooden houses up to the Skansen church.

reviews.title: Worth the climb
reviews.text: We opted to walk up the track. It wasn’t as steep or as hard as I had anticipated. Even though we visited on an inclement day, the view was still amazing. We then enjoyed a ride back down to town on the funicular and that was fun

reviews.title: View
reviews.text: If you visiting Bergen you have to visit this place. My suggestion is that walk it up and don't use funicular. Walking up is not as hard as it seems and take only 45 min to one hour max but is more fun. Up there you have nice view of city on good days and can continue up to the wood and enjoy it.

reviews.title: Sight seeing
reviews.text: Cool wiew from the top. Pricing to the funicular is ok, but doesn't fit alot of people. Worth visiting if in Bergen.

reviews.title: A must do funicular ride when visiting Bergen
reviews.text: When visiting Bergen, taking the short, steep funicular ride to Fløyen, the mountain adjoining the city is a must do. You will without doubt enjoy the ride and the spectacular views from the top. On a clear, sunny day, you can see the fjords and North Sea as well as the whole city and harbor. If you feel sporty, I recommend taking the walk back down to the center.

reviews.title: Enjoyable trip with lovely views
reviews.text: The funicular ride is good fun. At the top the views over Bergen are fabulous. There’s a cafe and restaurant up the top. If you don’t want to walk all the way down, if you get the funicular at 00 or 30 mins down then you can  get off partway down and walk through the lovely cobbled streets of wooden houses.

reviews.title: Great trip - really worthwhile
reviews.text: This is well worth doing. I wish we had gone earlier because it's a great way to see the layout of the city and how everything links together. Fantastic views. And a super piece of engineering! LOvely people in the cafe at the top.

reviews.title: Viewing area
reviews.text: A great ride to go up and enjoy the panoramic view of Bergen City. But it's a much better to go up when the weather is good else it will very cold and windy

reviews.title: Amazing view.
reviews.text: The number one thing to do in Bergen. The view is above spectacular. It is breathtaking and scenic. You get a sense of the size and expanse  of the town

reviews.title: Spectaculare ride and amaizing wieu
reviews.text: This is no 1 tourist attraction in Bergen, and on a sunny day it will be amazing, it's also possible to walk to the mountain, but its a little tricky to find the way and its a hard walk for about 40-50 min.

reviews.title: A must do trip
reviews.text: We had to do this trip because our trip by cable car had been cancelled due to high winds, but it was just as breath taking and the views were amazing.  When reaching the top you see such a breath taking view, once in a lifetime experience.  Make sure you walk around the back of the cafe where there is a troll park for the children, you wouldn’t know it was there unless you take the walk.  It’s brilliant.  The cafe also serves up a lovely cuppa and hot chocolate, with traditional cakes.  They are also a must.  An amazing time for all the family.  Enjoy!

reviews.title: Walk
reviews.text:
We walked to mount floyen. Starting from the fish market. It was a very easy walk with plenty of signs to show the way. 
Definitely worth going to see the views. 
I

reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.text: As soon as you leave the funicular the view is gorgeous. We walked briefly after taking pictures and found mountain goats on the rocks grazing.  A must see while in Bergen.

reviews.title: Top of bergen
reviews.text: While in bergen take the funicular and go to the top of mount floyen. The views of bergen from the top is stunning and it's worth the visit. There is a lake on the top where you can go for boating.

reviews.title: Very Nice Sunset
reviews.text: The view from Floyen is amazing. The funicular’s trip is short, around 10 min. And the fantastic view worth U$ 15!

reviews.title: What a view
reviews.text:
Well worth joining the queue for the funicular railway - the views from the top station are amazing, and there are so many activities at the top especially for little ones.
This is a beautiful city with plenty to see. Lots of places for coffee or a beer/wine.

reviews.title: Beautiful View
reviews.text: My husband and I ventured to the top of Mt. Floyen twice during our short trip. We did a little hiking and brought a picnic lunch. It was fantastic! The view is amazing. There are plenty of trails for some light hiking. And goats! ❤️ highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text: The funicular ride to the top is a lot of fun. The views at the top are great and there is a hiking trail up top. Also a souvenir and coffee shop. You can take the funicular back down or hike your way down which is a great exercise.

reviews.title: Wonderful Views at Sunset
reviews.text: The start of the funicular is an easy walk from the centre of Bergen. The funicular itself is nothing exceptional but the views of Bergen from the top make the trip more than worthwhile, especially in an evening sunset.

reviews.title: View
reviews.text: Great walk to the lake with  last snow making it eerily beautiful. Well worth the cost of the funicular fare. Should have walked down .

reviews.title: Amazing nature right from the city center
reviews.text: We visited Fløyen on a beautiful sunny day. On the way up we took funicular and then walked around to see the lake, goats and troll's park. On the way down we walked and it took us around 45min.

reviews.title: If you have to do just one thing in Bergen, do this!
reviews.text: Easy to get to the top, spectacular views of Bergen, a lot to do once up there. You can even walk up to the lake and spend some time there. The most enjoyable experience in Bergen.

reviews.title: Quick Trip to the Top, Walk Back Down!!!
reviews.text: It's a short five minute walk from downtown.  The trip to the top is pretty quick.  The view is spectacular.  We walked back down via the trail.  It was a great experience, with even more nice views.  Those Norwegians are in great shape.  We saw lots of folks walking/running UP the mountain, some even pushing baby carriages.  Watch out for Trolls!!!

reviews.title: Bergen from the top
reviews.text: When in Bergen you cannot miss to have a go in the Mount Floyen and the Funicular (Floibanen) views incredible and a very good perception on how the fjords look like.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: The ride up is very scenic and there are many things to do up on the mountain: hikes, ponds, big playgrounds, zip line, etc. very suitable and fun for children

reviews.title: Fun funicular!
reviews.text: Worth the time.  Great view! Took my 80 year old mother and there were not too many stairs...easy, interesting, and beautiful!

reviews.title: It's a Must!
reviews.text: In order to understand the layout and scope of the city of Bergen you must ride the Floyen to the top of the mountain and take in the amazing view!

reviews.title: Great dun
reviews.text: Excellent funicular railway to the top where you can then go for lovely walks. But don't buy a return and walk down instead - fascinating.

reviews.title: Well run operation
reviews.text: Visited Mount Floyen. Took the funicular railway up, there was a bit of a queue but pleasantly surprised that it didn’t take too long to go down. The carriages take a decent amount of people so does move reasonably well. Views are amazing and well worth a visit to the restaurant at the top, even for a beer  although the ice cream looked amazing! We had a gorgeous sunny day so made it all the better. Is under development at the minute, so a bit of work going on but looks like it will be lovely when finished! The prices for food and drink are typical Norwegian prices so £8-£9 for a beer, £4 for a soft drink. Return ticket on the Funicular was about £10.

reviews.title: Lovely birds eye view
reviews.text: Tickets are purchased from an individual,  but scanning your ticket and entering the que is a self serve function. The steep climb on the funicular has several short stops, but you are eventually rewarded with a panoramic view of the city. Sunny days are best for enjoying this photographic opportunity.

reviews.title: Best view of Bergen
reviews.text: Quick and painless to reach the highest point in Bergen and well worth the effort as it gives a Birdseye view of Bergen. You can walk to the top but if you don’t have the time or inclination the funicular can get you there in a couple of minutes. Suggest going before 10am to beat the tour lineups

reviews.title: Fabulous views
reviews.text: Fantastic views from the top - well worth the trip although I would recommend buying tickets online in advance to skip the queue.

reviews.title: Funicular ride is awesome!
reviews.text: The ride is awesome. Some people in our group hiked down but it was not as interesting as they expected. Views from the top are beautiful. There is a restaurant, a cafe, a self service and a gift shop with really cute items. Prices are the same as the rest of Bergen. A playground is available for the kids, as well as some live goats. Go early in the morning as it does get crowded as the day goes on. Base station is easy to find, a short walk from the wharf area.

reviews.title: Must do in Bergen
reviews.text: Of course you have to do this when you are in Bergen.  Took the Funicular up to the top, spent an hour or so appreciating the view, taking a walk to the lake, and a beer to finish off.  We then would recommend the nice walk down to town from the top admiring the changing view as you go.

reviews.title: Full view of Bergen
reviews.text: 6mins up by tram and get a full view of beautiful  Bergen. It was a Sunday so it was crowded with tourist and locals. Went on a short hike to the lake. Beautiful peaceful lake. Enjoyable to spend half a day on the top.

reviews.title: Great view and a fun ride
reviews.text:
I thought I knew funiculars, but this one was special.  It goes way up the mountain, and indeed has stops along the way, presumably for locals who live on the mountainside. 
The ride was fun with a great view below.  As it was not a busy tourist season, we were not crowded and could enjoy it.
Once up top, the view is spectacular and it's worth it to walk around and take it in.  There is a lovely gift shop and café at the top that are both worth visiting, as well as very clean washrooms.

reviews.title: Sit in Front
