reviews.text: Unless there’s a crowd waiting, make your way to the front of the car on the way down (and in back on the way up).  Wonderful view

reviews.title: Great views and infrastructure
reviews.text: Took the funicular which is already a nice experience on its own. The views are very nice and the forest trails at the peak are well kept and nice to walk. Definitely worth it if you're in Bergen!

reviews.title: One of the highlights
reviews.text: This was one of the first things we did after arriving in Bergen. I was so excited to ride the Fløibanen cable car to the top of Mt Fløyen where majestic views of Bergen and the harbor await. A round trip ticket is 95NOK ($12 USD) and can be purchased at the base. The ride up the cable car takes about 10 minutes. At the top the views are spectacular. There is a restaurant, a gift shop, bathrooms, and a small park/playground up at the top.

reviews.title: Absolutely stunning
reviews.text: This is definitely worth a visit during your stay in Bergen. A return trip costs the equivalent of about £10, and the view from the top is absolutely spectacular. Whilst at the top, do take the opportunity to do some exploring. There is a selection of paths and trails, and a beautiful lake about 5 minutes walk away, so is a great starting point for walkers and runners.

reviews.title: Incredible view
reviews.text: The view of Bergen was a sight to behold.  From the top, you can see the Bergen waterways and city.  This is a must-see.

reviews.title: The place to go
reviews.text: What views! Not so good on amenities in April - but big crowds. At least the rest rooms were open. Good hiking trails.

reviews.title: Wonderful views of Bergen
reviews.text: Beautiful affordable way to see gorgeous views of Bergen.  The funicular is 95NOK return of purchased on the day.  It is also possible to buy your ticket using the Fløibanen app, which is free to download.  Tickets are slightly cheaper if purchased via the app.

reviews.title: Familytrip
reviews.text: Tok the cablecar to the too. Nice area to walk around in, also if in a wheelchair. On the too you can bring food for your pen picknic or buy food at the restaurant

reviews.title: An excellentview
reviews.text: The trip itself is quite fast, but gives you a great opportunity to have a great view of Bergen. The cafe on top hasthe best cinnamon buns on Earth!  If the weather allows, take the opportunity to walk at least part of the way down.

reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.text:
A must-do in Bergen, and best to take the ferry before 10am in the morning to avoid queues!
Cheap for what it is and the restaurant on the top has excellent lunch!

reviews.title: Marvellous View
reviews.text: The view was just marvellous. I had a coffee at the stop on top, and I certainly enjoy walking around staring at the view, pet the goats there and walked down. I anticipated the view to be amazing on top but was thrilled by how easy and beautiful the walk is.

reviews.title: Brief but great views of Bergen
reviews.text: The weather was not great  but did clear  briefly for a spectacular view across the city. Well worth the effort , and would be even better if the weather had been dry and clear

reviews.title: Great views of the city and beyond
reviews.text: The trip to the top is worth it (we had a Bergen card, so the ride was included in that price). Great views, some pretty walks and a good children's playground at the summit station.

reviews.title: Incredible views  - stay for the goats!
reviews.text: Not only is the hiking trail fantastic, but the views from the top are breathtaking. Plus, there are plenty of photo ops with friendly mountain goats.

reviews.title: Amazing views of Bergen
reviews.text: Trip to Floibanen on funicular was magical. Great value for money. From the top the city is beautiful and we spent a couple of enjoyable hours up there. Great views, Fun, Efficient; would highly recommend it as a "must do" if you are visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Delightful!
reviews.text: Great fun - ride up & walk down! Good exercise! Walk is paved & easy to maneuver. Don’t miss it!! Great views too!

reviews.title: Great views & fun playgrounds
reviews.text: Visited Fløyen via the funicular railway today and spent a relaxing couple of hours at the top. The views across Bergen and the surrounding countryside are amazing and the kids loved the adventure playground in the forest, complete with small zip wire.

reviews.title: Great views but sadly our day it was raining
reviews.text:
On a cruise and we were visiting Bergen and had pre-booked a trip on the Mount Floyen funicular. What was a shame was that the weather had turned and it was raining. Which was a shame as the views of Bergen and the surrounding area would be stunning on a clear day. 

If you are going to do the railway I would advise booking your tickets in advance as the queues can be long.

reviews.title: The best attraction of Bergen.
reviews.text: Ignore the reviews that tell you to buy tickets in the Information Centre.  We spent 20 minutes queuing there and there was no queue at the Floibanen ticket office.  Doh!  It was a spectacular ride up to Mount Floi and we spent several hours up there digesting the wonderful views across the city that was bathed in brilliant sunshine which only happens once a century.  Comparatively at £10 per head for the journey this was a cheap trip for Norway.

reviews.title: Must do on few days in Bergen
reviews.text: Great view of town. Recommend a walk down by taking left when coming out of funicular. 3km on good path down all the way. Great view all the time.

reviews.title: Wonderful Place To Visit
reviews.text: I have visited Bergen several times and this trip is one I have done each time and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. There is a short ride up a very steep funicular railway which affords brilliant views. At the top is a gift shop a restaurant and magnificent views across Bergen. You may buy a single ticket up the funicular and walk back down if you fancy it.

reviews.title: Great trip, great views
reviews.text: Fun triangle to mountaintop. Great views. Can walk down easily on paved track. Large park at top. Restaurant too. Open in the evening for night views

reviews.title: You have to go there!
reviews.text: The view is beautuful, in all kind of weather, except fog. If you are in really good shape you walk up and down, if your shape is like mine you take the train up and walk down, otherwise you take the train up and down. Have a nice trip.

reviews.title: Well worth it!
reviews.text: This is a worthwhile stop in Bergen. The view is fantastic and there are a number of trails that you can explore.

reviews.title: A Must Visit
reviews.text: I spent just an evening in Bergen and made this as a must-see. The funicular ride and views from the top of Mount Floyen are well worth it. Sunrise may be great - although not sure if they are open that early

reviews.title: Imposing views of Bergen at 320 metres above sea level.
reviews.text: Take the funicular or a 1hour climb by walk. The views from the top are breathtaking. Trekking, childrens' playground, lake, BBQ, etc. available.

reviews.title: Pretty Views
reviews.text: We took the funicular up Mt Floyen.  It offered pretty views of Bergen.  You can also see the surrounding hills and sea.   Walked up to the viewpoint too.  You can also explore the trails and many people also walk down the trails.  Sit down on the bench and enjoy the tranquility and peace.

reviews.title: View from the top
reviews.text: Convenient to centre of town, and the ride to the top takes only 10 minutes.  From there you have great views over the town of Bergen, the surrounding hills and the sea.  Up on the hill there are plenty of trails for walkers, snowmobilers etc to explore. We were there in January, so it was very much off-season – there was only one small café open.  Visit at a better time and there are more eating places plus at least one place to hire hiking stuff – gear, maps for the area etc.

reviews.title: A beautiful sunset
reviews.text: Rode the funicular after an early dinner, and it was not crowded.  Enjoyed the view and an ice cream.  One could walk down, but one would need to be in pretty good shape.  Admired the construction of the line. The view is incredible on a nice day.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text: The funicular is modern and comfortable and it’s include in the Bergen card at this time of the year. The views from Mount Floyen are impressive and you can take a short walk to a beautiful nearby lake.

reviews.title: Sightseeing from the highest point
reviews.text:
Super funicular that delivered amazing views over Bergen.   The local use it for access to different areas and at the top people were using it for recreation, walking dogs and picnics.

Amazing views over Bergen and definately a do while you are here.

reviews.title: Worth the time if the weather is right
reviews.text: The funicular ride is OK - parts of it have blocked views as you go through tunnels.  The view from the top is great - as long as the cloud cover is high enough.  We had a good day, the clouds rolled in 10 - 15 minutes after we got there, so we had time to see the view and take some good photos before the view was only clouds.  Total time - including ride up, seeing the view and ride down about 1 hour.  There are many hiking trails on the top, but we were there in March, so didn't do any hiking.

reviews.title: great trip up the mountain, nice shop and hikes
reviews.text: great time at the top of the mountain and the journey up and down of course.  weather changes every 15 mins, sunny, cloudy, rainy etc.

reviews.title: Stunning city views
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to experience a sunny day in Bergen. So I went up in the evening- it gets pretty crowded so makes sense to get there a bit earlier and find a nice spot for yourself. Usually a lot of the crowd ends up hanging around the Funicular stop. But you can find places to relax if you walk further up and IMO you may find better views.

reviews.title: Killer views
reviews.text: We were lucky to make it to the top on a sunny day.  March seemed fairly quiet.  There are places to eat at the top and loads of walking trails.

reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.text: You only realise the size and sprawl of Bergen when you visit here. When we visited there were little or no crowds but could imagine busy at times. Restaurant undergoing renovation at the moment so closed but other coffee outlets are available. For the energetic a walk down or up? followed by the opposite is a good option.

reviews.title: Great views whatever the weather
reviews.text: We used this twice as part of the Bergen Pass. Day one was cloudy but clear views. Day two was sunny. Both times gave us a different perspective and view. The funicular is well organised and runs on time.

reviews.title: Good workout and fantastic views
reviews.text: We walked up to the top of Mount Floyen rather than taking the funicular.  (According to my Fitbit, it was approximately 3 miles.  We are in our mid-50s and in pretty good shape, but we did have some huffing and puffing along the way.) The view from the top was spectacular!  At the top, there are a couple of shops/restaurants, restrooms, a place to refill your water for FREE!, a playground (?), and walking trails.  It was really the best thing we did in Bergen and I enjoyed it so much.

reviews.title: Go in the morning when it’s clear!
reviews.text: We had a lovely morning here. Ride up and walk down to enjoy magnificent views and the freshest air you’ll ever breathe! We took many satisfying pics and then ended up in Bryggen for lunch and an afternoon stroll.

reviews.title: Good place to visit with your love ones, family and friends
reviews.text:
This place is a must if you are visiting bergen. Rode all the way to the top (and return) via a fornicular which upon climbing up will give you a glimpse of the city. Once you reach the top, you will be welcomed by the spectacular view of Bergen. Your visit doesnt end by taking pictures or staying in the platform view but rather it is just a beginning. You can explore the area by walking further. You get to enjoy nature at its finest, the lake-ducks and trees are gorgeous even at winter. You can relax and feel the fresh air while chatting with your friends and loved ones. Playground is also availble for your little ones.

Place is in the center of Bergen so accessibility is not a problem.

reviews.title: Short 15mins ride up?
reviews.text: It's quite expensive. But I recommend taking the funicular up, then walking down. Recommend to go during the day and catch the sunset! As you walk down after sunset, you can see how the city transitions to night with all the city lights.

reviews.title: Great views from the top
reviews.text: This is a good lazy way to get up the hillside and the views from the top are really beautiful over Bergen.  It is only a 3km walk back down and it is clearly marked so I just bought a single ticket.  I think if I did my trip again I would probably go up the Stokzekleiven steps then hike to Mount Floyen to have a longer hike because it really is lovely up there

reviews.title: Fløyen by foot
reviews.text: We didn’t use the funicular. We walked 3,5 km by foot. And it was totally worth it! The weather changes quickly. During 25 minutes it was raining, snowing, it was hail and sun again. So bring warm cloths.

reviews.title: Fun Ride;  Spectacular Views
reviews.text: The views from up on top of the mountain are indeed fantastic.  The ride up and down on the funicular is great fun.  This is one of the best things we did in town, and we enjoyed a beer in the sunshine.

reviews.title: A must when in Bergen
reviews.text: The trip with the Funicular to Mount Fløyen is a must when you visit Bergen. The trip up and down - and the view from the top is amazing. It can be rather busy at times, so I recommend that you book tickets online in advance to skip the queue.

reviews.title: Must do - View of Bergen
reviews.text: Just do it - Gon on it - get to the top and have a great walk around. Experience the view. One of the best views I've seen and Bergen is glorious!

reviews.title: Wonderful views
reviews.text: This is the way to see Bergen. Fenicula will take you steeply up the hill, or you can walk it up. Views are beautiful. Harbour, town and then take a stroll around the lake which is 5min away only. Fresh air, beautiful nature, definitely a place to visit.

reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.text: We went up the funicular twice today, once in the daytime and the second time to see the lights at night. Both trips were interesting and on the second time the funicular was very quiet. We thoroughly enjoyed the walks through the woodland at the top and thought the views to be amazing.

reviews.title: Terrible weather but still worth it
reviews.text: I love funiculars. This one has a glass roof. It has 4 stops I think. Goes through tunnels and it is nice to see that locals use it just to reach their homes. Not just a tourist attraction!

reviews.title: Great little adventure
reviews.text: You have 2 choices to rise above the city and this is by far the better choice... Great views, a lovely walk at the top with a restaurant and kids playgrounds and it is so accessible just walking from town centre.

reviews.title: Beautiful but crowd on the train
reviews.text: Have been there several times,fist was with the traing, very crowd and long waiting in queue. Next we rented bicycles and got on the top quite hard. Atmosphere there is pretty calm, especially on side view, choose to get down other road (to the left)

reviews.title: Sunset view over Bergen
reviews.text: Don't miss this attraction once in Bergen. The cable car goes frequently up and down (there is also a walking option) and the view over the whole Bergen you get is really amazing. We planned our visit around the sunset and it was a good decision. The weather was beautiful and we could see how far Bergen stretches itself. I would definitely recommend this activity.

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Super cute and simple trip to mount Floyen! We took the funicular up and decided to walk down to get some "exercise" !

reviews.title: Get here early
reviews.text: We were there at noon and there was quite a queue. This is the easiest way to get to the top though you can walk up as well. Amazing vistas with great opportunities to trek once up there. Of course, walk down.

reviews.title: cool cable car and nice view
reviews.text: lots of things to see at the top. well wort a tour. use your legs and walk to the top :-)  resturants, kiosk, and a fantastic view

reviews.title: Offers a very nice view on the city
reviews.text: Very easy to find and not expensive. There is a restaurant on top of hill and you can just enjoy a coffee and the view.

reviews.title: Great view if the weather's good
reviews.text: One of Bergen's best sights, with a view across the islands protecting Bergen all the way to the Atlantic horizon. Crowded with tourists and families having an outing, but still worth it.

reviews.title: Trip up to the summit with our Norwegian friends
reviews.text: We took the funicular up to Mt Floyen with some locals. The funicular is excellent and gives great views on the trip up. The views from the top are fab, although our friends said they aren't as good if it's raining etc - we had sunshine so bear that in mind. Well worth the time to do this.

reviews.title: Great trip and friendly workers
reviews.text: It is well worth taking the train up to Floien. I had a friend with me who was weak on her feet and we were helped very much to a seat where she could wait for the train. The workers were friendly and helpful and the view from the train and the mountain is fantastic.

reviews.title: Great place to see
reviews.text: Great place to see and good for children and anyone who appreciates nature and a good view. They also have a cafe with coffee and food and as well a restaurant.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Went up the mount by funicular and had a walk around the tracks to the lake etc and took in the fantastic views of Bergen,  a most do if visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Perfect walk on a perfect day
reviews.text: We came at 10 am, which was a great idea as the top of the mountain was not crowded with tourists. The funicular was great, took very little time and saved us heaps of time going up. We walked down, which I actually wouldn't recommend if icy. It was very icy and there were times when we held onto the railings hahaha. The views from the top were great as expected, but the walk down was even more fun. Definitely a must do when sunny, not sure I would have enjoyed it in the usual Bergen weather= rain.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: I was impressed with the view and how clean it was ,the one thing I did not know was you can walk down the hill and when you buy the ticket you buy one way or return I wasted the return because I walked down the hill and had bought a return trip.

reviews.title: Wonderful view of Bergen
reviews.text: We rode the Funicular to the top of Mt. Floyen.  We spent about 1 hour, but you could spend a whole afternoon if you have the time.  There are beautiful hiking trails up there.

reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.text:
We only had a morning in Bergen, and this was the activity we chose to do. We were lucky that the sun was out but I am sure the view from the top would be spectacular regardless of the weather. 

We had a little walk around away from the main viewpoint, including to the lake which was very peaceful.

We visited first thing in the morning, and it was very quiet. Would definitely recommend an early visit if you want to avoid it being too crowded.

reviews.title: nice vieuw on city center
reviews.text:
Beautifull vieuw on city center.
Nice walking opportunities and playgrounds for the kids.
Restaurant and shop on top, restaurant was closed.
.

reviews.title: Amazing views of Bergen and beyond
reviews.text: We bought our tickets at the tourist information office but you can also buy them here. The funicular goes up regularly every 20 mins or so. The ride to the top is very quick and then you have multiple places to take in the views of Bergen as well as walk on paths into more countryside. A must on a trip to Bergen

reviews.title: Great view from the top
reviews.text: Great way to get to the top. Efficient time keeping to timetable. Smooth and comfortable ride. Free with Bergen card. We chose to stroll back down to take in the views .

reviews.title: Fantastic view from it
reviews.text: U will never forget visiting this place. Whole view of Bergen city visible from top. If u go by tracking its even more adventurous. It’s fun to be there on top and I can’t explain the feel u get when u see Bergen city from top of it.

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text:
So i read that when in Bergen, you have to go to Floyen. Ok so my partner got us tickets, NOK 95 each; lined up; then got to the cable car. 

In approximately 10 mins, we reached the top and was presented with a panoramic view of Bergen. I personally find it like the usual view from the top

After a few snaps, took a walk where we found a cafe, a souvenir shop, restaurant, a playground with a gigantic troll. Thats it, After less than 30 minutes, i begged to ride back

Since its just by the wharf, i opted to end the day with a cold glass of beer

Maybe ill check it again on summer or spring and hopefully i will have a different opinion about it

Nevertheless, twas memorable bring there with my favorite person in the world .

reviews.title: Worth it for the view!
reviews.text: We were there at high tourist season so of course the Funicular was very crowded which made it a little uncomfortable but it was interesting regardless. The icing on the cake however was the view from the top - absolutely spectacular on a clear day. Also there are a herd of friendly goats that will eat out of your hand (or your bag if it's open and you have food in it)

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Great view after the short ride up the mountain.  In the summer it would be a good place for hiking. The is a cafe and resturant at the top though the resturant was closed for the season.

reviews.title: Sunset at Floyen
reviews.text: I took the funicular up the mountain to watch the sunset. I wish I had left myself more time as it was a nice place to walk around. I did do a short hike through the Troll Forest. If you don't want to take the funicular, there's a lovely paved trail (a bit steep going up!). Anyway, beautiful view over Bergen and the fjords!

reviews.title: Nice day outdoors
reviews.text: We visited Mount Floyen two times during our stay and took the Funicular up. The train is included in Bergen Card which was very convinient. It is also possible to walk up, if you want to. At the top there is a good view to the city and many very nice walks. I printed few maps from Mount Floyen website and they were very useful and mostly easy to follow. There were a lot of people up there and kids as well, there seemed to be something for everyone. As the trails are in the mountain area, there is up´s and downs so make sure you wear good shoes.

reviews.title: Fastest way for a beautiful view.
reviews.text: A bit pricey bit an easy way to get up to Fløyen and have the beautiful view. Otherwise I would recommend hiking up, it is approx 40-50 minutes hike up and it worth it!

reviews.title: Lovely view
reviews.text:
Great view from up there, definitely worth the visit (especially with the Bergen Card - it’s included!) there’s great viewing platforms, although I did go in February so it wasn’t very busy and easy to get great pictures up there. 
I recommend walking up to the lake and having a look up there (I did despite the thick fog and it was still nice).
The only thing I was disappointed in was that I didn’t get to see any of the free range goats but no doubt the weather was a factor!

reviews.title: Must do
reviews.text: We headed straight up here to get a good view of the city and orientate ourselves.  However, the nice surprise was the pleasant walks from the top with beautiful scenery and something for all level of walkers from family strolls to more serious hiking.

reviews.title: Must-do
reviews.text: Even though it was a little bit overcast I went up with the fonicular, it was windy and cold morning but the view from there is amazing!. I went down to the city center on icy trails so it took me more time than it should, still had a blast up there.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: We bought a Bergen card and it give free admission in the month of Feb. The first time we went up was a drizzling day and we almost had the whole place to ourself. There is a park for children and a lake about 500 m walk. The view was foggy on our first visit and we went up the second day with clear sky. It was so beautiful view with clear sky and was crowded too. Worth going up if you are in Bergen.

reviews.title: Oh wow what a grwat place!
reviews.text:
Wen up Floyen and had a stroll in the day, fantastic views over Bergen.

Tasty coffee and muffins from the café ( great service by friendly staff ), which we had outside in the February sunshine.

Liked it so much we came back to see the sunset and how Bergen glittered in the dark from all the lights. Magical.

reviews.title: Must see!
reviews.text:
This is a must see when in Bergen.
Make sure you visit on a Clear Day for the most awesome views of Bergen and the Harbour.

reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.text: There is a cable car that brings you to the top of the mountain.  right in the center of the city so it is very easy to access, I did this the day after there had been light snow so everything had a fresh covering of powder snow. The views are spectacular. It was nice to see the local people actually go there to do some skiing and other snow activities. The view of Bergen from the top is spectacular. I had a three day Bergen Card so the funicular was included in it. This is definitely a worthwhile activity to do in Bergen.

reviews.title: Fantastic view
reviews.text: We went up in the fonicular and down by foot, chill but really nice, you can take a food and there is place for pick nick, a park for child’s and a souvenir store.

reviews.title: Absolute must do
reviews.text: Efficient, fun, great views, enjoyed the walk down but it was a shame the two alternate routes weren’t explained when buying tickets.

reviews.title: Fun ride and beautiful view at the top
reviews.text: The funicular is so cool and fun.  Once at the top you have an amazing view of Bergen.  There are some hiking trails to a lake.  If you don't want to take The Funicular back down you can hike back down as well.  The funicular is also really fun to make a time lapse video.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen (weather permitting)
reviews.text: The funicular runs until late at night, and is well worth taking for the great panorama. We went up just before dusk and had great views as the lights started to go on. However, you do need to choose a day when it isn't raining (much). There is a nice walk through the woods back into town, well worth doing if you have the time and weather on your side. With a Bergen Card you can visit this once each day.

reviews.title: Fantastic Funicular
reviews.text: The trip to Floibanen on funicular was amazing. Cost of a return trip was only 95 NOK. The views of the city, wharf and fjiords were awesome. thre is a cafe and kids play ground at the top and heaps of walk and cycle tracks up there as well. We spent a couple of enjoyable hours up there. Would highly recommend it as a "must do" if you are visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: So fun!
reviews.text: A bucket list dream come true! This was so exciting (for Mom and the 3-yr old!) and the park, restaurant, and nature area at the top was a pleasant surprise. A must if you're in Bergen for the weekend!

reviews.title: mountain floyen attractions
reviews.text: This is a viewpoint at the summit. We enjoyed local bakery production after 1 hour hike. As I noticed this is also possible to rent a bicycle. Very interesting playing ground for children. The most impressive there are views of the city fjord

reviews.title: evening trip
reviews.text: we had a lovely evening trip and the views were amazing! would definitely recommend a trip up and a stroll back down...

reviews.title: A must do
reviews.text: This is a great value for money trip, the views are spectacular, the walks great and the restaurant gives value for money

reviews.title: Bergen Funicular
reviews.text: We only had a couple of days in Bergen but this is a must do. Entry is in the city centre and is quite cheap for a return ticket. At the top of the mountain there are lots of walks to take,great views and a cafe and little shop.It was beautiful weather when we went but it would be just as stunning in any weather. There is a childrens' play area also.

reviews.title: One of the best things to do in Bergen
reviews.text: The funicular is easy accessible, in just a few minutes you are faced with the most amazing views of Bergen. If you go with children, there are a couple of nice playgrounds they can enjoy. You can also take a walk through the woods to the lake. All is well marked. The restaurant also offers nice refreshments. Mount Floyen is the first thing to do while in Bergen!

reviews.title: A must do when in Bergen
reviews.text: we went up in Sunshine and it was snowing at the top within 20 mins. However cleared as quickly. Great photo opportunity. The restaurant was closed when we were there so apart from small gift shop with coffee area not a lot one could do.

reviews.title: AMAZING!
reviews.text: Amazing! I went up here three times over my stay. The first time was at night- spectacular! The second time was during the day but i watched the sunset and then went back up later that night. Well worth it, make sure you give yourself enough time to truly enjoy and appreciate it. There are also hiking tracks too which are beautiful. It snowed when I went up there during the day and I found a few really nice look out points from some of the tracks but it was a bit slippery from the snow. Still, really worth it! There is a nice little cafe and toilets too. Def need to go on your visit!

reviews.title: Great funicular
reviews.text: Great ride up from Bergen central with at least 3 stops on the way up for locals. View is great unfortunately limited restaurant options.

reviews.title: Amazing view!
reviews.text: Yes, it has been a while since my visit back in 1991, but I still remember the view and the beauty. I was in the US Navy during my visit. This was the highest above sea level I had been for almost a year. It was amazing to just sit and look out over Bergen and enjoy the view. It was a nice ride up and down. I also remember the people of Bergen were all very nice and friendly to us while we were in port for three days. This is one of the places I would love to return to as well.

reviews.title: Best thing in Bergen
reviews.text:
This was the best thing I saw during my weekend in Bergen. It's a beautiful walk up the mountain, though it can be extremely icy after it has rained, which severely limits the number of routes up the mountain. Failing that (or if you're not feeling up to the walk), there is a funicular (cable car) that'll haul you up the mountain in style.

This place feels like it hearkens back to a bygone era, despite only being about 100 years old. Fantastic place that I highly recommend. Pun intended.

There's also a cafe, a kids' play area, a troll park and a frozen lake with some smartass signs kicking about. These really amused me...

reviews.title: A Bergen 'must-see'
reviews.text: Great trip up the mountain where you can marvel at the view and/or join several hiking trails. There's also a cafe and gift ship and restaurant.

reviews.title: Superb view of the whole area as the weather was fine!
reviews.text: The railway takes a few minutes to lift you from the city to a peak where families were skiing, tobogganing and just enjoying the views. We were lucky because Bergen is a very rainy city but we had perfect weather on the day. We took a hike (there are lots to choose from) on snow trails to see a lake (frozen in winter) and just to enjoy the area. If the weather is clear this is a must do activity.

reviews.title: Experience the beautiful view Bergen
reviews.text: If you visit Bergen i would highly recommend a trip to Floyen. It have a beautiful view of the city, the resturant serves beautiful, tasteful dishes and drinks. If you want to take a walk in forest&mountains then Floyen offer several diffrent trips and experiences, short and long trips, good options for anyone to experience the  beautiful Norwegian nature. Trips from 1 hour to a whole day is possible.hy

reviews.title: Walking up on winter can be slippery
reviews.text:
- beautiful view on top and along the way even in winter, snow everywhere and on the road so it can be very icey and slippery, normal shoes are not recommended
- took about 30 - 40 minutes to walk up (we walked quite slow)
- free toilet on the top
- there are a restaurant, cafe and souvenir shop
- if you don't like walking, you can take the cable car 30kr single or if you catch the cable from the top of the mountain to city centre is 50kr

reviews.title: Can’t miss this!!
reviews.text: Easy trip and worth every penny, gorgeous views of Bergen. If short on time, no issue. Easy to go up, take photos and return to the bottom in about 1 hour.

reviews.title: Beautiful Bergen
reviews.text: The perfect pkace that you can see Bergen. There are also have a beautiful lake. Eventhough in the  rainy day you can still enjoy this palace, just take a cup of coffee and enjoy the magic Bergen

reviews.title: Lovely cog railway trip
reviews.text: A smooth steep ride lead to a rocky top with amazing panoramic views over Bergen and surrounding area - depending on the weather. When we went the clouds had not yet dispersed, sadly.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: We intended to take the funicular up and walk down but were advised not to attempt walking down as the paths were icy and dangerous. We paid for one way and decided to see for ourselves. At the top we walked around the frozen lake which was beautiful. The paths were dangerous so we returned by funicular. Return and two single tickets cost the same.

reviews.title: Nice view close from the city center
reviews.text:
I went with my family on Mount Floyen by foot. We didn"t took the funicular but we followed a path that took us right at the top of mount floyen.
It was very nice, green, not hard to climb at all. Overall it's refreshing.
At the top you can stop for a drink/snack, admire the view (very nice when there are no clouds). They also have some facilities for children to play.

reviews.title: Stunning views
reviews.text:
Great value for money 
Busy at weekends . Lots to do at the top with stunning views . Walks sledging skiing or just a nice coffee and cake

reviews.title: Beautiful view of Bergen and nice atmosphere, so nice
reviews.text: You take the bane up to Floyen were you have a nice restaurant and a perfect overview over Bergen city

reviews.title: Wonderful views
reviews.text: The funicular chugs up the mountain on a regular basis and at a reasonable price (I think you can walk, but I had no intention of doing so!). There are several walking trails, a cafe/store and a children's playground area. There were very few people at this time of year, and the ice kept me off the trails, but it was an enjoyable visit nevertheless. The views of Bergen and area are spectacular. The weather changed from fog, show, rain and sun during my two hours at the top ... very typical weather for Bergen; wait long enough and the sun will probably come out.

reviews.title: Great ride and view from the top.
reviews.text: This is an easy, fun ride to the top and GREAT view from the top.  There are shops at the top, and a place to eat.

reviews.title: So much more than just a great view!
reviews.text: My mother and I took the funicular (which isn’t scary at all since we were both terrified of heights) to the top at around 10:30am. When we got to the top the view was a bit foggy, however, it cleared up in minutes and soon we had a perfect view! We also then went exploring around the area. The Troll Forest and the lake are not to be missed! We had fun with all the snow and would definitely recommend hanging around to explore Mount Floyen rather than just seeing the view and going back down.

reviews.title: A must!
reviews.text: If you walk it will take around 30 minutes to get to the top. Its a nice walk and the view when you get there is absolutely worth it! You can also buy food at the top and its a big playgroud and lots of activities for kids!

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text:
Title should really be great views if weather is good. It was snowing when we ascended but still nice to see the city from above. Looked like some good walks at the top but unfortunately the weather was against us. Never mind, we can't control the weather.
The ride up seems to run efficiently and is not really overpriced for an expensive city like Bergen.

reviews.title: Beautiful views over the city
reviews.text:
The funicular runs till 11pm- every 30 mins.

The views from the top are beautiful especially on a clear night.

The restaurant at the top was not open when we visited - winter and not so many visitors in town, so it was actually lovely to have the place all to ourselves.

Stunning views over the city - definitely worth the effort

reviews.title: Great Views and Pleasant Walk
reviews.text: We came here twice during our stay: the first time, it was a cloudy day and the views were just alright. We decided to come back the next day, which was sunny and clear, and we're so glad we did! The views were amazing. We also had time to kill so we decided to walk down the mountain back to the city center, and it was really enjoyable with great scenery.

reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.text:
Being in Bergen this is a must do! If you’re not a walker of if you have difficulties walking you can still go up and enjoy the view by taking the funicular. If you don’t mind walks but you’re not in shape, go up with the funicular and descent on foot, If you enjoy hikes and are in shape, go up by foot. It’s an amazing walk and the views in between are incredible.

Watch out with the weather conditions and type of shoes you’re wearing. As we went up in February about 75% of our walk down was incredibly icey!

reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.text:
Fantastic place to visit when in Bergen. Costs about £9 for a return ticket. 
The views at the top are amazing and depending what time of year you go there are different activities you can take part in. Lots of walking trails too.

reviews.title: A must when in Bergen
reviews.text: Great escape from the city and a recommendation to get an overview over they city. Going for a walk up there is almost a must a ways are well prepared.

reviews.title: The best Bergen view point
reviews.text: Very popular place all year round. Good for hikers and also for all Bergen guests. Many islands along the shore of the North Sea

reviews.title: Great views over Bergan and nice views
reviews.text: Took the 10 min trip up the funicular - well worth the time and cost. Looked like there were lots of walks and a lake to see but none of this was accessible to a family with a travel pram..

reviews.title: When the sun is out in Bergen... you go to Mount Floyen!
reviews.text:
You can either walk (long hike up) or take the “Tube” to Floyen! It only takes 10 minutes to get up there with the tube and the views are wonderful:) 

I would recommend you to visit it during week days and not weekends (no tourists then)! You will enjoy wonderful peaceful walks and views up there! There is also a cozy cafe.  

Cost was 100 NK both ways.

reviews.title: Fabulous views
reviews.text: Took a trip up Mount Floyen on the Funicular and what splendid views awaited at the top. Could actually see my Hurtigruten ship arriving to take me on my cruise up the Norwegian coast. Lots of snow and gorgeous scenery, we'll worth the trip.

reviews.title: Nice view, worth the money
reviews.text: It is very nice and easy short trip from the heart of Bergen. The train is clean and quiet. Not expensive compare from what you get.

reviews.title: Must do!!
reviews.text: Great view from the funicular and the watching platform at the Fløyen. Heavy snow up there, got some very great picture with the snow and frozen lake. Don’t miss that!!

reviews.title: Great trip, a must-do...
reviews.text: Took the funicular last week, with the morning. Not busy, nice easy ride with great views.  There is a restaurant, coffee shop and gift shop at the top.  Excellent views.  About £10 return.  I went back again in the evening to view at night.  Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Must do when in Bergen
reviews.text:
We weren't really planning to go up the mountain while in Bergen, but we had done with the Stave Church and still had an afternoon to spare, so we thought we would head up to Mount Floyen. 
We got the Funicular Railway to the top, which only takes 10 minutes or so, although you can also walk up if you want.
The views at the top were absolutely stunning! You cannot miss these - Bergen never looked so good!
There is a restaurant and a cafe where you can have lunch, although you can also take a picnic or barbeque if you want, and eat somewhere quiet!
Once you get away from the busy tourist part with the shop and restaurants, there are beautiful trails you can follow to see some of the quieter parts of the mountain. We walked up to a lake which is a peaceful getaway - from here you'd have no idea you were just 5 minutes above Norway's second biggest city. 
Perfect place to be on a nice day - don't miss it for the world!

reviews.title: Magical view of Bergen at night
reviews.text: We took an evening ride to the top accompanied by local people laded with skiis and  sledges. The views are astounding and well worth a look!

reviews.title: a must-do
reviews.text: Bergen is a gorgeous city and it really needs to be viewed from above to appreciate the outstanding beauty of its surrounds

reviews.title: RISE TO THE TOP OF THE WORLD
reviews.text: It was a snowy, grey morning and we wondered if we should attempt the funicular. We are so pleased we did. It had a great view over the city and the harbour. The snow at the top was beautiful and we even walked to the lake about 10 minutes through the trees. It was windy when exposed but in the trees it was calm and beautiful and serene. The engineering feat to have built the original funicular is amazing. Overall an excellent experience and well worth the money.

reviews.title: Lovely Floibanen
reviews.text: This was such fun!  The view from the top is just amazing!  There is a few lovely walks at the top and some nice little shops.  Delicious food available.  I was amazed at how many people come up, well into the night.  A must do!!!

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: A must do in Bergen. Got our tickets from the tourist center and went up late morning. Slight drizzle but still worth the trip. Super view. It was October so the cafe on top was closed. Had a nice walk around. Photo ops everywhere. Brilliant!

reviews.title: Nice views, but everything closed in January
reviews.text: Part of a city tour organised by Jules Verne because the Hanseatic Museum was closed.  I'm not sure I would have gone on it if viewing the city independently; the views were indeed very fine, but it was a short chug up a hillside to find everything (bar a very small shop/self serve cafe) resolutely closed.  People wandered around rather helplessly before going back down again.  I'm sure the walks were very nice, but the bits I wandered round (trolls, play areas, etc) did not particularly inspire me.

reviews.title: Birds Eye View
reviews.text: If there is only one thing you achieve in Bergen, it is to take the funicular up Mount Floyen to enjoy the view back over Bergen. This really puts the city into perspective. We were lucky to take an early funicular on our visit as the weather soon closed in and it was snowing up top within half and hour of our arrival. Aside from extensive viewing platforms, there are lovely walks - both short and long - from the top, cafes and restaurants and of course, a gift shop. You have the option of a one-way fare but we chose to return via funicular as at the time of our visit, the roads down were very icy.

reviews.title: Fantastic views from the top
reviews.text: Fantastic views from the top - worth the trip.  There are also walks to the lake which are equally as pretty as the views themselves.   There is also a coffee shop and restaurant at the top but we did not use these.

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: When in Bergen take the time to visit the Mount Floyen. You will have a great view from the city and there are other things to see, lake, animals..

reviews.title: Great views and trekking
reviews.text: When you get on top of the mountain you have dozen of different routes you can take for trekking. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: What a View!
reviews.text: On our trip to Bergen, we were told this was a must!  And we are so glad we took it in.  The ride up is great, and the views at the top are amazing!  We were lucky to enjoy it on a sunny blue September day.  We wandered the trails a bit, and toyed with walking down, but our time was limited and we wanted to enjoy more of Bergan. Defiantly a must do.

reviews.title: Walking around a frozen lake listening to Grieg
reviews.text: The furnicular is a great ride and the view across Bergen is panoramic.  The best part though is the extensive walking tracks behind. This was magical, just after a snow storm and still and beautiful.  Don’t miss it.

reviews.title: Great spot to watch the sunset
reviews.text: It is about NZD32 to go up and back. We went up to watch the sunset.. very nice spot indeed. The view from up the top is very good, you can see over the harbor and the cuty

reviews.title: Wonderful view of Bergen, and a beautiful park
reviews.text: Take the funicular up, but if you are in the condition please please do walk down on foot! The park is beautiful and starting midway down you will be walking through narrow streets, seing the Bergen like a local!

reviews.title: Top of the world!
reviews.text: It is a spectacular view, trails to enjoy walking around with different angles if nature surroundings. Parks for kids to,play, typical local food...lots for everyone

reviews.title: The (secound) best view og Bergen
reviews.text: This is the most triticale thing u can do in Bergen, but also one of the nicest it's right downtown, it's takes u about an hour and u get a nice ride, a great view and see a lot of Asian.

reviews.title: Awesome view and nature
reviews.text: Worth going up at Stoltzekleven stairs on top of Mount floyen on your own if you want to work on your fitness. The rewards are stunning views, a lake on top surrounded by beautiful nature and fresh air. Great😀

reviews.title: Beautiful view over Bergen!
reviews.text:
We took the railway up to the top of Mount Floyen today and saw Bergen and the Bergen Fjords from this stunning vantage point! The train ride up was pleasant. The trains themselves were quite modern, clean and spacious enough. They run regularly and ticket prices weren’t too bad. 
Once at the top there’s stunning views, cafe bars and a restaurant. We went for a forest walk and enjoyed that very much. There’s a lake too.

reviews.title: Worth it in the winter
reviews.text: This is a nice way to get to a great view. Yes you have to pay for it, but it made the day much more enjoyable not having to walk to the top on our own. It was very peaceful walking around the various paths and going to the tiny little lake. I'm a little curious to know what it looks like with canoes on it in the summer, because it is such a small lake.

reviews.title: Mt.Fløyen and Fløibanen Funicular
reviews.text: Mt. Fløyen is the best area in the city for walks and for children to play. The morning is a perfect time to walk through residential areas, forest and small waterfall while enjoying the city view from a height on the way to the top of Mt. Fløyen. A variety of refreshments is available from Fløiestuen shop and cafe. Top of the mountain can also be achieved by riding  26-degree Fløibanen funicular which depart every 15 minutes from Vertlidsallmenningen 150m from Fish Market.

reviews.title: Fantastic City biew
reviews.text:
Took this up at sunset, which was spectacular!  It’s a lovely view of a lovely city. And the warm focaccia pizza bread at the top really hit the spot!

We also wondered through Troll Forest before heading down again.

reviews.title: Trip
reviews.text:
We prebooked tickets on line in the UK ( they are valid for the day you choose so you can pick anytime to go up and down on the funicular).  The train is really quick and comes regularly - we waited for about 5 minutes for one and it’s great if you can sit at the front as you ascend to get the views.

The views from the top are great - really expansive of the whole of Bergen. There is a nice gift shop/ cafe and good clean toilets and a children’s playground which even out teenagers loved! As it was winter some buildings seemed closed so I don’t know what else would be going on in the summer.

We went on a 10 minute walk to the Lake which was semi frozen and then walked around it in a snow storm but it was lovely and nice to get the fresh air. 

It’s a lovely trip to do - obviously when it is clear enough to see the views so check the weather before you head up.

reviews.title: Amazing Bergen views
reviews.text: Lovely little ride up the mountain on the funicular with beautiful trails of different lengths at the top, through the forest. Great views of the city & water and a nice break from the hustle & bustle.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: It is a little hard to find the ticket office as our google maps was a little misleading.  A quick journey up the mountain which shows spectacular views over Bergen so worth the visit.

reviews.title: Good on a clear day
reviews.text: On a nice day it is a great walk up or down and use the funicular the other way. Great views of the city and lots of flattish walks once at the top. Walk up then have a coffee in the cafe or shop.

reviews.title: Good views, great walks
reviews.text: We used the funicular for a return journey on each of our 3 days in Bergen (free in winter with the Bergen Card). The views are great as you head up the mountain and see more and more of the city and water below. Good views from the top (when visibility is okay), but the real attraction is the number of walks and hikes from floyen. We did two fantastic round trips of about 2-3 hours each, with spectacular views, particularly around Rundemanen

reviews.title: Well worth the price for this amazing view
reviews.text: This short trip up the mountain is a must do, especially on a fine day. What a great way to get a better perspective of the Bergen land- and cityscape. You can chose a return trip, or better still, walk down the mountain.

reviews.title: Magnificent view and great walk!
reviews.text:
We took the funicular train up on New Year’s Day and walk all the way down. 
The train was 50Nok one way, and cheaper if you buy two ways ticket. 

The view was incredible and could easily kill 1 hour of your time just admiring the view. 

if you are outgoing person I highly recommended to atleast take the trails around mount floyen to explore the lake or walk down the trail to city. It is an easy walk yet with great scenery along the way. 
Local Tips: 
- take the trail on back of the cafe, it is more scenic! ;) 
- Keep warmth, wear wind breaker, as the wind can be really strong and chilly up there!

reviews.title: Family day with funicular-ride up, walking down mt.Fløyen
reviews.text: 2 families of 3 (2 mothers, 2 kids, 4 and 9, 3 and 7) took the funicular from city centre up to Fløyen. We had a sit in the very first row at the funicular; very spectacular! 🙌🏻 Tried the first playground: very crowded (sunday) but very Nice for the youngest. Then went about 200 meters up to the «klatrepark» to climb trees and different obstacles. Super! 👍🏻 Walked down «Tippetue» to the city centre again. Appx 3 hours including eating, playing. ⭐️

reviews.title: Easy to get to with lots of beautiful hiking trails
reviews.text: Spent half a day hiking the trails here. Easy to get to. Not too crowded in late September.  Went up in the morning and enjoyed a early lunch on a bench in the woods with a lovely view.  There are enough trails you could spend all day or just a few hours here. Seems like the locals enjoy this area too, walking there dogs and running the trails.

reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.text: Must have of visiting Bergen, necesssery point on your list of activities there! On the top restaurant, cafees, souvenirs, nice playground for children and a lot of routes for walking, bicykling, etc, i strongly recommend!

reviews.title: Excellent value for money
reviews.text: This is probably one of the cheapest and more enjoyable things to do in Bergen.   The ride is approx 10 minutes and it enjoyable. However, the best part is when you get to the top. Wonderful panoramic views of Bergen and lovely either in the daylight and rather beautiful at night.  There are lots of walks and biking trails and a reasonable cafe there too.   There is a restaurant there which is supposed to have a good reputation but we didn't try it.  Overall, lots of fresh air and excercise which is what one needs.

reviews.title: Bergen Must-See – Spectacular Views
reviews.text:
The Funicular in Bergen is definitely a must-see attraction. We visited it as part of a walking tour. The views from the top are spectacular. Plan on spending a little time wandering around the top before returning to Bergen. 

Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Visited in Winter
reviews.text: Great night view of the city and not a lot of tourists so perfect for photos. Lovely walking tracks around area and areas for the kids to play .

reviews.title: Stunning views and good walks
reviews.text: The weather changed so much the view was beautiful and constantly changing. The funicular was quick and regular and the kiosk good value for hot drinks and snacks. Additionally several good walks can be had, at various difficulty levels. Very good day out.

reviews.title: Sight seeing
reviews.text:
The Foibanen is a must see. It has a mechanical/cable driven train/ lifting you onto the nearby Ulriken mountain which overlooks the City. Beautiful scenery of 360 view around the city vicinity. 
Bergen is the 2nd biggest city in Norway and known as the rain city which experiences 235 days of rain per annum.
If its not raining then you ask "why" is it not raining. In winter it could rain, snow or blow in the space of 10 minutes. And it can blow seriously strongly. Very cozy city to visit and easy to walk. The locals are very friendly and helpful to assist in any way. The Tourist Information Centre is most helpful.

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.text:
Definitely worth doing it 
Lovely little coffee shop and souvenirs 
Quite expensive .The view is amazing and got a giant troll to take some fun photos with

reviews.title: With the sun
reviews.text: It is an activity to do when the weather is good, with the sunshine it’s just perfect, a beautiful view

reviews.title: A wonderful view of Bergen
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to have a magnificent sunny if cold day. The Hanseatic museum being closed we went up there instead and certainly did not regret it. The view over Bergen was breathtaking and we spent some time taking it all in and having a good walk around before getting back down. I certainly recommend going up and in fact it is something not to be missed when you go to Bergen

reviews.title: A Family Year End Tour
reviews.text: Must be beautiful view from the top of the Mount Floyen. It is pity however, that the visit by me and my family was on the rainy, foggy and cold  last day of December 2018. Anyway, the funicular train works very well and  departs on time.

reviews.title: Excellent idea to get a view and enjoy forest walk.
reviews.text: Apart from the pretty impressive view over Bergen we enjoyed most the walk through the forest to the lake. Pavements are extraordinarily well kept, so you can walk even when visually impaired or in a wheelchair. Playgrounds are paradise for the smaller (and bigger) children!

reviews.title: A wander in the mist
reviews.text: A short ride in the funicular up the mount ascended into the mist. While this limited the view the walk to and around the lake was eerily beautiful. The 3km walk back to the city centre was a welcome option to returning on the funicular. The walk is on bitumen and is a comfortable grade.

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text:
Wow....what an amazing experience. Took the funicular up to Mt Flòibanen. Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful. 
Simply amazing views. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Snow and views from the top!
reviews.text: Enjoyed my second visit, this time in winter and coincided with a few snow showers. In between, the views of Bergen can never disappoint. For those that feel the need, you can walk back into town, but we took the funicular back.

reviews.title: Worthwhile excursion.
reviews.text: The funicular runs often and is open for extended hours so is really convenient to slot into your time in Bergen. Easy to get to--we just walked from our hotel. The funicular was very full so we couldnt see anything on the ride--grab the very front seats if you can! The view from the top was lovely. We did a short walk through the forest to the lake.  Lots of food and hot drinks available on top of the mountain. You can spend as much time as suits you--just enough for a quick view or many hours walking and exploring the area.

reviews.title: Fun Funicular
reviews.text: Even though it was a very foggy rainy day the views were still amazing. The restaurant and gift shop at the top is interesting and a warm place to browse around

reviews.title: Brrrrrrr! Windy, but worth it!
reviews.text:
Gorgeous views, nice little (extremely expensive) gift shop, lovely hiking paths, and a lake I imagine would be glorious in the warmer weather. We met a lovely Norwegian woman walking her dog up there and chatted a bit, which was a plus. Certainly worth the ticket price.
We also heard there’s a forest kindergarten up there where the teachers and kids are outside almost 100% of their school days. What’s not to love?

reviews.title: Lovely View of Bergen
reviews.text:
The trip up and down on the funicular is great fun for both children and adults and once you get to the top you are rewarded with a magnificent view of Bergen. At the top take the time to walk around the forest trails. We were there in December around 2 pm by which time some of the paths were icy. With hindsight and given the short day light hours in winter I would have gone earlier in the day and enjoyed a walk down the mountain back into Bergen. 

Overall a really worthwhile excursion which I would happily do again.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Loved the trip up there and the view was just beautiful.  Really worth the trip whilst in Bergen especially on a clear day

reviews.title: Great trip to the top of Bergen
reviews.text: Must do when in Bergen. Great views at the top and a fun safe trip up. If you feel up to it, once at the top, you can walk down. It’s an easy pace and all down hi!

reviews.title: Fantastic view
reviews.text:
Well worth the time and the small fee to go up the rail. 
Great views on way up and at the top. At the top there are a couple of cafes, children’s play park and walks to further up the hill

reviews.title: Love love love this little trip up the mountain
reviews.text: With the Bergen card you get one return trip per day, so my friend and I went up every day. A great way to start the day with a lovely view. The goats at the top were lots of fun and so friendly. There's a great kids play area, and lots of space to walk around. The cafes are lovely. Definitely a must do if you're in Bergen.

reviews.title: Best place to visit in Bergen
reviews.text: You can take Floibanen to the topp to see Bergen from above, or start your hike in the mountains surounding Bergen from there.

reviews.title: Fløybanen
reviews.text: A must do in Bergen. Spectacular view over the city  at the top.Have lunch at the cafe og take s hike at fløyen mountain.

reviews.title: Funicular ride
reviews.text: This is a must-visit destination in Bergen as a tourist as you get a great view of the entire Bergen city and the fjord from the top. There is a forest trail to walk which is very refreshing. You also get to see the birds.

reviews.title: Top most attraction for a reason!!
reviews.text: Its a very scenic ride up and down. You get great views of the entire city of Bergen. There are lots of trails to wander around and the cafeteria at the top provides decent eating options.

reviews.title: Spectacular view of Bergen
reviews.text: Spectactular view of Norways most wonderful town Bergen. You see al of the town from north to south.

reviews.title: Best view of the city
reviews.text: This is a must if you visit Bergen! Take the funicular up and walk down. At the top there are restaurants and beautiful places to walk in peace and quite.

reviews.title: Not to miss
reviews.text: One of the city highlights. Amazing view of the city, and accessible right from the centre. Many nature trails, many suitable for families. You can spend many hours walking/hiking if the weather is good. There is also a playground,a restaurant and cafe to spend the day. If you don't mind walking I would recommend climbing up and down on foot in order to enjoy the amazing nature.

reviews.title: Short ride to a fantastic view of the city
reviews.text: Short ride up to get a great view...the cars are comfortable, frequent and clean..once up at the top take some photos, visit the troll and the go for a short walk around the lake which is 300m away. In the summer take a picnic or bbq stuff for a good day out..recommended

reviews.title: Reminder of home
reviews.text: Fun trip on the funicular to Mount Floyen during a break in the weather.  Walking and photographs interrupted by a brief snowstorm reminding us of the Rocky Mountains in Colorado. Carry snacks, an umbrella, and layered rain gear for this must-visit. We look forward to returning.

reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.text: We took train up and walked around area and back down to Bergen. A fabulous area of outstanding natural beauty

reviews.title: Great views and walks from the top
reviews.text: Travelled on the Floibanen on a drizzly day in December. Still great views, and nice short walks. A must if you have kids with you. Redevelopment at the top at this time so most places closed. Quite expensive for a short ride.

reviews.title: Definitely worthwhile
reviews.text: Wonderful views somewhat curtailed by bad weather. Would be spectacular without rain. We enjoyed the cafe at the top.

reviews.title: WONDERFUL VIEWS
reviews.text: IO loved the funicular. It was such fun to travel up and down the mountain whilst basking in the gorgeous views of Bergen and its surrounding fjords. At the top, the viewing station and its surrounding areas were beautiful, a great spot for taking pictures!

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: A must in Bergen. We went late one night and the ticket office was closed. However, we bought tickets from the machine and since it was the last hour of service enjoyed the ride and view with just a handful of others. Delightful.

reviews.title: A nice break after a walk
reviews.text: We had been walking in the mountains for a few hours behind Bergen when we arrived at Mount Foyen. As it is a quiet time of the season the main restaurant was closed and under refurbishment but the coffee shop at the top of the funicular was open. The staff were lovely, the coffee and sweets were very nice and they also sold some wonderful items made by people with a disability.  After coffee we took a ride down the funicular, which was fun.  Worth a visit.

reviews.title: You need to go here
reviews.text: Best view of Bergen. No need for 100 letters about Fløien. Thats how awesome the gondola up to the mountains is.

reviews.title: A must do
reviews.text:
We went up for a ride & were fortunate enough to have a very empty cab so had unlimited views on the way up.
Was perfect to step out & find fresh snow all over the ground, as was just raining down in town.
This provided an amazing view of Bergen, such a beautiful town, with or without snow.
Its a very reasonable price but there is the choice of walking too

reviews.title: Rainy weather
reviews.text: We were there when weather was rainy. Kids enjoyed open space and play park none the less. Good views. Would like to do this again, then hike to city centre (3km). Shame about weather

reviews.title: Windy!
reviews.text: I went up here at night as the rain had stopped.  I got some great pictures of the town with the lights.  But then it started to rain, so I didn't stay too long.  Make sure you are prepared for the wind!

reviews.title: Fløyen
reviews.text: What an experience! Take the train to the top and walk down back. A lot of tourists in summer. I advice you to go very early or in the evening. Very nice place to walk. Also viewing platforms. Take you own food with you and have a picnic. It was available to  go canooing if you like (for free). A lot of greenery!

reviews.title: Wow
reviews.text: Great service...very efficient system...wonderful views and reasonably priced...the cafe on the top was great too...amazing views...a must do if ur in bergen!!!

reviews.title: Lovely view of Bergen
reviews.text: Wandering around Bergen, we more or less stumbled upon the Floibanen station.  We asked ourselves why there was a train station on the mountain and then realized it was the funicular.  We bought tickets for the ride to the top and would have walked back down (the ticket seller said it was about a 45 minute walk)  but we were pressed for time, so, after walking around for a bit and enjoying the view, we took the funicular back down.

reviews.title: Oh, the View!
reviews.text: This is an easy, accessible, and fun adventure to the top of Mount Floyen.  The views of Bergen and the surrounds are magnificent!  It was quite windy when we went, but I wouldn't have wanted to miss the views.  There is a lovely restaurant on top where we drank hot tea and relaxed before the descent.

reviews.title: Beautiful at Sunset
reviews.text: The funicular ride was easy and inexpensive. We went up in the evening, there were not too many people there and the view was lovely. The walking/hiking is very civilized and paved: if you want to hike, get to Ulricken instead.

reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.text: Free with the Bergen card, when you get to the top it has breathtaking views of Bergen, I would recommend walking to the lake.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.text: It is definitely worth it to take the funicular up the mountain to see the views of the city, the sea and the countryside.  We were there on a lovely sunny day.  Enjoyed a beer in an outdoor cafe.

reviews.title: What a view don’t miss it
reviews.text:
A return trip is 95nok and well worth every nok. The tram has a few seats but plenty of standing room. It doesn’t take that long to get to the top. And OMG what a view. 
We didn’t have a lot of time to go walking the trails etc we basically went up to see the view.
There is a gift shop, restaurant, cafe and toilets. 
Lucky it was a beautiful clear morning.

reviews.title: Fabulous views
reviews.text: The views from the top of the funicular are amazing, we bought a 1 way ticket and walked down which is about 3 km and took a leisurely hour.

reviews.title: Saw a lot in a short time in Bergen
reviews.text: It's easy to navigate and lots to see. We had a local tour guide who was excellent. Wish I had bought some more Sami bracelets.

reviews.title: Great city views
reviews.text:
The Funicul makes several stops on its way up Mount Floyen to drop off and pick up passengers that live along the sides of the mountain.  

The scenery along the way is interesting.  The view from the top is amazing.  On a clear day, you can see all across the town to the other Fjords.  The visitor/souvenir shop is pleasant.  Bathrooms are clean.

reviews.title: Bergen Roof!
reviews.text: From mount Floyen, a complete view of Bergen is available. One can go on foot or use the tram up to the top. I have been there both in summer when the sky was quite blue and sun shines and in March when it was a bit snowy. I recommend you to take a walk up and if you have no knee problem, come back all the way down on foot to enjoy more.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Great way to see all of Bergen,  Lovely troll carvings and lots of walking trails on the mountain top

reviews.title: Fabulous views, great walks
reviews.text: The Funicular provides a worthwhile side trip while in Bergen. Easily accessible from the old town. Frequent rides allow for short wait times.

reviews.title: Tram up/Hike down
reviews.text: We took the tram up around 11 a.m.  The sun was shining and the sky was blue but there was still frost on the ground and some slippery conditions up at the top.  The view are spectacular.  There are several hikes you can do from the top, including the relatively easy, winding walk back down to the harbor.  We saw a small herd of goats at the back of the cafe building.   Because of the temperature we did not do any of the other hikes, but took our time walking down back to the harbor.  Once you get out of the forest you meander down through the tiny houses and neighborhoods above the harbor.  Take your time checking out all the unique houses and buildings on your descent.  It was our favorite thing to do in Bergen.

reviews.title: Go up at Dusk
reviews.text: Allow time for more than just a few photos at the top. There easy marked short trials (and some more difficult) to give you a different view of Bergen. We went up at dusk and did not have the light to attempt any, shame.  However, this timing allowed us to see Bergen in three different lights. The viewing terrace is massive and it was not crowded, we had uninterrupted views. There is a small café near the station where the cinnamon buns were very good. The hot drinks are from a machine, but I can recommend the hot chocolate. The pictures and history of the funicular displayed in the bottom station are very interesting. Do not sit in the front of the car on the way down if you have a fear of heights!

reviews.title: Must do!
reviews.text: This is the biggest must-do from Bergen, for me. It gives great perspective on the city, and there are activities (trails, kids playground, restaurant, adventure ziplining park) at the top as well!

reviews.title: Morgenfugl
reviews.text:
Hello🙃🙃
Was in Bergen late September this year. On business, I always try to squeeze in some excersise. 
This time I woke we up at six, put on warm and waterproof clothes (it was raining....), but raining is no showstopper. 
I walked as fast I could all the way up to Fløyen, pretty dark the last part, but the wire was amazing on top, all alone. 
Took some photos and run down. Took me only about 45 minutes. A really good start on an ordinary day👍🏻🙃 try it out👍🏻👍🏻

reviews.title: An easy ride to the mountains
reviews.text: The Floyen Funicular is the best way to start off a day of hiking in the mountains outside of Bergen. In under 10 minutes you are at the starting point of many possible hikes and the view of the city from the terminus is excellent (when it's not fogged in). I don't recommend buying a coffee in the gift shop attached to the funicular...it's out of a machine and was barely coffee. The staff in that shop, however, gave me some excellent hiking recommendations. The funicular also has free wifi.

reviews.title: MAGNIFICENT VIEW
reviews.text: While traveling on a your with Trafalgat, I took time to utilize this funicular experience and I was not disappointed. The views from the top of the port area and the city of Bergen are remarkable. I was able to capture some amazing photos and there are also places to eat and drink at the top. The ride on the tram to the top and return are also photo worthy. Don't miss this memorable opportunity.

reviews.title: A Clear view of Bergen City
reviews.text: Mount Floyen has one of the best views in city next to Ulriken. Cable car/Floyen banen will be a good experience and there are few shops and restaurants in the top. Definitely visitable

reviews.title: Lovely mountain view
reviews.text:
There is a funicular from near the centre of Bergen that takes you to the top of Mount Floyen. Mount Floyen offers outstanding views over Bergen, the port and down the fjord. 
The funicular is basic and no different to other funiculars, walking up Mount Floyen is a better option, or take the funicular up and walk down. 
The view from Mount Floyen is wonderful and there are paths around the mountain to get many different views. 
There were also several ‘tame’ goats wondering around the viewing area of Mount Floyen, they enjoyed having their photos taken. A trip up to Mount Floyen is a worth while experience.

reviews.title: Great views from top
reviews.text: It was pouring with rain, and there was a hoolie blowing.  Great ride, good photo opportunity, coffee not bad, but couldn't really stroll around due to weather.

reviews.title: Good View of Bergen at Top
reviews.text:
The Funicular ride is only a couple of minutes to the top. We went up during the day instead of night because of wanting to have a seafood dinner at the fish market area. It was unfortunate that it was raining that day and was not having very clear view of the city. We waited till the rain stop and the view of the harbour was great. 

Not to miss this trip up mount Floyen which is a must to have a spectacular view of Bergen. However, there is nothing much up the mountain except a small souvenir store and a restaurant. An hour or so would do to have some good photographs if you are not eating at the restaurant.

reviews.title: Goats on a mountain in Bergen
reviews.text: Not only in Switzerland can you find cunning goats. They are in Bergen, Norway as well, on mount Floyen. There you can admire some spectacular views of Bergen, buy souvenirs and if hungry grab a bite or sit in a fancy restaurant. If interested in hiking, mount Floyen is the place where the inhabitants of Bergen go for a brisk walk. Taking the funicular is fun, but it is also nice to walk back to the city, enjoying the scenery on the way. Would not miss Mount Floyen if in Bergen.

reviews.title: Excellent viewing point, great walks at the top
reviews.text: Very frequent ad efficient funicular to the top of the mountain. Lovely walking routes on the top and great views over Bergen

reviews.title: Great photo opp
reviews.text:
Good views en route and at summit. Went in November so no queues to contend with.
Friendly goats at summit may appeal to children. Can choose to walk down through attractive woodland.

reviews.title: Mount floyen
reviews.text:
Excellent! We took the train up and down the mountain. We spent about 3-4 hours on the top of the mountain 

It is breathtaking up in the mountain

reviews.title: Great view over Bergen
reviews.text: Fløyen is located next to the city center and can be reached either by walking or by cable car. You get a great view over Bergen and can use this a starting point for exploring the mountains surrounding Bergen

reviews.title: Good hike
reviews.text: I went hiking and it took about 5 hours back and forth, with frequent stopping and taking pictures.Definitely worth trying if you want to breath some really fresh air and see some amazing trek. Don't forget to check the local weather before you reach uphill as it can get rainy up there and the spoil the view.

reviews.title: Spectacular view
reviews.text: I live in Bergen. Floyen is the first place I make sure to bring visitors. And they are all very impressed by the view of our beautiful city.

reviews.title: Bergen Norway
reviews.text: This a amazing gorgeous place.. Bergen is beautiful city. Full mountain attraction floybanen, Bryggen, fish market. Clubs is just beautiful place.

reviews.title: Absolute must-see and must-experience
reviews.text:
The funicular is operated smoothly (tech specs available for nerds like me) and is well worth the short wait (it runs continuously when there's a queue). The view at the top is just magnificent, being that close to downtown. Don't be fooled and think the view is the only thing worth coming up for; this is only just the beginning. 

Behind the big playground for kids, the real playground begins. Endless hiking possibilities and (in summer season) mountain bike rental, canoe, zipline and many other activities. Hiking (well sign-posted) ranges from short family walks to the lake to a 6 hour breathtaking walk to Ulriken (the other mountain). Very knowledgeable and kind staff at the info desk who gave us custom hiking recommendations. We could have spent days here. Will definitely be back for biking the forest!

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: Was much better than we expected. Beautiful walls, lakes and playgrounds. We even saw goats wandering around! Look out for the signs on the trees - both funny ones and QR codes telling you about the tree.

reviews.title: Escaping the heat
reviews.text: Bergen turned on the heat during my visit; 26C in October and not expected so a trip to the hills was a wonderful escape. The railway was crowded - school holidays but on the trip down managed to get a front seat which offered great views of Bergen. I'm told that hiking is a national pastime in Norway. It's spectacular walking along the trails, passing lakes and finally climbing to a peak recommended by a Norwegian dad out with his two young sons. Out of season so the toilets were locked on the walk! Thank goodness for a cafe with facilities at the top.

reviews.title: Beautiful view!
reviews.text: It is worth the ride to the top for the amazing view you have of the city. Dress warm as it can be a bit windy and chilly.

reviews.title: Fun even in cold weather!
reviews.text: Just so much fun!  The funicular glides up the mountain, beautiful views all the way up.  No surprise this is a popular spot with families in the warm weather, but even on a cold November day this was a great experience.  So many opportunities for photos overlooking the city and inlet, followed by a nice walk around the grounds and a stop in the shop. A must-see on your trip to Bergen.

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text: Easily accessed in downtown Bergen. We paid for the ride up and took the scenic walk down. Once at the top, there are many things to do. There is a lovely restaurant and various hikes. Worth your while.

reviews.title: Spectacular whatever the weather.
reviews.text: We went up first thing on a Sunday morning by accident which turned out to be the best decision.  It was totally uncrowded and the weather was good (no rain!) ,albeit windy.
