The view is fabulous.  There is a cafe that opens early which sells souvenirs as well as muffins and coffee.  The restaurant is only open on weekends from 11am over the winter.

reviews.title: Nice view from Bergen
reviews.text:
It’s always cool to take a funicular to see the city you’re at. In Bergen couldn’t be different!
Obvious reminder: Just watch out for the weather when going up - we ran into 70 km/h winds and tons of rain. We’re still able to see the city but it was tough to stay long outside.

reviews.title: Fantastic!!
reviews.text: The view and hiking trails are absolutely wonderful! Long wait to get on the funicular, but definitely worth it.

reviews.title: Mountain
reviews.text: Walked up to top great views hard going some of the way. Going down was easy ! Recommended for the views. Managed to get up b fire it started raining ;

reviews.title: Funicular up, walk down
reviews.text: My second time in Bergen so wanted to explore the top of Floyen a bit more, got the Funicular to the top which is about 50nok(£5), the view is stunning and we'll worth the trip. After walking around the woodland and lake we took the scenic route down on foot which took around 30-40 minutes and ended up taking us through the pretty coloured houses just above the ticket booth at the entry to the Funicular railway

reviews.title: Convenient location, easy access
reviews.text: The station is location conveniently in town and easy to access. the views at the top are magnificent and really helped us to appreciate the beauty of the city after a wet and cloudy day previously

reviews.title: Nice View ❤️ affordable price
reviews.text: Loved this experience.. you have the chance to take a full overview of Bergen .. & its a nice place to take a walk in the top of the mountain ❤️ the price was about 5 Euros for the ticket - 2 Ways

reviews.title: Bergen panorama
reviews.text: Very cool view of the City of Bergen from the top of the Mount Floyen. Great pictures to be taken. Nice ride with the funicular. You can’t miss it, you will enjoy it!

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: This is a must do when in Bergen.  The view from the top is spectacular.  If you are a senior, request a senior discount as it is available.

reviews.title: If is sunny...
reviews.text: Bergen is the most rainy city in Norway, I heard.  We hiked up before.... do if sunny but don't bother if not.  It is not worth it...

reviews.title: A stunning sight in any kind of weather
reviews.text: The funicular station is easy to get to from the harbour and the round-trip ticket is a must-do excursion while in Bergen. We went on a day that was overcast, and a bit rainy by the time we reached the top of the mountain, but the views were still incredible and worth the trip. There's lots of room to explore, and sit, at the top of the mountain, with multiple vistas for photo opportunities. There's also a restaurant if you're looking to eat while appreciating the view. Don't miss out!

reviews.title: very good soup and bread on a cold day
reviews.text: good cafe for light lunch with a great view of Bergen and the harbor or just have a beer or glass of wine to enjoy the view.

reviews.title: Excellent views
reviews.text:
We had a couple of days in Bergen and due to amount of rain there, we were advised that if we could see the top of the mountain from below, go up it - we could so we did!
Well worth it - stunning views over Bergen, with a cafe, restaurant, shop, toilets and small play park. Saw a couple of the goats, went for a wander about and found the lake at the top, which was lovely. 
The funicular is also a great way to get up there as would be a bit of a trek, although we found ourselves almost walking back down at one point!

reviews.title: wonderful experience!
reviews.text: Inexpensive, frequent service on clean, new trains.  No photo can do the view from the top justice.  If you have half an hour, take a walk to a nearby lake and also look out for the troll statues.  The walk down isn't very far - 3 km or so according to the sign.  (I suppose the walk up is the same distance, but it's very steep so only for athletes!

reviews.title: Magnificent view & funny goats
reviews.text:
Wow, this view! Totally worth the money. And the goats were so funny! Keep track of your plastic bags, they are stealing everything they can looking for snacks. 

Bring picknick! 

Approved by worldbytina.se

reviews.title: Knock-out views
reviews.text: A short ride up the mountain and you feel like you're on top of the world - brilliant views over Bergen and beyond.  Cafe was closed when we were there but the gift shop was selling coffees so we sat and enjoyed the view before venturing off on a walk to the lake, to see the wild goats ( a trip highlight i must say) and then to walk the approx 3km descent down.  Superb views, get a real sense of Norwegian countryside/trees etc.  Great value. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Mount Floyen funicular and hike
reviews.text: Took the funicular to the top of Mount Floyen before hiking.  Clean, well-run, cheap, and it leaves frequently even in the off season.  Amazing views of Bergen from the top.  I would say it is worth going up even if you don't hike and there are some little parks, etc for children.  From there we did a 3.5 hr hike before returning to take the funicular down.  Beautiful views and I would definitely recommend it.  Get a trail map from the tourist office at the fish market for 10Kr- it will give you options for hikes, the routes, and difficulty level.

reviews.title: Great View with Nice Care and Shop at the Top
reviews.text: I hiked to the top of Fløyen last week with my daughter.  It was worth the uphill climb for the beautiful view of Bergen, the delicious mushroom soup at the restaurant, and the lovely shop where I purchased some beautiful mittens.  We did not take the funicular, so I can't comment on that, but the walk up is suitable for most everyone.

reviews.title: Great views and a scenic ride
reviews.text: It was a fantastic experience to go up the Mt Floyen on the Furnicular. The views of Bergen City and the surroundings is astounding. A must do.

reviews.title: A must if you visit Bergen
reviews.text: This is something you must seriously consider doing if you visit Bergen.  The views from the mountain top of Floyen are fantastic on a clear day and the railway gets you there in an efficient way.  Facilities on the top are good with the usual souvenir shops and some cafes.  Locals use the area for walking and there are some good walks.  Children will love the goats.  If you are feeling energetic you can walk up or down instead of using the railway.  One tip is to get to the ticket office early; if cruise ships are in there may be long queues.  You can buy tickets in advance; if you do the alternative queue is much shorter.  In either case, the queues move quickly.  A recommended place to visit.

reviews.title: Best part of Bergen
reviews.text: We walked up and down on one day plus walked around while there and went to the lake.  The walk is easy and beautiful.  Today we took the funicular up and down twice once in the morning and late this afternoon.  It was a gorgeous day.  There were adorable goats and lots of families.  We love this place!  We are in our 60's.

reviews.title: Cold on top
reviews.text: Short but pleasant visit on a cold day, but the views from on top were wonderful. Journey only takes 4 minutes and the vernacular runs regularly. Easy to get to, and small cafe at top is good. Main restaurant is only open at week ends, I think.

reviews.title: A must-do
reviews.text: This is a must while in Bergen. Stunning views from the top, a lovely cafe/restaurant, and some amazing trail walks through the forest. Also a kids playground.

reviews.title: A wonderful ride on a clear day
reviews.text:
This was our first activity in Bergen.  We found the ticket booth and fortunately did not wait long to catch a ride up.  We stood all the way up and saw the panorama of the city below.
At the top we decided to skip the exploration of Mt Floyen and stayed in the cabin, but snagged two seats.  Each cabin only has 4 seats.  The others must stand.
This is a must-do!

reviews.title: Awesome view!
reviews.text: We went up here while staying in Bergen for a few days while waiting to start a tour of the Northen lights. Well worth the price and trip up to the top.

reviews.title: Great view and fun!
reviews.text: Fun ride and a great view of the entire city. The goats were fun too. Since it was October there was no waiting in either direction.

reviews.title: Stunning view.😍
reviews.text: One of the most beautiful spot in Bergen. Really love this place with a great city view. Also beautiful during the sunset. Highly recommended for everyone.

reviews.title: Go for a hike!
reviews.text: There were long lines for the funicular and I was nervous that the whole experience would be too crowded.  But, the hiking was great.  Beautiful views and well maintained trails.  We loved exploring Mount Floyen.  And the OBSTACLE COURSE!  So much fun for our school aged kids.  The whole experience was a real win.  So, my advice would be to allow enough time to get away from the crowds and enjoy this beautiful location.

reviews.title: Spectacular views right outside the city
reviews.text: The Fløibanen funicular railway is simply the easiest way to see all of Bergen from up above the city itself - from the old town of Bryggen to Bergen city centre the views are breathtaking (even on a cloudy day). Whilst at the top of Mount Floyen take the opportunity to wander any one (or even all) of the trails and tracks that wind all over the top of this natural paradise mere meters outside of a bustling city - The lake and it’s waterfalls were a personal favourite.

reviews.title: Stunning views!
reviews.text: If you visit Bergen this is a must! On a clear day the view over the city and harbour is stunning and one can easily spend a couple of hours there.

reviews.title: Always a treat
reviews.text: This is an activity that I enjoy each time I return to Bergen. The tickets are only a few dollars for adults and the view is spectacular. If you travel October or later in the season it can be cold and windy, so dress appropriately. There are walking trails along the mountain side along with real goats that live there. They are friendly goats, but per the signage, do not feed them.

reviews.title: Fantastic views of Bergen.
reviews.text: A must do in Bergen. 50k return ticket to a fantastic panorama of a pretty city. The restaurant is only open on weekends  except in high season, May to September. It's actually the  local public transport up the mountain with two short stops on every second run.

reviews.title: Beautiful view on Bergen and its bay
reviews.text: Surely it is much better to go there on a sunny day. If there is a nice period of weather during the day and between two showers, do consider of going up there. Retunr ticket cost 90 NOK, half of it with bergen card and if you are out of the season (from October), it seems you can go up and down with bergen card without paying for the funicular. You will find restaurant and some souvenir shops as well as lovely paths to walk though the woods. Too bad we could not have more time to walk to a nearby small lake (the sign indicated 500 meters or so). If you are fit, you can even go up (or down) on foot, which makes it than even a sport activity.

reviews.title: great views and wild raspberries
reviews.text: the family hiked after taking the funicular. After getting pastries we were set upon by hungry and aggressive but cute goats. Then we hiked up, stopping at various points (my daughter loved the play area with the mini zip line) and finding wild berries along the way. Truly beautiful, and the views are amazing. Lunch at the hot dog stand was also really good

reviews.title: The highlight to our visit to Bergen
reviews.text: We took the funicular up for a few Kroner, the ride took about five minutes. Once at the top one starts seeing the beautiful views of town and the harbor from up high, they are spectacular. There are many clearly marked trails for those who want to explore this beautiful spot. Be aware that with every turn you will run into another stunning spot that offers yet another breathtaking view. While one can take the funicular both ways, we opted for hiking around, enjoying the fresh air, watching families enjoy these beautiful surroundings while getting some much needed exercise. This is also a photographer or, in my case, a wannabe photographer’s dream. My wife and I ended up walking about 8 miles and enjoying every single step we took. As we hiked down to town, we were stunned by the beautiful vistas with every turn we took. Do not miss Mount Floyen, it’s an absolute must on a visit to Bergen

reviews.title: A must-see for the best view of Bergen!
reviews.text:
A simple ride up on the funicular with stunning views of the city of Bergen!

Won't call it a tourist trap as it really does warrant a view from the top.

Check out the website for when they have free rides :)
Think there are certain months when they offer free rides.

I enjoyed going up there for the panoramic view

reviews.title: On a good day what a view
reviews.text: Stayed very near to Funicular railway. Well worth a trip up to the top with a wonderful view of the city and surrounding area. Very pleasant on the top with walks, wild goats and a restaurant. very reasonably priced.

reviews.title: Must do in Bergen, Look for the goats
reviews.text: A must visit in Bergen! The funicular lift is worth trying and probably quicker but to get the best photos one must find a place .Don't miss out on the goats in the back. They are most charming! If you have kids they will love to meet the goats.

reviews.title: Fun activity
reviews.text: This is a great activity for everyone.  You can ride the Funicular up and down or there are also gorgeous hiking trails leading up to the top.  Great view of Bergen and the water.  It was very affordable and open late.

reviews.title: Efficient funicular to fabulous walks on top
reviews.text: The funicular moves a large number of people quickly - 100 each train. There are lovely walks at the top with goats and views and walk through a beautiful forest to a large lake.

reviews.title: Fabulous Vistas (if You’re Lucky with Weather)
reviews.text: My wife and I were blessed to have a beautiful day to visit Mount Floyen. The funicular was fun and reasonably priced, and the views were spectacular. There are also abundant hiking trails up top once you get there.

reviews.title: Another great trip
reviews.text: 3rd time here and still love the 5min journey to the top of Mount Floyen. About ten pounds buys you a return ticket that is well worth paying for the spectacular views from the top. Railway can become very busy so be prepared to wait if it’s the height of the holiday season. There are free toilets and a Cafe plus the usual gift shop at the top and also the chance to see and have a photo with the resident goats that roam around at the top. . . . .they are very friendly and seem happy to be stroked. This is a “ must go to “ place if you are in the area and I thoroughly recommend it.

reviews.title: Beautiful views of Bergen
reviews.text:
We stopped at Bergen on a day of our cruise and 3 of us decided to visit Mount Floyen and the Funicular which offered stunning views across the town and further.
We had pre booked our tickets which was good as the queues were quite large. We still had to queue - less of a queue, more a mish mash of people- to get on the funicular. It doesn't seem very organised but fortunately it's not too long a wait to get on the funicular itself. Hold on to your tickets as you need them to get through the barriers, so stay together as a group - and be prepared to get separated on the train. It's only a short journey and they're keen to get as many people in the carriage as possible so it can be hard to enjoy the views on the way up or down. 
However, upon arrival at the top, the views are stunning and there is a large area where you can sit it stand for photo opportunities plus another platform you can walk down to (not too many steps) which offers the perfect photo location, where you can see a long way out. 
There is a cafe and a nice little shop at the top and I expect you can do a bit of walking although we didn't do this.
The queues for the return journey down were more organised but still a bit messy getting on the carriage. 
Once you get to the bottom, you're in the town centre where all the shops are and we walked from the Funicular back through the town, through the UNSECO site of Bryggen to our ship which only took about 30minutes at a leisurely stroll.

reviews.title: Great views (if the weather is good!)
reviews.text: Good, fast funicular - a 'must visit' in Bergen. It was a pity the weather was not too good, but there is a large restaurant at the top which serves nice coffee and cakes (bit pricey though, like most things in Norway, but then we found another little café at the back!). We intended to use the railway on the second day of our stay, and walk down to the town through the forest, but the weather was not good enough for this. If you are a senior, then ask for senior price on the railway. We will definitely go again, if we visit Bergen another time.

reviews.title: Ride the funicular up, hike down!
reviews.text:
No matter which way you go up and down Fløyen, it is fantastic! The ride takes about 5 to 6 minutes to the top. When you get there, there is a very wide lookout point with plenty room for everyone. Of course, while you are there, the cafe and restaurant are open during regular hours. There is a play ground for the kids, and hiking trails to several different places as well. The hike down to the city center isn't terribly long, maybe between an hour and hour and a half, but it will be a workout on the legs for sure! 

We went up twice. Once both ways on the funicular, and once riding up and walking down. The forest was really nice and the trail was very well kept. Would suggest for everyone visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Nice little Funicular Journey , expensive but view from top is beautiful on nice sunny day. Nice residential area to see as well.

reviews.title: Wonderful views from the top
reviews.text: The Funicular Railway offered the best views of the city with excellent, terraced, viewing pplatforms providing superb spots for photographs. The very top also has woodland walkways which can be explored and for those who just want to sit and relax, there's a café offering light bites, coffee and tea.  Also a shop for souvenirs. Various signposts advertising other activities, mainly for the young and fit so quite a lot going on up there. A must do if you visit Bergen.

reviews.title: Great way to explore Bergen Norway
reviews.text:
We took the rail up right before sunset, catching the colors change as the City lights came on, was really beautiful.  The rail is fun and really just the tip of the iceberg for what Mount Floyen offers everyone, at any age.

Once at the top we stayed close to the Lodge, exploring the playgrounds, sheep, and views of Bergen.  The mountain should be given at least a day or two to fully explore the trails, lakes, and exploring that can be done.

Super fun find in Bergen to explore nature within an urban area.

reviews.title: Stunning Views and Easy Walk Down
reviews.text: Definitely worth going on the furnicular.  We bought single tickets as we wanted to walk back down.  There were lots of tourists, but the funicular holds a lot of people so we were soon journeying up the steep slope.  There are stops on the way up so don't make the mistake of getting off too early!.  When you reach the top there is a well laid out area where you can take photos of the Bergen or just stand and take in the amazing views.  There is a cafe and gift shop.  We walked along the path and met all the goats which looked beautiful and were very friendly and then continued walking down the hill back to Bergen.  We were pleased we did as the queue to get back on the furnicular was very long.

reviews.title: Great way to get to the walks available at the top
reviews.text: The Funicular provides a good way to access the kilometres of walks and trails on Mount Floyen. The young and the fit run or walk up. We walked down.

reviews.title: "All in one package-cable car, lake view, small hiking" 😁
reviews.text: Mount Floyen visit satisfies the all in one package tour. You get to walk around the small hillocks, valleys and streams, a beautiful lake and small waterfall, picturesque funicular ride, around 2-3 kms of short hiking etc. Its really worth visiting this place. We would have enjoyed even better if it was not raining. After the enchanting walk and thrilling experience, we entered the cafetaria and it completed the circle. Hot chocolate, muffins and pies with good wifi was soothing to the tired legs after walking and hiking along the lake. Must visit to Mount Floyen. If no rains, its good to climb up.

reviews.title: A Must Do Activity
reviews.text: It rains almost constantly in Bergen so don’t wait for a sunny day...Cloudy, overcast or a bit of drizzle take the trip.GREAT views as well as a small gift shop, coffee shop, hotdog stand,ice cream and café in the restaurant building. Be sure to check opening times as we visited in October and the restaurant was closed for the season but everything else was open Saturday and Sunday but not during the week. There are two Handicapped Accessible toilets... one in the restaurant and another as you get off the funicular.  There is also a play area for children with some goats that wander around so be sure to check that out but don’t take food with you as you won’t have it long before the goats take it from you. Also .... the food is quite expensive as it is many places in Norway however I made the mistake of ordering soup without asking how much. It turned out to be a bowl of soup that could be refilled constantly but THE COST… The kroner equivalent to C$26!! Unreal!! And insult to injury ...It was cold!!  When travel extensively and I have to say this was the most overpriced food item that we have ever had. ....anywhere!!

reviews.title: Yes! They are correct.  Must do in Bergen.
reviews.text: This was our last port in Norway and we had booked this in advance ... and were glad we did.  It is truly a must do.  Be advised that it can get extremely crowded with LONG wait lines.  We took an early morning bus tour of Bergen, and our guide told us that in the morning, before some of the other ships dock ... the line is not bad ...so get there ASAP,     We got off our tour bus at the Bergen Hanseatic Wharf stop and did not return to the ship and only walked about three blocks and had a five minute wait to get to the top of Mt. Floyen.  We stayed at the top for about two hours .. had lunch, etc. and when we returned, the line had filled all the inside waiting areas and the maze out on the street.  We found out later there were four major cruise ships in port that day.  The views are spectacular, there are several restaurants and gift shops up top, and a very nice park with trails, zip lines, canoe rentals, bike rentals, etc.  This really gives you an overview of Bergen with its harbor history laid out before you.

reviews.title: An absolute must do in Bergin
reviews.text: If you get a break in the weather make sure you go up Mount Floyen by funicular and walk around to lake. The views are spectacular and the walk is delightful.

reviews.title: Must do for Bergen
reviews.text: We got a one way ticket up so we could do a bit of walking and then walk back into town. It was a bit of a wet day but even still the ride up is so easy, starting close to the town centre, and the views were stunning from the top. Things were scaling down with it being October but normally they seem to have lots of options once you’re up there, trails, bikes, high wire, playgrounds etc. Really cheap to go up which in Bergen is unusual!

reviews.title: Must do
reviews.text: Walked up to Mount Floyen from Bergen. Took just under an hour. Scenic walk amongst pine trees and moss. Beautiful. Keep walking up to Rundemanen if you can, well worth it. The funicular on the way down was a fun way to end the hike and save the knees.

reviews.title: Would Like to Stay Here Forever
reviews.text:
There was a technical trouble and our Funicular ride got delayed first. Finally when we started the tour it was a nice ride towards the Mount Floyen. First the cart comes down the hill and then goes back in reverse. My fiancée said to have a better view should sit on the front raw which has a good observational glass. But the cart is operating in reverse. So my brilliant mind said that we should go for the rare side which is facing the direction of the motion towards Mount Floyen. So I overruled her choice and went to the rear end of the cart. Then there is no view and whatever the space available was for disabled. Rest is history. 

Top of the mountain you get the stunning view of the city. There are many restaurants available over there. We chose to take a walk down the hill through the Forrest. Many people anyway used to climb as well instead of using the Funicular. 

Believe that walk is one of the most relaxing experiences I ever had. It’s a that kind of a place. I have posted some pictures. It might give you some idea. Never miss the walk.

reviews.title: Enjoyable experience
reviews.text: We bought one way tickets and rode the funicular up the mountain to enjoy the vast views of Bergen. We then enjoyed a stroll down the winding,scenic paths all the way back into town.

reviews.title: Nice elevator
reviews.text: Good choice to start a hiking day. On the way down you can easily walk down Floyen to the city centre. You actually arrive exactly where the funicular starts ascending.

reviews.title: Something very special
reviews.text:
Monday 3rd September and were out and about exploring and sightseeing in Bergen and a trip on this funicular was top of our list. The Floibanen funicular runs from the city centre to the top of Mount Floyen 

The ticket office and station are located in the centre of Bergen, simple to find, there are signs posts, can't miss it.

We queued to purchase our tickets which were 190 Krone return for 2 adults, 95 Krone each (roughly £9.50). 

The queue was a bit long we thought we would be there for a long time, took about 15 minutes, very fast moving. The journey took about 6 minutes ride amazing views on the way up to at the top. There was no queueing for the return journey we walked straight on to the awaiting funicular.

There is a wide range of activities available at the top, however the hiking, zip lining and canoeing were not available when we visited, these activities are only available from June to  August. However, it was still possible to visit the Troll Forest and the lake, and enjoy the wonderful views of Bergen down below.

While we were exploring, at the top, we encountered a number of goats wandering freely, they all had names, which was displayed along with photographs on one of the goat huts.

There was still plenty to do at the top and there is shops and restaurant.

reviews.title: fantasicview do not miss it. Bring your camera and been Bergen...a raincoat.
reviews.text:
A really spectacular view over Bergen, the port and miles out. 

The cable car that climbs the steep incline is a great experience, and at the top, there are souvenir shops, places to eat (which seem to offer good quality and at prices that do not seem to exceed anywhere else in the town), and trails to walk. 

Not very far away from the cable car station (about 1km through a nice area of forest) is a fine lake, excellent photo opportunities, so don't forget your camera....or raincoat. Friendly goats are a nice touch too.  There is something for everyone up here, kids or adults will enjoy. 

Return to town via the cable car, bike or hike the 5 or so kilometers depending on what you enjoy.

reviews.title: Floibanen in Bergen
reviews.text: We had a great time exploring Bergen in May 2018 and enjoyed the Floibanen Funicular.  After a short trip up the mountain, we strolled down the lovely, wooded path.  A must-do in Bergen!

reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.text: An exciting ride to the top of this attraction and a beautiful view when you get there.  Lots to explore and enjoy.  Goats and trolls at the top.  If you are in fit condition you can do the walk up or down but the ride up was breathtaking.  Nice gift shop at top as well as restaurant.  Best thing was the very big ice cream cone to enjoy while waiting for the tram down.  The only negative was the hour wait to get onto the tram.  There were a couple of ships in that day so the wait longer than usual.  If you have mobility issues like I do then ask to go to the front and sit on the benches.  Wheelchair accessible with elevator that goes onto the level and into the tram.  Definite must see.

reviews.title: Plan 2 - 3 hours
reviews.text:
We were under some time pressure so regretted not planning in more time. You can happily spend a few hours exploring the area on the summit. Much more than just a view.
If you are fit I’d suggest take a one way ticket up and walk down.  It’s only 3km (2 miles) and takes you through some impressive residential neighbourhoods.

reviews.title: One of the best views of Bergen!
reviews.text: Highly recommended sight with one of the best views of downtown Bergen.  We would recommend you arrive early as later in the day the lines for the funicular get quite long.  It was a neat little trip up the mountain to the top which has a nice open area with seating and just general viewing the area.  I believe you could also walk up the hill, but why bother when the little tram is fun and gets you there so much quicker.

reviews.title: Nice view of Bergen
reviews.text: Very Nice view and good hiking to the summit..Fløibanen is the experience that no visitors to Bergen should be without. It is one of Norway’s most famous attractions, and you will find it in the heart of Bergen, only 150 meters from Fisketorget and Bryggen.

reviews.title: Breathtaking day or night
reviews.text: You can ride up buy your tickets at the information center or right at the train station either way. Can do a round trip or one way either up or down. We done the up bc the walk down way easier. Nice view from top and cafe. There is a place to eat just need make reservations first. This shouldn’t be missed.

reviews.title: Amazing views over Bergen
reviews.text: We took the funicular on the morning we were leaving as the weather had improved.  Great trip up, lovely views and a really nice walk back down to the centre

reviews.title: do this trip!
reviews.text: Great view. take a hike if you would like. We took the Funicular/Tram up anyway. This was a good pre-scenic view for us before heading up to Mount Ulriken the following day.

reviews.title: A must do in Bergen - an amazing view of the city!
reviews.text:
Even if you're just in Bergen for a short-time this is a must do. The funicular is a fun ride up to the top of Mt. Floyen, and gives you an amazing view of the city. Really puts the entirety of everything in prospective.

I recommend doing this early evening, and watching the sun go down. A nice relaxing after-dinner activity. If you're up for it, you can take the hike down, but note its not very well marked, so if you're a slow walker, and you're doing it late, it will get dark quick.

reviews.title: nice view but done in 15 minutes
reviews.text:
A funicular ride is always fun! The ride takes about 5 minutes. The view is very nice. But if you do not want to spend your money at the restaurant, then you are done in 15 minutes.

For the Dutch. The finish line where Tom Dumoulin won his World Cup time trail is still there with a plaque.

reviews.title: Enjoy the funicular and keep on walking
reviews.text: It is highly recommended to take a hike when you reach the top. I recommend a trip to Rundemannen mountain.

reviews.title: Spectacular views of the city.
reviews.text: We got here early in the morning (9:30) and there was no line! It can get very busy as tour groups arrive and fill up the car quickly. As one car goes up, the other comes down. The view from the top is great. There is a nice gift shop and a dining venue at the top. Locals ride up and enjoy the abundant outdoor activities in the park at the top--a park with trails, skiing opportunities in winter, play structures for children, etc. Bergen offers many scenic views and this location was our favorite. Plus, riding the funicular was really fun. We were lucky and got the front seat going down.

reviews.title: Great view and nice park
reviews.text:
We had a great time taking the Floibanen up Mount Floyen. The station is easy to access, directly in the city center, and the ride was fun. The view over Bergen was great. We strolled around the lake and our teenage boys had a lot of fun skipping rocks on the water. 
The only downside was that it was very crowded and we had to wait for some time to get onto the cable car. But overall well worth it!

reviews.title: Great place to take in the view
reviews.text: On arrival to Bergen on our Viking Cruise, one activity was the funicular tram to the top of Mount Floyen.  The tram was quite an experience and the view from the top showed all the city and surrounding area was outstanding

reviews.title: Nice view over Bergen
reviews.text: Definitely worth your time to hike up or take the funicular. Good view over the city and a stroll around the area.

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: It's a super beautiful place and super easy to access. Can take cable from central city to the top only six mins. Can't be miss!

reviews.title: Great View
reviews.text: This is a very popular attraction in Bergen and the queue can be a bit daunting. However the cabins are pretty large and the crowds move up quickly. The trip up in the Funicular can be a bit crowded and if you are stuck in the middle photo opportunities are limited. The view from the top is very spectacular, but rug up, it can be pretty cold. It is not too expensive. That said, everything in Norway is expensive! Well worth a visit.

reviews.title: A must to see if you visit Bergen
reviews.text: Funicular Fløibanen in Bergen is a must to see when in Bergen.  which takes you to a stunning view-point at Mt Fløyen. Funicular train takes from city to top of the mount Floyen in 15 minutes. It is wheel chair friendly. View from top is breath taking. Loved the place.

reviews.title: Top of the world
reviews.text: Weather was not great - bit overcast with mix of sun and rain - but even so, had a really good experience. Views spectacular and you get such a fantastic panoramic view. I ate at the café at the top and it was very great quality and not overly expensive. Waiting staff great. Well worth spending time once you're up there. Nice to see Bergen as it gets dark and the lights go on. Possibly due to weather, but there were no queues when I went, I was advised, if going on a busy day - when weather excellent or cruise ships in - best to go before 10am or after 5pm. Bergen is such a great place for a visit but the Floyen Funicular is definitely its crowning glory.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text: It is a short ride up the funicular and once up, you have great views of Bergen's harbor, town and surrounding areas.  Once up, you can spend as much time as you like taking easy walks around the area or setting off on more demanding hikes.  There is a restaurant and shop at the top.

reviews.title: If you get a nice day when you can sit outside, drop everything else and go there!
reviews.text: It rains 235 days a year in Bergen.  We were fortunate enough to get one really nice, sunny September day out of three.  We quickly seized on our good fortune and took the funicular up to Mount Floyen.  There are paths to hike, a nice playground for kids, a hotdog stand and a  large restaurant with outdoor seating.  But the real deal was sipping a couple of Hansa Beers while sitting at one of those outside tables in the rare sunshine, and looking down at the harbor and city below.  It's quite the view.  Like I said, if you get a day like that in Bergen, drop everything and head up the funicular to Mount Floyen.  You won't regret it.

reviews.title: Must Do
reviews.text: We were here on a dull dreary rainy day and it was still outstanding. I can't imagine how much nicer it must be on a sunny day.  It is about a 10 minute ride up. You can purchase a one way ticket and walk down or get a return ticket.  There are numerous paths and trails to walk when up top

reviews.title: Great view from the top
reviews.text: Clean, bright and efficient trip up the hill, great views at the top, and a lovely walk down. Definitely a 'must do' whilst in Bergen.

reviews.title: Beautiful views. Book on line not via cruise ship.
reviews.text: Lovely views. Booked on line and cost 1/5th of the price charged by Cunard. Restaurant at the top is pricey but no more than we expected in Norway.

reviews.title: A lovely funicular trip
reviews.text: Take the Fløyn funicular up to the mountain (fjell) top, it will most likely rain, and go for a walk among huge trees, many of the several hundred years old. After a while you will find the lake Skomakerdiket, lovely among the old wood. Back to the funicular and look out over the Bergen town deep down on the seaside. A visit to Bergen should always include a trip up to Fløyn.

reviews.title: Amazing views of Bergen and nice hiking paths
reviews.text:
Although there are nice hiking paths upwards, we decided to take the funicular and then hike in the top of the mountain. We purchased the funicular ticket on the spot - I suppose as it was already off-season there were only about 8-10 people waiting before us. The price was 95 NOK (it is a retour ticket).
The funicular runs regularly and it takes you up in 5-10 minutes to the top. After arriving you might take pictures about the wonderful views of the city and the fjords. We also went on a smaller hiking to the forest and the lakes - it was absolutely amazing and peaceful.

reviews.title: You have to do this.
reviews.text: To get the best view of Bergen you have to go to the top of Mount Floyen on the funicular. The view is the perfect way to see this picturesque seaside city. A nice restaurant and sausage/hot dog stand. Consider walking down...not to stressful and good exercise.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: You can walk up Mount Floyen, but most people take the Funicular railway which runs from close to the town centre in Bergen. When you get to the top there are great views across Bergen and beyond. There are food outlets with local walks and a children's play area but the views are what really makes it. Be warned that at busy times you can queue for a while to join the funicular railway.

reviews.title: Up and down cable car, great view in any weather
reviews.text:
Overall: 4
Comments: a visit to Bergen has to include a ride with Fløybanen, always exciting and never the same. 
Location: 4
Offering: 4-5
Originality: 4
Presentation: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Service: 4
Cleanliness: 3-4
Price: 3
Price/value: 4
Revisit: next time

reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.text: When visiting Bergen you might wanna check out this view. We liked the view. Could easily give it 4/5 rating. But after the view in Ålesund (Fjellstua) and the overview of Geiranger (Dalsnibba) I didn’t enjoyed this view as much as I should. I feel kind of spoiled. But the view over city is still great.

reviews.title: Three minor hikes to try
reviews.text:
Mount Floyen has multiple paths that you can follow.  There are some which are well marked and some are slightly off trail (but still marked).   The presence of these multiple trails allows you to mix and match and see something different each time you visit. And what multiple trails also allows for is the spreading out of people so that you get the satisfaction of being close to nature and also a bit of solitude.  This was my absolute favorite activity in Bergen and although I had only planned on visiting it once, I ended up going every day and dropping most other things. 

All the proper trails are centered around Brushytten (it's a cabin/shop).  So first make your way there - the signs will take you there easily.   What you won't find though is any signpost that shows all the trails that you can follow. I used Google Maps for this, zooming in enough shows the different hiking trails. 

So here are a few minor hikes to try if you're looking for ideas.  

My first day I veered right at Brushytten and then walked all the way up the overlooking hill, then down and to the bottom of Store Tindevatnet - where there was an ancient looking wall that you can cross over!

Second day, veered left just before Brushytten to walk along Storediket, Nedrediket and Storevatnet.  About Storevatnet - continuing along will take you to Stoltzekleiven, so it's a bit busier than other parts, lots of people walking or running here. 

Third day, continued straight up from Brushytten which takes you further up the Floyen area for nicer views.  

It was perfectly fine walking here even in rain/overcast weather. There was a pretty good breeze as well which reduced the difficulty of any upward climbing.  

And as everyone will tell you - always take water, snacks, proper hiking boots.

reviews.title: Beautiful views over Bergen
reviews.text: Used the funicular as part of a tour off a cruise ship. You could quite easily do it yourself. The train is very busy when a ship is in port. The walking trails are well signed at the top and were mostly wide and easy to find. Nice cafe at the top of the funicular plus there are public toilets. The views were stunning. The Hanseatic League era quayside was a bit of a disappointment, lots of work going on.

reviews.title: Nice park on top and great views
reviews.text: This funicular takes to you to a place with outstanding views of Bergen and its fjords.  But, it is more than that.  From there, there are hiking trails that take off.  There is also a beautiful park filled with parents and their children having a wonderful time.  It is not to be missed in Bergen.

reviews.title: Worth a visit for the views
reviews.text:
We docked here as part of our cruise. Being a Sunday meant a lot of the retail shops were closed in the area, so we opted to go on the funicular.

I would recommend either pre booking tickets on the website or visiting the bakery on the same street to pick up a ticket (and a pastry) in advance as there are 2 queues - one pre paid and one to buy tickets. On the day we went, the pre pay queue was about 12 metres long as wgere as the queue to buy tickets was approx 50 metres long down the street.

The trip up in the car is only about 8 minutes or so but the views at the top are fantastic - a real sightseeing treat and photo/video opportunity.

There is also a restaurant and shop at the top too.

It offers good value for money (80 NOK return adult fare) and should be done if in the area.

reviews.title: Fun ride, great views, and cute goats
reviews.text: Great views of Bergen await you after a fun ride on the funicular. Once you arrive at the top, the kids can burn off some steam in the playground, pose with a friendly troll, say "hi" to some friendly goats, take a hike, have a snack, or just enjoy the beautiful scenery!

reviews.title: Fantastic views and nice walking trails
reviews.text:
The funicular is a quick way to reach the top of mount fløyen. 
The view is definitely worth the trip up. 
There are well signposted walks starting near the viewing platform.

reviews.title: Great view from the top
reviews.text: I bought tickets on line before we went on our cruise.  They gave a senior discount.  The view from the top is wonderful.  This is a must see in Bergen.

reviews.title: Great view of the city!
reviews.text: Definitely worth taking the funicular to see the best view of the whole city. Quick trip up and down, plus some nice places to see, get a bite to eat or even walk around and do a small hike.

reviews.title: Good view of Bergen
reviews.text: Good for people who don’t like hiking. Easy way up to Floyen mountain and enjoyed the view of Bergen from above. Nice park for kids to enjoy.

reviews.title: Good Panoramic View At The Top
reviews.text: The line for the funicular ride was extremely long as our group waited about an hour to get to the ticket window.  But once you get the tickets, you're immediately in line to board the funicular.  The ride on the funicular is not long lasting about 10 minutes to get to the top.  Once at the top, you get a majestic panoramic view of the Bergen coast and after taking in the numerous photo opts, walk around to see the many goats that seem to reside in that area.  There are also trails for walking if you want to spend more time at the top.  If not, do back down and visit the fish market and the town...

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.text: We went on a very clear sunny day so it was well worth it. Great view from up the top. Go early as, when we arrived back down, the line to go up was about 500 people long. When we boarded, it was only a 10 minute wait but it would have been at least 2 hours with the queues we saw.

reviews.title: Well worth the wait
reviews.text: My suggestion is that you purchase your ticket in advance either online or at the visitor's center. The line for people with tickets was far shorter. Your seating in any of the cable cars is really luck of the draw - you line up on the stairs and then slide into the cars. The view on the way up and down depends on where you are sitting or standing. The views for the top were outstanding. You have options as to what to do once you are on the top if you are so inclined. Relatively inexpensive and a wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.text: This was the highlight of our visit to downtown Bergen.  It was fun to take the funicular to the top and to enjoy the great views of the city.  We had great weather and spent many hours hiking around the park at the top and enjoying cold beverages and ice cream while being followed around by the resident goats. The easiest way to see the views from over the city.  We found it best to wait until the afternoon to go up in order to avoid the crowds from the cruise ships, but still had plenty time to explore at the top.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: We had limited time so rode up, and straight back. It was cold and windy at the top. A great experience though, and wonderful views. Would love to return on a sunny day.

reviews.title: amazing views!
reviews.text: Cool funicular and so much to do at the top.  Highly recommend enjoying the stadium viewpoint, the goats on staff and many other activities on Mount Floyen.

reviews.title: As Advertised
reviews.text: Took the Funicular up once and walked down. Gorgeous summit views; Absolutely Must See. Had some beers at the top. Do not miss. Would have loved to stay for sunset but that would have been at midnight ;).

reviews.title: Great Views of Bergen!
reviews.text: This funicular railway goes all the way to Mount Floyen and the views of Bergen from the top is spectacular.

reviews.title: windy foggy weather are good to be too
reviews.text: It is nice idea to use mountain train to get to te top of Floyen even when weather is horrible . There is a good touristic base on the top of mount  so  you will not be disappointing by  luck of spectacular  vie win bad weather conditions . The  real trip Advisors  never give up

reviews.title: Great Views at top
reviews.text: Good little railway up to viewing platform with very regular departures. At top great views over the harbour and a wealth of walking trails

reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.text: The driver who collected me and my wife from the airport strongly recommended we take advantage of the clear skies and take the funicular up for best views of Bergen. We were not disappointed. Its a short sharp steep ascent and the views are wonderful. After coffee and  a lovely walk through the forest to the nearby lake we returned all in all within 90 mins. A stunning introduction to Bergen.

reviews.title: Great view over Bergen
reviews.text: Took the funicular up the mountain to look over the city. We were not disappointed as the view is just perfect. Bergen really is a beautiful town!

reviews.title: Stunning View of the City
reviews.text: The ride up the funicular was one of the highlights of our trip. We were lucky to have a beautiful, sunny and clear day to enjoy our time up on Mount Floyen. We enjoyed the cafe at the top and also loved getting an ice cream cone in the little store. Definitely a must activity if you are in Bergen!

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Great view of Bergen from the top! There are souvenirs, restaurants, playgrounds and even goats up here. Nice hiking trails that offer short or long excursions in nature. It's possible to walk back into town in about 45 minutes.

reviews.title: Great views even on Rainy Windy Days!!
reviews.text: We decided to go during a rainy afternoon even though we knew the views wouldn’t be the greatest. Well the views turned out better than we thought and we got some great shots. The wind was very strong and made standing outside on the viewing platform uncomfortable but not enough to not enjoy the view. Another plus of going when we did was there weren’t many other people there or on the ride both up and down.

reviews.title: Unforgettable views
reviews.text: The trip up and down the mountain to the view point is effortless with the cable train. Cost for a return ticket was 95 NOK. Great views of Bergen from the top. This is one of the must do activities when in Bergen.

reviews.title: View not to be missed if weather good
reviews.text: Join the long lines for the funicular. The ride is very quick but the view has that wow value. Almost didn’t go because of the line, but it moves fairly quickly. Shows what a beautiful city Bergen is.

reviews.title: Something to do for a few hours in Bergen
reviews.text: My friend and I went up one morning when it just opened. We enjoyed the funicular that took us up as it gave us a great view of the city. Views from the top of Mount Floyen was pretty amazing as you can see the city and the fjords in the distance. We walked around for a bit and saw the resident goats up there but otherwise were unable to track further in due to the weather and too much ice on the ground. But still, the view was worth the trip up.

reviews.title: Fantastic views of the city.
reviews.text: The trip to the top of Mount Floyen was well worth the price, even if we had some rain. To have the maximum experience, try to get the front seat on the way down. We were treated to a double rainbow!!

reviews.title: Train with a view
reviews.text:
We found if there are cruise ships in, it is better to wait until around midday before trying to go up in the Funicular as there were long queues.
The carriages (two on a balanced system) car about 65 people per journey which takes just a few minutes and shuttles each time it is filled.
The views over Bergen from the top are fantastic and then there are around 10 tame goats wandering around the top usually on the cadge for food.

reviews.title: Wow what a view!
reviews.text: Fantastic trip up funicular railway (tip: buy tickets before you get there to save one queue ) to arrive at a most spectacular viewpoint.  There are a couple of cafes, a shop, children's play area and several walks at the top as well.

reviews.title: MUST SEE!!
reviews.text: Don't be scared by the line, it moves fast. The trip up to the top of Mount Floyen only takes 5 minutes and the view is spectacular!! There are lots of hiking trails and places to grab a bit to eat, ice cream and souvenirs.

reviews.title: Spectacular Views of Bergen & areas
reviews.text:
Date of Visit:  Friday, Aug 31st, 2018

One of the Must-do attractions in Bergen is the Mount Floyen Funicular. This ‘train’ shuttles you from the base of the mountain to the Top, where you will be greeted by some of the most spectacular views of Bergen – the fjords, the city, mountains, and waterfalls. 

When you arrive, you will see a very long line, do not let that discourage you, as it almost did us. If you do not have a ticket, just go to the left hand side – do not stand in that long line. The ticket booths are on the left hand side of the entrance building. The long line up is for Pre-purchase ticket holders. 
When you buy your tickets you will then be corralled forward. 
As you get closer you will realize how fast the line really moves. 
each car holds about a hundred people, and there are 2 cars – one going in each direction at a time. 
The ride is very short - they say 5 minutes, but it feels shorter. 
So with 2 cars doing the mountain, those lines move fast. 

The cost – not expensive – it doesn’t really matter the price – because the experience is worth it. 
It is mostly 360 panorama glass – so you will get great views regardless where you sit or stand. 
The rush is for the front of the car – but I just happened to get the seat at the back of the car going up. This provided me with a beautiful vantage point of the views of Bergen as we ascended the mountain. I think I prefer this. 

The car is crowded – so if you cannot handle crowds – keep this in mind, but also – remember the ride is very quick. 
There are stairs to climb once you get to the top, however people with real mobility concerns needn’t worry – there is an elevator. 

Once you reach the top – WOW! – just gorgeous. All of Norway is gorgeous – but just when you think it can’t get any better --- you reach the top of Mt Floyen. 
Be considerate – everyone wants to get that perfect photo – so do not get pushy, and make way for others – so they will do the same for you. 
There is a lovely set of stairs with a look out that is made of glass so it is perfect for photo ops. 

There is a café to buy a bit of lunch, a gift shop to buy some souvenirs, there is a children’s park – complete with a Troll Statue. 

IF you come to Bergen, a trip to the top of Mt Floyen on the Funicular is a must. 
It won’t eat up a lot of your time, so just make it happen. 
This is definitely a must-do on your next trip to Bergen, Norway

reviews.title: A great photo opportunity
reviews.text: If taking the blue bus tour, purchase a ticket at the same time to avoid the line at entry point. Great experience.

reviews.title: Must do in bergen
reviews.text: The funicular was fun, line moved quickly and many things to do at the top...particularly for children but we loved it as well. Lovely walk down so wear comfortable shoes if you plan to hike down, canoes on the lake at the top

reviews.title: Beautiful views of Bergen
reviews.text: We were on a cruise, so didn't have a huge amount of time (the problem with cruising).   Took the funicular up Mt. Floyen to see the views.  Didn't expec the goats!   Yes, goats who live up there.  They're sweet and friendly.   The views are spectacular.  There are some trails up there, but we didn't have time to do a lot of exploring.   Very pretty place and worth the trip up.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: This is a must! We have a four year old, and she loved the playgrounds. The nature playground is fun for kids and adults! We loved the zip line at the nature playground. The hikes at the top of very nice. We liked the Floyen so much we went twice. The first time we rode the funicular up and walked down. The next day we hiked up and back down. You can do this - we did it with a four year old! We also liked relaxing at the top with a snack from the restaurant. The views at sunset are wonderful.

reviews.title: Fun train ride to the summit for breathtaking views.
reviews.text: We didn't have to queue for very long to get on the train but it can be very busy. The ride to the top took less than 5 minutes. The weather wasn't great but the views were stunning over the city and port of Bergen. There is a viewing platform stepped over many levels so everyone can have a great view. There is a cafe and gift shop and walks through the woods.

reviews.title: Extraordinary view!
reviews.text: This was the highlight of our trip to Norway, wow! The view is just out of this world. We went up a few times, I suggest going up in the evening if you can, the cruise ship passengers head there very early so you might want to avoid there until the late afternoon to early evening.

reviews.title: Easy way to the top of Floyen!
reviews.text: Lots of fun riding the funicular and much more to do at the top as well as a spectacular view of Bergen and the valley!

reviews.title: I can never resist a funicular and this one is something special
reviews.text: Very steep with great views almost from the outset, this is such a fun journey.  Both ways I had a great seat to make the most of the views but wherever you are they are stunning.  Once at the top the views over Bergen are quite spectacular and there was plenty of room to make the most of them.  I was lucky as I managed to avoid the cruise crowds.  The frequency of the service is really spot on and you do not find yourself waiting for ages.

reviews.title: great view
reviews.text: I went up near sunset. Great views at the top and the trip up is fairly quick. You can buy a ticket online if there's a big queue at the ticket office, but when I went there was no line.

reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.text: Definitely a must do! Even though there was a long line it moved constantly. Wouldnt have waited more than 10 minutes in total and that includes getting tickets. Very efficient boarding & disembarking system. Amazing views of Bergen from the top. Would be wonderful at night!

reviews.title: Great Views Over Bergen
reviews.text: Traveling up Mount Floyen by funicular is fun and the views over the city and harbour are breathtaking. We walked to the beautiful Scomakerdiket lake before walking down around the mountain, a lovely walk with fun statues e.g. Brass Stag, Dobbie which capture your interest on the way back to town.

reviews.title: quick efficient and a great view
reviews.text: As the title really, this is a good ride to a fantastic viewpoint over all of Bergen. Do it at the start of your day/stay in Bergen  for a god overview

reviews.title: Stunning views, and a pretty lake as a bonus.
reviews.text:
The venicular railway will take you to the top of this mountain and on a clear day provide absolutely stunning views over Bergen. 

Whilst at the top of the railway, take a six minute walk through the Forrest to reach a very pretty lake. Stunning. An easy walk.

If you are a senior citizen make sue you inform the staff when buying your ticket. We received 50% discount. At 100 Krona for two people it was a wonderful value-packed morning that left us gasping at how beautiful Bergen is.

reviews.title: Fun and great views!
reviews.text: This was a fun ride. There are great photo ops at the top. There are a couple of stores and a couple of restaurants.

reviews.title: Marvellous Experience
reviews.text: Took the ride up and walked 40mins back down and enjoyed the beautiful views all round. Well recommended.

reviews.title: Ya... just go!
reviews.text: Stellar views, ‘nough said. “Have-to-go” type of place. Pricey, like everything in Norway. Don’t forget to visit the Troll bear the gift shop. Plenty of ways to spend money up there.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: The view is the thing but there are numerous forest walks to enjoy also. Don’t bother about the food and drink. Better options are down below.

reviews.title: Timing is everything!  Fantastic views but try to avoid the cruise crowds.
reviews.text: My friends and I had a wonderful experience and ride up and down the funicular.  It's a wonderful view and there are some short walks available at the top, too.  We heard from other tourists we ran into that they experienced a very long wait both ways due to cruise ship crowds. We did not, but we went up late in the afternoon.

reviews.title: Breathtaking. Beautiful views of city. Epic photo opportunity.
reviews.text:
A must do thing in Bergen. Again a lot has been spoken about this place and there is no doubt anyone who sees it will be swept away with the views of sea and city. This is what I have to suggest.

1. Take the ride up by floibanen and walk it down on your way back.

2. The views up there are spectacular. There is whole list of activities you can do up there from adventure sports, play in park, see wild cattle, good restaurant options, perfect place to see sunrise and sunset and most importantly the a photo opportunity where you will not stop clicking pictures.

3. The walk down is interesting as the landscapes keep changing and the neighborhood and house are interesting sights.

4. For people who would not like to walk down all the way, take the funnicular to one station before the final station on your way down. You can start walking from there on and it is 15 mins from there.

reviews.title: Great Vista
reviews.text: The ride up the funicular is well worth the price of admission. Sweeping views of all of Bergen. One can also use some trails to get an even better perspective. Restaurant available.

reviews.title: Spectacular View awaits if you take the funicular
reviews.text:
Funicular ride up to mount floyen and down from mount floyen is fun. Its a must when in Bergen.
What is more spectacular is the panaromic view from top of Bergen from Mount Floyen. It leaves us awestruck on how well a city can look.
There are lot of fun activities as well to take on top and a place to dine.
When in bergen dont miss the ride and views.

reviews.title: Sort ride and nice city view from the mountain
reviews.text: I visited this place multiple times with in a couple of years. The short Funicular ride itself is entertaining for those not having enough time to walk to the top. The Mount Floyen is one of the most visited place in the Bergen, as it is popular to enjoy beautiful cityscape and the fjord. I recommend to check weather before you plan your travel and take windproof jacket with you.

reviews.title: Walk it up and funicular it down
reviews.text: Mount floyen is a nice walk. Start off early in the morning, preferably before 9. We suggest you walk up and come down with the funicular, its more fun that way. Beware of long lines for the funicular if you decide to go up after 11am.

reviews.title: Ride up - walk down.
reviews.text: Great way to spend a couple of hours. Lovely view and a very comfortable 3km bush walk back down to Bergen. There is also a couple of restaurants at the top but not great for coffee.

reviews.title: Amazing view of Bergen
reviews.text: During our stay in Bergen we went up Floyen twice, the first time we went to watch the sunset which was absolutely amazing! Second time we went up on the funicular and then walked down to the city centre. Very scenic and beautiful!

reviews.title: Beautiful view and nice hikes
reviews.text: A ride to the top costs you 95kr for a return. You get a beautiful view of Bergen and the opportunity to walk in the forêts which are amazing ! Really worth it!

reviews.title: Raining cats and dogs!
reviews.text: So we decided to go up the railway and hike down because of the weather. The lake at the top was a short walk away and gorgeous. Great views and the hike down was easy and very scenic. It would have bee nice to do this on a sunny day but I've been told that is very rare.

reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.text: Enjoy the funicular ride although you are packed in at the top there is a shop and restaurant plenty of toilets children’s play ground and a lovely walk the view is amazing. We walked down took about 45mins but worth it.

reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.text: The sun came out when we arrived after the short but thrilling ride to the top of the mountain. Many opportunities for stunning photography. Large paved trails and small woodsy paths. Reasonable ticket price reduced further with Bergen Card.

reviews.title: Lovely secret lake!
reviews.text: We had not booked a tour from our cruise for Bergen so got out early and walked to the funicular stop. We were lucky we went early as on the way out the queue was very long but when we got there, there was no queue at all. So if you have not booked already, I advise to go early. The system to get on the funicular is very organised but it feels like they crowd so many people in it and so its not fun for people who have other people in front of the them and cant see the view. Once we got to the top, the viewing point was spectacular and there was a nice seating point and place to take pictures. We then walked to the lake which was about 10 minutes to get to and the scenery was spectacular. It was so so peaceful and beautiful to be there. However, the walk can be a bit steep so if you have trouble walking I do not recommend,

reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.text: My wife and I took the Funicular to see the views. It was gorgeous. We bought our ticket as part of the Hop On - Hop Off bus tour. It enabled us to skip the ticket purchase line. There was a long line, but the line moves quickly. The car comes every ten minutes, so there is not a long wait. The views are spectacular, and it wasn't cold. There are cafes, bathrooms, and gift shops at the top. There is also a small park for kids, and walking paths through gardens. Trolls are all over, to get additional pictures. Trolls are big in Norway!

reviews.title: Great photo opportunity
reviews.text: High reccomended to photo lovers. By night, you have a great shot to wonderful photos. Open til 23 h. If you are a fit person, buy one way ticket, and walk down from the mountain to the city. There are a lot of local people running and it is very safe.

reviews.title: Great views - a must do in Bergen
reviews.text: We got here early (around 9am) which meant we avoided the queues which build up as the day goes on. It cost about £9 each which was good value ( especially for Norway). It was a pleasant trip up and the views at the top were fantastic.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: We took the return trip and even though it was raining, we both enjoyed it. We went early (9.30am) and only 6 people on it. By the time we returned to the bottom, there were crowds lining up, so go early. There is a cafe, restaurant and gift shop at the top and toilets. Worth doing.

reviews.title: Good way up, cool view
reviews.text: It takes 10 minutes or less to go up and you can already see how high you go. It leaves about every 15 minutes. If there is no mist or much clouds you have a beautiful view, otherwise you see nothing because its to cloudy. You have different walking routes and a cafe and souvenir shop. If you want to get out of the city you can find more peace here.

reviews.title: Must do in Bergen
reviews.text: Lovely ride 885 meters to top of Mount Floyen. Great views of the city and water, photo taking, and there’s a pretty nice gift shop too.

reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.text: Probably the best view in Bergen. This place is so popular, you have to wait at least for 30 minutes. It is best to go early in the morning to avoid big lines. We took one way ticket up and walked down to the city, it was a great walk.

reviews.title: Quite possibly the best views in Bergen
reviews.text: Really a must-do if you are in Bergen. The funicular is open till late (11:00 pm I think). If possible, go in the evening and make sure you see Bergen with its lights. There is a play park up there for children. I also read about some activities like zip-lining (but we didn't do them). Overall, it's value for money.

reviews.title: Superb view and wheelchair frienfly
reviews.text: Weather was perfect so the view was totally unrestricted. 2 of our party need mobility assistance and the site was organised superbly to allow this.  Fantastic trip

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: Well worth the fare. The view from the top is gorgeous.  There is a cafe and a restaurant/bar plus a children’s play area.

reviews.title: Special place to spend a couple of hours
reviews.text: The side itself up mount Floyen is well as special as any other funicular ride is. But once up there, besides the views, this is a wonderful place especially for young children. Lots to places to run around, swings and slides, ice creams and mountain goats, a lake to paddle in and lovely woods for easy walks. We actually walked down to the city centre which made the afternoon out even more exciting. Definitely recommended.

reviews.title: If the weather is good this is a stunning experience.
reviews.text:
If you arrive at Bergen by cruise ship make sure this is the first place you visit as by mid morning the queues are incredibly long.
Tickets are available at the entrance but pre-booked tickets give you a slight advantage and are probably cheaper.
Personally I really enjoyed the ride up and down and as it was a clear sunny day the views were fantastic.

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.text: We arrived in Bergen on a cruise with one of our to dos being the funicular and Mt. Floyen.W and i would suugest if coming from a cruise to go straight to the funicular  and then tour the city centre. We had a wait of 45 minutes to get aboard because of the crowd. Nevertheless it was a great trip both ways as the the city came into view as we rose up with absolutely stunning views over the city from the viewing point. WE were lucky to have a very fine day which added to the views. We also walked to the lake which wasn't far away. Definitely a must do.

reviews.title: Nice trip to the top
reviews.text:
We decided to go up the funicular railway to Mount Floyen, and is something we will do again when we go back to Bergen.

We were visiting port on a cruise ship, which makes for long queues waiting to go on the train.  There are two lines of queues, one with tickets and one without.  We got lucky that the line without tickets was shorter than those with, and were up the top before the other line.  Even when your through the ticket office, you still join the lines through the tunnel to the platform.  Probably took us 30 minutes to get on the train.

Stunning views over Bergen await you at the top, particularly if its a clear day like we had.  There are plenty of trails to walk at the top, and  restaurant, toilets etc.  We didn't find any of the roaming goats though.

This was also the location of the 2017 Road World Championship time trial, with a commemorative plaque on the finish line, celebrating Tom Dumoulin's win.

If we had more time I think we would have walked back down the mountain, and enjoy the wonderful views.

Well worth a visit, but time it well if more than one cruise ship is in port.

reviews.title: Well worth it
reviews.text: The views from the top are out of this world. Only downfall was queuing to get onto tram.as only holds so many.

reviews.title: Perfect for a City overview
reviews.text: Mount Floyen is th eperfect start to get an overview of the City and the surrounding Fjord. You need to use th eFloibanen to get to the top. Avoid the time when the big Cruise Ships arrive. It is better to wait an hour till they are gone and you will have easy access instead of waiting for 60 minutes.

reviews.title: You should climb this if possible
reviews.text: I took a oneway ticket to up and walked down to city in a sunny day in Bergen. Floyen is in "must-do-series". Beautiful sights and restaurants also up there. But if you really have some time - you should hike a little bit around Floyen like norwegians/locals do there. Trails are were wellconditioned and distance via road down to valley is approx 3km and offering nice woods plus sights and norwegian houses via roads.

reviews.title: Best views of the city and nice walking trails
reviews.text: We took the funicular up Mount Floyen after dinner. The ride was quick but it was a little crowded as we got there they same time as a tour group. Views of the city were great! We got there too late in the day to see any goats or do any of the Mount Floyen activities but we did take the trails back to the city center. It was a great walk but pretty steep - make sure you're wearing good shoes if you chose to walk down!

reviews.title: A must in Bergen
reviews.text: We took the Funicular up and walked down.  The view of Bergen and harbor are spectacular!  Since the weather is ever changing we had to wait a bit for the fog to clear but wow!

reviews.title: Great view, long lines
reviews.text: We went on the funicular through a cruise excursion so we didn't have to wait on a line for tickets, although there is still a line for ticket holders. You won't see much unless standing up and we enjoyed the ride going down. Up at the top, there are lovely views, hiking trails, a gift shop and cafe. Also there is free WiFi, a big treat after using the ship's slow service. The lines were huge when we came down in the afternoon. Table mates on the ship had no trouble getting on early, when it opened.

reviews.title: Stunning Views! Go Before 10/After 3 to Avoid the Cruise Crowds!
reviews.text: At about $6 roundtrip, this is a pleasant interlude for adults, and offering play facilities at the top for children. At the top are also a charming, spacious restaurant, as well as a hot dog stand and ice cream. And a few resident goats for the children. Unless you eat here, you will enjoy the views and (barring long lines) be up and down within 45 minutes.

reviews.title: Lovely view and route to hikes
reviews.text: The funicular is a quick beautiful ride up the mountain with a view of the whole city. There are cafes at the top, and you can ride back down, walk down, or use the peak as a starting point for many miles of hiking above the city.

reviews.title: Must see/do in Bergen!
reviews.text: We went twice in two days to do a couple different hikes. The mountain is so accessible if you are in central Bergen and the views at the top are amazing. Absolutely a must do if you’re in Bergen.

reviews.title: Gorgeous, a must do!
reviews.text: We are on tour.  A cruise ship was in town too.  We were advised to wait until the ship was due to depart before going.  That meant after lunch.  We were worried the clouds would be moving in but once we got up there the views are absolute amazing! You can walk up and/or down.  We were told the walk down is 45 mins so I suppose the walk up is however fit you are!  We rode both ways as it was paid by our tour company.  Our queue time was about 30 mins long to go up and we walked right on to go back down.  Windy up top meant if I had my jacket I would have worn it.  We ate at the restaurant but there was also an outdoor place selling hot dogs, beer and soda.  Since we ate at the restaurant I used the inside toilets.  The entrance was not guarded so probably anyone could use them.  It was crowded but there is lots of space to spread out for great views of Bergen!

reviews.title: Wonderful Views – Long Wait
reviews.text:
This is a spectacular ride up the mountain within Bergen. The view from the ride is very interesting and the view from the top is terrific and well worth visiting. To avoid standing in long lines you should buy the tickets in advance. Even so, with 4 cruise ships in town both queues were too long. Closer to lunch time there was almost no queue at all.
The price is reasonable for this great funicular ride and there is free wi-fi. The shops and cafes at the top of the ride are small and not very interesting. However, if it is a clear day the views are wonderful and ideal for photos.

reviews.title: Fabulous views and an amazing natural wonderland at the top
reviews.text:
A ship was in Bergen so we had to queue but only for 30 minutes.....well worth the wait

We bought a single with the intention to walk back down (45 mins approx and 3.3kms)

The views are stunning, all of Bergen laid out below you.

Behind the station there are an abundance of walks in a much wilder and natural area than we were expecting given it’s close city proximity.

Really well worth the trip and if you have time spend a few hours walking up on the tops

reviews.title: Incredible view - even better at sunset
reviews.text: I went here with family and we happened to catch the right train for a sunset view. It was stunning! The ride up itself is awesome. If you wait at the bottommost step, then you have a great view on the way up of Bergen unfolding beneath you. If the train isn’t crowded, there isn’t a bad seat on the train.  (if it’s crowded, it’s just hard to see anything if you are short.) absolutely worth it, and even better if you can make it work to watch the sun set over the ocean.

reviews.title: Photographic sights...
reviews.text: A popular sight in Bergen. The ride up the hill is also used by locals as there are a number of neighbourhood stops on the way up. Fantastic views of harbour, town and countryside. Just the view can be done in 15 min but there are other things including restaurant that could keep you longer.

reviews.title: A must see
reviews.text: The funicular was wonderful although the queues were long we had prepaid tickets and had to wait about 25 minutes to travel, but it was well worth it. The views from the top of the mountain are spectacular.. I would recommend going around 2.00--3.00pm when the queues seemed to have dispersed. The best thing is to purchase your tickets before you go..

reviews.title: Beautiful views!
reviews.text: We ascended and descended by funicular and with much regret, only had time to enjoy and admire the great view of Bergen and its surroundings, and to buy several souvenirs in the nice shop.   Had we had several hours to spare, we would have enjoyed the various trails and parks the mountain offers.   Something for everybody, a hiker's dream!

reviews.title: Spectacular view.
reviews.text:
Had a fill of great views. Spent quiet time there, taking in the view of the valley below. Glad we could get up there on a nice sunny day. Lucky, I guess. We were told that fog can roll in at a moment's notice. But not when we were there.  Restaurants, eateries are on the expensive side. If you are hungry, I guess you gotta eat. The ride up was more enjoyable than the way down, that's my opinion. I have done a similar one on table top mountain in South Africa. I enjoyed the down ride. So, it depends on how you feel.
It was cool up there. Go prepared.

reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.text: Took the ride while on a stop during a cruise. We did not buy tickets in advance and were lucky, the line was only about 15 minutes. The cab driver said it could easily be over 1 hour just to buy tickets and then wait in line. Short trip to the top. Lots of places to spend money, but the reason for our visit was the ride and the view. Took some pictures, wondered around and headed back down within an hour. Glad we did it once, but really no need to repeat it unless your first experience was in bad weather.

reviews.title: Excellent outdoor area above Bergen.
reviews.text: The funicular is extremely busy but queues and ticketing are dealt with efficiently. We took a one way trip up to Floyen deciding to return on foot to the city centre. When you arrive at the upper station the viewing platform, although understandably busy, offers extensive views of Bergen and surrounds.
