However getting away from the crowds is easy in this remarkable outdoor playground where you quickly forget you are above Norway’s second city. There are a variety of walks, all lengths and ranging from easy to challenging. You can also hire bikes and canoes and during the summer there is a zip line. Everything the locals need to remain fit and healthy, on their own doorstep.

reviews.title: An absolute must when in Bergen!
reviews.text: We enjoyed our ride up the funicularand were able to take some photos along the way.  There was a line and we did have to wait about20 minutes before our ride, but it was worth the wait.  Once we reached the top, the view was spectacular!  We took many photos of the city below, from every angle.  We found our hotel, various museums, but mostly enjoyed the view of the ships and water below.  Unfortunately there were a lot of people there at the same time, so it was tough to take pictures with the other couple who accompanied us to the top without strangers in the photo.  If there are large cruise ships in the harbor, we were told to plan your trip up the funicular for late afternoon.

reviews.title: Lovely... wish I had more time
reviews.text: Loved the funicular (went very late in the evening as there were long queues in the morning). There is  a lot to do when you get up there but unfortunately I didnt have the time. I did walk back to the city which was lovely.

reviews.title: Fabulous Views
reviews.text: We were lucky I guess. The weather and the lighting of Bergen were fabulous so we got a lot of great pictures from the top. The  ride up was as exciting as we expected, as was the ride down. It was so goo dthat we had to do it a second time, but this time we walked down on the well signposted paths. Only downside -- be ready to queue

reviews.title: Amazing, a must!
reviews.text: Took the tram up during a beautiful sunny day – absolutely amazing views and even though there were a lot of people it never felt really crowded. You can easily walk to a small lake at the top and take in the wonderful scenery.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Worth going up after 4pm to avoid the queues. An amazing view at the top. We purchased a drink and enjoyed the view in the sunshine.

reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.text: I travelled to the Norwegian fjords on a cruise  with my family and my mother in law. We went up the funicular early which we were glad we did as it gets very busy. It’s very easy to do as there is a ticket office at the entrance,not sure if the price as we brought the tickets as part of an excursion. Short train ride takes you to the top of the mountain where you get to see amazing views of Bergen, the fjord and harbour below and you can follow one of the many nature trails that leads you to a small but still very beautiful lake. There’s a play area and troll rail for small children and a zip wire for the most daring. Some other trails will take you down the mountain if you didn’t want to go back down on the funicular. For those who just want to take in the scenery there is a cafe and a souvenir shop, warning when spending money Norway is very expensive but it is worth doing.

reviews.title: Funicular
reviews.text: Amazing views of Bergen!! Would highly recommend it if you are ever in the city. There’s a lake up there and play areas for children. You can walk back down to the city if you wanted to instead of using the tram.

reviews.title: Must do in Bergen
reviews.text: Were lucky with great weather, so the view was even better than imagined! It's a must see and do when in Bergen. The ride itself is nothing special, but the view from the plartform is a great way to see the city and sorroundings.

reviews.title: A great vantage point of the city
reviews.text: We took the train up and decided to walk down. The journey was very steep lasted about 5-6 minutes so was a bit pricey but worth doing. Up the top is a cafe/bar and loads of walking trails. On the route back down is loads of outdoor gym posts but also some great ‘off-piste’ trails to come down. It was a decent trek down but a lovely view too. Worth a few hours to get the great vantage point of the city. I think we were too late in the day but there was mountain bike hire, canoe hire, zip line routes and all sorts up there.

reviews.title: Great atmosphere and view
reviews.text: We walked up and down so can't comment on the funicular but definitely worth the trip however you make it. It was a sunny Sunday afternoon and it seemed like a large proportion of the Bergen population had headed to Mount Floyen. Lovely family atmosphere and even though queues for refreshments were long, they were quite fast moving. Views of the city are fantastic!

reviews.title: Don’t miss this experience
reviews.text: We had a little trouble finding the entrance, a short steep walk only a block off the main tourist area. Well worth price and wait for enjoyable ride to the top for panoramic views of Bergen.   There’s gift shop for snacks or restaurant for a meal.  Lovely in the evening as a cruise ship departed and the sun was low over waters.

reviews.title: fun ride, great views
reviews.text: Crowded ride up and down, but amazing views are well worth the trip. Spend some time walking around the top seeing just how spread out Bergen is.

reviews.title: Excellent View
reviews.text: It afforded spectacular views of Bergen. A yoga class was being held up there and it was rather cool to cold

reviews.title: Beat the Queues
reviews.text: I got on the train first thing in the morning with about four other people.  I got the viewing platform to myself and had a quiet walk around.  By the time I went back down there was a huge queue and over the next few days I would look up and see that same viewing platform full of people.  Get up there early.

reviews.title: Must do.
reviews.text: Go early. At 9-10 am in the weekends it is crowded. Before 9 am we were 3 people going up. Possible to take childrens stroller and wheel chair

reviews.title: Walk in the forest with great views!
reviews.text: Amazing views of the city!  We also walked through the forest to the lake and got some great pictures

reviews.title: Short of time? This is a must😀
reviews.text:
Get here early and avoid the rush. Cruise ship tourists etc
We only had one full day in Bergen and the tourist information centre recommended the Floibanen - thank you.
You get a birds eye view of the city and can wander around and talk to the goats, see the lake etc
Easy walk down to the city for the active if you don’t want to return on the Floibanen

reviews.title: Must see!
reviews.text: We’re here on a cruise and took the fanicular up. Then we hiked down. It’s a gorgeous hike and you can’t get lost. Many trails lead to City Centre. So, just follow the signs.

reviews.title: Spectacular and Fresh
reviews.text:
3 weeks ago visited Mount Fløyen in the city centre of Bergen. Long queues but remarkably, waiting time was not as long as expected due to the capacity and speed of the funicular's and company's organisation. Clean and tidy throughout and amazing views of Bergen and surrounding areas, THIS IS A MUST DO when visiting Bergen.
There are also many activities at the top of the mountain for example canoeing, zip wire, hikes, etc. Really enjoyed our time and stayed for 5 hours at the top, just so relaxing and fresh. One last thing the staff are really friendly, helpful and sincere, thank you.

reviews.title: Busy but a fantastic view
reviews.text: Very busy on top but not too bad away from the view - which is spectacular. Various things to do on top - nice cafe, play area, souvenir shop, walks and goats! Nice walks down back to town too.

reviews.title: Panoramic Views of Bergen, Bryggen, Fjords and the North Sea
reviews.text: The funicular station to go up to Mount Floyen is an easy walk from anywhere in the Bryggen area.  The lines move quickly and it is a short ride to the top.  We were fortunate and enjoyed a beautifully clear day.  You are able to see the entire Bergen cityscape, the historic Bryggen waterfront, the fjords and the North Sea in a sweeping panorama.  There is food for lunch, snacks, and desserts with indoor and outdoor seating, plus wine, beer, soft drinks and water.  There are walking trails and a play area for children.

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen!
reviews.text: This is a must do when visiting Bergen. If you have already purchased your ticket the line moves pretty fast. Go for the views, not the ride. Take a walk and see the many sights; a lake, goats, shops and a restaurant. If you happen to be a geocacher you can find those there as well. We would have stayed longer but the water wasn't working which meant the restrooms weren't either. Go before you go.....

reviews.title: Nice view with panorama terrasse
reviews.text: This funicular starts from the city center (close to fish market) up mount floyen. At the top, there are restaurants, a shop and a beautiful terrasse with view on Bergen and the Fjords. There are multiple short & long hikes on top. You can also walk down in about one hour. If the weather is nice, it's really enjoyable and so close to the city. Lots of people.

reviews.title: What a view
reviews.text: We went here purely on the advice of our waitresss and we were so glad that we did ..we saw the sunset over Bergen, then sat at the restaurant wrapped in warm blankets drinking hot chocolate Admiring the amazing view, the waitress at the restaurant was so sweet and told us about the tradition of taking down the flags of an evening, which she was doing 😀 Thank you for a lovely experience 😀

reviews.title: Great views! Very crowded!
reviews.text:
Great views from the topand travelling up/down, but extremely crowded. It was, however at the weekend and there were lots of locals (many with dogs).
I got elbowed several times by over enthusiastc tourists!
Had a quick walk round the lake at the top, which was pretty. Kids played in playground and we all ran from the numerous wasps!! Massive queue’s for the toilet!!

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We took the funicular railway up on a day when there were 5 cruise ships in port. We were surprised that we didn't have to queue very long and we hadn't pre-booked tickets. It was a stunning day and the views from the top were amazing. We walked down through the forests which was lovely. Definitely not to be missed when visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Wonderful views!
reviews.text: The funicular itself is fun but its only a short ride. But the views from the mountain are breathtaking! Go up and have a nice strenuous walk back down to the city. Really lovely nature and views on the city.

reviews.title: great views of bergen
reviews.text: Very quick trip to the top of Floyen,best taken early or late to avoid crowds.several hikes available from the top.

reviews.title: Great views on a nice day
reviews.text: Queues were not too long and it was a quick funicular ride up the top of Mount Floiban. Great views up top. Friendly goats for entertainment, kayaking on a lake and a 40 easy minute walk down.

reviews.title: Great view worth your time
reviews.text: We took the Funicular up because we were short on time. Next time we might just as well hike up. The views are well worth it.

reviews.title: Perfect view!
reviews.text: This was incredible. 30minutes waiting line but it is worth it. Trainride was fun too! Costs are 9€ for a return.

reviews.title: Go early morning if you can!
reviews.text: Great experience with fantastic views on what turned out to be a beautiful sunny day in Bergen! Book your tickets online ahead of time if you can, to skip most of the queue still buying tickets on the day. And go early morning if you can....the queues & volume of tourists taking selfies at the top builds up as the morning goes on....

reviews.title: Amazing views on a sunny day
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our journey up the mountain and the views from the top. Highly recommended if you visit Bergen.

reviews.title: Great views from the top
reviews.text: The day I went the lines were very long. There were a few cruise ships in port and it didn't rain. The ride took about 5 to 10 minutes each way. Once at the top there were great views.  I opted to use the funicular both directions.  There was an option to walk down.

reviews.title: Get there early
reviews.text: We arrived at the floibanen by 8:30 am, and boarded right away. We enjoyed the views of the city from the top, and spent some time hiking in what look like enchanted forests. When we reached the bottom, the line for the funicular reached far down the street.  Even though we very much wanted to hike mt. Floyen, we may have skipped it if we had arrived with that line already in place.

reviews.title: Beautiful view of the city
reviews.text: Road the funicular in the late afternoon when the crowds & cruise ships had left. We had a short wait, less than 10 minutes. Beautiful views of the city. Grounds at the top were well maintained and there are multiple viewing opportunities. There is a gift store at well as food.

reviews.title: top view
reviews.text: Great viewpoint, photo ops, great ride to top. Get an online ticket so that you dont queue. on top there is a trek to see a lake or Loch.  coffee shop, which sell a good cuppa and cakes. Troll human size and a playground for kids....and so on

reviews.title: Long Queue but great views
reviews.text: We arrived in Bergen by cruise ship and the city is within easy walking distance of the port. Begen is an interesting city with various attractions and points of interest. There are colourful wooden houses, a fortress, a fish market with dining, lots of shops and the Funicular railway, The queues to buy tickets and then to queue for the train can be considerable. My advice is to purchase the tickets on line through the web site, which then allows you to bypass the ticket queue. The trains run frequently to the summit so the queue does steadily move along.  The views at the top are amazing and worth the waiting time, although a clear day is best. The woodlands and walks aat the top are also very good and there are play facilities for children of various ages, toilets and a gift shop. Unfortunately some of the organised tours simply do not allow enough time at the summit. We explored alone and easily spent 2 hours  but were aware others on tours were only allowed about 30 minutes. Bergen, like most places in Norway is expensive compared to UK prices so be aware if dining or shopping. The weather in Bergen can be wet so best be prepared. We enjoyed our day in Bergen and would happily re-visit on a future occasion.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: Very nice views. Amazing scenery. Too busy. Good value for money. Lots of poop on the pavement unfortunately and so a bad smell

reviews.title: Nice view from top of the city
reviews.text: One of the must-see attractions in Bergen with an excellent view over Bergen. Buy the Bergen card and you can get a great discount when buying the funicular tickets.

reviews.title: Amazing views - bring hiking boots
reviews.text: Go in the evening to see the sunset. Bring your hiking shoes if you want to walk down - it's crazy steep. Also evening will avoid long lines from cruise ships passengers (heard it was a 3 hour wait in the morning).

reviews.title: Great views of Bergen
reviews.text: The Funicular is a short walk from shopping and the piers, and it's very easy to get tickets for and ride.  The line looked long, but the wait was only about 15 minutes to go up (we had no wait to come down).  We really would have liked to walk back down, as there are nice trails to do so, but it was sort of a rainy day so we chose not to.  It was fun wandering around at the top, seeing the great views (including the goats!).  We were surprised to see how big the Bergen area is; you can't really tell from below.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: Well worth the money! Buy your tickets in advance as it helps with the queue. Wonderful views and great walking up on the plateau.

reviews.title: cheap and easy - a lovely view
reviews.text: We went up to this viewpoint on Saturday - the queue was only about 20 mins. It was a very easy to use automated system. The view from the top was super - we stayed about an hour. The goats were pretty fun too - but there is no chance of having a picnic up here unless you want a goat to sit inches from your face and spend the whole time trying to steal your food!

reviews.title: Lovely place to spend time when in Bergen
reviews.text: The funicular looks more like a train than anything and is built to carry 100 passengers at a time. There are no guard rails when waiting for the funicular so watch out for your kids! The ride is fast and views at the top are amazing. Also awaiting you are the resident goats who are clean, tame, and pet-able! So cute. Lots of hiking trails, a lake, a decent restaurant with clean bathrooms, and a nice gift store. Ice cream is available too. A very lovely visit.

reviews.title: Worth doing for the view
reviews.text: However, we went as a part of a cruise tour and the coffee shop wasn't open late morning.  They did eventually open up - and the coffee and carrot cake was delicious!

reviews.title: A Bergen Highlight!
reviews.text: We spent several delightful hours enjoying Mount Floyen during our visit to Bergen in June 2018. Mount Floyen towers over Bergen at a height of nearly 1,400 feet. There were four separate segments to our experience of the mountain. The first was a ride up the mountain on a funicular which ascends from the centre of the city to the mountaintop in a ride of less than ten minutes, one which provides great views during the ascent. The second segment was our time on the mountaintop whose various viewing stations provided breathtaking views of Bergen, it's harbor and the surrounding countryside. The third segment was our invigorating hike down Mount Floyen through forests and eventually past older mountain residences. Finally, when we reached the bottom of the mountain just to the left of the entrance to the funicular station we found a great bakery with delicious coffee and baked goods. Overall, it was a great afternoon in Bergen!

reviews.title: A Must!!
reviews.text: We had a beautiful day to take the Funicular and enjoyed hiking all the trails when we got to the top. The trip to the top of Mt Floyen is only 5 minutes so the line moves fast and the views from the top are spectacular.

reviews.title: Good times on a Sunny day!
reviews.text: The view is amazing.  Grab your friends and family and head up to the top.  If the lines are long no worries they move fast.  If you are smartphone savvy you can buy your tickets with the app.  Don't forget a vanilla ice cream cone with licorice sprinkles

reviews.title: Great place to vist
reviews.text: Fantastic experience recommended to everyone see and the information given was excellent well worth the trip.

reviews.title: A ‘must do’ if you are visiting Bergen
reviews.text: A beautiful trip that ends in a spectactular view over Bergen. You can chose to walk if you don’t mind some uphill walking or you can take the wire-based funicular.

reviews.title: Easy walk for an amazing view of Bergen!
reviews.text: From up there you can see the whole of Bergen and it is breathtaking! We did not use the funicular as the way up is quite easy - we did not put our hiking shoes back on which was nice. Sneakers were enough and still the view point was amazing. Easy way to have a great view of the city.

reviews.title: More than just a good view
reviews.text:
A couple of tips:
- Book tickets online to avoid the queues
- There are 4 entry gates. Many people queue in twos, so it's up to you if you push up a bit!
- If it's a nice day, I'd recommend walking down. It's mostly a small road so you don't need specialist shoes, but it's quite a long way, so make sure you're up to it
- There's quite a lot of other things to do when you get up there, so do a bit of research first and plan time appropriately!

reviews.title: Nice romantic walk up and down
reviews.text: If you have a issu about walking, you can take the mountain trolly up and down. And just take the breath taking overwue from the top. Its also a good place to visit with children, old people, or just a family trip.

reviews.title: Spectacular views - but pick your time to visit
reviews.text:
Visited this as per of a Fred Olsen cruise excursion

We noticed that the queues in the morning were enormous and we were told people turning up on spec gave up  - whereas we visited mid afternoon and the queues were quite small 

The views of Bergen at the top of the railway are (on a clear day) spectacular - and the viewing platform gives ample space and time to appreciate it 

A must if you’re in Bergen

reviews.title: More than just the views
reviews.text: Floibanen is a very popular attraction in Bergen so be sure to come early and buy tickets online to skip the queue.  We got there early and by the time we came down around 11ish and the line was already super long on a Sunday morning.  You can actually hike up/down here and take the furnicular midway or at any of its stops.  The views are why people come, but what is more surprising is the amount of activities provided from children playgrounds for young to older kids, zip line (more for younger kids), goats to canoe rides which are free of charge from 6/24 to 8/26.  There're several hiking trails that can take you all the down to the city.

reviews.title: Great Hike
reviews.text: We climbed through the forest to the top twice for exercise and the views of Bergen. We liked the hike up and taking the Funicular down. Highly recommend it!

reviews.title: Beautiful and affordable
reviews.text:
The funicular up is about $11USD per person. The ride is short and feels extremely safe. The views from the top are absolutely breath taking even on a rainy day. The local goats at the top of the mountain are also adorable and friendly! They have a gift shop and small restaurant for snacks and refreshments. 
This was maybe one of the most beautiful things in the city!

reviews.title: Your visit to Bergen isn't complete without this
reviews.text:
One of the few things you must do in Bergen is to find your  way up to the top of Mount Floyen.   It gives you a perspective of the city, there are hiking trails, and it's just fun.   

Make sure you avoid times when cruise ships arrive - usually in the morning.   Taking in the view via the Funicular is one of the first things they do when they land, and you can find yourself waiting an hour for the ride.     If you have the stamina, you can walk up.  It's a couple mile uphill trek, and you get a good feel for the city.   Otherwise, head up there in the afternoon after the crowds die down.

The best place to stand is at the bottom of the car to get an unobstructed view.  If you can't get that, find a place to stand along the railing of the section you're standing in.

At the top, you'll find a few things including an ice cream shop.   It's a place meant to deal with the high volume of tourists, so don't expect gourmet.  But an icy treat is great for hikers.

Photographers would want to get up there either really early in the morning or after sunset.   The late day sun shines right at the top of the hill, so it's hard to get a good photo straight into the light after around 11am in summer.

reviews.title: A Must Do - lovely trip
reviews.text: We went up the funicular to Floyen twice, once in thick cloud where we couldn't see a thing - it was really cool and a bit creepy! We went up again on a clear day and the views are fantastic, loads of walks, and the lake. There are a few coffee shops at the top, and the walk down is beautiful.

reviews.title: Beautiful views, hiking trails and lake
reviews.text: Absolute must for any visit to Bergen!  Very pleasant walking trails through woods and to small lake (with canoe rentals) to get away from the manageable crowds at scenic overviews near funicular station.

reviews.title: Good time. Buy your tickets in advance
reviews.text: Our tickets were bought in advance by our travel agent...totally worth it...separate kiosk line (with no one on it). Easy trip up on a crowded funicular. At the top, after you take in the classic view it becomes like a park grounds. A nice walk around.

reviews.title: Nice way to spend a couple of hours
reviews.text: We skipped the funicular and instead enjoyed a nice 50-minute walk up the mountain to check out the view. This is a lovely area, with playgrounds, a cafe with pastries and ice cream, and a lake for activities as well as access to other hiking trails. A nice activity for the whole family in Bergen.

reviews.title: Fine
reviews.text: The funicular is fine, nothing special, but cool for children. It is a bit overpriced for what you get. If you want the view, but also would like to save some money, there is a hiking trail which is not demanding with which you can get to the top.

reviews.title: A great view od the city
reviews.text:
The furnicular cost 95 krone return. It takes a couple of minutes to get to the top, stopping at a few points along the way. Once you reach the top the view is pretty spectacular! A must do for Bergen in my opinion. We went up at 9pm. At that time, teams come every half hour.

At the top there is also a shop, restaurant, playground and a few other things, including friendly goats.

reviews.title: Mount Floyen Funicular
reviews.text: Well worth a visit.  £9.50 entry to the funicular, if on a cruise ship, don't book a trip here, you can easily walk from the ship, a booked trip will cost around £40 and thats vastly overpriced.  View from the top is fantastic, the goats are lovely and the experience is a nice thing to do!

reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.text: Very easy to get to.   Easy to purchase tickets on site.   Beautiful view from top.   Go early to miss the crowds.

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.text: Great view. It takes only few minutes to reach the top. Nice cafe, gift shop, playground, forrest walk and connection to other activities are there. Must do at Bergen.

reviews.title: Good views, crowded vehicle
reviews.text: Get to the station early before the tour buses or be prepared for a wait and an squashed ascent.  They manage to flow of people very well, but there are still lots of people to manage.

reviews.title: Great view over Bergen and nice walking areas
reviews.text:
Fløibanen starts in the city centre of Bergen and the funicular take you right up to the Mount Floyen, where you have panorama view over the city and harbour of Bergen.
Note that there can be que especially in the peak tourist periode and when large cruice ships are embarked in Bergen harbour.
At the top, why not walk along the many nice footpaths. There is also a nearby small lake where you can picnic and rent a canoe.
Instead of taking the funicular down again, do the 2.5 km walk with nice view

reviews.title: Must do in Bergen
reviews.text:
Reading the reviews and arriving with cruise ship our strategy was:
Book online for 95 NOK, more or less 10€ for return ticket.
Walking from the pier to the Floibanen is 15 min.
Don’t rush and take your time by the time organized tour groups from the cruises take their pictures and leave.
After lunch there is no queue to enter, but there are still people buying tickets in line.
Note that the schedule from their website is not applicable when there are cruise ships. They operate continuously. Any time is good to go.
People normally spend less than 2 hours there. Taking breath taking photos of the town, the port and the islands around.
Amazing views. 
We followed the recommendations below to walk around. The lake is great for relaxing stop.
Taking the cable car up and down is great experience with 3-4 stops, passing couple of tunnels and enjoying the view to the city and the neighborhood.
The wagons are with windows on the roof that allow amazing views.

reviews.title: Great outing
reviews.text: Great outing! Get there early as the queue can get quite long if the weather is good. It’s a great walk back down and I’d recommend walking down instead of taking the funicular.

reviews.title: Fun ride - easiest hiking in Norway!
reviews.text:
If you’re lucky enough to take this short train ride when no cruise ships are in port, it will be much more enjoyable (no waiting in line).  Once at the top, the are endless paved and gravel hiking trails that go high if you want to.  There is a fantastic children’s play area, and good signage throughout.  If you didn’t bring hiking gear this might be the set of mountain trails for you.

The vistas of Bergen are quite breathtaking.

Lots of runners going up and down the trails - quite impressive.

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text:
Very much worth taking the funicular up to mount Floyen for the vista.  Just get there as early as you can and buy tickets to the funicular online as the lines can get very long.  

Once you get off the funicular there is a shop and viewing area.  A short hike up from there is a fresh water lake and a troll exhibit.

reviews.title: High Bergen
reviews.text: A must to see in Bergen. With or without the rain. You have a good feeling of the fjord and how this city spreads around.

reviews.title: Very nice walk
reviews.text: We drove up to the mid station and then walked up in the woods. The trails are very well described and the panorama is outstanding. Nice restaurant/ cafeteria on top. Several playground for kids. There’s also an area with very funny goats used to be petted by tourists. Recommended.

reviews.title: On a clear day there is a great view over Bergen. Well worth the ride.
reviews.text: Great ride to the top with splendid views of Bergen. Nice coffee shop to relax and admire the view from.

reviews.title: Great hike with amazing views
reviews.text: We hiked up the mountain, took us about one and a half hours with quite a few stops in between; at the kids playground, the fun tube slide and stops for some stunning photos. The hike is not difficult with a proper road and pathway, smooth terrain and not very steep either. I'd definitely recommend the hike to the top to avoid the long queues for the funicular and you also get to enjoy the views along the way. We took the funicular on the way down which was really quick, less than 5 minutes and shorter queues as well.

reviews.title: You have to do this!
reviews.text: So glad that we took the trip up the mountain. it was a beautiful day and the view was amazing. There's a lovely park area at the top with wild goats wandering around. Had a great ice cream up there. I resisted the locally produced hot dogs, but regret not trying one as they looked really good.

reviews.title: Must Do
reviews.text: A must when visiting Bergen. It’s a very modern cable car which takes you to the top of the mountain for stunning views over the city and harbour. Doesn’t take long to get to the top but it’s very popular so suggest getting there around 9am before all the tour buses turn up and there will be a long wait. There are only two cars on the track taking about 100 people at a time.

reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.text: Last time we visitedBergen we took the funicular. It’s best to go early as it can get very busy. This time we decided to walk up the zigzag path from the cruise port which was about 5km and great fun though tiring. The cafe at the top had many customers but managed well. There was one server and he could sell coffee and pastries as well as cooking fresh batches of pastries. There was free wifi

reviews.title: Must see in Bergen
reviews.text: Make sure this is on your list when visiting historic Bergen.  Amazing views of the city and harbor.  Be sure to hike up to the lake once at the top.  Worth it.  We recommend being there early morning or evening.

reviews.title: Perfect panorama
reviews.text: Easy reach of the top even if there was a lot of people waiting for going up. Perfect panorama to Bergen. Some tame goats can be contacted. Easy tours can be made e.g. around a lake (combined with a free canoeing on it). It is not hard to descend back to Bergen by walk.

reviews.title: When in Bergen....
reviews.text: So when in Bergen you might as well do its number #1 attraction- Mount Fløyen.  Get into the queue to get your tickets - with early morning crowds in August - it should take you about 1/2 hour to get on the funicular railway. When on top - take the pictures & enjoy a beer!.

reviews.title: View Plus!
reviews.text: It’s a nice view of the city and harbor from the top, but there is also more. Trails lead to a pond, multiple playgrounds, bike rental, etc.

reviews.title: Bad weather but worth it.
reviews.text: Really nice funicular. Quick ride to the top. Although it was raining and overcast it was still a site to see. The weather changes so quickly in Norway so after 5 minutes of rain and clouds it cleared and the view was beautiful.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text:
Well worth a trip up, not that expensive and we walked back down which is an easy 45 minutes down a tarmac road. There are a few off roads areas as well if you want to cut out the loops.
Great walks at the top and with a bit of planning you could do an number of routes. Weather changes quickly so be prepared

reviews.title: Best view of Bergen
reviews.text: We got to the Funicular early and waited for only a short time to ride to the top.  If you don't arrive early, expect long lines.  It really has phenomenal views of Bergen and the harbor and was probably the highlight of our stay.

reviews.title: My wife said what do we do in Bergen
reviews.text: I replied take the funicular & have a look at the view & go for a little walk. However, when we reached the bottom of the funicular the queues were long & so we decided to have a look at the fish market & also the fruit market

reviews.title: Bring Your Camera - Amazing Views
reviews.text: This is a must do if you visit Bergen. This was the second time I've done it (both in March). The ride up is quick and then you are in for a treat because the view is amazing. You can take the tram up and down or you can walk up and down. You can also get a one way ticket up which is what we did. Bears repeating - the view is incredibly amazing. Tons of photo opportunities with the city and mountains in the background and not too crowded (keep in mind this was March so it might be more crowded in the spring and summer). There's a hotel up there and a gift store. When we went this time, there was a ton of snow. This is important because they do not treat the path so you're in for a lot of ice and rail holding walking down. I was a bit scared during one portion of it as I'm super clumsy and shuffling along a sheet of pure ice downhill is terrifying to me. The first time we did it, the path was clear and it's not a bad walk at all. I'd definitely go back again if in Bergen.

reviews.title: Obviously a Must DO when in the area
reviews.text:
Gorgeous views from all areas, the area is a must see and the funicular which was built for practical purposes is now teeming with tourists and for good reason, You have to wait on line which moves fairly quickly, There is some pushing and shoving which is not necessary , all get to the top , there is much to see and do on the top, lots of photo opportunities, hikes, beautiful lake, THe obligatory picture with the troll, Buy some trinkets and just enjoy the day!
Tip: when you get into the funicular going up  go to the opposite door where the view is better, prepare your camera. Going down to to the window facing forward and prepare your camera. However dont push and shove to get there, better to wait for the next car and position yourself first to get in. Its worth the minor wait as long as you can do so politely. 
The area is clean and well maintained,

reviews.title: HIGH AND HIGHER
reviews.text:
A good tip is pay before you go up the funicular to avoid the qs.
The ride up is fast and fun. The view up the top of the mountain over the town is spectacular. The town is exciting and full of culture.

reviews.title: Great view of Bergen
reviews.text: Having read other reviews, we booked online, got to the station early, and had no line.  The view from the top was good, we walked to the nearby lake, then down the easy trail back to town.

reviews.title: Fantastic view of Bergen
reviews.text: This was our second time on the funicular. Weather permitting, the view is marvelous. Our first time a couple of years ago, the weather was less than perfect as was the view but we still had a nice time. This time the weather was perfect although maybe a little warm for Bergen. When we got to the top we enjoyed a nice lunch from the cafeteria style restaurant, wandered a couple of the trails and saw the goats that inhabit the area. Everyone including our grand kids enjoyed the experience.

reviews.title: Get to the floibanen early!
reviews.text:
I have been here twice and also know others that have done the same- get here early! If you are arriving by cruise ship (as we did), the cruise line will offer you a 'fast track' ticket up the funicular. For able bodied people, the cruise line deal is a waste of time. Please, please walk off the ship early and head straight to the funicular. You can then go up without queuing, enjoy the scenery (with relatively few other people around) and explore the area, all before the 'fast tracked' cruisers. We laughed as we came down from the viewing area to find a very long queue of cruise passengers who thought they were being fast tracked - they were yet to go up and we had already spent a good two hours exploring! 
A note on mount Floyen, there is much more beyond the viewing platform. Take a look around the troll garden, stroll up to the lake (free canoe experiences from 11am) and have a general ramble around. My children also loved the play areas. Well worth the money to climb the funicular.

reviews.title: Beautiful View!
reviews.text: On a clear day the scenery is beautiful and well worth the trip.  It is an easy walk to the ticket office in town making the trip a good half day outing.

reviews.title: Mount Fløyen
reviews.text: It is a nice ride in the funicular up to Mount Fløyen. It is a quick ride to the top. Once you get to the top there are lots of activities to do, zip lining, troll forest, bike rentals and of course hiking. If you are adventurous, then I would recommend simply hiking to the top. It’s a great way to get some exercise! There are many lovely trails to explore. Lunch and coffee are available at the cafe!

reviews.title: Good Hike
reviews.text: Decided to hike upto Floyen and wasn't disappointed at all...lovely day with great view points on the way...view from the top is breathtaking ... definitely worth a visit.

reviews.title: Pretty view, but long lines and take your coat!
reviews.text: We waited in a long queuing system for almost an hour to take the sky tram up to the view point which was frustrating as it has a wide hallway where people kept cutting the line.  Taking the tram up was cool as I was in the lowest level seat where I could see everything as we went up.  The view at the top is great, probably even better on a clear day (we had low clouds).  I had to buy a sweatshirt because it was very cold up there.  After we took pictures we got in the long line to go back, but it moved a lot faster so only about 15 minutes.  When we got back to the bottom there was no one in line to go up (frustrating!).

reviews.title: Fun on the Funicular
reviews.text: Funiculars are an easy way to get to high places.  The Floibanen is the transportation tool you need for a quick an easy trip up Mount Floyen to take in spectacular views of Bergen.

reviews.title: Touristy
reviews.text:
I walked from MONTANA guest house to Floyen. It's a 6-7 hr hike but so well worth it.
Don't take the mega touristy tram or even stay longer at Floyen unless you have small children who want to play on the playground there. 
It is a total turnoff when you come down after hours of nature pure to be surrounded by tourists snapping fotos over the city of Bergen. Plenty of spots to do that on your hike, undisturbed and without screaming kids or Asians waving their selfie stick in your face. :)

reviews.title: Experience the beautiful view Bergen
reviews.text: If you visit Bergen i would highly recommend a trip to Floyen. It have a beautiful view of the city, the resturant serves beautiful, tasteful dishes and drinks. If you want to take a walk in forest&mountains then Floyen offer several diffrent trips and experiences, short and long trips, good options for anyone from kid families to couples,friends who want tonexperience beautiful Norwegian nature. Trips from 1 hour to a whole day is possible. Buy a map of the territoriy and choose the prefarable trip for you.

reviews.title: When the weather is good
reviews.text: Great to go for a walk on the hill. You just have to take the funicular and on top you can walk for hours. Buy a prepaid ticket online so you can go around the queue.

reviews.title: Free kayaking experience
reviews.text:
Busy but once at the top walk away from the crowds for a peaceful time in a park above the city .
A free kayak is available to spend time on a small lake. Lovely scenery.

reviews.title: Great ride to an excellent outlook
reviews.text:
We enjoyed the ride up the mountain for excellent views.  The funicular was nothing special--just a good ride up.  The views upon arrive were fantastic!

There was a bit of a line, but not as bad as we had heard it could be.  Actually, it's two lines:  one to buy the ticket and then one to board.  We had purchased our ticket as part of the sightseeing bus, so could skip the first line and the wait for the second was about 15 minutes.

At the top, in addition to views, there were food and snack outlets, shops, and trails for hiking the Norwegian woods.  Well worth the trip!

reviews.title: Panoramic views
reviews.text: I have nothing but great things to say about the views at the top of the funicular. I rated it down one notch because the lines to ride up and down were very long.  There were a lot of cruise ship tourists and they really clogged up the lines.

reviews.title: Nice place.
reviews.text:
We took the funicular to Floyen.
This was on a Sunday and the were quite a lot of people waiting there.
At the top of Mount Floyen you get a nice view of Bergen and all the changes done in this nice city in the past , a lot of oil money has been invested here.
Lots of people at the restaurant up there.
Nice place for walking around and for hiking.

reviews.title: Awesome views
reviews.text: My husband and I visited the Funicular as 1 of the hop on, hop off sights. I'm glad we got there early as there are a lot of organised trips, with many, many tourists. We did manage to get on quickly, without waiting too long, it was well worth the trip, amazing views from the top, you can see all the harbour, with the surrounding buildings, right across the Fjord, you can see for miles (it was a clear, sunny day; luckily). Well worth a visit.

reviews.title: So True—Get there Early & Allow Time for Trails
reviews.text: As others have stated, go early! On a cruise & went directly to Mt. Floyen after docking, arriving about 8:45.  Easy walk.  Did not buy tiks in advance waiting to see about weather.  Line going up was <10 mins, but by the time we went down about 11:00, the ascent line was >1 hr. Check out self guided hiking guides on their website.  Not just about the view, although it’s great.  Charming forested trails.  Unique forest playground with trolls.  When descending, get off at mid-way station and walk through lovely neighborhood.  Stop only available on 30 min intervals.  Allow enough time for this attraction.

reviews.title: Definitely worth it
reviews.text: Views were fantastic even on a rainy day like we had (we got soaked). Plenty to do, especially for kids of all ages. Multiple playgrounds even for teenagers. Lake trail was nice. Restrooms were clean and available,  which is NEVER taken for granted anywhere in Norway. Price of entry is the only bargain in the area.

reviews.title: Stunning view of Bergen
reviews.text: Take the cable car to this spot. You can enjoy the stunning view of Bergen. Then you can do some hiking. You can also walk down the hill (3.3k) or take the cable car downhill. If you have Bergen Card, you can have 50% discount of the fee of cable car.

reviews.title: Like a kid
reviews.text:
First we went with funicular on the top of the hill, the vieu is spectacular. Than we went on the numerous playgrounds, we were like kids 😊
Had a realy great time
Then we went down from the hill on foot. Great walk! The day was sunny so it waa realy beautiful experience

reviews.title: Nice city view
reviews.text: It was a rainy and cloudy day, but the view was breathtaking. There’s a souvenir shop up there and the prices are pretty much the same that in Bryggen but the keyrings were more beautiful.

reviews.title: Get there early!!!
reviews.text:
I arrived in Bergen by cruise ship. The day I was in town there were 2 other huge ships docked, so there were a fair few tourists in the area! And everyone wants to ride the funicular and see the beautiful views.
We got there for just after 9 and only queued for around ten minutes. The ride to the top is very quick and once you get up there the views are stunning.
You can then visit the shop or cafe or wander off into the woods. We walked off towards the lake which is beautiful.
We went back down after a couple of hours and the queue was all the way down the road...waiting time looked to be over an hour! So get there as early as possible if there are lots of cruise ships in town.

reviews.title: Up up and away
reviews.text: This is by far the busiest tourist attraction in Bergen.  They handle crowds extremely well and the view from the top of the mountain is excellent. That is why so many people do it.

reviews.title: Great way to see the city!
reviews.text: We arrived in Bergen so late that we missed our prearranged tour, so decided to walk around by ourselves.  We found a Ho-Ho bus that included the funicular ride and went to the top.  Having the tickets in advance saved us some time.  It was a beautiful, sunny day, so we had lots of company, but the line moved fairly quickly.  The view at the top is as beautiful as everyone says.  There's a restaurant with a lovely patio, a cafe, playground for the kids.  There is also a flock of goats wearing GPS collars to keep them where they belong.

reviews.title: Nice ride ... may be crowded
reviews.text: riding this is a core element of any trip to Bergen is it not?  It looked very crowded when we walked up but we boarded (a very crowded car) within 15 minutes.  Consider going early, or late, to lessen crowds.

reviews.title: Spectacular view
reviews.text: If you're lucky enough to get clear weather this trip is a must.  Superb panorama and watch out for the hi-tech goats grazing nearby.

reviews.title: We had so so much fun!
reviews.text:
The funicular it’s very nice, the view in the top it’s spectacular. 
All the process to join in is very smooth and you can but the tickets on line to make your queue shorter. 
On the top there are few parks for children, very little or grown up. 
We decided to  walk back to the city center because it’s just is 3km, not very steep, very easy. We did it twice.

reviews.title: A must-do, must-see attraction
reviews.text:
When the sun is shining in Bergen (a rarity, we’re told, so we count ourselves lucky), a visit to Mount Floyen is not to be missed. 
The funicular trip to the top is not long but impressive all the same. Getting on may take a while, but it will be worth it. The cost is comparatively reasonable (once one gets used to the high cost of everything in Scandinavia).
The attractions at the top are mostly what one would expect – cafes, ice creameries, souvenir shops – except for perhaps the goat house. Don’t ask. 
The views from the several vantage points are, also as one would expect, spectacular.
We would recommend a one-way ticket, as the walk down is not at all arduous, and quite simply beautiful; through peaceful, lightly forested countryside, where you will unexpectedly find sub-tropical plants in abundance, lichen-covered rocks in gorgeous colours and patterns, babbling brooks (yes, they do actually babble) and birdlife galore – more heard than seen. There are also some more lookout points to enjoy on the way, and towards the bottom, back streets and lanes to explore.
Just do it.

reviews.title: Spectacular city view & a cool inclined ropeway train experinece
reviews.text: Like all other places in Fjords - this place also offer spectacular views from a mountain top. Would recommend to buy tickets in advance to skip the queue. Up there is way cooler - hence adequate warm clothing is recommended especially to beat the wind. There is a 45 min trek back also in case you want to skip the long ropeway queue on way back. Towards afternoon & early evening the queues to return back become really long with waiting time of more than 60 minutes.

reviews.title: Good fun
reviews.text:
Nice to get above the city and enjoy the view. The park, walks and playgrounds are all good fun along with some goats

The train is fun especially when you do the usual sitting at the front/back. Very handy if you have small children or mobility issues. 

But I would recommend walking in one direction, I like walking so there is that and I like walking through the towns and cities I visit. Only 30-45 min and there is plenty of walking to be had at the top with woodland, lakes, streams etc. Range of walks/runs from a short circle around the station to slightly more adventurous ones to other nearby hills

reviews.title: Great views.
reviews.text: Beat the queues and arrive before 10:00 am. The trip takes around 6 minutes and has lovely views on the way. Reaching the summit, there are viewpoints overlooking Bergen and the Fjords. There is the usual Restaurant and Souvenier shop for the visitors. Bought the tickets on line before we went on holiday so that we did not have to queue. By the time we came down and through the exit, the queue for tickets was half way down the street

reviews.title: Wonderful views!
reviews.text: Lines can be long for the funicular but the view at the top is worth it.  Also take the short walk through the forest to the lake (follow signage).  Lovely scenery.

reviews.title: Must do this
reviews.text: Buy a one way ticket or walk both ways!  We did not buy our tickets in advance but only had about a 10-15 minute wait - there was free WiFi so we just browsed about walks we could do at the top while we waited.  Once we bought our tickets, there was another short wait (about 5 minutes) to board the funicular and then the quick ride to the top.  The view from above is spectacular and worth it just for that but there is so much more - buy yourself a cinnamon roll and coffee (or hot chocolate) and people watch - go for a hike or just a walk to one of the nearby lakes (easy walking on gravel paths or even paved in some cases). Go for a (free) canoe paddle on the nearest lake (only between noon and 3pm in the summer).  And then, walk down via one of the two or three paths - again paved so you can take a pram/bike/wheelchair as well.  We saw plenty of people walking up (and some running) as well.  On a beautiful day, why not?

reviews.title: Morning visit .... very pretty
reviews.text: We took the little train up but walked beck down after our 2 hours hiking and our picnic.  Beautiful panoramic view of Bergen.  Line fir train was only 20 minutes and the walk down is very pretty.

reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.text: Don’t miss this spectacular view of Bergen.   There are all kinds of concessions at the top if you like that kind of thing. But they don’t distract from the spectacular views. The funicular to the top is fun and makes it easy.

reviews.title: Worth it even if it means standing in line for 1 hour
reviews.text: We came quite early in the morning of this very sunny day and decided to take the funicular up Mount Floyen. The line started way down the street and in all it took us 1 hour to finally make it to the funicular. The ride was a short 5-6 mins. The view on such a perfect day was amazing. We loved see the Cashmere goats.

reviews.title: Nice view of  City
reviews.text: We stayed in Radisson Blu and Floyen is just away from hotel. We decided to hike the mount Floyen. Hiking is easy and provides nice view of city. It took around 1.5 hour as we were going along with our 2 and half year old kid. Way is nice and easy to climb. I urge to hike this mountain to get best views of city and given it is easy to hike.

reviews.title: Great views! Hike to the top, skip the train!
reviews.text: We were so lucky that the sun was out and stayed out during our hike up the mountain Floyen. It made all the difference! The views were spectacular at every turn of the path. It was a great workout out, as the elevation is some 300 meters. This is a very easy walk, and a most enjoyable one. Not to be missed, especially when the weather is good!

reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.text: Definitely worth the trip up as it's a beautiful view below.  We were silly as we didn't realize the sun didn't set till 11:30pm!  So make sure you adjust your timing based on when you want to take pictures.

reviews.title: Breathtaking view
reviews.text:
There are no words to describe the breathtaking view from the terrace of the funicular terminus on Mount Floyen.
A great view of the city of Bergen and all the surrounding fjords.
The return ticket costs 95 NOK and you can buy it from the automatic machine at the Tourist Office if you want to skip the queue at the funicular ticket office.
There is however a queue to get onboard, but it is fast.
The trip takes just 7 minutes with some intermediate stops.
I advise to get off at the final stop to enjoy the best view.

reviews.title: Long lines moved quickly
reviews.text: So you wait at the entrance to get tickets and then you wait in a shorter line to get on the vehicle.  Free WiFi so it goes really quickly.  The car has very few seats but it is a short and very smooth ride.  Stand facing backwards to get a great view.  At the top is about 30 minutes of picture taking of the breathtaking view unless you have children to play on the playground with the Troll.  The is a case, gift shop and a small restaurant.  It was hot and everyone was getting Ice Cream with the traditional Norwegian toppings. A very short ride to get back down this time face forward.

reviews.title: Beautiful View
reviews.text: It gets really crowded when the tourists (mostly from the cruise ships I believe) arrive.  But you can take the tram after the crowd subside.  It's a fast ride up and there's a choice to buy a one way ticket and hike back.  It's a beautiful view of Bergen!  Worth seeing.  There are also a restaurant and gift shop.

reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.text: It's pretty amazing how organized and quickly they are able to get passengers on and off the Floibanen.  The views on the Mount did not disappoint.  The resident goats were hilarious!  It was too hot to walk to the mount ; otherwise I would probably buy a one-way ticket up then walk back down so I could check out the residential homes along the street.  There were 3 choices of food vendors for snacks .  The hiking trails go on forever.  Great playground for the kids along with a zipline.  It is a magical place.

reviews.title: A must to do and the best view of Bergen!
reviews.text:
This is a great experience!
Ride up and spend time looking over the great view of Bergen.
When returning back rither walk along the trail down, or go on the departure that stops at Fjellveien.
From there it is a nice walk along narrow and winding streets with cobblestones back down to Bergen.Old white houses ehere people live.

reviews.title: Cruise ship tour group.
reviews.text: The visit was the end of a fantastic tour of Bergen. The stations are clean and tidy and well organised. With minimal waiting times. The site at the summit is well presented and great views of Bergen.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: What a view!  You want to see Bergen than this is a must!  You can pinpoint places below where you have been - the fish market, Bryggen, museum, etc.  Was well worth the money!

reviews.title: Great views over the city
reviews.text: Love a good funicular railway. But your tickets online in advance so that you don’t have to queue. Great views and good walks at the top as well as what seems a nice cafe/restaurant - we only had coffee. Injury meant we didn’t walk very far at the top but seems good for trails. Look out for the friendly goats.

reviews.title: Now I know why this is the #1 attraction in Bergen
reviews.text: Bergen is a pleasant, clean, fun city to visit with good shopping, good food and beautiful scenery, but until we took the funicular high above the city, we had missed out on one of the best experiences Bergen has to offer.  Round trip tickets cost $11 - 12 USD.  The cars run back and forth continuously so the lines seem to move along at a good pace.... to be fair, we arrived to find no line at all.  We also walked right on to our return trip.  The views at the top are spectacular, but weather dependent.  Lots of photo opportunities.  Also at the top are some shopping and dining venues.  For the outdoorsy types there is hiking and biking... as well as playgrounds for the kids.  If you are into trolls, there are plenty of them too.  Remember, with the change in elevation comes temperature change, so prepare accordingly.  This attraction is highly recommended by our group of four highly experienced travelers.

reviews.title: Nice view of the city, not much else
reviews.text: The ride is nice but short, and eventually you arrive the a view point overlooking the city. When the weather is nice you can see all around. But, if you travel around Norway, you will see similar views...

reviews.title: Awesome views, worth every penny
reviews.text: We waited a day for the cloud to clear and then one train so we could get the front seat for brilliant photographs. It was well worth every penny for the view over Bergen; we used the Bergen card for 50% off and a free return trip. Lots for the kids to do at the top, a restaurant, cafes and a snack booth.  There were unfortunately lots of wasps buzzing around so be careful if you have something to eat.

reviews.title: Beautiful once at top 😁
reviews.text: We purchased tickets online before our cruise docked here! Please do this!! We got to the funicular at 9.30 bear in mind 3 cruise ships were in this day! We just walked past the queue and straight to the line for the funicular... We timed it and goes out every 7 or so minutes and it holds 100 people. We loved the ride up and down and wished we’d walked down. The views up top are stunning and go off into the lanes and see we’re you end up.. We walked to a beautiful lake but think there’s more than 1 here.. Highly recommend 😁

reviews.title: Great views and playground
reviews.text: Definitely worth the trip. Get pre paid tickets to avoid the queue for those buying tickets. Allow plenty of time as there's lots to do up there. Our little boy loved the kids playground so we didn't venture to the other activities but heard good things about them from others.

reviews.title: Didn't know what to really expect - and we were pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: The funicular itself is really just a means of transportation up to Floyen. We purchased round trip but in hind sight me have have enjoyed the hike back down. Floyen is very picturesque and has many fun trails that allow you to escape the crowds and feel like you are one with nature. Don't miss this area!!!!

reviews.title: A fantastic view of Bergen
reviews.text:
The funicular tickets were included in our tour and we initially a bit hesitant to take advantage of them because the weather was pretty horrible - cloudy and rainy - on the only day we could use them, but we were very glad we did!

We did a walking tour of Bergen in the morning and were told by our guide, that if we were interested in going up to the top of Mount Fløyen, we should wait until the afternoon for two reasons: firstly, the hoards of people waiting in the morning would have gone back to their respective cruise ships and so there would be far less queuing, and secondly that the weather was forecast to improve after lunch.

We ended up going around 4pm and there were very few people in the ticket queue, but for us there was no queue as we had already been issued with our tickets.

The journey to the top is quite quick and very steep so even from the funicular it is possible to get an impressive view of Bergen getting smaller and smaller in the distance.

Once at the top, the views were amazing once the weather had cleared up - the whole city can be seen below to give an idea of its size (small) and yet detailed enough to be able to spot individual landmarks such as a church near our hotel at the opposite end of the city as well as the main road/pedestrianised shopping street which cuts straight through Bergen from the railway almost to where we were staying.

There is also a café, a gift shop and a playground at the top. Bicycle hire is also available next to the Troll Forest, so it would be quite easy to spend most of the day there if you had the time and good weather.

I think the tickets cost about €10 if bought from the ticket office, and I think it will be one of the best €10 you can spend in Bergen!

reviews.title: If you do one thing in Bergen do this
reviews.text: You can just go to the end of the ride and enjoy the views. Children can enjoy the zip wire. Canoe on the lake. Hike around the mountain

reviews.title: Outstanding views
reviews.text:
If you visit Bergen you MUST do the funicular trip up the mountain. 
Apart from the views there are goats and pleasant walks.

reviews.title: Flaming Fabulous Floyen Funicular
reviews.text: The lines were long, but moved very quickly. For someone who HATES Gondolas or Funiculars, this one was OK! Wonderful views from the top; eateries (which we didn’t do); a beautiful small lake, which we walked around; then we chose to take one of the 2 walks back to the town. An easy walk, but lovely to see yet a different part of Bergen

reviews.title: Great panorama from mount Floyen
reviews.text:
We had great weather and we went up to Mount Floyen . The funicular was smooth and fast. 
The panoramic views of Bergen from the top was special. 
The weather was good today. Cool and sunny. 
Great views. 
The goats were friendly

reviews.title: View of Bergen from Mt. Floyen
reviews.text: The whole trip took about two and half hours. The weather was hot about 30 degrees celsius and very hot in comparison to what one can expect in Bergen. Going up and down takes about 30-40 minutes. Once you are up in the mount, the view is gorgeous and you can have a beautiful view of Bergen centre and around. There is a good restaurant and bar to cater to your taste buds. There are ice cream bars outside. The few tamed mountain goats add to the experience. There are good trekking paths of different lengths going out in different directions

reviews.title: Not too many people
reviews.text:
There are quite a few warnings about this place and the queue to get a ride. The wait this Thursday in mid-August was not much at all. About 15 minutes for the ride up. The car takes around 80-90 persons per tour and the ride takes 5-6 minutes. On the top there are one restaurant, one café, some souvenir shops and a really great view of Bergen.
Instead of taking the track car down again try the 45-minutes walk and enjoy a spectacular one of a kind forrest.

reviews.title: Train up / walk down
reviews.text:
We rode up by train and walked down. The view from the top is a must see with views all over Bergen.  
The walk down is lovely and takes approx 45 minutes ending with a winding walk through the pretty wooden fronted houses on the lower levels.

reviews.title: A great way to see all of Bergen
reviews.text: This is an easy way to get to the top of the mountain and see all of Bergen. The line is often long but it moves quickly. We enjoyed the trip up and all of the photo opportunities but didn't do anything else at the summit. We wanted to see the goats but they weren't grazing that day.

reviews.title: Sensational views and lots to do!
reviews.text:
Best views of the city for sure! The funicular is kind of hectic and can have extremely long lines so I would recommend getting tickets ahead of time. We did the one way up (50 kr) instead of the round trip (95 kr) which was a good move. The funicular was jammed pack with about 80 people and there is very little room. The trip is roughly 6 minutes but was so glad to finally get out of the car. On the way down, it was a 2.5 km walk down a pretty steep but very wide and paved path. Pretty easy for anyone’s standards. 

The views up top are sensational!! You’ll have to navigate a lot of other tourists depending on when you go but still should be fine. Biggest wait will be in the queue (line) to get the tickets and tram up.

Lots of cafes, hikes, shops, playgrounds and bathrooms up top. Also cool to see the goats who just chill right on the path. Would be suitable for all ages and worth the trip!

reviews.title: Good hike up the hill
reviews.text: A long hike up the hill but well worth it for the views. Nice cafes at the top and gift shops. Best to take the furnicular if you are not very fit.

reviews.title: Quite a view
reviews.text: It worths the waiting time. Lines are long and some tourists pretend they don’t see the line and just walk in. The place lacks supervision and tourists end up having discussions among themselves when the situation becomes intolerable. The view from the top worths everything.

reviews.title: Mountain Bike Experience
reviews.text:
Bergen's popular Fløibanen funicular climbs 1000 feet to the top of Mount Fløyen, which is the starting point of many hiking trails.
To save our knees, we decided for renting hard-tailed mountain bikes. Well, we ended up (nearly) breaking our knees from our maiden mountain bike ride, but that's really rewarding. The mountain bike experience with beautiful hillsides and forest, little lakes and great views of Bergen, is good reason for taking selfie - not during the bumpy ride, of course. 
We aren't experts and it's the first time our family (including our eight-year-old daughter) to try the hard-tailed mountain bikes. We were overtaken by loads of cyclists during our mountain bike ride. We realised then that we should simply sit down and relax. No rush. There are unbeatable views (for a brake) and kiosks (for a break). Why hurry?

reviews.title: The mountain is very nice. The funicular sucks.
reviews.text: Great view over Bergen from the mountain. Lots of very nice activities. I would skip the funicular if possible. It is very expensive for a short trip, lines are very, very long sometimes. The crew tries to pack as many people as possible as densely as possible in the station building (which is beyond stupid for fire safety and similar). There are a lot of rude people that try to push ahead in the line since the seats in the cars are limited and the waiting time is long. I would try to save time and money and just walk up instead.

name: DMG GALLERY
ranking_subcategory: #38 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #38 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #38 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: David Matej Goljat / DMG GALLERY - local painter and designer

reviews.title: Unique souvenir
reviews.text: We really liked this place. We bought a souvenir to remind us the wonderful holiday we had in Scandinavia. The owner of this shop was really nice. We recommend this place to everyone who wants to buy a unique souvenir!

reviews.title: What a great place! A must-see!
reviews.text:
This is one really high quality art gallery in the old part of Bergen. The owner/artist is really nice and friendly, explaining his art. The whole place feels very comfy and welcoming. Stop by and have a chat with him. You won't regret it. After you buy one piece from him, you'll come back for many more.

I would highly recommend this place!

reviews.title: Lovely gallery tucked away in historic Bryggen.
reviews.text:
This is a delightful little gallery in historic Bryggen, tucked away in a corner waiting for you to discover it. The talented artist, David Matej Goljat, is warm and friendly, his art is colorful with unique character and texture.  We were delighted to return home with one of his special pieces, a little bit of old Bryggen, for ourselves and several small images for gifts.  Take the time to find this wonderful little gallery. You won't be disappointed.
Cheri

name: The Norwegian Knitting Industry Museum
ranking_subcategory: #39 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #39 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #39 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: Salhus Tricotagefabrik was founded in 1859, as one of the first knitwear factories in Norway. Trikotasje means knitted fabric. Join one of our guides for a tour of the knitwear factory from 1859. Take in the smells that still linger at the factory premises after many years of hard work and knitwear production. Enjoy our home-baked goods in the café, or look for a gift in our museum shop.

reviews.title: Lovely museum
reviews.text:
I had heard a lot about this museum through the Bergen strikkefestival Instagram, and I was not disappointed. After the two buses out of town to get there we arrived a bit late for the tour but they let us in and we caught up with it. The tour was in Norwegian (which I understand) and the machines were great to see! My partner who is not a knitter, found the industrial history of the place super interesting. I feel that it does help a little to have some knowledge about how yarn is made before coming to the museum and It may be an idea to show how the process was done by hand before these machines, as that was one of my biggest take aways. 

I noticed some other reviews commenting on the price of the yarn in the shop. I felt that it was actually very reasonable for small batch, non-masproduced yarns. I do wish that they sold bigger skeins or more cones! 

We missed the bus on the way back, so got to enjoy the cafe for an hour. There are many books to look at, as well as cakes and drinks. I enquired about vegan snack options and was told they had vegan berry ice cream. 

All in all a great visit and I look forward to coming back during the strikkefestival!

name: Pepperkakebyen - The Worlds largest Gingerbread Town
ranking_subcategory: #34 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #34 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #34 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: The world's biggest gingerbread city. Miniature houses, trains, cars and ships made from real gingerbread. Schools and kindergartens contribute every year in making a miniature version of Bergen - all in gingerbread-cookies! Miniature houses, trains, cars and ships made from real gingerbread. Schools and kindergartens contribute every year in making a miniature version of Bergen - all in gingerbread-cookies! This is one of the most breath-taking traditions we have got in Bergen. This is the World's largest Gingerbread town!

reviews.title: Creative work by the kids!
reviews.text: A very interesting work of art to showcase the city of Bergen using Gingerbread. Cool stuff! It made me hungry after coming here....haha.

reviews.title: Things to do
reviews.text: Very cute place to visit especially with kids. It has a mini recreation of Bergen City showing models of common local scenery made by kids from gingerbread. Pricy for adults. Nor a muat do.

reviews.title: Gingerbread Xmas fairyland!
reviews.text: This was such fun--a gingerbread replica of Bergen made by the students of the schools in Bergen. The lighting and layout was great .....the details amazing. We loved watching the way the children responded to it and enjoyed it.  We could also see how proud they are of their city....what a fun exercise for the students at Xmas time.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: We busted the amazing and very large Gingerbread town in Bergen last night. Just amazing and so beautifully displayed

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.text:
Such friendly staff and really BEAUTIFUL ginger bread town 
Can definitely spend half an hour there and the smell of the ginger bread is mouth watering 
Extremely talented putting together of this little town

reviews.title: A wonderus sight!
reviews.text: Wasn't quite sure what to expect when we had some time to fill, but was more that a little amazed at how this collection of gingerbread structures comes together in this hall to create a truly magical experience.  I found the variety from gingerbread animals, to hot air balloons, to multistory gingerbread houses amazing.  The fact that these are not done by professionals is what makes it so unique and charming.  Truly it is the whole (not the individual pieces) that make this come together so well.  I was happy to spend my 100 NOK each to see this.

reviews.title: Ginger'bad' town..
reviews.text:
Sure, seeing a gingerbread village is unique and if one is around the corner anyway, 'why not' go there. However one thing is important to understand. This is not a exhibition produced by a team of experts. Everything in this exhibition is made by young kids. In school, or with their parents. It is then all placed together in a hall. Of course adult create some mountains and an electric train etc, but the result is a 'town' that is very inconsistent and of varying quality.

The whole thing is 'cute', and one can really not spend more than 30 minutes there.

The staff is super friendly and if you are travelling with kids yourself, there is a play area inside as well so this may be a good place to go.

If you are on a budget I would recommend you safe yourself the 100 NOK entrance fee.

I was told the 'town' is build every year since 27 years and always starts around the 20th of November and always ends on the 31st of December. And no, the houses are not eaten afterwards.

reviews.title: Something out of the ordinary!
reviews.text: This is definitely something you will not regret visiting simply because it is so rare. The “world” of gingerbread houses might  feel magical and help the christmas spirit. Mainly meant for children, but could be enjoyed by adults as well.

name: University Museum of Bergen - The Cultural History Collections
ranking_subcategory: #22 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #22 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #22 of 110 things to do in Bergen
address: Haakon Sheteligs Plass 10 Museplass 3, Bergen 5007 Norway

reviews.title: impressive
reviews.text:
Dear readers,
this is a very nice area to walk around and to take lots of pictures.
it is very interesting with lots of souvenirs to purchase.

reviews.title: Typicaly old buildings
reviews.text: This typicaly old buildings are located in the harbour of Bergen. This is a museum and there are boutiques.

reviews.title: Historical and cultural section open
reviews.text: If you are interested in stave churches and church art generally this is a must. Also interesting rune stones, sections on national dress and the theatre in Bergen

reviews.title: Different Stories of Artefacts from the Past
reviews.text:
In the University Museum of Bergen are located several exhibitions concerning prehistory and history of Western Norway (Vestlandet). Downstairs are presented nice exhibitions dedicated to the Viking Age and Stone Age. At exhibition related to Viking period is shown the history of different artefacts (e.g. jewellery, weaponry) which were robbed on 14th August 2017 and retrieved in October 2017. This fascinating exhibition presents also basic problems connected with the conservation of various archaeological finds. Stone Age exhibition presents the various finds dated to this period which were discovered in Norway. 

At other exhibitions in the University Museum of Bergen are presented in an interesting way medieval art (e.g. beautifully decorated portals), the art of western Norway and history of theatre. 

In my opinion, during the visit to the University Museum of Bergen, we can not only see nice exhibited finds but also learn a lots of interesting facts about prehistory and history of Western Norway. Totally worth visiting!

reviews.title: Early closing time
reviews.text:
We got here at 14:15 and were informed they closed at 15:00. So we raced through the many floors and got to see quite  few of the exhibitions. I would have appreciated more time to see more of the upper levels but I guess I will just have to come back. I would recommend at least two hours here to see everything. We really enjoyed our visit and only lament that we counted see it all or at a leisurely pace!

A must see museum while in Bergen!

reviews.title: Museum of Cultural History
reviews.text: An overlooked museum.  With the Hanseatic Museum closed until 2021 we wanted a Museum on Bergen History.  Though small it went into the viking history, early church history and folk history.  Beautiful gardens surround the museum with nice views of the City and harbor.

reviews.title: great little museum
reviews.text: This is an excellent small museum. They have an extensive collection of items from old stave churches that were torn down. It was smart to collect all of those pieces. Admission cost was reasonable. They also have some Egyptian items including a couple of mummies. And when I was there they had an exhibit of items from "the colonies" mostly African but also some Asian items. Fascinating photos and film from the early part of the 20th century.

reviews.title: Superb! Great Museum!
reviews.text:
We had the "Bergen Card" which allows free access to probably 20+ museums. After some reviews, we decided on the University Museum of Cultural History. So glad we did! The Museum encompasses a large area. The history of Norway, Cultural changes and Exhibits are fascinating. There are a variety of Exhibits which kept us looking forward to what we would discover next. 

After leaving the Museum, we wandered around the botanical gardens which are adjacent. The gardens were beautiful, the area was quiet & peaceful. We then stopped at "Godt Brod" restaurant which is on the 2nd floor of a University Bldg with a deck looking out over the gardens. Great place to rest and reflect on the day.

reviews.title: herbarium
reviews.text: So we went to see the gardens and the famous herbarium they recently have been cataloguing.  Great spot for a lovely walk and a wonderful herbarium most of which is inaccessible and will take orders of exhibits to be viewed for research.  Got more than we bargained for only not what we thought we would see.

name: Bergen Maritime Museum

photo.caption: The museum seen from the Møhlenpris buss stop

ranking_subcategory: #23 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #23 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #23 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: The Bergen Maritime Museum (Bergens Sjofartsmuseum) was founded in 1921 and moved into award-winning museum in 1962. The museum building is situated 100 metres from the red church (Johanneskirken) up the steps from Torgallmenningen at Nygardshoyden (nearest bus stop: Mohlenpris) and among the University campus.
