reviews.text: Such a fun self-guided tour through the labyrinth of different rooms and floors, and a great insight into many facets of Bergen history. Worth it.

reviews.title: The location and architecture gives the feel of post Viking middle ages Bergen.
reviews.text: This area and building is  interesting to visit and provides an awareness of the significance Bergen has played in the history of Scandinavia and the world.

reviews.title: A big hall and a decorated table
reviews.text: Nice grounds around this place, but not much to see. A lot more to do in Bergen besides this unless you have lots of time.

reviews.title: Huge hall of former king
reviews.text: It was devastated by a blast in 1944 if I am not mistaken, reconstructed now which is obvious, but you can easily imagine how huge it was (and still is) when it was built. Below it is also amazingly large area with lot of tables and chairs, presumably for some large events involving food and drinks (but not offered on a daily basis).

reviews.title: Bergen City Tour
reviews.text: This is worth a short visit. The hall is named after its first builder King Hakon Hakonsson. My visit included a tour guide who gave us a short history of the hall including the changes it went through over the years.

reviews.title: Huge banqueting hall.
reviews.text: A lot of it is big rooms with chairs but the last room was worth it a huge banqueting room with large window

reviews.title: Not Much to See
reviews.text: This would be a pleasant venue for a special event, but there is very little to see, for which you will pay $10-$20, depending on your age or if you have already paid for another Bergen museum. Save your $$$.

reviews.title: Former royal hall
reviews.text: Make sure you do the tour. They will explain you the history of the hall and some stories around it.

reviews.title: o.k.
reviews.text: Same as the Rosenkrantz tower o.k. if you have extra time otherwise skip it.Not as many stairs or as steep as the tower.

reviews.title: Almost empty hall, history more interesting
reviews.text: Fairly pricey to see one large hall where only sidewalls remain from a few centuries ago, so not medieval.  Got to listen in to guide which made it more interesting.

reviews.title: A historic hall
reviews.text: Visited the fortress and decided to take a tour through Haakon’s Hall. Informative tour and knowledgeable guide who talked us through the history of the former capital’s fortress and main hall which was used for banquets and other meetings. It is close by the fish market and other sights so well recommended.

reviews.title: The picture were so inviting
reviews.text: Had to see this Hall, partly for the history of political meetings and partly for the romantic ideas of huge Renaissance banquets.  But the pictures I thought left so much out actually were quite accurate and there isn't much left to see, but the building, nice building some nice chairs, and plaques to read.  Nice grounds.

name: Lille Lungegaardsvannet
ranking_subcategory: #17 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #17 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #17 of 110 things to do in Bergen

offer_list.title: Bergen actually, city tour

reviews.title: Beautiful park
reviews.text: It is a few minutes walk from the Byparken light rail station. There is a statue of Edvard Greig here too. The gazebo is so beautiful. The views of Bergen from the pond are stunning. Great place for a picnic.

reviews.title: VERY NICE SETTING
reviews.text: This little water gem is octagonal in shape. A fountain spouts from its middle. Several museums dot its southern side. There are park benches should you just wish to watch the world go by. It is an easy walk from the wharf area.

reviews.title: Pictures don't do this justice
reviews.text: Truly lovely park surrounding the lake. Chock full of beautiful flowers and hosting some rather interesting sculpture.

reviews.title: Nice park gardens
reviews.text: Behind the waterfront from the fish market and up a few blocks is this open plaza and garden area that also boasts some of the best architecture in town.

reviews.title: Lovely lake
reviews.text: Excellent lake with lots of nice seating areas to enjoy the sun and have a picnic. Also some nice views of the Bergen hills in the background. Near to here is the great little park Byparken.

reviews.title: City Lake
reviews.text: This is a big lake with the fountain in the middle. If you need a rest this is rather good place. Many benches around the lake and carpets of natural flowers

reviews.title: Nice little place to walk
reviews.text: Pretty place to walk around, a bit out from the port area, plenty of seating areas to relax and worth finding if you want peace and quiet

reviews.title: Lovely small lake in the city
reviews.text: While it has the size of a large pond, Lille Lungegårdsvannet is actually a small lake.  It was once much large but was gradually made smaller with landfill until reaching its current 5 acre size. It’s quite unique and pleasant to have a lake in the middle of town. It’s located between the Bergen train station at one end and Byparken at the other. Beautifully decorated with yellow tulips during our visit. Nice place for a leisurely stroll on the path that circles the lake or taking a break on one of the many benches.

reviews.title: The city lake
reviews.text: In the middle of the city there are many lakes that can be seen from the mountains. Lille Langegard is the biggest of them

reviews.title: Lovely lake to walk around
reviews.text:
Monday 3rd September we were in the city of Bergen, this was the first port of call of our cruise of the Norwegian Fjords on board Celebrity Silhouette.

Lille Lungegardsvann is a 5 acre small lake, with its fountain, it is situated in the centre of Bergen. The lake is surrounded by Byparken, the City Park (reviewed separately).

When we visited the sun was shining and it was wonderful walking around the lake, there were loads of colourful flowers around as well as many ducks.

There are lots of seats around, to sit relax and enjoy this lovely peaceful place.

Earlier in the day we travelled on the Floibanen funicular to the top of Mount Floyen where we saw amazing views of Bergen inculding the City Park, Byparken, where this lake and fountain are situated and were clearly visible from above.

Kode Art Gallery ,was along side the Park, there was an Edward Munch exhibition running in the Gallery when we in

reviews.title: Great place to relax in the city
reviews.text:
Date of Visit:  Friday, Aug 31, 2018
We saw this giant fountain off in the distance when we were on a hop on Hop off bus, and decided we needed to check out this area later on. 
We came for a visit and it was a beautiful park, with a ‘pond’ in the middle that has a very large fountain. 
This is a great place to relax, unwind, have lunch in the park, etc. 
There were many locals doing just that while we were there. 
There are beautiful grounds surrounding the ‘lake’ and amazing views of the town & mountains. 

This is a little slice of heaven in the middle of the city that already is pretty stunning. 

Take a break and visit this park. It is free & beautiful.

reviews.title: Nice little park
reviews.text: This is a nice little pond in the city center. Close by are the KODE museums. You can walk around the lake in a short time.

reviews.title: Beautiful lake right in the middle of town
reviews.text: Lovely lake right in the heart of town so lovely to walk around and enjoy the sites of Bergen very well kept park.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Park With, Gardens, Beautiful Building, Water feature & A Great Pace To relax
reviews.text: What a spectacular spot to just hangout, taken in the sights and relax an watch the world pass in front of you. My wife and I were doing our self guided tour when we stumbled upon this beautiful area of Bergen. The colors of the flowers are lovely, the scenery is awesome and the calm of the area is wonderful

name: Sailor's Monument
ranking_subcategory: #26 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #26 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #26 of 110 things to do in Bergen

offer_list.title: Bergen Like a Local: Customized Private Tour

reviews.title: HOMAGE TO SAILORS
reviews.text: The monument is a bit southeast of the Bergen Tourist Information office. Bergen is an important naval center, carrying on the significant role of the water in the city's history and life.

reviews.title: Worth a Visit
reviews.text: Monument celebrates Bergen's past and those who lived and worked in the sea. Represents all classes and each side represents a century,

reviews.title: Can’t miss it.
reviews.text: Large monument on the main street in Bergen. Took a few pics of it for the album. Popular with dogs and kids:)) Very representative of Bergen as a sea port.

reviews.title: Nice monument honoring the many sailors.
reviews.text: This was a nice monument honoring the many sailors as would be expected from fishing area. tasteful.

reviews.title: Fascinating monument
reviews.text: This monument is also known as the seafarers’ monument and the seamen’s monument, all different translations of the Norwegian “Sjøfartsmonumentet”. It is centrally located on Torgallmenningen, the wide pedestrian street in central Bergen. It is interesting to stop and look closely at the four sides. Each side represents a different age of sailing (starting with the Vikings and ending in the 10th century), with a picture above and three seafarers of the age below.

reviews.title: Great stories about the monument
reviews.text: The monument has 4 sides up top and individual sailors on the bottom, each with its own stories. There is one which has a Viking ship navigating across the seas and you see how the lookout(for other ships,storms) is at the head of the ship. You can see others - captain,etc.

reviews.title: Interesting Monument
reviews.text: Right in the middle of the main shopping Mall, this is a very large and extremely impressive monument.

reviews.title: Interesting Statue
reviews.text: A free attraction in the shopping square. Check the moustache of one of the sailors!, interesting to say the least.

reviews.title: Main walking street
reviews.text: The Seamen's Monument (Norwegian: Sjømannsmonumentet) was placed in honor of Norwegian sailors from Viking times to the 20th century. It is located in Bergen city centre. It was designed by Dyre Vaa in 1939 - 45 and unveiled in 1950.

reviews.title: An interesting monument
reviews.text: This monument is well worth a look as it is dedicated to sailors and depicts the progression of sailors across time

reviews.title: Bang in the city center!!
reviews.text: Its a naval monument dedicated to sailors and has some interesting sculptures around world war 2. Its located bang in the city centre so very easy to spot.

reviews.title: Neat sculpture
reviews.text: Very nice installation highlighting the evolution of the Norwegian seaman. Worth a glance, and on a pleasant plaza.

reviews.title: A beautiful monument to the maritime heritage of Bergen.
reviews.text: Located in the city center/square this is a pleasant place to sit and watch people. The monument is well done. It is hard to believe that in WWII this area was lined with tank b locks and full of Nazi troops--perhaps that was the most humbling/eye opening  thing to take away from the visit.

reviews.title: Monument in very city center
reviews.text: Sea and sailors are linked to Norway and probably within every Norwegians DNA. Thus no wonder central monument of Bergen is this one, with many stories and characters depicting this link with the sea.

reviews.title: Unpleasent lunch
reviews.text: It's a decent monument, but it is full of birds and one of them pooped on my brand new jacket. Would not recommend to eat your snack here.

reviews.title: Impressive monument /fountain in heart of Bergen
reviews.text:
Monday 3rd September we were out and about exploring and sightseeing in Bergen and this monument was one of the attractions that we visited.

The Sailor's Monument (Sjømannsmonumentet) is in honor of Norwegian sailors from Viking times to modern days.

The statue with its infinity pool and fountain, is situated in the center of Torgallmenningen, the main square in Bergen, and it is pedestrianised around it.

Each side of the square-shaped monument represents a different age of sailing, with a total of 12 statues and four reliefs, equally positioned on each of the sides.

It only takes a few minutes to walk around, it is definitely worth a look at.

reviews.title: Monument in the main square of Bergen
reviews.text: This is a monument in the main square of Bergen. Around the square, there are many shopping possibilities.

reviews.title: BERGEN IS VERY NICE
reviews.text: We enjoyed being in Bergen a nice city with magnificent places. You need to take cruse and see the beautiful places

reviews.title: Right In The Middle Of Bergen Harbor Area
reviews.text: The statue is very large and right in the middle of a lovely shopping area where you can't miss it.We were lucky the day we were there because the Bergen philharmonic was practicing for a concert that evening and it was fabulous standing next to the statue and listening to the music.

reviews.title: Beautiful monument for lost sailor’s
reviews.text: When a city is built on sailor’s it is only fitting they would have a special memorial for the fallen. It is very nicely done in a beautiful place right off the water. Up the street is the National theatre and the Cathedral.

reviews.title: Kinda cool
reviews.text: Happened upon it while on a walk through town.  Nice recognition to all sailors from Bergen's past.  Like the integration of water into the monument.  There are lots of statues many a surprise as you walk around the town.

reviews.title: Sailor's Monument, Bergen, Norway
reviews.text:
To be honest, I had no idea what it was until I started looking for places in Norway to review that we had recently visited, only to discover this monument, which I took some photos of was the Sailor's Monument!

It is quite impressive, with several sailors carved into all four of its sides, and is on a raised plinth containing water in the middle of a pedestrianised shopping street on the way into the centre of Bergen. From this vantage point you can get great views of the city, the houses going up the mountain and if you're lucky the funicular railway making its way up Mount Fløyen.

name: St John's Church

photo.caption: 在教堂位置可以俯瞰市區街景

ranking_subcategory: #21 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #21 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #21 of 110 things to do in Bergen

reviews.title: Lovely Church
reviews.text: We enjoyed the walk to and neighborhood around St. John’s. After watching groups playing pétanque outside the church, we listened to a carillon concert outside and inside the church. I very much appreciate the  woodwork and simplicity of Norwegian Lutheran churches.Despite the simplicity, it has two pipe organs. I can imagine the sound would be most impressive.

reviews.title: HIGH AND MIGHTY
reviews.text: You are first struck by the stairs leading up to the church. The elevated location of the church makes it stand out. It is also the church in Bergen with the largest capacity. The red bricks also grab your eye. The interior is fine. There is no admission charge.

reviews.title: Bergen's Largest
reviews.text: Compared to many churches across Europe this would middle of the road. The church seats about 1200 people, which might be full during one of there concerts. Church dates to 19th century in Gothic  Revival style. Worth a stop if in town and exploring.

reviews.title: Beautiful church towering over Bergen
reviews.text: Tall red brick church sitting on hill up main street with series of stairs and soothing waterfall. Open and light inside interior.

reviews.title: Nice concerts here in the Summer and at Christmas
reviews.text: I have been to a few concerts here which run in the summer. There is also a great view over the city from outside the church and nice gardens nearby.

reviews.title: Tall red brick church
reviews.text:
The red brick church has 1250 seats, making it the largest church in Bergen. The church was built between 1891 and 1894 in the Gothic Revival style. It was consecrated in 1894.
It is tall and imposing building which you can't miss while in city centre.

reviews.title: Tall and imposing!!
reviews.text: The church is hardly 2-3 mins walk from the city centre. Its very tall and imposing and has a lovely architecture. Bonus is no entry fee.

reviews.title: Beautiful & Charming Church
reviews.text: Doing a self guided tour my wife and I walked up the stairs to this beautiful church and to our surprise they were having a student choir entertain. Lovely, just lovely. They preformed for more than 45 minutes as we all sat and completely enjoyed our selves.The church itself is beautiful with a gorgeous wooden ceiling, very nice stained glass windows, and understated alter. I saw someone else said that paying to enter a church to say a few prayers is offensive and we agree. It's nice when you have no fees. Donations are always appropriate.

name: The Homeless
ranking_subcategory: #37 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #37 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #37 of 110 things to do in Bergen

reviews.title: Meaningfull sculpture
reviews.text: Like some of the homeless on the street, we only just noticed this sculpture. Placed by a building just across from the fish market. Some of the most meaningfull art I’ve seen.

reviews.title: Thought provoking statue
reviews.text: This statue was created by Arne Maeland. It has no name but is known locally as “The Homeless”. Some reviews have mentioned that it is difficult to find but it is actually quite visible. As you walk down the street from the Seafarers Monument to the wharf, it is on your right hand side. It is to the left side of the entrance to the Hoyer clothing store.  Thought provoking statue of a homeless person sitting on the sidewalk.

reviews.title: Hard to find
reviews.text: It took us a while to find this, we gave up one day and came back the next. The statue is called "The homeless" by sculptor, Arne Maeland and has text: "Ingen er bare det du ser", which translates to: "Nobody is only what you see".

reviews.title: Stop and think
reviews.text:
This statue should not be ignored. Stop, look and think.

Homeless people are everywhere - but they are still people and deserve to be seen and treated as human beings.

reviews.title: The human being
reviews.text: If you search enough you can find this great statue of humanity. It’s both sad and encouraging at the same time. Give you a lot to think about.

reviews.title: Thought provoking sculpture
reviews.text:
Monday 3rd September and we were out and about sightseeing and exploring in the centre of Bergen.

We walked by and did not really notice or pay any attention to this sculpture, just noticed some other people stop to have a look and take photographs, so we went back to investigate and we saw this sculpture.

Supposedly the sculpture has no name, but it is just called “The Homeless”. It is sitting on the ground close to Bergen Fish Market and outside the DnB building.

It did make us think that maybe we should be more aware and be more vigilant, keeping our eyes open to what is going on and happening to others around us.

reviews.title: Beautiful statue
reviews.text: Walking from the fish market to the Cathedral we came across this statue. At first I though it was a homeless guy until I saw it was a statue. Makes you think and wonder how lucky we are

name: The Arboretum and Botanical Garden, Milde
ranking_subcategory: #56 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #56 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #56 of 110 things to do in Bergen

animal_welfare_tag.msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.

reviews.title: Well kept Botanical garden.
reviews.text:
The gardens aren’t big and are divided into two areas. The gardens themselves and the arboretum, which is about 1 
Km away. Gardens have been with new car park, cafeteria and patio (which wasn’t open), and very cleant toilets. Worth a visit if you’re interested in plants and gardens, but not fantastic. Nice little parking area by the fjord only 200m from the gardens.

reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
reviews.text: This is a wonderful place outside the city, perfect for a relaxed half day's exploring.  The botanical garden is well maintained, and the Japanese garden is delightful.  The Arboretum is larger than expected so I'd suggest using Google maps etc to really find your way around.  We chatted to one of the gardeners, from Finland, who recommended the Morkevatnet lake - he was right, it's lovely.  We then continued on to north-east shore which was a pleasant walk.

name: FlipZone Trampolinepark
ranking_subcategory: #55 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #55 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #55 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: Welcome to FlipZone Trampolinepark in Bergen, the hottest park in Norway. Our walls are covered with graffiti art and we have more than 70 trampolines including multiple 4x4 olympic sized trampolines. We also have Walking walls, jump through walls, a really large foam pit, Dodgeball court, Ninja Warrior course, Wipeout, Slam dunk basketball court and a lot more fun activities. All this along with a great light show and good music from the speakers makes this a pretty fun visit. We also have a cafe overlooking the park with surprisingly good food.

reviews.title: Litt lite!
reviews.text: Vi hadde 1,5 time med hopping. Barna gikk fort lei da det er noe lite. Holder mer enn nok med 1 time hopping.

reviews.title: Feiret 5 års dagen for min datter der med 15 gjester! Fantastisk er alt jeg har si!!
reviews.text: Feiret 5 års dagen for min datter der med 15 gjester! Fantastisk er alt jeg har si! Fantastisk opplegg, mat, service og Bursdagsvert som fulgte de hele veien! Så imponert . Når det nærmet seg slutten av en fantastisk bursdagsfeiring var det ikke noen av barna som ville gå! De koste seg og hadde det så utrolig kjekt!👍😊🎉

reviews.title: Ypperlig konsept - anbefales på det sterkeste
reviews.text: Fantastisk konsept som virkelig overgår konkurrenten i Bergen. Her er det utrolig mye gøy for både store og små. Instruktørene viser stort ansvar for alle og ivaretok og instruerte de små såvell som oss voksne på en smilende og imponerende måte gjennom hele besøket. Hele familien ble frelst så vi kommer nok hyppig på besøk. Anbefales på det sterkeste:)

reviews.title: Fantastisk opplevelse
reviews.text: Hadde gleden og feire min sønns bursdag der sammen med klassen hans og dere gav dem en uforglemmelig opplevelse. Bursadagsverten var med barna og hjalp dem under lek under hele perioden i parken. I tillegg stilt de 3 verter og sang bursdagssangen🙂👍. Samtidig er fasilitetene når det gjelder resturant og fersk mat fra kjøkkenet i en særklasse. Vil anbefale dette til alle som ønsker å ha det gøy og samtidig bli tatt vare på. Godt jobbet Flipzone, dere har fått til noe unik i Åsane  som skiller seg klart ut i forhold til andre med samme konsept. Kommer klart til å benytte dere igjen. Sønnen min er frelst etter ett besøk 😀

reviews.title: Ypperlig
reviews.text:
Barna likte seg. Det var noe for dem som likte å ta saltoer, klatre, spille kanonball, kjempe på holmgang, slam dunk, total wipeout og hva de nå heter alle aktivitetene. 

De ansatte var flinke med både barn og voksne. Et flott sted.

name: Stine Hoff Kunstglass Economusee
ranking_subcategory: #50 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #50 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #50 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: We are a glassblowing studio welcoming travellers to learn about and experience the magic of hot glass being formed into wineglasses, bowles, etc. We are part of the Économusée-network.

reviews.title: See local artists at work
reviews.text: We just walked into town and found this wonderful glassblowing place. You can easily see the local artists at work and observe them creating their works of art. There is also a shop with items for purchase. No entry fee when we visited.

name: Mount Lovstaken

photo.caption: Fél úton felfelé a "túra útvonalon",Bergen a háttérbe.

ranking_subcategory: #48 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #48 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #48 of 110 things to do in Bergen

reviews.title: The best view in Bergen
reviews.text: We climed to Mount Løvstakken last week and it took us about 2 hours to get up. We went very slowly and stopped to enjoy the view. The ascent was pretty steap and rocky at times, but not that bad. Beware of the rocks on rainy weather since they can get pretty slippery. The view at the top was towards the sea, I preferred this to Mount Floyen. The summit was pretty wide but there is no buildings or shelters to go to. It was also pretty windy day when we went there, so it was good we were wearing windproof jackets.

name: Brann Stadion
ranking_subcategory: #52 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #52 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #52 of 110 things to do in Bergen

reviews.title: Byen e Bergen og laget e Brann
reviews.text:
Stedet er Stadion og syng alle mann! Byens fotballstorstue og hjemmearena for Bergens store stolthet, Sportsklubben Brann.
Med splitter ny tribune mot sør (fra 2019) blir «Staddaen» bare enda bedre enn før.

reviews.title: Under bygging
reviews.text:
Kampresultatet er en ting. Stadion noe annet. Eller "staddaen" som folk gjerne sier.

Det går raskt og effektivt i forhold til antallet folk som skal inn og ut. Litt knotete å komme nære med bil. Offentlig transport anbefales.

Vær obs på soneparkering. Bruk appen P i Bergen.

reviews.title: Nest siste hjemmekamp for Brann mot Strømsgodset. Brann vant 3-1. Heia Brann.
reviews.text: 04.11.2018. Det er Brann sin nest siste hjemmekamp. Se spiller mot Strømsgodset. Brann satser sterkt på å presse Strønsgodst høyt fra kampstart. Dette er en vanlig angrepsform på hjemmebane og en kampform de har brukt i hele 2018 sesongen. Det lønner seg umiddelbart. Haugen får ballen på 16-meteren, får et reint treff på ballen og denne er utagbar for keeper. Brannspillerne presser hele kampen høyt og Strønsgodsespillerne blir etterhvert slitne for hele kampen å måtte jage ballen. Sluttresultat Brann 3 - Strømsgodset 1. Gullet ska hem. Heia Brann. Det var mange ledige plasser på tribunen. Synd ikke flere bergensere og striler tar seg råd til å kjøpe kampbilletter til Branns hjemmekamper.

reviews.title: BRANN!!!!
reviews.text: For alle som liker fotball er det absolutt verdt å få med seg en kamp her uavhengig av om mann er Brann supporter eller ikke. Stemmingen her når Brann spiller er helt unik. De spilte uavgjort når vi så de men stemningen var fortsatt topp

reviews.title: Norges beste fotball stemning
reviews.text: Vil du oppleve fotballstemning er dette plassen å dra, selv om en ikke er fotball interessert. Min brann lidenskap ble født her for mange år siden, og mine barns fotball og brann lidenskap har våknet her. Selv om de er fra en annen landsdel. Verd ett besøk selv om en ikke er brann supporter

name: Kunsthall 3.14
ranking_subcategory: #58 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #58 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #58 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: Kunsthall 3.14 has visions and wills to globality. We focus on the pressing questions of our time. We are continuously supporting the international, and responding in a variety of ways to different contemporalities. The focus includes presenting artist with established and reknown voices, recognizing the work of emerging artists, placing different media into new and meaningful contexts.

reviews.title: Art as the new capital
reviews.text: This contemporary art gallery Kunsthall 3.14 is located on the second floor in an old Norwegian bank from 1843. every time I visite their exhibitions the curator manages to blow my mind. It seems like they are going for candy for the brain and eyes. If you are a hardcore enthusiast or an amateur you will enjoy a visit to this gallery. And remember to  enter the vault

reviews.title: Great art
reviews.text: Very actual and interesting exhibition in a very nice space, in n old bank. Absolutely worth a visit!

reviews.title: To svært forskjellige utstillinger, men begge to veldig flotte utstillinger.
reviews.text: Dette er et veldig etablert kunstgalleri som jeg hørte om allerede for ca. 20 år siden da jeg bodde i Hong Kong, men det var første gangen at jeg besøkte Kunsthall 3.14 i Bergen. Jeg ble svært imponert over begge utstillingene, - en billedutstilling og en videoutstilling, - sørkoreansk og iransk ustilling.

name: Fantoft Stave Church
ranking_subcategory: #53 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #53 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #53 of 110 things to do in Bergen

reviews.title: An very good impression of Norways'life
reviews.text:
A fine restored building, just a few kilometers from the centre of Bergen.You can go with the tram (11 stops) Tickets at the Touristinformation or 7Eleven shops. (the ticketmachine is a tricky device)
After the tram a walk 15 min. hill-up. A beautiful place, just fort nice pictures.
Students give you all the information you need.

reviews.title: So Norwegian in architecture.....just lovely, like all the structures in Norway!
reviews.text: the original church was built in 1150. It was moved and then was burnt down...this is the exact replica and it is on a hill and so very peaceful.

reviews.title: Great restoration of a time past
reviews.text: Beautiful site on a hill in the middle of the city.  Building has been restored lovingly and is still preserved with tar.  We had a guide that made the place come alive.  Peaceful and gorgeous.  Worth the time.

reviews.title: Beautiful Structure
reviews.text:
Norway is known for its stave churches, and we were fortunate to see two on our trip:  Fantoft and the stave church at the The Norwegian Museum of Cultural History in Oslo.  Although all stave churches are reproductions, the church is Oslo dates to the 19th century and just felt more authentic.  Fantoft is gorgeous, but it was built in 2010 and has a distinctly modern feel to it.

If you are in the area, definitely visit Fantoft.  It's pretty and worth seeing.  But if you have opportunities to visit other stave churches, I would recommend them over this modern one.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text:
This remarkable wooden church was exquisite and the history of it was most interesting. Situated not very far from Bergen amid quiet woodland it was very peaceful. It’s best to go earlier in the day to feel the calm ambience of the place, as tourist buses full of sightseers descend later.
The interior is simple but beautiful and the exterior had striking dragon type carvings on the apex of each roof. Craftsmanship was beautiful.

reviews.title: Great movie theatre
reviews.text: Great location, many movies showing at once and most movies are shown for weeks so if you want to see a particular movie you will definitely find a time that suits you. Generally a good movie theatre, but expensive. However, movie theatres in Norway (and their snack shops) usually are - and I don't think this one has prices above average.

reviews.title: Great place to spend an evening when traveling. Films in original language.
reviews.text: The films are shown in their original languages, except for most children`s films. So you will always find English language films, along with French and other languages. Instead of sitting in your room at night, go to the movies. There are two large theatre complexes very near each other: Konsert Pallet and Magnus Barfotsgt. The seats are numbered and assigned. You can buy tickets online or at the Theaters themselves before the film starts, even a Day or more in advance. You can buy popcorn, candy, drinks, cotton candy, etc. at both Places. Enjoy!

description: Every Sunday from mid June to mid September you have the opportunity to travel on the Old Voss Steam Railway the 18 km from Garnes to Midttun. The steam loco is a ten-wheeler built in 1913 as the first generation mountain locomotives for the Bergen Railway. Along with the locomotive you will find shiny wooden coaches built in the same period. Throughout the summer we offer special arrangments, offering something for the whole family!

reviews.title: Slow ride to Voss
reviews.text:
Not necessarily a fan of train rides but will say the scenery was beautiful. We did have a guide with us so the information was invaluable. And, one of the falls we stopped at was worth our time. 

Not sure if an audio guide is available. No food on the train and the seats were not real comfortable.

name: Damsgaard Manor - Bymuseet i Bergen
ranking_subcategory: #51 of 110 things to do in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #51 of 110 things to do in Bergen
ranking: #51 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: We are very happy to present this beautiful classical summer house to our visitors. In the 1700s, Bergen was a large, busy and rich city. The city’s upper classes adopted trends from the continent and established elaborate, aristocratic homes in the countryside. By 1800 one would find around 70 of these summer houses in the countryside surrounding Bergen, and Damsgard was the most stunning. Damsgard Country Mansion, as it appears today, was built in the 1770s for General War Commissioner and General Customs Manager Joachim Christian Geelmuyden (1730-1795). Geelmuyden was knighted in 1783, and took the name Gyldenkrant. The house he built at Damsgard is still considered to be a masterpiece of Rococco architecture in wood in Norway, and it is perhaps Europe’s most authentic wooden building from that period. Garden exhibition can be visited all trough the opening hours. Access to the mansion only in guided tours. Guided tours: 12:00 & 14:00, Sundays also 13:00. Open June-Aug daily.

That woman was shouting to a mom and her small baby because of a croissant! And she called a security person to make them leave!!in h&m!!in Galleriet!!! What kind of city is becoming this, normal people being treated as criminals???!!!children as well???!!!

reviews.title: Unfortunately, Not Open
reviews.text: As with many historic sites in Bergen, this one is no longer open, and closed for an undetermined time like several other historic sites in the city.Seems that Bergen's focus is more on tourist activities and history is not a priority for travelers. There are no signs telling you that it is closed, but we heard from other travelers that there are renovations in place and that those who saw it, said it was beautiful inside. Hopefully it will open again.

reviews.title: A STORIED HISTORY
reviews.text: The building dominates the surrounding area. Its history is rather striking, having its roots in the 12th c, dedicated to St Olaf, the warrior king who lost his life at the battle of Stiklestad in 1030. It has suffered many fires over the centuries. It was locked the two times I went past.

It’s a bit of a hike up to the fortifications but well worth it. Excellent preservation of Atlantic wall defences built in an existing Norwegian Fort. One of the guns is actually still in place. ranking_subcategory: #82 of 110 things to do in Bergen

ranking: #82 of 110 things to do in Bergen
description: KRAFT Bergen is a leading showcase for contemporary crafts and materials-based art by national and international artists. As the only professional exhibition venue in Western Norway specialising in crafts, KRAFT represents a unique voice for the visual art scene in the region. KRAFT is an innovative and professional driver for the development of the field, the status of crafts and their dissemination. Different exhibitions and events enable KRAFT to contribute to the debate on the significance of crafts. The exhibition programme at KRAFT spotlights different traditions and material fields, and thus reflects the diversity of the field. The exhibitors range from recently graduated artists to well-established, recognised professionals in the field. There is a high level of activity at KRAFT, including exhibitions, presentations, talks by artists, evening lectures and seminars.

reviews.title: In Memory
reviews.text: It is a small memorial on the dock front, but is a reminder of those who gave their lives at sea in WW1.

reviews.title: Til minne om dem på sjøen
reviews.text:
Tidligere var Minebøssen plassert vis a vis Torvet. Der man kjører inn med biler vis a vis busstoppet I åpningen mellom Harbitzhjørnet og Kjøttbasaren. Der stod den fra 1921 til 2006,

Den gang var det et sted man kunne donere penger. Nå er bøssen flyttet til mellom Narvesen ved Fisketorget og Skur 11. Mellom Sheltland-Larsen Brygge og Hanseatisk Museum. Bøssen er plombert og innsamlingen avsluttet. Dette fordi det kom inn mindre penger enn det kostet å drive stiftelsen som organisert innsamlingen.

Bergens Tidende kan fortelle at "Minebøssen er en hornmine fra første verdenskrig. Den ble fisket opp av en norsk torpedobåt da den kom drivende langs kysten. Det eksplosive innholdet ble fjernet og minen senere satt på sokkel."

name: Ole Bull Fountain

reviews.title: A FITTING TRIBUTE TO ONE OF BERGEN'S FAVOURITE SONS
reviews.text: This 19th c virtuoso violinist was one of Bergen’s most acclaimed citizens. A large tree provides heavy shade to the statue, making it a bit hard to photograph. The statue is not that far away from one of Edvard Grieg, his friend and musical compatriot. The surrounding area makes for a pleasant stroll.

reviews.title: Lovely monument to Ole Bull
reviews.text: There is a lovely area of Bergen to explore along Ole Bulls Plass from the National Theater to Byparken and Lille Lungegardsvannet. Near Byparken is the Ole Bull Fountain. Ole Bull was a famous Norwegian virtuoso violinist from the 1800’s and a major star in his day. The statue and fountain is a beautiful monument to him. Right below Ole Bull is a troll with a harp! The fountain is in a nice shaded area making for a very pleasant location to visit.

reviews.title: 很受小朋友喜愛
reviews.text: 這座有著人像與公牛像的噴水池位於卑爾根市中心，水池裡面有圓形的石板，可以讓人走在上面，很受小朋友喜愛。

reviews.title: Pocta rodákovi
reviews.text:
Krásna fontána je okrem osvieženia poctou slavnemu huslistovi a skladateľovi obdobia romantizmu Ole Bullovi, ktorý koncertoval v Európe aj v Amerike. Videl hrať Paganiniho a tak si zaumienil, že aj on bude výborný virtuóz. Poznal sa s ďalším skladateľom z Bergenu Edvardom Griegom. 
Deti samozrejme láaka behanie po kameňoch vo fontáne.
Vedľa je výborná pizzeria a kúsok ďalej hudobný pavilón.

reviews.title: Enjoyable monument to a literary great
reviews.text: The Henrik Ibsen statue sits in front of the National Theater at the top of Ole Bulls Plass. It’s a fun statue in honor of Norway’s mist famous playwright. Ibsen worked in the 1850’s, early in his career, as a resident dramatist and stage director at the National Theater. The expression on the statue’s face, especially the eyes. Is something to see. Definitely worth a quick visit while in central Bergen. (Then walk down Ole Bulls Plass to see the beautiful and serene Ole Bull Fountain).

description: Farming and fishing was not only an occupation, but a way of living. Harvesting nature's bounty was for generations the only way of making a decent living in our county. With its collections of traditional houses, boats, tools and textiles. Hordamuseet gives an insight into the unique way of life of the people of rural Hordaland. The museum has an open air section with 30 buildings and rich archaeological finds and a boat shelter preserving 26 boats. Beautiful situated close to the Fana Fjord. The museum is open sunday from 12:00-16:00 from the 7th April 2019. Activities, exhibitions and cafe.

reviews.title: The worst ever !
reviews.text: They really don’t want you to come ! There’s no indication for people who don’t have car. The site only mentions that we could ride a bus in Lagunen and totally forgets to mention that there is only one bus every two hours !!! What does it cost to specify that ?

name: Bergen Kunsthall

subcategory_ranking: #92 of 110 things to do in Bergen

description: Alternating exhibitions of contemporary art. - a place for dicovery, experiences and surprises. The Bergen Contemporary Arts Gallery (founded in 1838) is beautifully located by the pond Lille Lungegardsvann, in the centre of downtown Bergen. The galley presents changing exhibitions of Norwegian and international contemporary art. The building, designed in 1936 by the architect Ole Landmark, has an exhibition area of 450m2 and a seperate sales gallery. The Festival Exhibition which annually runs from May-August, is the most important exhibition.

reviews.title: Hit and miss
reviews.text:
Firstly from looking at other reviews your visit will depend on what’s showing.

My visit was hit and miss, one exhibit (the smaller of the 2) that I really enjoyed and second that was ok but didn’t do too much for me

This gallery is small but that shouldn’t put you off (50KNR entry is ok + gives you discounted price at KODE).

I enjoyed the space, the larger gallery area spanning three rooms if it had something that clicked with me would have been a good experience. There was a video installation playing in one of the rooms, again well positioned and good effect just the type of film wasn’t my cup of tea

Cafe space looked nice & was busy but I didn’t stop for anything there.

Overall I enjoyed the gallery, & on balance a bit more than the three KODE galleries that I visited later

description: Galleri GEO is an art gallery and space to showcase the work of established and unestablished artists in the ‘’street and contemporary art scene’’. We thrive to push ourselves in new creative directions to make sure the gallery always develop and produce new high quality and innovative exhibitions. We host both national and international artists with our simple goal - to produce the best shows possible where borderlines don’t matter. We're an art house and share location with Ramme Service who offer custom framing on all artworks.

Det var laga til film/ leikerom på låven, noko som fall i smak hos både store og små. Nydelege bollar og sveler. Anbefaler eit besøk på den sjarmerande garden «der du ikkje skulle tru at nokon kunne bu» 🙂

description: Hordaland kunstsenter was established in 1976 as the first artist-run art centre in Norway. The core of our activities is our exhibition program, in which commissioning new projects from international artists plays an important role. Since 1987 Hordaland kunstsenter has hosted a residency program, which was initially open to Nordic region artists, but is now open to candidates of any nationality. Our aim is to increase the visibility of contemporary art in and from Norway, and to create opportunities for exchange between arts professionals in different geographic and political contexts. Hordaland kunstsenter´s bookshop carries a broad range of magazines and books dealing with contemporary art and culture. Welcome!

description: From catechism to the mortarboard. The School Museum and the Holberg museum are co-located in the old Latin school building, just north of the Cathedral, and are entered from Lille Øvregate. This is one of the country’s oldest school buildings, which previously housed one of our oldest schools. It was called the Bergen School, and for half a millennium after its establishment in the mid 1100s it was the only school in the city. That which began as a seminary would later become a ‘Latin school’ and a ‘gymnasium’, the gateway to academic training for generations of Bergen residents and others. The school, now the Bergen Cathedral School, still exists, in a more modern location on the other side of the cathedral. The Museum will be closed in 2018. Groups on request.

reviews.title: Ferry ride out of Bergen - very nice
reviews.text:
Our desire was to leave tourist-filled Bergen and make our way along the sunny, warm southern coast of Norway, to experience more of the normal lifestyles of the country.  We booked a passage on the Fjord Lines ferry from Bergen to Stavanger for $38, although the ferry landed at Risavika, then a short bus ride to Stavanger.  We took a cab in Bergen to the ferry dock and then got in line to check our luggage, and proceed to a waiting area for the gates to open.  Once we actually heard announcements for boarding, we showed our tickets and proceeded onto the ferry.  We headed toward the bow and the open lounge with comfy chairs and full windows onto the bow of the ship below.  We had drinks and watched the scenery while the area filled with passengers and finally under way.  We passed by the exceptionally clean, organized galley area earlier and visited that again for food.  The galley area had a wide selection of snacks, hot meals, and drinks all with prices in Denmark Kroner- roughly the same as Norwegian Kroner.  The ship was from Denmark so that was the only currency used, so we wore down our credit card numbers on frequent visits to the bar and galley.  There was an ATM on board, but only gave out Danish Kroner to add to my currency collection.  We walked on the cold outside deck on the windward side.   We found a top level deck with a broad area for walking around outside when it was less windy.   The entire ferry was modern and very clean as was the entire staff.    There was a wonderful selection of Scandinavian foods, especially chocolates.  We found all the food delicious and reasonably priced.
Along the route were wonderful towns and boats to watch as well as the mountains and occasional bridges.  We met several passengers from Europe and Scandinavia, all speaking English and full of questions about America.
We docked in Risavika, and left the boat hurriedly after we realized the ferry didn’t go all the way to Stavanger.  There was a bus waiting in the parking lot for those of us who had paid to get to Stavanger.  We boarded the bus and 20 minutes later were dropped off in Stavanger at the bus station.  I plan on returning to Norway and riding a ferry somewhere there again, either with Fjordline or Hurtigruten.

reviews.title: Weekendtur
reviews.text:
Vi var på weekendtur med jobben frå Bergen til Hirtshals og hadde lagt denne til fjord Line sin båt ms Bergensfjord 
Innsjekking,lugarer og selve turen var heilt ok,men det som skuffet meg litt var commander buffet på dekk 7. Vi hadde måltidene våre her,og jeg var ikkje fornøyd. 
Det var feks samme rettene både fredag og lørdag,samt at søndag frokost fikk vi ikkje spise frokost når vi ville,vi var tidlig ute for å spise frokost(0630) og fikk beskjed at vi ikkje kunne spise før 0830!! Det var mye ledige plasser her!! Når vi omsider fikk satt oss å spise,fikk vi også høre ved nabobordet at dei som jobbet kom bort til de og sa at tiden deres var brukt opp og de måtte forlate frukost bufeen!! Dette er uansett det rareste jeg har opplevd,må nå få lov å nyte måltidet så lenge bufeen er åpen uten å måtte risikere å bli kastet ut. Her må dere finne en løsning Fjord Line .

reviews.title: HIS SPIRIT SEEMS EVERYWHERE IN THE CITY
reviews.text: Whether museums, hotels or other forms, the composer has a presence in town. The statue is an apparent favourite pace for the local avian population too. He was a short man.

reviews.title: Monument to a Norway’s great composer
reviews.text: Edvard Grieg is Norway’s greatest composer and the most celebrated person to hail from Bergen. This is a wonderful bronze statue of Edvard Grieg in a delightful location in Byparken. Byparken is a lovely park in central Norway extending from the Rikstelegraf & Rikstelefon building to the KODE 1 Museum, with a nice restored pavilion in the middle. The statue sits in a lush lawn in front of the Rikstelegraf & Rikstelefon building. Worth a quick visit while in central Bergen. (Be sure to check out the nearby Ole Bull Fountain and Henrik Ibsen statue while you are there).

name: Bergen Segway
description: The Original & Authorized Segway Tour Operator in the heart of Bergen. Take benefit from our long experience in doing segway tours. You will be in excellent hands, and we focus on safety with indoor training before we go into the streets and have an amazing route. You will be able to see the older parts of Bergen with it's narrow streets and old wooden buildings, as well as the magnificent view to downtown driving alongside Mount Floyen.

offer_list.title: Best Views of Bergen - Segway Day Tour
Segway Experience in Bergen
Segway Night Tour of Bergen

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Bergen Segway tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: A very fun way to explore!
reviews.text: Highly recommend this trip.  It was fun and hugely informative.  A great way to get a feel for Bergen.

reviews.title: Bergen Segway by Night Tour
reviews.text:
Just awesome.

Easy to learn to ride.  We saw all of the important landmarks.  The guide was fantastic.

I recommend the night tour - in summer was not dark until the very end.  I saw others taking the day tour.  More crowded. Hotter.

Random benefit - we were able to see the fireworks for the tall ship festival from the tour above Bergen at the old fire station.

reviews.title: The best way to see Bergen!
reviews.text: We had already been in Bergen for a few days and thought we’d seen a lot - but only when we did the Segway Experience tour did we realise how much we had missed. Gorik was the best guide!  He quickly showed us how to operate the segways and then we headed out, stopping every so often at interesting or beautiful (usually both) places. We covered so much ground in two hours and Gorik’s knowledge of Bergen combined with his fun personality was brilliant.  He gave exactly the right amount of history for us but, let’s be honest, you book this tour for the segway! Scooting around the little streets, up and down hills was definitely the highlight. We had an amazing time and would recommend to anyone - if you get Gorik as your guide, that will be a definite bonus. Thanks Gorik (and all the best with your little one H&Jx).

reviews.title: Great fun with great info
reviews.text: This was lots of fun, lots info. Our guide, Siegmond was fun and informative. It’s the 5 tour we have done on Segways.

reviews.title: Bergen segway
reviews.text:
A wonderful couple of hours ... great fun. The guide spoke excellent English and showed us parts of Bergen we didn’t know existed. Very informative about the local area and history. 
A must do

reviews.title: Beautiful City, great tour, fantastic experience
reviews.text:
We had a great time! Really fun, great great service, we did almost all of Bergen.
We strongly recommend it

reviews.title: Awesome way to see Bergen!
reviews.text: We took all 13 of our family (including extended family) on this great adventure of a Bergen segway tour. Only 2 of us had ridden segways before, but we all did great and had so much fun! (Age range of 14-60) The 2 guides we had were very kind, helpful, fun, patient and knowledgeable. It was definitely one of our highlights on our trip to Bergen. I would highly recommend!

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: We loved our Segway tour of Bergen. It was a great way to see all the beautiful sites in a short amount of time. I was a little nervous about riding the Segway, but it was super easy and they give you plenty of practice time to get comfortable before the tour begins. I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.title: 9pm Segway tour
reviews.text: A definite highlight of our trip.  A beautiful landscape and safe event.  It was a great experience and would do it again.

reviews.title: So much fun!!
reviews.text:
Pablo was an amazing tour guide! You get to see all the main points of attraction in 2 hours plus you get to save energy by not having to walk all the steep slopes haha. 
This is a must do first thing when you get to Bergen! 
Dress warmly as going fast on the Segway makes it even colder & anticipate rain (:

Muchos gracias Pablo ¡Eres el mejor!

reviews.title: Super fun
reviews.text: It was super easy and a lot of fun! Great way to explore the beautiful Bergen! It was my first time and I loved it! Our guide (Gorik) was great!! Highly recomended.

reviews.title: Great way to see Bergen
reviews.text: This Segway tour is right on the pier near our docking location. We had previously taken a segway tour in Halifax and wanted to see if this would be as good. It was even better! Our guide was a local university student who was quite knowledgeable about his home town. This was the best way to get a good feel of what to see in town. Our 1-2 hour tour took us to all the nearby sights and even to a great overlook point above the city. By the end we had a good lay of the land and were able to go back to sights that interested us. Due to the size of Bergen, I think an overview before you start to walk around town is crucial.

reviews.title: Segway in Bergen in the rain :-)
reviews.text: The tour war great. The guide was very competently and the Segways are technically in perfect condition. We Recommend !

reviews.title: Super Segway stunner
reviews.text: We had never done Segwaying before and were expecting it to be easy. Turns out it's trickier than it looks. However,  with some fab instruction we were rapidly whizzing around confidently. Our South African tour guide was fantastic and very informative. Learnt loads, laughed loads and saw loads. Highly recommended. Thank you!

reviews.title: Best way to see the city
reviews.text: The best way to see a city in my opinion on your first day. The guides are very knowledgeable and can help you work out what to see while you are there . This was my girlfriend and my first time on a segway and we both picked it up quickly as it very easy . There was a range of ages in our group from 20s to 60s so anyone can have a go.

reviews.title: Segwaying in the rain(and shine)
reviews.text:
Stopped in Bergen on a fjord cruise and enjoyed a Segway tour led by Gorik - shout out! 
It’s a great alternative to the normal walk and sightsee! You cover a lot of ground - around 8 to 10 k.

reviews.title: Fun way to tour the town
reviews.text: The tour of Bergen was fun.  We were in and out of some crowded areas, which made things a bit challenging for some of the less confident riders.  The instruction wasn't as thorough as it could have been.  When advising that you steer with the handle bars, they weren't clear that you do it by moving it side to side.  If you're used to driving a snowmobile or a bicycle, you turn the handlebars, which definitely does not work on a Segway!  There wasn't as much commentary from our guide as I was expecting, but she was definitely patient and friendly.  And we did see some lovely sites.  The weather was rainy; ponchos were provided to anyone who wanted one.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: Overall one of the best things you can do in Bergen. You get to see almost all of Bergen in a short period of time, and the crew is very helpfull. Everyone can ride a Swegway with their help :D

reviews.title: Cruise excursion
reviews.text: We LOVED our first Segway experience! Despite the weather we saw so much of Bergen which we’d never would have covered without the guided tour. Our instructor was brilliant and made us all feel safe and competent.

reviews.title: So much fun and great guide!
reviews.text: Had never segway'd before so was so looking forward to it. I wasn't disappointed either as the guide was super friendly, helpful and explained everything well. The Segways were of course so much fun to ride and surprisingly easy to handle. Highly recommend Bergen Segway and hope to do it again one day.

reviews.title: Segway  Bergen Tour
reviews.text: Absolutely lovely and joyful visit. My 12 year old was very scared at first but due to the awesome teacher she left happily and would do it again.

reviews.title: Best experience
reviews.text:
We actually booked a day later by mistake. But when we reached this wonderful guide said he would take us anyway. And we did go on one of the best ride experience. And the time just flew it was too soon that we finished the tour. Our guide was this gentleman from Belgium who explained throughout and made Bergen and Norway more beautiful that what it already is. Being first timer most of us he could take away the fear very soon and made us enjoyed. 

Thank you,

reviews.title: Bergen segway
reviews.text: The Bergen Segway tour was awesome fun. It was the first time on a Segway and we had a great time exploring the old and new streets in the city. Our tour guides were knowledgeable, patient and allowed extra stops and chats. Totally worth it!!

reviews.title: 1) You will get wet 2) If you’re afraid of heights it’s a little scary 3) No matter what, it’s totally worth doing
reviews.text: We did the night Segway tour in Bergen. I know the description said it would go to the top of Mt. Floyen, but I hadn’t really thought about what that entailed. It means you are riding up narrow roads with hairpin turns in the dark to the top of the mountain that overlooks Bergen - through a neighborhood with some very beautiful houses, through a dark forest (short distance) to the top. While I was a little nervous, that I would wreck the Segway over a cliff, the view at the top was absolutely breathtaking and it was much less nerve wracking going down oddly. Our guide was great and they do provide rain ponchos. I know a lot of the reviews complain about weather / rain...so here is the deal- it rains in Bergen A LOT. It’s rained every day since we got here. If you let the rain stop you, you will miss out on so much fun and such a beautiful city. Bring your rain gear (including waterproof shoes) and get out and enjoy it! You with LOVE the Bergen Segway tour! A definite must do while in Bergen!!

reviews.title: Friendly and amazing experience
reviews.text:
Our group of 4 friends booked the Segway Bergen tour weeks in advance to make sure we get a space. Unfortunately on the day not only the rain was coming down heavily but the wind was also blowing strong.  Our guide was friendly, courteous and very helpful.  After checking the wind he offered to reschedule but as we were flying onwards the same evening, and as an exception, he  offered us a refund.  It was a great loss for us as Bergen by Segway is an activity not to be missed but at the same time we appreciate the gesture of goodwill on behalf of the company. 
 If you are in Bergen do try the Segway tour!!

reviews.title: Fun Tour
reviews.text: We truly enjoyed this fun and informative tour of Bergen. We were a bit apprehensive because we had never been on Segways before but we learned very quickly and realized using the Segway is very intuitive. We had a patient and knowledgeable tour guide in Matthew, who was excellent. In two hours we truly saw all of Bergen, with magnificent vistas, even in the pouring rain. We highly recommend this tour! Thank you, Matthew!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: Booked the tour from a cruise ship, Splendor of the Seas.  Stephanie was our guide and he was fantastic.  Took us all over the city and up the funicular mountain which saved us the price of that ticket.  Great guide, great tour.

reviews.title: An awesome way to see such a large, varied and hilly city!
reviews.text:
Sigmund was our guide and he was excellent - the right blend of friendliness and professionalism mixed with a fun streak. He got us up and running on the segways in no time and took us on a good one hour tour of the city. Highlights for me were zipping up the zig-zag roads effortlessly and seeing the beautiful wooden houses in the residential area of the city. We wish him well with the continuation of his studies abroad!  

From the Queen Elizabeth Waver! 👋👑😉

reviews.title: Great way to see the town.
reviews.text:
My Daughter and me went for the tour.It was our first time on a Segway ,but Tue instructed was very good must say ..he was also the guide for the tour which was fun and knowledgeable .He also provided us with ponchos as it was raining .
Dont remember his name the guide  but he was good .

reviews.title: Best guide ever!!
reviews.text: Can’t say enough about how kind Pablo was with me. I had such a hard time coordinating the Segway and he was very patient and never gave up on me. We felt very lucky to have such a great guide! Don’t hesitate...Take the tour!! You won’t regret it! Absolutely worth the cost!

reviews.title: Brilliant tour with a great guide
reviews.text:
A great setup with really helpful and engaging guides who are happy to tailor your tour to your taste.  If you like a little of the history and information but also enjoy the Segway riding a little more, you can go further than the "standard" tour and see more of the city.

I was lucky enough to tag onto an existing group on the day as it was only me participating out of our traveling group, and I managed to do this in Flåm as well.

Don't be drawn in by the cruise lines prices, they charge more (for nothing) so if you want to do a Segway tour and it's only 1 or 2 of you, you might still get away with turning up on the day.

Thanks guys for a great day!

reviews.title: Just a heads up
reviews.text: I am sure it is a wonderful tour. That said if you are on a cruise and docked at one of the remote locations you need plenty of time. Location was not near our ship. No directions on how to get back. Too far to walk. Not sure of taxi. Tried to get directions for the cruise ship shuttle - asked 3 different people and got three different answers. Decided to waste 250.00 as we could not chance not getting back to the ship in time. If you are at the remote locations you better have a lot of time . Really disappointed. Would have been great if our ship docked near the location. Would have been really nice if this was noted at the time of booking. Oh well.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience, #1 to do in Bergen!
reviews.text: We took the 2 hour day tour around Bergen. Luckily it was a sunny day, and I must say the experience was wonderful! We were a family of 4 and were accompanied by another family of 3, making it more fun when we were cruising around the city. Our tour guide, Steffano, was a very enthusiastic guide. He only made the tour better. I'd high recommend anyone who visits Bergen to take the day Segway tour around Bergen as it is the perfect way of enjoying the beauty of Bergen and the stunning scenery from the top. A must do :)

reviews.title: Bergen City Segway Tour
reviews.text: This was a wonderful way to tour the city.  It was the first time on a Segway. The guides provide good instructions and time to get fairly comfortable on the machine. It is good if you have some dexterity with your body and trust in the unit. Some things seem counterintuitive at times and you will kinda panic. Take your time and you should be fine. The route takes you on sidewalks, streets and alleyways. There is cobblestone and narrow passageways to manage along the way.   You must watch for pedestrians as they are everywhere.  All of that being said, we saw a lot from the shore to old town and everything in between. Lots of fun!  One more thing, the store front is not easy to find. It is located on the right side of a long warehouse type building. You enter through a garage door. Look for the Segway flag out front.

reviews.title: Excellent tour guide, sour grapes afterwards
reviews.text:
First, the location is not a "short" walk from the fish market.   It is a long walk...but it IS a short walk from where our cruise ship docked.  We practiced on the machine for about 15 minutes and then headed out.  Our guide was excellent, patient and kept a good eye on us.

He took us all over Bergen and to one fantastic view point where we could see our ship.  Really a good tour.

However, when we returned, my husband and I sat down on the only available bench in the entire shop...the ONLY seating, as I was tired from standing for 2 hours.  We started checking our e0mail  The owner/manager/or whomever, came over to us and told us that the bench (about 3 feet by 18 inches deep) was only for customers!  Can you imagine that?  So, even though the tour was really nice, that enounter left a bitter taste in my mouth.

name: Escape Bryggen
description: Escape Bryggen is a real-life escape game located in the heart of Bergen, in the historical Bryggen. Our escape room offers a fun and challenging adventure game for 2-10 players. The goal is simple - get out of the locked room within 60 minutes, using only your mind, logic, creativity and teamwork. Tease your brain, follow the clues, find the puzzles, solve the mysteries and open the door.

reviews.title: Escape Bryggen is worth it!
reviews.text: The Hanseaticus escape room had a great theme and design, and felt very authentic due to its location in the Bryggen. The puzzles were clever and not repetitive. We were a team of two and just made it out in time. It was a really fun experience overall.

reviews.title: Great escape room in the heart of bryggen!
reviews.text: This escape room is located in one of the heritage buildings right in Bryggen. The building itself is really interesting and definitely sets the mood. The Hanseatic room was really cool. The puzzles were challenging and clever and my group had an awesome time! The staff were very friendly. I highly recommend Escape Bryggen.

reviews.title: Too easy
reviews.text:
We were a party of 5 and finished the "hanseatic" room within 35 minutes very easily. It was good to win, but frustrating that we paid for 60 minutes of entertainment and got only half of that for our money.

The room we did is recommended for 2-7 players but I do not see how 7 people could fit in there and have fun playing. The room should be recommended for less people. Since the rooms are not rated for difficulty on their website, it makes it seem like we would need more people to solve the room, when in fact this is not the case.

I would recommend the room we played only for people who have not played an escape room before, or who want a guaranteed win.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Hanseatic Experience!
reviews.text: Our party of 6 (3 adults and 3 children) LOVED the Escape Bryggen Experience! Definitely recommend this to everyone looking for a challenge!

reviews.title: Fun room!
reviews.text:
we were three friends ing to sovle this puzzle and it was awesome! Thumbs up all the way!:)
Recomend this!

reviews.title: Get youre brain going
reviews.text: We have been 6 and had great fun with the Puzzles. Working  as a team(s) is the key to find the keys.

reviews.title: Fun date
reviews.text:
Went as a couple to the "la diva supernova", and it was very funny. Cool experience, really worth the time! Nice staff, and great location.
Two people was good for this Room, but it would probably be good with more too.

reviews.title: Very nice indoor activity.
reviews.text: Would highly recommend, polite and serviceminded staff. Gets you and your friends a nice teamwork experienced activity. Several «escapes» to choose from. Affordable and perfect for bacheloretteparty, family, teambuilding etc. Thumbs up!

reviews.title: Great teambuilding
reviews.text: We were two teams in the two rooms at Skuteviken, Crimson Hotel and La Diva Supernova. It was great fun and there was strong competition between the teams! The level of difficulty was good, both rooms had exciting and unexpected twists and turns in the plot and only one team managed to get out on time, after 55 minutes.

reviews.title: Well worth a visit!
reviews.text: We did the Hanseaticus room as a group of four, two of which had never done an escape room before. The whole thing was well organized and went very smoothly. The rooms are available in English and Norwegian. The location is very atmospheric. You enter through one of the alleys on Bryggen and the rooms are in one of the old buildings there. Highly recommended. We definitely plan to return for more rooms!

reviews.title: Teambuilding
reviews.text: I went there with some colleagues. It was fun and interesting. Some tasks difficult and some easier. It was a great experience, and the whole group loved it.

reviews.title: Great for teambuilding
reviews.text: We were a team of 9 colleagues who barely managed to defeat the evil rain machine. It was a lot of fun and everyone was involved.

reviews.title: Great Escape in Bergen
reviews.text:
Great fun solving La Diva Supernova. Tricky codes, absolutely worth the hour.
We were four people, in different ages, were we could all tribute to the solution.

name: No Stress
description: No Stress was awarded “Norway´s Best Bar 2015”. This is one of the best cocktail bars in Bergen, and we pride ourselves on only using fresh and proper ingredients. The atmosphere is in our name; No Stress. We look forward to see you.

reviews.title: Great drinks
reviews.text:
We stopped in here for an afternoon cocktail. They have an extensive drink list and have some inventive cocktails along side all the classics. 

I had an old fashioned that was not drowning in sugar which can happen when a bartender isn’t familiar with the drink. My wife had a cosmo with had 5 ingredients besides the vodka and loved it. Our friend had a lemontini which she loved and thought tasted like lemon pie. It was too sweet for my taste but she loved it. 

I also appreciated that the bartender tasted each drink she made before she served them. Quality clearly matters here.

reviews.title: Afternoon drinks
reviews.text: Cosy little cocktail bar with a great selection of spirits and beer (local and imported). Bartender Connor was very knowledgeable and really friendly, definitely made it a lovely experience! Try the chilli martini it is unbeatable

reviews.title: Best cocktails in Bergen 🍸
reviews.text: Best low key bar in Bergen! Perfect for a chill night out with your friends, enjoying the best cocktails Bergen has to offer 💃🏽🍸a good choice for whatever mood your in!

reviews.title: Bad cocktail bar !!
reviews.text: Evel stuff, to much sweet cocktails, nice interieur but bad experience for me with this bar. I hope you have a better experience than me.

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: Great place - well worth popping in. Didn't open until 17.00 when we were there in April but glad that we waited. We just had a couple of local beers and a couple of glasses of red wine and the quality was good. Lovely location and lovely people. Not as frighteningly pricey as we had feared. Excellent atmosphere and super-well situated.

reviews.title: Unique and funny cocktails in Bergen
reviews.text:
We found this address on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed! The bar is located on a dead end street. You have many tables inside and a tiny bar with professional barmen. They recommend us their best seller cocktail, a spicy one with raspberries, ginger and spicies at least. First of all, the menu was really funny, with a lot movies references and a large sense of humor and a large choice of surprising cocktails. We tried 4 of us, with different tastes and all were delicious 😋
A place to recommend!

reviews.title: Awesome cocktails
reviews.text:
Ive been there during my trip in Norway. We were in Bergen and did not know where to go. A local reccommended this place to us. Been there took some drinks and they were all awesome! Fair price and great place. 

Best cocktail I drank in my life (Spicy martini) 

Cheers!

reviews.title: Interesting blends
reviews.text: My daughters loved the cocktails here, and a lovely atmosphere. Very creative and fresh ingredients.

reviews.title: Cozy bar just off the harbour
reviews.text: We visited here twice on a Saturday. Saturday afternoon it was quite quiet, Saturday night is was bustling. No problem getting served either time, staff we're great and there was a good atmosphere - full of locals with a few tourists.

reviews.title: Cozy. Perfect for unwinding.
reviews.text:
Spent only a couple days in Bergen but made sure to set aside some time for No Stress. It can get very crowded on weekends and difficult to get in (like most bars), so my friend and I waited till an off night to try it. The drinks were excellent albeit pricy. We were both a bit travel weary at the time, so the low key atmosphere was perfect. I believe the Norwegian word for it is "koselig". At a basic level its a feeling of groundedness and appreciation for where you are and when you are. The word is a catch-all for the feeling derived from good atmosphere, company, and being in the moment. This place is what I think of when I think of koselig. Between the comfortable lighting, amazing cocktails, homey furniture, and of course the friendly Norwegian people (seriously so incredibly kind), this is an excellent stop if visiting Bergen. I'd call it a can't miss.

There was also a Nintendo 64 with Mario Kart which is an extreme boost in my book.

reviews.title: Very good drinks!
reviews.text: Went here to try some cocktails. Some classics that tasted good but when we ordered a drink that gave the bartender free hands to do it, with some influence, it was absolutely perfect. One of the best whiskey drinks I've tasted. I will definitely go back here.

reviews.title: Best ever!
reviews.text: Amazing cocktail bar! We came here by recommendation of our friend, local who said that “No Stress” is must visit. All of the syrups that they are using in cocktails are homemade, and every single one that we tried is really 5star. Without a doubt, must visit place if U are a cocktail lover. Chilli martini, Ginger slapper, Lemon pie, Philly smash- must try!

reviews.title: Great afternoon cocktail!
reviews.text: We came here around 4 pm! It’s so great a nice cocktail place so early in the afternoon! They are really the best! The drink we ordered tasted so nice! You can easily have at least two!

reviews.title: Best Cocktails
reviews.text: Love love this place... Googled two places and then I asked the hotel stuff and they recommended here. Some of the best cocktails ever especially the hot step mom. The bar servers are very friendly and the vibe is truly amazing. People chat with you and just an a good place to hang out and have some amazing drinks. And I met some new friends.

reviews.title: This bar is sensational
reviews.text: The guys making cocktails are a work of art in and of themselves. Watching them serve 4 to 5 people at the same time and deliver exceptional cocktails was a joy to watch and drink! It's not a huge place and it's Very friendly. Met several locals and shared booths. All in all a fantastic way to end a few days in Bergen.

name: BarBarista

photo.caption: The excellent interior and fine paintings on the wall make the place very special!

description: art-cafe, great coffee and the best waffles in norway. daytime: cafe. evening: bar and DJ. the best place to meet the locals!

reviews.title: Best waffles in beegen
reviews.text: you need to come here and try their waffles and brown cheese classic and their smoked salmon and waffles dishes. It’s absolutely amazing and well priced. The shop is filled with quirky designs and pink umbrellas.  the waffles were so good i went back twice.

reviews.title: Great quirky bar
reviews.text:
Staff welcoming. Good beer.
Toilets down steep flight of stairs so if like me you have walking issues you might fine toilet access difficult.

reviews.title: Cool Bar
reviews.text: Cool, cozy bar with a unique atmosphere and extravagant, amazing decoration. They specialize on waffles. Definitely to go and check it out!

reviews.title: Great waffles
reviews.text: Do not miss this unique restaurant! The decor is funky and unique, and they play retro music. Their waffles are fantastic, and come in many varieties - you can get them with peanut butter and jelly or with Brie and nuts. The coffee is terrific, and staff are very friendly.

reviews.title: Cozy
reviews.text: Cozy place, spectacular interior. Friendly staff and good beer. A small backgarden for smoking and such.

reviews.title: Good atmosphere
reviews.text:
Exotic atmosphere and the drinks are so good. Thank you so much. 
Good coffee and good tea as well. Peace

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: I suggest just go - definitely worth checking it out once during your visit to Bergen. I went here couple of times. The place has a nice vibe, love the decor - quirky and friendly staff. Had plenty of Norwegian waffles and coffee here. Loved it!

reviews.title: Cool spot
reviews.text: A friend suggested I visit, really cool inside, friendly staff, very chilled and great waffles! Would highly recommend

reviews.title: Funky bar/caffee/ restaurant
reviews.text: A friend recommended this amazing little place to meet  in Bergen. What a sensory overload when you step through the door! There is a DJ station in the middle of the room making the atmosphere very nice . All the different decoration from the roof makes you not be boring even if coming alone. Very good choice of beer and cider, at (for Norway)  very good price. You should also try  the famed waffles.This place is great fun if you like a bohemian, burlesque fusion vibe. Nothing boring here!

reviews.title: Super quirky interior--great place to meet with friends but not to do work
reviews.text: I wanted a quiet coffee shop to do work, and this is not that. The chairs and tables are a mismatched hodgepodge that are cute and fun for a bite with a friend but not very comfortable if you're trying to work on a laptop.  The chai was the second best I had in Bergen--pretty spicy and loose leaf tea. There are not many food options except waffles.

reviews.title: Great/random bar
reviews.text:
BarBarista is a great place to get away from it all and get a drink from a huge choice of beers. Service is excellent, and definitely worth getting the lady behind the bar to recommend something for you. You just can't go wrong! 
Décor is eclectic to say the least but it's definitely got a charm of its own.

reviews.title: Great Find!
reviews.text:
Had a most enjoyable long weekend in Bergen with friends, and this was a gem of a find. Very reasonably priced beer (we found Bergen very expensive – I'll never complain about London prices again!)
We ended up in here 2 nights in a row. You will never tire of looking at the decor – an amazing collection of, well, everything. Really friendly people, great music, and very comfy, squashy seating, that's very difficult to get out of after a few beers. I believe they serve food, although we didn't eat here.
When we return to Bergen, this will be top of our list of places to revisit.

reviews.title: Eclectic, burlesque, funky bar/ restaurant
reviews.text: Our concierge recommended this amazing little find in Bergen. What a sensory overload when you step through the door! There is a DJ station in the middle of the room, and it seems this is quite the party venue at night. However, we were there for a quiet pils and cider at midday. We sampled the famed waffles as well.  This place is great fun if you like a bohemian, burlesque fusion vibe. Nothing boring here!

reviews.title: An unique, personal experience of Bergen
reviews.text: Probably one of the best bar´s in Bergen with really cool interior, good beer and tasty waffles. The wine is not the best, and the prices a little bit stiff, but good music and atmosphere makes up for it! As well as nice service and interesting people and decorations. Worth a visit!

reviews.title: great place to chill
reviews.text:
