last time we went there it was with our neighbours to have a meeting. 
it's just a great place to chill, have a coffee or just eat a snack.
great atmosphere! and good prices.

reviews.title: Barbarista - Cosy bar in Bergen
reviews.text: I used to live in Bergen, and pop into this bar whenever I am in town. A visual treat or assault, according to taste. A bustling, cosy, friendly place. I am quiet at ease going there on my own, day or night. Seems to be a lot of young people there, but nobody would feel out of place. The crazy decorations look more organized now than it was a few years ago. Fascinating just to sit and look around.

reviews.title: Great find !!!
reviews.text: It was cold and rainy, we just looked for an open door, we were so surprised to find this corner of warmth, fun and great oldies, the coffee was great, and we went out with great smile on our face, if you are in the area and you like good 60’s music, and lots of cool memorabilia to look at and play with, its the place for you!

reviews.title: Take a break and eat a waffle!
reviews.text:
This was one of our favorite eats while in Bergen.  It was a nice change of pace from our other sit down meals.  My husband decided we needed waffles and this seemed to be the place to go, we were not disappointed.  The waffles were excellent and the beer selection was amazing!
This is the one place we ate at we felt we would go to again if we had more time (easy food to eat, relaxing and not to hard on the wallet).

reviews.title: An ultimate positive visit
reviews.text: I visited this place with family and friends. We vere only to stay for an beer, but this place was so entertaining that we stayed until they closed. Facinating  interiour, friendly staff, good music and an menu of beer selection i have never seen in Bergen anywhere before. Visit and enjoy

reviews.title: Such a cool spot!
reviews.text:
We stopped here for hot chocolate (which was unreal!) and enjoyed an hour just sitting enjoying the scenery and bar! 

It’s open until 1.30 on weekend, and seems like a very cool place to enjoy drinks and cocktails too.
We will be going back but YOU must go here and enjoy all the wonder inside!

reviews.title: Weird, chilled, interesting....
reviews.text:
Very strange decor that the owners appear in a number of times. It goes from odd to bizarre and beyond!
Good back ground music, relaxed atmosphere with locals having a drink and playing card games.
Very good beer and we visited a number of times, staff friendly.

name: Bergen Food Tours
description: Bergen Food Tours & Experiences offer delicious 3-hour neighbourhood food experiences focused exclusively in Bergen's off-the-beaten-path neighbourhoods near the UNESCO site Bryggen. These guided Food Tours & Experiences include mouth-watering food tastings from unique specialty food stores and local restaurants. Discover an insider's view on Bergen's best food, drink, and street art.

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Bergen Food Tours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Awesome food tour!
reviews.text: Bergen food tour was an awesome experience, the  traditional Norwegian food was amazing! Our tour guide Ina was super fun and knowledgeable about Norwegian tradition and dishes. I would recommend this to anyone stopping in Bergen to learn more about Norwegian tradition and local foods, or looking for a new favorite food!

reviews.title: Perfect way to try tastes in Bergen, Norway!
reviews.text: Rachel’s was a wonderful guide! I highly recommend this tour.  The samples at each place were so fantastic! This is a great way to experience Bergen!

reviews.title: True food tour
reviews.text: My husband and I have done quite a few food tours around the world and this was a true food tour... as in there was lots of it! Each stop gave a good sized helping of what was being sampled and our guide knew a lot about the food, it’s origins, the history/story of the chefs, etc.  We thoroughly enjoyed the 3 hours.  The only reason I’m not scoring this a 5 is that there wasn’t a ton of Bergen history covered.  We’re experienced tours before that were a perfect mix of city history and food knowledge.  Would definitely recommend this tour!

reviews.title: Wonderful food tour
reviews.text: This food tour is a great way to experience Bergen. Our tour guide Rachele was fun, friendly and knowledgeable. It lasted about 3 hours and you won’t be needing another meal afterwards. Everything was delicious, and Rachele sent a very detailed email out about the tour for reference if you wanted to return to any of the spots. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: You won’t be hungry after this tour!
reviews.text: We spent a lovely afternoon with Ina and a group of other foodies sampling yummy Norwegian food. We started out tasting a variety of smoked salmons, moved on to fish soup, fish cakes, reindeer hot dogs with lingonberries and crispy onions, fish potato mash, delicious cookies and brown cheese cheesecake, then ending with aquavit and beer tasting. The stops were all different but definitely places we’d visit again. Ina was a great guide with a fun personality. She’s perfect for this job!

reviews.title: Fantastic food walking tour of Bergen!  We learned a ton from Ina who was our guide.
reviews.text: We learned about local foods and also a lot about the local culture. Ina is a fantastic guide. Furthermore, she emailed us with the recipes about all of the food that we tried which was a really nice touch. The food journey really enriched our experience in Bergen.

reviews.title: Fantastic Food Tour
reviews.text:
I highly recommend the Bergen Food Tour.  Ina our guide was terrific .. so friendly and really did a fantastic job. Not only did she take us to the best places to try Norwegian cuisine but also answered all of our questions about Norway and in the end put the entire experience in an email. She also added recipes so we can make the great foods we tasted. 
It’s a must do if you’re visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Fun food tour
reviews.text: My son and I enjoyed this food tour. Rachele was an engaging and kind host who maneuvered our small group through the various locations expertly. Heavily seafood, understandably of course. Interesting side notes. Would definitely recommend to both foodies and those who are looking for an interesting introduction to the area. Thank you.

reviews.title: Leisurely food tour with adventurous finds
reviews.text: We had a great time touring the Bergen fish market and several key food attractions around the city. Ina was a terrific guide with lots of interesting anecdotes about the rich history of Bergen's culinary scene, going back to Hanseatic League traders. Bergen Food Tours owner Cheyenne also stopped by at the beginning of the tour to give us the lay of the land. The brown cheese cheesecake and reindeer sausage were unexpected delights! Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Lovely for whatever travel you are doing!!
reviews.text:
As a solo traveller I was looking for some nice, but not lame, avtivities and found the food tour. It was the perfect way to combine great taste and knowledge of the city & the life in Bergen, without the feeling of a typical tourist-activity. Our Tourguide Ina was very open for all kind of questions (and always knew how to answer them) and it felt like talking to a friend. Really appreciated that! 
I also liked the selection of food (and the amount, i was full afterwards :) ), the small group size as well as the stories and fairytales Ida told us. Thumbs up!

reviews.title: Inexpensive, but tasty, food tour
reviews.text: We chose this tour at the last minute on our first day in Bergen. With our guide, Ina, we made 6 food stops and learned a bit about the culture and layout of Bergen. There are several more expensive food tours of Bergen, but the Classic Food Tour was inexpensive, informative, and very tasty. A great start to our time in Bergen.

reviews.title: Excellent food tour
reviews.text: This was the first food tour my partner and i had done in Europe. It was such a good tour that he's already researching our next one. Ina was a great guide, all the food was delicious. Really cool trying local  delicacies and the wild salmon was incredible. 😊

reviews.title: Informative and fun food tour in Bergen
reviews.text:
My sister and I went on a Bergen Food Tour while in Bergen in June 2019.  Our guide was Rachele, who was entertaining and personable.  We went to six different restaurants/food establishments and ate and drank a lot!  We took the afternoon tour and skipped dinner that night.

What we learned about Norwegian food came in handy during the rest of our time in Norway - we ended up going back to one of the six places we went to on the tour for lunch the next day, and we also ordered a dish we had tasted during the tour at dinner another night.  In addition to learning about Norwegian food, we also learned about Bergen, Norwegian holidays, and Norwegian customs.  

After the tour Rachele emailed us a summary of where we went and what we ate and even included recipes for a couple of the dishes.  That was much appreciated.

All in all it was a great tour and I recommend it highly!

reviews.title: Best food tour yet!
reviews.text:
We had an AMAZING tour with Rachele on this trip! We found we had a lot in common,  and she was just an incredible guide. Smart, sharp, funny, wonderful!
We loved her!
Also the food was awesome- I particularly liked the plukkfisk at Bare Vestland, the pickled leeks really made that dish- it was delicious!
Cheyenne was amazing with communication, we knew exactly where to show up, when, and what to wear for the weather. And Rachele really personalized the tour to us, I feel like we've made a new friend.
Definitely, if you like eating amazing food and exploring with super fun people, take this tour!

reviews.title: Bergen food tour during our cruise stop in Bergen
reviews.text: We were on a recent cruise to Norway on P&O Azura and during our stop in Bergen we decided to schedule a food tour instead of doing one of the standard cruise ship excursion offerings.  We are certainly glad we did.  The food tour was a perfect way to explore Bergen city centre, learn something about the city, and taste some excellent food from places most tourists wouldn't know to visit.  Our tour guide Ina was enthusiastic and engaging, and as a local Bergen resident knew a lot about the city and the food scene.  We tasted salmon and trout at the fish market, had fish soup at another stop, and my favorite was the reindeer sausage.  We would highly recommend doing the Bergen Food Tour with Cheyenne and Ina when visiting Bergen, especially if you are on a cruise and want something more unique than a typical cruise excursion.

reviews.title: Great food tour!
reviews.text: We took the Bergen Food Tour and had a great time.  Our tour guide, Rachele, was very knowledgeable about the history of the area and food.  She took us to some great spots in the harbor area.  We went early in our time in Bergen which was great because then we were able to go back to some of the restaurants and try other food later in the trip.  Can't say enough good things about this tour.  Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: A very interesting and personalised tour of Bergen centre. Do it on your first day here and you'll get loads of tips and ideas of where and what to eat! Brown cheese cheescake! mmm! Lovely salmon, reindeer sausage, great local beers and a hide-away bar-restaurant you'd never find on your own! Cheers Ina!😁

reviews.title: A fantastic experience!
reviews.text: The Bergen Food Tour was a big highlight of our trip to Norway. We had a fantastic day with Ina, who was a brilliant, fun and knowledgeable host. She took us to some lovely food places and we tried a lot of really great dishes. We were definitely very full afterwards! Ina - thank you so much for a memorable experience!

reviews.title: Wonderful way to experience Bergen! Highly recommend!
reviews.text:
We had an excellent tour with Ina, who is delightful and knowledgeable.  We highly recommend this tour as a way to see a different part of Norwegian culture.  The food was delicious and interesting, but not intimidating (we had a range of palates and adventurous eaters in our group - foodies and lay people alike).  

Just make sure to go on an empty stomach!

reviews.title: Bergen Classic
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our recent experience with Bergen Food Tours. Our guide, Ina, was a joy and well prepared to show us her city and its food. Well organized and comprehensive, we checked a lot of boxes in three hours. We always try to get a walking food tour early in a visit to a city and we can highly recommend this one.

reviews.title: Great food with great people!
reviews.text: We enjoyed the different foods and drinks, and we enjoyed our guide Ina very much. She told us everything about the foods&drinks, and all other topics that came to our mind.

reviews.title: Wonderful Bergen food experience! Loved Ina!
reviews.text: You need to enjoy fish, and if so...this food tour is for you! Hot and cold smoked salmon, trout and whale; traditional Norwegian fish "stew" although it was more of a mashed potato consistency topped with local crispy bacon bits and chives (delish!); Bergen fish soup, fish cakes and more from circa 1929 recipes; reindeer (and hopefully not Rudolph!) sausage dogs topped with crispy onions and lingonberry sauce); yummy brown-cheese cheese cake (so much better than it sounds) from a local bakery; all topped off with a five-flight beer tasting. Who could ask for more! Local Bergen Ina was our guide and she was upbeat, very willing to answer questions and expertly explained the details of all tasting items. She also followed up with an email that provided more information about the food we tasted and even provided a recipe. There were eight in our group, but Ina managed to make us all feel very special, and we (my hubby and I) enjoyed the energy and fun of the event as much as the food itself! Booking was a breeze, and the email and text communication was extremely comprehensive. Be sure to include this event when you're visiting Bergen! It was truly the highlight of our Bergen stay.

reviews.title: Relaxed and enjoyable with delicious food!
reviews.text:
My husband, father and our 1 year old baby had a fantastic tour with Bergen local Ina. She was an awesome guide relaxed, friendly, enthusiastic and engaged. She made sure she chatted to all of us in the group and made sure everyone was happy and enjoying the variety of feasts we tasted. The food tour is an easy and fun way to see a little of Bergen and Taste a broad variety of local cuisine- from the seafood markets and the wide variety of smoked fish and Salmons; reindeer hotdogs and the brown cheese cheesecakes just to name a few! My husband particularly enjoyed the beer tasting!! This small group tour was great fun for all ages and a lovely way of seeing beautiful Bergen and tasting its offerings. Cheyanne was wonderful and friendly and very accommodating with the booking process and my mistakes! 
To make our life easy high chairs we’re waiting for us everywhere we went, they were so accommodating of our little son!
Highly recommended!!

reviews.title: Bergen food tour was awesome!
reviews.text: Rachele was our guide for the Bergen Food Tour . She was an amazing guide. We tasted many different types of fish and she explained the hot and cold smoking . It was very informative and the Salmon was delicious! We then tried different sausages and a pub dish that was traditional Norwegian and included fish, mashed potatoes and leeks. It was delicious! We continued on with fish cakes and fish stew and then stopped at a wonderful bakery . Finally we had aqua vita ( local alcoholic drink similar to a type of vodka) and beer tasting with different cheeses. The food and drinks were great but Rachele was what made the tour so special. She explained everything and also helped us understand the culture with stories and interesting information. She was just fun to be around ! I would highly recommend this tour and hope you get Rachele as your guide as she was fantastic. Thank you for a terrific tour!

reviews.title: Come hungry. Leave with friends.
reviews.text:
My wife and I booked this trip last minute, and Cheyanne was wonderful about accommodating us. Because it was the shoulder season, we were the only ones on the tour and we really got the personalized experience. Being able to sample dozens of dishes was amazing, but what really made the experience spectacular was the people. All the vendors were friendly, Ina had a wonderful personality and was very knowledgeable, and even Cheyanne (the owner) and her baby paid us a visit to make sure everything was going well. Definitely a must do in Bergen!

Tips: Be prepared to walk through whatever weather. Come hungry. Be curious. Have fun!

reviews.title: Tasty fun!
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed this tour very much. Rachele was a wonderful guide, and the communication both before and after the tour was excellent. The food we sampled was tasty and varied, with the plukkfisk dish from Bare Vestland a definite group highlight.  I would have liked one more food sample, to feel full and satisfied, but then again I do have quite a large appetite, therefore, I’m sure most people would be more than happy with the amount of food on offer. Thanks Cheyenne and Rachele for a wonderful introduction to the Bergen food scene. :)

reviews.title: Entertaining and delicious
reviews.text: Cheyanne knows her way around Bergen. When I come back I know just where to go for the best eats. Definitely exceeded my expectations. It was a lot of fun learning about the locals and local food and drink.

reviews.title: Fun foodie day in Bergen!
reviews.text: Rachele was a fabulous host to the 3.5 hour tour.  We started at the fish market - trying 8 different types of fish!  She carefully described the spices and smoking methods to understand the texture of the meat as well as the flavor.  Next we went to try a local street stand with various kinds of sausages - I had previously tried the reindeer sausage so I opted for the lamb - very delectable with the traditional sauces and accompaniments!  We tried a local fish "fast food" that has been in assistance since the 1920s - tried 4 different items here, my favorite was the fish soup!  Next we headed to a lovely quiet dessert place to try the brown cheese cheesecake, homemade jam and cookie.  All divine and the smells of the cookies freshly made were to die for!  Last on the food stop we had hearty "pub" dish with meat and potatoes - so large I had to take some home!  Our very last stop was to sample 4 local beers.  Yum!  I have never before been so well fed - go hungry! Rachele was very friendly, answering any questions I had and sharing about the local area and culture.  Thanks for a fun day!

reviews.title: Make Time for this Tour!
reviews.text:
From the very start, communication with Cheyanne (the owner) was excellent. In retrospect that was a hint as to how great this tour would be. She was prompt, honest and so personable in her emails. We weren’t just another booking.

As a vegetarian, food tours can be a challenge. Not here! The cheese samples were a perfect replacement for the sausage. There was a nice selection of Norwegian food sampled and portions sized to enable us to continuing tasting without being overly full. Though my husband and I left the tour not wanting for another meal that day!

We had a fabulous time with Ina on our tour! It was her first solo tour, but she was already a pro. Her obvious enthusiasm for sharing the foods and stories of her home town made it easy to ignore the drizzly day. 

We were hesitant to visit Bergen because it is a large cruise port. When a ship is in port the city looses so much of it’s charm. But we were glad we did decide to visit and not miss this great tour!

reviews.title: Nice Food Tour
reviews.text: This food tour is definitely a nice activity for anyone visiting Bergen and willing to get a sense of the city. The tour allowed us to taste typical Norwegian food as well as learning a bit more about the city. I definitely enjoyed the slower pace of the tour and the fact that we were walking between places. You do not end up bloated and unable to savor the next meal. Good choice!!

reviews.title: Deliciously Fantastic!!
reviews.text:
We visited Bergen for just one day by cruise ship and there was no better way that we could have spent our day than on this food tour. From the moment I first contacted Cheyanne the communication was fantastic and the tour absolutely lived up to our expectations and all the fabulous reviews that we read. 

Our guide Ina was fabulous, it was her first week on the food tour but you would never have known it. She was knowledgable, fun and really kept us all on track guiding us around the best hidden food treasures in Bergen. 

The route was well considered, the food was fabulous and plentiful and there were so many places we would revisit if we were to return.  We really did get a great taste of Norway. 

As an occasional fish eating vegetarian I was a little worried but I needn’t have been. I loved every single dish that I tried and especially loved the cheese platter that replaced the reindeer. 

We were lucky to get to meet Cheyanne and the youngest recruit on the food tour Henry on our route.  This tour really is a labour of love and she has worked so hard to make it what it is. Thanks so much Cheyanne and wishing you all the best for the future of this tour! 

Huge thanks also to Ina for a truly fantastic day and especially for the additional tip to see the ‘Fish to Mars’ musical. It was eye opening and a perfect end to our day.

reviews.title: More Than A Food Tour
reviews.text: My wife and I joined Cheyanne's tour a few weeks ago. We have been on many of these types of tours but hers was one of the best. Cheyanne is a very enthusiastic host who has put a lot of time and effort into organizing her tour. You taste many of the Norwegian food and drinks but in addition she gives you a great deal of insight into Norwegian culture. Also her communication from pre tour to post tour is great. My wife and I highly recommend her tour.

reviews.title: Bergen and It's Food
reviews.text: We wanted to see the city of Bergen and understand it's culture. What better way than through her food. As a tour guide, Cheyanne is fun and informative. I was a little unsure at the small portions at first, but you visit so many places you wouldn't want to fill up early and not be ready for the next stop. A walking tour in a city that rains a lot, but we came prepared for the day with rain coats, and Cheyanne had extra umbrellas. What a fun tour that helped us see the city within easy walking distance.

reviews.title: Great intro to Bergen and it’s food
reviews.text: We had Cheyanne for our tour and she was great.  Informative, not just about the food, but also economy, history and culture. The samples were unique and delicious. I was a particular fan of the plokkfisk and my teenage son was crazy about the venison sausage with lingonberry sauce. Great job Bergen Food Tours!  All the best!

reviews.title: The Best Way to See Bergen
reviews.text:
Cheyanne is delightful. The tour is not only about food, but you also learn interesting things about Bergen. The food is varied with some sweet and some savory. A great mix! There was not a single "dud" in all the places we visited. Unique foods, comfort foods, fancy foods. All are included. 

If you're lucky like we were, this will be the first time you try plukkfisk and it will be amazing. If you are not so lucky and have tried it elsewhere (we had a different version later in our vacation that was dreadful) take a chance and try what Cheyanne has arranged! I promise you will not be disappointed.

Highly recommended. The food is wonderful, the tour both entertaining and interesting.

reviews.title: Tasty and Interesting: A Great Food Tour of What Bergen has to Offer
reviews.text: We highly recommend the 3 hour Bergen Classic Food Tour with Cheyenne.  Took the tour in late August 2018.  Does a great job introducing and exploring Bergen’s food culture through unique tastings and captivating explanations.  The owner guide, Cheyenne is knowledgeable, funny and very expressive.  The tastings are all very good without exception and some are very unique to the point that I might not have tried them on my own but am glad that this tour provided our the chance.  There is a local fish soup that is chock full of fish and flavor that made me want to go back for more and the brown cheese cake is over the top.  Been on numerous food tours in cities around the world.  This tour ranks high on our list without reservation.

reviews.title: Fantastic Day Experiencing Real Norwegian Cuisine!
reviews.text: Cheyanne was a delight as she took us to delicious spots in Bergen we would never have found ourselves! She has much knowledge about Norwegian traditional dishes and customs, and the food at every stop was fantastic! The beer tasting at the end of the tour was very special also. I highly recommend this tour!

reviews.title: Street Art Tour
reviews.text:
I knew little about street art when I joined Cheyanne's street art tour.  She provided an enthusiastic introduction to that world, and along the way we explored areas of the city we would not have found on our own. I highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in art in public spaces.
Janet

reviews.title: Get to Know Norwegian Food
reviews.text: I took Cheyanne’s tour in August.  I have visited Bergen 2 years prior but had no idea what Norwegians eat.  Thanks to Cheyanne, now I know.  From the fish soup at Lysverket to the reindeer sausage, the choices of food were excellent.  In addition, Cheyanne shared her knowledge and experience of Luke in Bergen.  A must for foodies!

reviews.title: Wonderful Introduction to Bergen
reviews.text: Cheyanne gave us a fun and very informative afternoon, stopping at wonderful spots along the off-the-beaten-track route. Time and money well spent.

reviews.title: GREAT day!
reviews.text:
Cheyanne is an awesome guide and is full of energy. We learned SO much about the foods people eat in Bergen. Cheyanne did her research when looking for stops to have along her route. 

Finding the meeting point was a bit confusing because there are four KODE museums, so make sure you leave yourself enough time to find KODE 4, which happens to be the furthest away from the main parts of town. 

We tried a lot of different foods, most of them I liked, a couple I did not care for. That's the point of a food tour, to try things you normally might not taste. 

I highly recommend this tour as a way to spend your day in Bergen. You learn about the city while eating.

My fiancé and I had a great time on the tour! Not really knowing what to expect with the food scene in Bergen, we were pleasantly surprised. The tour hits some really cool spots, most of which were expecting our arrival. The tour was well-planned and allows you to try some interesting and delicious food. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: A "must do"!
reviews.text: We had an amazing time on the Bergen food tour! Cheyanne is an amazing guide and has an infectious energy that gets everyone excited :) She also does a fantastic job on communicating with you both before and after the tour with details about what you will be doing and what you ate, along with suggested recipes. We learned a lot about the up-and-coming food scene in Bergen and about some of the traditional Norwegian dishes (we would both eat plukkfisk everyday if we could!). It was the perfect amount of food where we both left full but not "stuffed"; the variety of dishes was perfect as well. The tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Bergen and something we would definitely suggest to anyone looking for a fun and informative afternoon :)

reviews.title: Informative and entertaining.
reviews.text: An excellent way to spend a rainy afternoon in Bergen. In setting up her business Cheyanne has done her homework, and then some! We were also impressed with the rapport she has built up with the establishments visited. What she doesn’t know about Bergen food isn’t worth knowing. She imparts her knowledge with passion and wit, and the small group size enables her to add a personal touch throughout the tour. The food samples were more than adequate, and informed by local proprietors, and the drinks provided a suitable finishing touch. Thank you very much and wishing you continued success.

reviews.title: Fabulous 3 hours!
reviews.text: A wonderful leisurely tour around all the best places to eat, sampling some of Norway's finest food and drink - Cheyanne has a wealth of knowledge and experience of all things Bergen, as well as a great sense of humour - just do it:-)

reviews.title: Fabulous Food Tour... Must do in Bergen!
reviews.text: The food tour introduced us to amazing  local food and Cheyanne shared interesting stories along the way which provided a great overall view of the city.  We went back the next night to one of the restaurants we visited.

reviews.title: Bergen Food and Street art
reviews.text: We had a great time being shown around the street art in Bergen. Cheyanne was very knowledgeable and she covered areas that we would not have found on our own. A great tour and gets you into the more interesting areas of the city.

reviews.title: Delightful Tour and Delicious Food !
reviews.text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of the center of the city with Hilde and loved the opportunity to taste some of the local delicacies!  She shared some of the history of the city and the evolution of the local food scene.  The food was delicious and the portions were perfect  ... although I could have eaten the fish soup for days!!!

The pace was relaxed and we never felt rushed or hurried ... we even took the time to wait our some very heavy rain in the bakery ... THAT was a wonderful serendipity!  

It was a perfect way to spend our last day in Bergen!

reviews.title: Cheyanne’s Tour is Fabulous
reviews.text: The variety of food and the charming stories that Cheyanne shared made for a fantastic tour. I have gone on food tours in other cities and the Bergen tour is a must.

reviews.title: Great Food and Great Fun
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed the food tour.  There was plenty of delicious local food, and the guide, Cheyenne, was very informative.  It was a great way to see Bergen.

reviews.title: Super entertaining way to learn about Norway and Bergen’s foodscene
reviews.text: The must-do  tour is run by the energetic Cheyenne who took us on a fun, informative and delicious way to learn about Bergen and its food.

reviews.title: Engaging, fun, educative
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our Bergen food tour with the lovely Hilde at the end of July.  She was positive, enthusiastic, attentive, responsive to questions and generally a perfect hostess.  The food stops included what we felt was a full range of local food experiences: high-end fish soup (could have done with a bit more to be honest), high-end bakery, trad food in trad restaurants, street food reindeer, all washed down with a choice of beer, cider or aquavit.  Communication was great before and after, and loads of recommendations for other places to visit.  Yes it was expensive but as others have said that's Norway in general.  All in all a really good way to get to know a bit about the city, the food and the vibe.  Recommended.

reviews.title: A great way to try new things
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our food tour with Hilde. Leading up to the tour, we had great communications from the tour company. It's clear that they sweat the details, including even bringing extra umbrellas. On this tour we got to be adventurous and try new (to us) foods, including urchin, reindeer, and whale. Even my husband, who never liked smoked salmon enjoyed trying the different Norwegian varieties. I especially enjoyed trying the different Bergen foods, including the brown cheese cake, and the very famous sisters' fish stew. After the tour we even received recipes of what we were able to try.  I think it was worth the price as we got to try so many different types of foods over the course of three hours.

name: Roedne Fjord Cruise
ranking_subcategory: #1 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #1 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #1 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
description: Rodne Fjord Cruise offers Fjord Cruise to Mostraumen all year round! All departures are from Zachariasbryggen in Bergen. Please visit our web site for schedule and booking.

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Roedne Fjord Cruise tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Arranged this trip privately and was much cheaper than through the cruise ship. It’s only 5 minutes walk from the cruise ship which is a bonus.They also put my mobility scooter onboard. Really good way of seeing a Fjord and would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: A lot to see in a short amount of time-great option for a short visit to a fjord.
reviews.text: We had an afternoon to fill and chose to do a three-hour tour.  This was a very pleasant boat ride that took you along the coast and then into a fjord.  The trip took us past two very small villages that are only assessable by boat.  The captain had the boat so close to one of the waterfalls that it seemed you could touch it.  We had a bright day which made it even nicer as the colors of the fjord and the villages were very vibrant.  It was an excellent way to see a fjord without a significant investment of time.

reviews.title: Terrific and worth the money
reviews.text:
This three hour cruise is perfect. You feel that  you have properly seen the fiords and little  housing settlements along the way.

The close of the waterfalls us amazing.

The fast cat boat is smooth and quiet.

reviews.title: Amazing sightseeing, great people,professional crew
reviews.text:
Yesterday I had a great trip with  Rodne Fjord cruise on Rygertroll!
Really, it was amazing!
I was totally blown away by the beauty of the fjords themselves which are stunning, with different, amazing scenery around every corner. 
Boat was great, plenty of room on deck and below with a little kiosk for snacks and drinks. 
Special thanks to crew member, who worked in kiosk : your explenation and help was very usefull!
Looking forward to taking this tour again in the autumn!

reviews.title: P&O cruise to Norway
reviews.text:
Great sea trip, friendly staff and reasonable prices. £4.20- £4.50 for a beer ain't bad.
A room with at least a window is best.😎👍
Family and friends holiday.

reviews.title: If you don’t have 10 hours this cruise is great
reviews.text: But it does take a while to get to the best bits. But then you are only doing the 3 hour cruise. Make sure you wear warm and waterfall proof clothes, it is quite chilly up on the deck when the boat is cruising at speed. Once you get to the end point then the views are really beautiful as everyone has said.

reviews.title: Great trip, classic views
reviews.text:
Completed this trip recently. We did the 10am cruise, which took off down the fjords.
The return trip follows the same route as the outbound trip.
Just before the end of the trip the boat is manoeuvred into a spectacular waterfall, allowing perfect photo opportunity.
Good commentary, relaxing cruise, totally enjoyed this trip.
As it is only 3hrs, good length of time.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.text: This half-day trip takes in some fantastic scenery en route to Mostraumen. You can sit comfortably inside the cabin and also outside on deck. The boat slows to let you take in the most beautiful places with a commentary in Norwegian and English. There is a bar onboard selling drinks and snacks. You can buy tickets on the day where the boat leaves at the side of the fishmarket.

reviews.title: Excellent tour into the fjords
reviews.text:
This three hour cruise from Bergen to Mostraumen is a beautiful way to experience the breathtaking fjords in the Bergen area. We went out a lovely partly sunny May morning (on the 10:00 cruise) which was perfect weather for enjoying the cruise on the open upper deck. There is also an enclosed lower deck but if the weather is decent, the upper deck is definitely the place to experience the tour. 

We really enjoyed the cruise. The boat was clean and well maintained and ran smoothly across the water. Once you get away from the more populated areas the scenery becomes magnificent. The fjord narrows and you pass between some very high cliffs. There are a few scattered houses along the way. Near the end of the cruise you also pass by and up close to some tall narrow waterfalls. Plenty of beautiful sights and lots of photo opportunities. 

If you are traveling to the Bergen area, a fjord cruise should definitely be on your itinerary and the Rødne cruise is a good one to take. A true Norway experience!

reviews.title: Was expecting more
reviews.text: The cruise was nice, the staff was friendly and the route was scenic. At the end of it, still felt that something was missing. The cruise is good for a 3 hour trip. May need a longer, more focused cruise if you want a more immersive fjord experience.

reviews.title: A taste of Norway
reviews.text:
The cruise from Bergen to Mostraumen is a 3 hours roundtrip. It is the shortest cruise you can have starting from Bergen but it's well worth it. In winter it is quite tough staying out on the upper deck, so get a good pair of gloves and a warm wind jacket. The best of it comes at the end when approaching Mostraumen. 
The snowfall of the previous night made all the experience magical.

reviews.title: Wonderful cruise on the fjords with breathtaking views.
reviews.text: The 3 hour ride takes you to some of the most beautiful spots in the islands and mountains around Bergen. The speedboat is well equipped, with a snackbar and at certain spots, you can go to open deck or upper deck to "feel" the nature. Add this to your bucket list.

reviews.title: Pleasant cruuse
reviews.text:
3 hours of the day relaxing cruising  the fjords. The staff are great the ferry is A grade and for the fee it’s is a nice way of experiencing the environment.

Plenty to see - villages, waterfalls, fjords and it is well managed with some simple commentary along the way.

Worth the time.

reviews.title: Beautiful Views
reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience with this tour!! It took around 4 hours to complete. The first half an hour was a bit boring in terms of scenery—mostly just looked at houses. Once we rode a bit further, we saw tall snow-covered mountains, waterfalls, clear water, and beautiful views! It was very cold and windy on the top deck, so make sure to bring a lot of layers (I went in the beginning of March). You can sit inside, where it's warm, or on the first or second decks outside, where the views are much nicer. We passed by one waterfall and got to have a cup of fresh water from it, which was pretty cool. We saw lots of typical Norwegian-style houses in different colors, and it was breathtaking. Overall, I would definitely recommend this tour!

reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Boat Ride of Fjord
reviews.text: This beautiful boat ride was a wonderful way to spend a chilly day in Bergen.  You have the opportunity to go from inside the warm cabin to the outside upper deck at anytime during the cruise, and during several points of the cruise they opened the from lower deck to people to enjoy the views.  The length of the cruise was just right, not too long and not too short.  The costs seemed good compared to other short cruises we have taken especially with the senior discount.

reviews.title: Was nice...but I was missing some extra ...
reviews.text: Well, for 550 NOK we get the boat ride to Mostraumen and back , with possibility to go out on the upper deck and make pictures. The tour was 3 hrs, 2 of them just pure boat ride. As we came to the last part , that was really nice to see, but some nordic mystic music from speakers and pre-recorded texts were not realy fitting in this. That we stopped directly in front of the waterfall and we could also almost touch it , was nice. The only personal moment was at the glass of waterfall water was served. It would be actualy , in my opinion, very good tour, if we would stop somewhere and could go on lan (at least in Mostraumen), this way, was only a boat ride with some extras at the end.

reviews.title: Best tour of our trip
reviews.text: This was a great tour and you get to see some amazing views. It was December and you are in Norway, so duh it was cold on the top deck. The inside is nicely heated and there was plenty of seats on our trip. Be sure this is one of your tours while in Bergen.

reviews.title: Very good boat tour
reviews.text: Very good scenery with plenty of opportunity to take photographs and take in the views.  It was unfortunate that on our trip it was icy and our tour had a different route.  That said, would definitely recommend this trip for a view of the fjords.

reviews.title: Fjord
reviews.text: We  hired this cruise in the tourism information point and we finish it happy with their services, the views and all around it. We sailed to Mostraumen, a great waterfall and throw the Bergen fjords.

reviews.title: Visit to Norway Fjord Cruise
reviews.text: This was one of the best tours I did while in Scandinavia.  I took the cruise with a tour group. I was amazed when our bus drove onto the ferry and we just boarded it at the end of the cruise. The cruise took us past majestic mountains, many waterfalls and interesting tiny villages. Most people started the cruise on the outside upstairs, however, it was cold so most people ended up inside downstairs. The best place to enjoy the view is upstairs. If you are doing this cruise during the cooler months bundle up so you can stay outside. This is a must do if you are in Bergen

reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.text: This particular tour showed me how amazing our Earth is. Excellent waterfalls view. A little cold when we visited but everything was worth every second of it.

reviews.title: Good even on misty days
reviews.text: Did this tour on a cloudy misty November morning. It was still stunning. The boat is modern and spacious with comfy seats and good views inside and out. It’s worth noting that the boat is available to board quite a bit before the departure time. We boarded at about 9:30. This is useful if you want to ensure a window spot inside as the boat was busy even though the weather wasn’t ideal. With our good indoor spot we could come in and out as scenery dictated. Standing at the front with the wind in your face is not to be missed.

reviews.title: Can't be missed
reviews.text: Friends had recommended taking a fjord tour while in Bergen, and while we were pressed for time, we were so glad we took the three-hour round-trip tour from Bergen to Mostraumen. The high-speed ferry is comfortable and offers lots of space indoor and on deck (on two levels) for viewing and photography. The view of Bergen from the habour in and of itself is great but the view of the fjords and small villages along the river are simply incredible. Lots of great photo opportunities.

reviews.title: Bergen to Mostraumen cruise
reviews.text: Stunning scenery!  Comfy seats inside and plenty of deck space outside.  We had booked a 2pm cruise but when I called to ask a question about it they recommended that we change our reservation to the 10am that day instead because the light would be better.  We showed up at 10am the next day, but it turned out we hadn't actually been rebooked.  They didn't seem very organized about it but we they let us on anyway.  Crew were very friendly though and it was worth it.

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.text: We took an amazing three hour fjord cruise with Roedne Fjord Cruise and were delighted by the experience, the boarding process was easy and seamless, the boat was comfortable and clean and the numerous viewing spots from inside and outside the boat were perfect. The three hour journey through the fjords was nothing short of amazing. I cannot put into words the magnificence of the places we saw. Massive rock collections, countless waterfalls, goats, Pulpit Rock, etc. This beautiful and brief journey has something for everyone. Don’t miss it, a spectacular trip offered by a professional company

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth
reviews.text:
Want to know how Nature puts on a great show for you in all its glory.. OK, go here. You will NEVER forget this experience. Well worth all the trouble.
What trouble you ask? Getting up early to get there as the sun comes up. Yup, taking an early morning cruise is highly recommended. Why?

The water is still. Almost like mirror. No ripples. You see the beauty twice over - once you look the reflection and raise your eyes to look up. Can you tell the difference? It is just that beautiful.  If you have not done anything else in Norway, this one thing is something you should never miss. If you have not planned on going here, you will miss something spectacular.

Highly, highly recommended.

reviews.title: 3-hour long stunning fjord cruise
reviews.text: We decided to take the 3-hour long version of the fjord cruises which is called Bergen-Mostraumen. There is a boat leaving at 10:00 AM and another one at 2:00 PM - we went with the morning one. It leaves just from the harbour in the old part of the city, next to the fish market. It is a very modern boat with sundeck, but there is also a place which is covered with glass and has chairs. The course goes all the way to Mo and back and offers some breathtaking views. Price was also acceptable, it costed 600 NOK per person.

reviews.title: Fantastic cruise down the fjord
reviews.text:
Large comfortable boat to cruise down the fjord. 
It is possible to sit indoors with plenty of windows to look out as well as go on top of the boat to see views from outside. 
They have some small commentary of places of interest that you pass. 
Even in the rain and wind this was a great tour with lots of lovely scenery to look at

reviews.title: A good day outing
reviews.text: Pleasant trip. We stayed down below inside where it was warm and relaxing for most of it. We had a nice window seat and table booth to eat at. I did go outside for the special sights to get some shots. The falls were spectacular. We drank the glacier water from it. The water was so cold, pure and refreshing, a great experience. I did have to push my way through a big crowd on the top observation deck, just to get a few shot from the front. It felt like being in a New York City subway car during rush hour. It was however well worth it as I got one of my best shots from our whole two week trip. The crew was pleasant and helpful. If you got a day to kill in Bergen, this is a nice way to do it. I recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Fantastic tour
reviews.text: We took the 3 hour tour to Mostraumen and had the best time! The scenery was incredible - leaving and returning to Bergen harbour, passing waterfalls and little remote hamlets - we were constantly surrounded by stunning views. I definitely recommend staying out on the sun deck, though it can get quite chilly so bring layers! We booked our tickets in advance online and were glad we had as the tour was fully booked that day. We were only in Bergen for the weekend so this 3 hour tour gave us the perfect fjord experience and meant we had plenty more time to explore the rest that the city had to offer.

reviews.title: Got to be done
reviews.text: Spent here hours on a boat and I guess it was worth it in the end. A total of about 20 minutes was looking at spectacular scenery, close up to local towns, the rest was a bit dull. But glad we made the effort

reviews.title: 3 hour cruise, stunning views
reviews.text: We opted for the three hour cruise as time was tight. We weren’t disappointed as the views were amazing and a real once in a lifetime must do. It was typical fjord scenery but still took our breath away. Pricey, but worth doing. Loved it.

reviews.title: The 3 Hour Fjord Tour to Take
reviews.text:
Rodney Fjord Cruise is well worth the 3 hours you spend on it.

Leaving Bergen to travel to Mostraumen up the Osterfjord (1.5 hours there and the same coming back), you will see majestic mountains, forests and small nestled settlements.

The boat which can hold up to 150 people will slow down at a couple of narrow spots and give you a chance to take some great pictures. 

Well worth it to see what Norway is all about.

Great crew and an English and Norwegian commentary make for a memorable experience.

reviews.title: Worth the time and money and a quick overview of the Norwegian Fjords
reviews.text: This is a short 3 hour fjord cruise which gives a good glimpse to what Norwegian fjords have to offer. Definitely do it if you are in a hurry. If you have more time, go for the regular day long cruises or hike along the hardanger fjord for more surreal scenic beauty.

reviews.title: Pulpit Rock
reviews.text: It's out of this world , great sights, its just an unbelievable time , great scenery, it's a must see. If you ever visit Norway you must take this tour. There is wildlife to see and other untouched scenes which are great to see. I would recommend this tour to everybody. Pictures don't do justice, it must be seen bye eye.

reviews.title: Great fjord tour with Roedne to Mostraumen
reviews.text:
The tickets were bought on the internet in advance for a 3 hour tours to Mostraumen. It was easy. It was also easy to find the starting point at the Fishmarket. The tour was well-organised, there was a lot of people but the boat was not crowded (possibly because of good weather and that people could sit outside). 
The boat moves smoothly. There is a perfect view through the windows from inside, but you can stand or sit outside if you can resist to wind.
The panorama is excellent, there are also different birds on the water. You can listen to the English-speaking guide and also there is adequate music to improve the athmosphere when the boat cross the nicest areas. You can also drink from the water of a waterfall.
It clearly worths the price.

reviews.title: Beautiful but wrap up warm even in Summer
reviews.text:
Lovely introduction to the Fjords if you have only a short time . ( I would say get a Bergen card before you start as it gives discount on this trip , free museum entry and other discounts . )
Boat has plenty of room for everyone to get the photo they want . The waterfall water gathering was a unique experience .. brilliant idea . Water is tasty . 
It is freezing though even in summer as the boat goes at speed .. gloves would have been a good idea !

reviews.title: Half-day taste of the fjords
reviews.text: This is a great trip to add to a Bergen city break.  Even on a grey day we had splendidly atmospheric views. The boat was fully booked for the 10am sailing but didn't feel crowded. The staff slow the boat down and facilitate photo opportunities.  Glad we went.

reviews.title: Spectacular and narrow fjord
reviews.text:
During the 3h boat trip (60 NOK), we visited one of the narrowest shady fjord in Norway, called Monstraumen.
It is really majestic, especially the final part of the trip when the boat crosses the Mostraumen strait: it is a magic place with strong current forms hundreds of maelstroms.
The end of the trip is around the village of Modalen, the second smallest Norway's village, and there is a waterfall from the mountain: the boat approaches the waterfall and picks some pure water that is then offered to the passengers.
Great experience.
Book the day before.
Get to the pier 1h in advance to secure a seat on the open air floor.

reviews.title: Nice trip but overpriced
reviews.text: The trip is very pleasant and well organized but I felt it was very overpriced. We didn’t see much more than we could see on our drive over from Oslo by car. The only thing was the boat going right up to the waterfall, that’s really the only thing we could not have done by driving our car out on the little local roads.

name: Flow State
description: Flow State is an optimization center where our focus is body and mind relaxation and a better and functional everyday life using: • Flotation tanks • Cryo therapy (cold treatment) • Light therapy • Functional training

reviews.title: One of the main highlights of my time in Bergen
reviews.text: I visited Flow State while in Bergen with a large group (20+) traveling in Scandinavia. We had the better part of 2 days to explore some of what Flow State has to offer - cryotherapy, infrared light therapy, rebirthing breath and the sensory deprivation tank. As a yoga & meditation practitioner, and recently a strength & conditioning enthusiast, I knew about these methods but never really had access to try them. It was a real treat to experience them all in one place, in a professional yet relaxed environment, and with the guidance of the knowledgeable team at Flow. They practice what they preach and therefore had the ability to guide, inform and encourage us. I especially enjoyed the deprivation tank, an hour of blissful peace with yourself - wish I had regular access to one!

reviews.title: Amazing float
reviews.text:
I was at Flow State with my partner in June after a heavy work period and recharge body and soul before a busy weekend I Bergen. 
I had 90 minutes in the float tank and the experience was priceless. After the first 20 minutes my body was totally relaxed on a new level I have not experience before. I got in touch with my body in a way not possible without Flow State's facilities. The staff gave us a very good intro to what to expect, knowledge and the service was great. My partner does not like small rooms and is a bit claustrophobic, but after the intro with the staff and a look at the facilities she was totally fine with the idea of getting in to the float tank. Both me and here had a amazing experience. I would defiantly recommend Flow State to everyone I meet. These guys know what they are doing and seem very in to their work.

Just amazing. Definitely coming back !

reviews.title: First time floating
reviews.text: This had been suggested to me as a good way to try and relax my back, which I had recently injured.  Although skeptical at first I thought I'd give it a go when visiting Bergen for a weekend break. No such thing as float tanks where I live, so when in Rome and all that.  Popped past a walk in the morning just to see if there was any availability, luckily they could fit me in later that afternoon.  The actual experience is awesome. I would highly recommend giving it a try.  Felt like I was in there for 20 minutes, was the full hour.  I had no clue.  Most relaxed my body has ever felt.  This has got to be good for anyone, although I would suggest understanding how mediation works first as this will enhance the time spent floating.  Would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Deprivation Therapy Tank
reviews.text:
After trying to mditate with no sucsess because its hard to find a mindset where you can relax totally, one hour in the tank was the perfect way to reset the mind and body. 

Thanks!

reviews.title: Flabbergasting experience, wonderful place and marvelous staff
reviews.text: I've tried floating several times. The benefits and uses are many. For me it's about going deep and working on chronic stress and the psyche in general. As a physician I think this is a great tool. Lying like weightless in the tank you really get to feel all the muscle tensions, tensions you didn't even know you had, but that still can cause trouble down the road. In addition, if one options to close the tank and add sensory deprivation, it is a great tool to get to know ones own psyche. Describing the experience is of limited value, since I suspect this is different for everyone. Frode and Christoffer are wonderful, openminded people who doesn't shy away from a little chat after the sessions, sincerely interested in one's experience if one feels to share. They also offer light therapy and cryotherapy, which both are cutting edge tools. Flow State comes highly recommended, whether one is a resident of Bergen, or just visiting, looking for experiences.

reviews.title: Awesome optimalizationcentre
reviews.text: Amazing! Facility is calming, clean and well laid out. Staff very friendly and explained process clearly and answered all questions. Very relaxing experience in the floatingtank, as well as an energizing experiense in the Cryochamber. Will be back again, and again, for sure.

name: Norway Fjord Travel
description: Private Tour operator in the Fjord region covering Bergen, Ålesund and Oslo. We have a fleet of exclusive cars and unlike other's in Bergen & Oslo, we do not hire Russian and East Europe "low cost" Guides. All our guides are born and bred Norwegians, fluent in English and can provide real and authentic insight for the travelers in the Fjord Region. We also operate several Fjord RIB boats

offer_list.title: Private Fjordcruise: Bergen & Veafjord by Zodiac Speed Boat
Private customizable Tour to Sognefjord and Flåm from Bergen
Private Tour: Full Daytrip from Oslo to the Fjords and back
The Scenic Roadtrip - Oslo to Bergen via the fjords by private van
The Scenic Roadtrip - Oslo to Bergen via the fjords, 24 hr Refundable

reviews.title: Try this for a nice view
reviews.text: We took this cruise for a fjord view and had a fantastic time. The crew takes you at the tip of the waterfall to enjoy it fully. There are two levels of seating arrangements and this gives a large scope to photo shoot. The shore line of Bergen is visible which indeed is a visual delight.

reviews.title: Magical fjords
reviews.text: We took a 27 km tour of the fjord from Bergen and enjoyed spectacular scenery and drank pure water from waterfalls of melting snow. Saw isolated communities and the extension of Bergen by way of gorgeous housing built along the coastline. A must do in Bergen.

reviews.title: Superb- Deserves more than 5 stars
reviews.text:
We are a group of friends  above the age of 65 who travelled around the world extensively. During our travels we utilized the services of many good guides and travel companies. But after traveling with Bjorn and Norway Fjord travel ,I have to say that the best among others comes way behind Bjorn. He is undoubtedly the BEST.We always wanted to see Norway and our planning started in December. I had interacted with many guides but the moment I started my communication with Bjorn I knew that he is the right guy and after completing the tour I can confidently say that the end result is much beyond our expectations.
I sent him our itinerary with my knowledge( acquired from the net)and he fine tuned it to suit us to have a good experience. He advised us regarding the hotels and in a couple of places ,where we could not get a proper accommodation ,he helped us to get accommodation for in good places. His knowledge of Norway is immense- be it scenic roads, view points, history, culture, economy . He drove us for 9 days from May 27 to June 4th through enchanting Norway. He knew the lesser travelled roads with stunning sceneries. In Bergen we went with him into the Fjords in a RIB. He took us through Fjords into which the big ships were not able  go. We had the greatest time of our  lives during that ride. We went literally under a waterfall. If it was not for him we would have missed out some incredible parts. He is punctual & jovial. He is observant and sensitive to the needs, comforts and discomforts of travelers and tries his best to make everyone comfortable and at ease . His commentary mixed with humor during the journey about the scenic landscapes, made the journey interesting. Norway is a very beautiful country with Fjords, mountains, waterfalls and the pleasure of seeing it enhanced many fold, thanks to Bjorn, Robert and Norway Fjord travel.

reviews.title: Great adventure - whole family enjoyed
reviews.text: We did a half day trip along the Veafjorden. Bjorn and Robert were great guides and hosts. Easy pick up in center of Bergen and Robert was entertaining and interesting for the hour drive to drop off point at which point Bjorn took over. The boat ride was fun, fast and smooth! The survival suits are surprisingly comfortable, clean and keep you nice and warm! Bjorn knows this area like the back of his hand and it shows. Magical mystical scenery along unspoilt fjord waterways which gave all of us a sense of life in this beautiful but remote part of the world. Bjorn has a deep knowledge of Norwegian history, life and culture. We are all wildlife and bird enthusiasts - so Bjorn found wild swans, nesting gulls, swallows, and other bird life. All of us - including the three teenagers - give this trip an enthusiastic thumbs up!  A highlight of our visit to Bergen.

reviews.title: An amazing vacation Northern Lights - Snow Hotel
reviews.text:
We worked with Fjord Travel for the Northern Lights-Snow Hotel Adventure.  The staff were amazing to work with and very helpful and accommodating.  We customized the package and staff made it easy.  

When working with a third party, you never know what you to expect.  The arrangements were perfect. The lodging was comfortable and the excursions were fun and memorable.  We rarely use the services of a travel company when we travel; Fjord Travel enriched our trip and made the planning easy.

reviews.title: Tour was amazing!
reviews.text: This tour exceeded expectations. I was really amazed on everything. The fjords we're amazing. Bjorn was a great tour guide and did everything we wanted to do.

reviews.title: Fjords in a nutshell
reviews.text: I highly recommend this trip to anyone! Bjorn was very knowledgeable! Much more then I expected!!!!!

reviews.title: Private tour from Bergen to Flåm etc.
reviews.text: It was really a nice tour. Because we could not make the previous plan, the guide changed the plan taylored for us. We were guided to the mid between Flåm and Oslo to visit the hydroelectric plant first and then the waterfall. On the whole trip, the guid talked a lot about the scenes that were some origins of the movies, nice fishing places with historical stories and local culture as well. 👍

name: Bergen Body Work As
description: Bergen Body Work is a well established clinic since 2001 and are located in the middle of Bergen center. We have 10 therapists working together doing different types of massage therapy, as sports massage, swedish classic massage, tripper-point treatment, cupping, structural integration, Myo-fascial release and osteopathy treatment. Please visit our webpage for more information Online booking available 24/7. If you and your travel company like to have a treatment saturday/sunday when the clinic is not open, please give us a call or email us before you arrive Bergen, and we might be able to offer you sessions on the weekend.

reviews.title: Probably the best massage, ever!
reviews.text: While not a 'relaxing', nor spa-like atmosphere, if you have sore muscles from too much hiking or touristing around Norway, def book an appt with Kevin at Bergen Body Works. He spent 90 minutes inflicting therapeutic 'pain' that left me feeling re-energized, walking without pain (from arthritis/degeneration in lower back), and all around better than I have in years! I wish I lived in Bergen and would definitely make this a regular treatment!

reviews.title: Life changing
reviews.text: My daughter and I had the most skilled treatments:  I had a fascia massage and my daughter a medical deep tissue. These were the choices of the therapists, given our specific complaints of tightness. Wow— incredible! Wish we had these therapists at home!!!!

reviews.title: Sports massage
reviews.text: My massage therapist, Charlotte, does a great job understanding what my specific needs are. I always feel refreshed and improved body movement after the massage. I highly recommend.

reviews.title: Excellent service!
reviews.text: I had a great session with Thomas Ziembicki. The massage was effective and he was very knowledgeable about the current research on myofascial release, pain, etc. I left feeling good physically, but also better informed about ways I can manage chronic pain. I'll definitely be going back!

reviews.title: Fantastic Norwegian massage
reviews.text: One of the best massages and treatments I ever had - so professional and effective. Quite a strong and deep tissue massage that sorted out all our kinks in our backs.

reviews.title: Excellent sports massage
reviews.text: I was in desperate need of a massage following a long hike. Their website was easy to follow and easy to book. My massage therapist was very professional and did an excellent job. I'm going back next week!

reviews.title: excellent myofacial massage treatment!!!
reviews.text: extremely profound and sophisticated treatment Therese and also the other therapists were highly professional and kind and friendlyin an very warm, modern, tidy and welcoming environment

name: Norway Mountain Guides
description:
Norway Mountain Guides- Your guide for hiking and skiing. 
From the fjords to the mountains’ . We do trips in the mountains around Bergen, Hardanger, Voss and the Nærøyfjord. Summer and winter. Hiking, snowshoes, Ski touring, Ski & Sail, Cross country 360 days a year.
Our goal is to create a unique experience in the Norwegian untouched nature for you. 
www.norwaymountainguides.com

address_obj.street2: NOTE: We have no office at this adress, this is the adress for attendance to already booked hikes.

address: Strandkaien 3 NOTE: We have no office at this adress, this is the adress for attendance to already booked hikes., Bergen 5013 Norway

offer_list.title: Bergen Classic. Hiking from Mount Ulriken to Mt Floyen. Vidden trail.
Do as the locals Bergen hiking with Norway Mountain Guides
Best of Bergen view - Hiking with mountain guide
Ski Touring with Norway Mountain Guides.
Snowshoe hiking Bergen - Norway Mountain Guides

reviews.title: Vidden Trail-Bergen Classic
reviews.text: We met at the benches in front of the tourist office & Frank, our guide, was carrying a sign for Norway Mountain Guides. I arrived early & was a little nervous as I was traveling alone, but was quickly put at ease. Frank was very friendly & after filling out the appropriate paperwork we walked across the street to purchase a ticket on the first bus to the Ulriken Funicular as well as a ticket for the Funicular itself. This bus & Funicular ride were an additional fee. I think it was roughly 100 kr. The hike can proceed from Mt. Ulriken to Mt. Floyen or from Floyen to Ulriken & Frank suggested that we start in Ulriken. We boarded the bus & shortly after we arrived at the Funicular. We boarded the Funicular & up we went to the start of the hike. The views already were beautiful. Once we began hiking though it became clear why this is the most popular hike in Bergen! The views & landscape were magnificent!! It was hard to believe that we were directly above Norway’s 2nd largest city as the terrain was untouched, pristine & gave the impression of being in the complete wilderness. There were mountain lakes to swim in & mountain streams to drink from, there were herds of sheep & lush farmland below & rocky & moss covered terrain on the trail which made it easy to understand how the legends of the trolls were born. Every turn offered a more beautiful view & truly was unbelievable! Although we saw very few people along the 13km route it did become more frequented as the day progressed. It was a confusing path that was marked by piles of stones & the occasional directional sign. I was very pleased to have Frank with us. He was incredibly pleasant, knowledgeable & amenable. His primary goal was to make sure that we enjoyed the trail. He adjusted the pace according to our needs-speeding up & slowing down according to the terrain. It was an incredibly long hike but I left wanting more. At no point was I ready for this trail with its remarkable views to come to an end. Furthermore, the lively discussions along the trail were almost as interesting as the views. Frank doubled as a history, economics & sociology professor as our group, entirely made up of Americans, peppered him with questions about the Vikings, World War II, healthcare, infrastructure, commerce & industry, kindercare, maternity & paternity leave, the environment, the government, natural resources-you name it. Frank earned his stripes & gave us all an incredible understanding of the history & present day Norway as well as a love of the landscape. It was an extraordinary day!! I highly recommend Frank & would have done every hike he offered, but sadly we had scheduling conflicts. Next time for sure!!!!

reviews.title: Beautiful ulriken to floyen hike
reviews.text: Frank barman led a small group of us on this tour and it was gorgeous. We got very lucky with beautiful weather but what made it special was franks description of the geography as well as social, economic and political history of norway. We basically asked him every question under the sun during the leisurely almost full day hike and he was totally accommodating and was clearly very proud of his heritage. beautiful landscape and preservation of it. I would definitely recommend the hike and the flexibility offered makes it a good option for most as long as ypu have a decent fitness level. And bring layers!!

reviews.title: Amazing hike!
reviews.text: My family and I did a hike this morning with Frank and it was a truly breathtaking experience. I would recommend it to all adventurous travellers who love a good hike with beautiful sceneries throughout!

reviews.title: Hiking Mt Floyen
reviews.text:
We had a terrific time today hiking the trails above Bergen with our wonderful guide from Norway Mountain Guides, Birgitte.   

We were initially unsure if we wanted to hike by ourselves or take advantage of a local guide.  We decided a couple of days prior to our hiking day to book a guide on line.  Signing up was quick and easy and we got an immediate confirmation.  

We met Birgitte on time at the designated time and place.  It started well as she greeted us with a big smile and quickly engaged us in conversations about what we want to do during our hike.  We proceeded up the funicular with her placing us for a good view for the quick ride up.  

We initially thought of hiking the Vidden trail but she mentioned that trail was very wet due to recent weather and that she would recommend her personal favorite trails that would provide very beautiful panoramic views.  We took her up on this recommendation and we were both very happy that we did.  We saw some terrific vistas and the various trails were in decent hiking condition.

Birgitte also took good care of us.  She checked with us for any needed breaks, picked a picturesque mountain top for a lunch break and double checked that the trails were within our hiking ability.  

What put the trip in a top category, was Birgitte’s friendly personality and her relating her experiences growing up in and around Bergen.  

Norway Mountains Guides does recommend packing a knapsack for the changing weather in the area and the advice worked well.  Given all the special trails that we experienced, booking with Norway Mountain Guides turned out to be an excellent decision.  

All in all, a good day spent hiking!

reviews.title: Bergen Classic Hike
reviews.text: This was a great hike! My dad and I were lucky enough to be the only two on the hike for the day, and our guide (Frank) was wonderful enough to customize the hike to our needs and abilities. The hike was gorgeous and we learned a lot about the Norwegian and Bergen culture. I would highly recommended this hike if you want to get away from the busy tourist areas and see some more local and less busy trails. This will definitely be a hike I remember for a life time!

reviews.title: Great New company!
reviews.text: This is a new little company that guides active travelers through the natural beauties in western Norway. Our guide Frank, was knowledgeable, friendly and even provided some Norwegian delicacies like brown cheese and deli meat. We did the Island Hike near Bergen on a foggy day but the experience remains a highlight of our trip. You will learn about the nature, culture and quirks about your area of exploration. The hike was four hours in total, bring water-proof shoes. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great hike in Bergen
reviews.text: This was my first hike in Norway and we had a great experience with our guide Frank. He was extremely nice and gave us a lot of interesting info about Bergen, along with suggestions for other things to do in the area. The hike was very well paced. Unfortunately the fog was so heavy that we couldn’t see much at the summit, but I think Frank was more disappointed than we were! Would definitely recommend this experience to other travelers.

reviews.title: Amazing hike in Bergen
reviews.text: An absolutely amazing hike in Bergen today from Ulriken to Floyen which took about 5 hours with breaks in between. Our guide Brigitte was extremely professional and took care of us throughout the hike, ensuring the pace was ok. Would highly recommend it without a doubt.

reviews.title: Off the beaten path experience
reviews.text: When planning my trip to Bergen, I was hoping to find experiences outside of the city and the 7 surrounding mountains. I emailed Frank and told him the type of experience I was hoping for and he catered to that need. I had truly one of the most amazing experiences of my life. Frank took our group on a 30 minute drive to outside the city where we hiked along a local trail to see Osterfjord and Sørfjord. On our adventure, we only saw a few people who lived in the area. Frank was extremely knowledgable about the plant life and surrounding areas. Frank also was very good at pacing the group so that no one felt left behind or overly tired. Once we reached the top he had local snacks as well as things to sit on. He was extremely well prepared and some of the best hiking company I have ever had. I highly recommend booking with Frank! Thank you for everything.

reviews.title: Most incredible Bergen experience
reviews.text: I had high expectations for our day hike and they were blown out of the water. Our guide Frank was absolutely incredible- beyond nice, knowledgeable, and hospitable. Frank picked us up right in the center of Bergen and drove us out of the city to hike the beautiful Mt. Hananipa with views of Osterfjord and Sørfjord. The hike was perfectly catered to our physical abilities, and Frank did a wonderful job providing information about our surroundings. He even brought us traditional Norwegian snacks to try along the route! If you are looking for an off-the-beaten-path hiking experience beloved by the locals, you MUST book with Norwegian Mountain Guides. Would give more than five stars if I could! Perfect for everyone and worth every penny. Thanks Frank!

reviews.title: Amazing hike from Mt. Ulriken to Mt. Floyen
reviews.text: I booked a tour with Norway Mountain Guides to do the hike from Mount Ulriken to Mount Floyen. This was my first hike in a very long time, but my guide Lene was wonderful and very helpful. She was friendly, knew very well her way around the mountains and the paths, and provided a very interesting tour. I could go at my preferred pace, especially at the steepest parts of the routes. Some of the landscapes along the route were simply breathtaking. The whole tour took around 5h40, and it was one of the best experiences of my entire trip to Norway. Would highly recommend!

reviews.title: Wonderful Snow Shoeing Trip
reviews.text: Frank took my wife and me about 45 minutes outside of town to a beautiful area with fresh snow and we hiked groomed trails, then did hiking across virgin snow to an overlook of a beautiful Fjord.  Frank was patient, told us about the area, took us to see gorgeous beautiful scenery, then ended with a snack of real Norwegian food.  Probably the high light of our trip to Bergen - Wonderful Memories!!!!!!

reviews.title: A fun and cultural experience in the fjords!
reviews.text: Our hike with Frank was truly one of a kind. He is personable, funny, experienced, and extremely knowledgable about the area. He shared great stories and we learned a lot about the Norwegian culture. We hiked about 1/3 of the way before we put on our snow-shoes. Snowshoe-ing was awesome and very manageable for people of various hiking skill levels. I am not too experienced in hiking--but Frank paced us well and I did just fine! At the top of the mountain, there was a small little red barn that we ate lunch at. Frank packed a traditional Norwegian snack (brown cheese and tea!). The brown cheese with buttered bread was so delicious--went to a grocery store and bought some for myself! Definitely would book with Frank again!!

reviews.title: Bergen Hike
reviews.text: Frank was an excellent guide even with some typical Bergen weather.  He was knowledgeable and guided us with our safety in mind.  Would recommend to anyone wanting to see beautiful Bergen terrain.

reviews.title: Lots of fun snowshoeing up to a great view of Osterfjord
reviews.text: Frank was an excellent guide, and made sure we had different options planned depending on how the weather turned out. He picked us up by the harbor and gave us lots of wonderful insight into Norwegian culture and history on the 30min drive to Osterfjorden. We hiked first on foot, then switched to snowshoe for the last hour. Frank packed some great traditional Norwegian farm food, which we ate with a fantastic view of the fjord. The route was well off the beaten path, and we bumped into just one woman hiking with her dog, who mentioned that she rarely sees tourists in the area--so if you're looking to experience some alone time in the gorgeous Norwegian wilderness, look no further! Also, they offer a very nice student discount.

reviews.title: Great Adventure!
reviews.text: Took a guided hike with Frank and was very satisfied with the trip! He knows different mountains and surrounding area incredibly well. The day we went happened to be quite foggy and windy, but his experience made me feel safe and prepared. I highly reccomend going through Frank if you want to get outdoors and see Norway!

reviews.title: Ski Touring course at Kvamskogen
reviews.text: I had an excellent day ski touring with a small group guided by Frank. I am new to ski touring and I booked a one-day guided course and tour, which included thorough information on how to pack for ski touring, information about avalanches (what set them off and how to avoid them), practising avalanche search and rescue, as well as techniques for ski touring. As the group only consisted of 3 people, we got hands-on information and follow-ups. Although the weather was not great (foggy and rainy), we nonetheless had a nice trip and we gained valuable knowledge about ski touring. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is new to ski touring!

reviews.title: Snowshoe hiking
reviews.text:
What a wonderful day out Snowshoe hiking with Norway Mountain Guides.
Frank was fantastic and so helpful.
Unfortunately Bergen was having a little bit of a heatwave so snow was in very short supply but Frank couldn’t have been more helpful.
