He picked us up right outside of our hotel and we were driven further afield to seek out the snow. Nothing was too much trouble for Frank. He even brought along a packed lunch for us to sample typical Norwegian delicacies.
We ate lunch nearly at the top of the mountain where there was lots of snow and so peaceful, there was no one else around to spoil the peace and quiet.
Once we were back to the car and on the way home we even got to stop at a lovely waterfall that you could walk under without getting wet.
Frank then drove us back to our hotel after a great day out.
If you’re looking for Snowshoe hiking, skiing, or hiking around Bergen then you couldn’t do better than hiring Frank to show you a good time as he’s extremely knowledgeable.
Overall 10 out of 10. A superb day out.

reviews.title: Ski Touring near Voss
reviews.text: We had an excellent day with Frank out in wild Norway ski touring. We encountered all sorts of weather but the scenery was fantastic. Frank was a wonderful guide. Very conscious on safety and excellent teacher passing on his expertise and knowledge of the local area. He gives you all the right information and guidance so eventually you can explore the area yourself. His enthusiam and passion is contagious. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend him to anyone.

reviews.title: Custom ski tour
reviews.text: I'm new to ski touring. My girlfriend and I wanted to experience the high mountains in Western Norway but we only had two days in Norway to do it. Our other goals were to see a glacier and a fjord. My guide Ole informed me that those goals are best experienced separately, skiing near the water isn't as nice due to the warm humid air that is generated by the sea. Skiing near the sea is best in there very far north of Norway. And glaciers are very remote in the southern part of Norway. Ultimately we focused on just the skiing. Ole organized two separate day tours in the Voss area. Each day we skinned from the car to the mountain ridge, then did some exploration and finally skied back to the car. On our second day we skied with a beautiful dog that lived at a local farm and makes his living showing skiers how to get to the summit and back safely in exchange for belly rubs and treats. Though we did not see fjords or glaciers from the slopes, Ole did drive me to Gudvangen to see Nærøyfjord, I appreciated the detour. Ole was knowledgable about the history of the area and most importantly about wilderness rescue based his resume of past courses. Fortunately, we never had to practice those skills. I found what he had to say about the Norwegian resistance in WWII fascinating. On our last day, my girlfriend took the train to Bergen to explore the art museums while we skied. Ole went above and beyond to drive me to Bergen to rendezvous with her. All in all it was a great experience, Ole was thurough in his planning and flexible with the plans when needed.

reviews.title: Ski Touring near Voss
reviews.text: Had a great day with Frank exploring some backcountry terrain. Frank shared lots of his knowledge on terrain management and safety considerations throughout the day, which was really appreciated. Thanks Frank!

reviews.title: Snowshoeing in Bergen
reviews.text: Snowshoeing was amazing fun with Frank would absolutely recommend! We called the day before and he picked us up at the accommodation the next morning, we drove 30 minutes outside of Bergen to snowy paradise. We spent then 3 hours or so snowshoeing up the mountain, it was so much fun and a great way to spend our last day in Norway- it was the best thing we did when there! Frank provided all the equipment that we needed, it was worth every penny

reviews.title: Snowshoe hike
reviews.text:
We phoned Frank the day before and he was super helpful over the phone, he even picked us up straight from our accommodation when we told him we were carrying heavy luggage. The snowshoe hike was amazing, great views over the fjords, and Frank is very knowledgable and easygoing.

Worth the money for sure

reviews.title: Great trip! Worth every Penny
reviews.text:
We called Frank the night before to see if he was available for the next day (Saturday) he said he would be happy to take us out even though it was typically his day off. 

Frank is a fantastic guide with extensive knowledge of the area both historically and culturally and did a great job communicating his knowledge in English. The trip was totally customizable based on your needs/wants and my brother and I ended up spending somewhere between 6-8hrs walking/talking/taking in the sites.

I will absolutely book Frank again on my next visit (hopefully soon) and look forward to grabbing a cold one afterwards as well!

Thanks again Frank!

reviews.title: Gullbotn snowshoe hike
reviews.text: Our hike with Norway Mountain Guides led by Frank was second to none. Frank is an experienced and passionate outdoor explorer which can be seen through his guided hikes. Frank is brilliant at adapting the hikes to suite the abilities of his clients and is very informative around any questions of the Norwegian culture. This company is highly recommended! A must do when visiting Bergen or even Norway!

reviews.title: When in Norway do as the Norwegians do, so we went Cross Country skiing / Try-IT with Frank and we loved it.
reviews.text: My husband and I were hoping to try some cross country skiing during our stay in Bergen and were lucky enough to come across the Norway Mountain Guides. Our guide Frank got in touch with us very quickly and also called us the day before to go through the details of our trip. Both of us are near to complete beginners when it comes to skiing and Frank's instructions were second to none and we both managed to complete a full circuit. As well as being an expert skier, Frank is also very friendly and interesting guy to talk to. We highly recommend this trip to everyone thinking of enjoying the great Norwegian outdoors.

reviews.title: Fantastic snowshoe hike !
reviews.text: We did a great snowshoe hike thanks to Franck. He has been very attentive, kind and respectful and he has a lot of knowledge about his country and his culture. This experience marked our journey. It was a great pleasure to share this moment of conviviality!

reviews.title: Bergen classic
reviews.text: Extremely good trip first time in Bergen seeing mountains,tour guide was very easy to get along with and had vast knowledge off all the areas. Nice touch to bring extra clothing and food for myself. I was stuck in Bergen due to not being able to go offshore so thought I would do something cool. After speaking with the guide frank he helped with every aspect from travel from hotel and what to wear etc. Couldn’t of asked for a better person and will defiantly be doing more tours with this company

reviews.title: City Mountain Hike
reviews.text: We had a great New Year’s Day walk with Frank. The trip was completely tailored to our needs and fitness level. I always say the view is the best at the top and this trip did not disappoint. There was even a Christmas tree at the peak where we stopped for some brown cheese and tea made by Frank our tour leader. Highly recommended and thank you for starting our 2019 on a high!

reviews.title: Amazing views with the perfect guide
reviews.text: We had 4 days in Bergen, out of all the “things to do” we booked on TripAdvisor, this was by far the best! If you are looking for a personal tour through the mountains where you see waterfalls and lakes on your way to the top, Frank is the perfect guide. You will not find better views! Once we reached the top over looking the harbour and islands, Frank provided a really nice hot drink and we were able to try some local brown cheese. I will be booking another tour with Frank when I return. Thank you for providing an amazing experience on our trip to Bergen!

reviews.title: Awesome hiking expierence with a great host
reviews.text: Found this company on Google and contacted the host via Email. The communication was smooth and everything worked out just fine. Since we didnt want to book a commercial hike, this company was the perfect solution. He took us to some awesome spots and made the whole expierence magical. Highly recommended from us. Thanks again! Cheers.

reviews.title: Awesome! Superb! Liked!
reviews.text:
I had a fabulous hiking experience with Frank Barmen. Very lucky me to be guided by so experienced guide! 

I travel alone and decided on one hiking for my trip. After my first hiking session in Bergen with Frank, I just immediately change my other day schedule to do another hiking before leaving Bergen! 

During the hike, I get to know not only  a lot of knowledge on mountains, fjord and hiking, I also learn a lot about Norwegian, Bergen, etc etc etc. 

Flexibility —> “Bergen Classic Hike” to Ulrika is not possible coz of the very bad weather and cable car was closed. But Frank give me a few options to choose from and it was just perfect.

Frank is very experience, helpful and  safety conscious guide.  I feel very safe and fun being guide by him. I manage to hike 3 of the 7 mountains and also Kolbeinsvarden mountain that mostly only local will do. Great experience for me! 

Thank you Frank for my wonderful time  in Bergen.

Hope the review is useful and you enjoy the photos!

reviews.title: New Year’s Day City Mountains Trek
reviews.text:
We had a fantastic hike with Frank it was the perfect way to spend New Years Day and our last day in Bergen.
Frank allowed us to tailor our hike throughout offering different routes, views and difficultly levels. 
I would highly recommend Frank to friends, family, travellers and tourists of all ages and fitness levels!
Great company, great stories, great Norwegian refreshments, great route; all round 5 stars ⭐️

reviews.title: Topptur kurs
reviews.text:
Flott og lærerikt kurs, med god lærdom selv for en som har litt erfaring.
Frank bidrar til trygghet og en god atmosfære.

reviews.title: Superbe randonnée en raquettes
reviews.text: Franck est un super guide, il nous a permis de visiter les montagnes autour de Bergen d'une façon exceptionnelle et hors des sentiers battus. On le remercie pour sa gentillesse, son écoute et son enthousiasme. À très bientôt.

reviews.title: Kurs om HMS i vinterfjellet
reviews.text: Gjennomførte kurs med instruktør Frank som lærte oss det grunnleggende om det å gå på tur i vinterfjellet. Veldig bra kurs som tok for seg det viktigste, og som gjorde at jeg nå føler meg mer klar og ikke minst tryggere når jeg skal spenne på meg skiene neste gang.

reviews.title: HMS i vinterfjellet
reviews.text: Kurset var veldig informativt og bra. Her lærte jeg mange smarte tips og triks for mine neste topptur-eventyr. Frank viser en allsidig kunnskap og jeg blir gjerne med på kurs med han igjen. Anbefales!

reviews.title: Grunnkurs, HMS i vinterfjellet
reviews.text: Hadde eit par gode timar på kurs hjå Barmen no i desember. Mykje gode tips, forhåndsreglar og god stemning. Tok seg god tid til å fylgje opp alle spm, og vart også igjen ei god stund etter kurs for å svare ivrige deltakarar. Anbefalast!

reviews.title: Kurs
reviews.text: Var på foredrag med Frank om HMS i vinterfjellet hvor det ble snakket om hva en må tenke på, hvilket utstyr, osv man bør ha med seg på tur på vinteren. Det levnet ingen tvil om at Frank er en mann med mye og bred erfaring innenfor sitt felt, noe jeg hadde stort utbytte av å høre på. Om jeg skal ha meg en guidet tur på ett senere tidspunkt så er det med Norway Mountain Guides og Frank Barmen som guide som valget faller på!

reviews.title: HMS I fjellet teori kurs.
reviews.text:
Frank er en utrolig dyktig og kunnskapsrik kurs holder. Veldig kjekt, informativt og lærerikt. Anbefales for den som ønsker litt mere kunnskap om skred, utstyr, ferdsel osv, som kanskje ikke har så mye kunnskap fra før. 

Tommel opp.

name: Martins Bergen Tours
description: Martins Bergen Tours offers guided walking tours (in german and english). Everyone can participate. City tours, Bryggen tours take place throughout the year.

offer_list.title: City Walking Tour - Bergen On Foot

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Martins Bergen Tours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: A really excellent way to see Bergen.
reviews.text: It was a wonderful way to see the highlights of Bergen. Martin was extremely informative and was able to answer everything the group asked him. We were lucky enough to take the the tour on a sunny day which added to the enjoyment. The 2.5hrs flew by and we learnt such a lot about this beautiful city. After the tour we carried on wandering through the streets and ended up at Bakeri Bar Mat on Marken street where we enjoyed a wonderful cake and friendly service.

reviews.title: Friendly and so informative!
reviews.text:
Admittedly I was a little dubious about the walking tour before starting because it was the only one we saw on VisitBergen.com. But I couldn’t have asked for a better experience! Martin was courteous and incredibly knowledgeable about the city and its history. I doubt I’d have learned anything about its Hanseatic history otherwise and that’s really the history of the city and Bryggen in particular. I also wouldn’t have known about the famous artists, certainly not much. 

I also enjoyed hearing about Martin’s personal experiences living in Norway as an immigrant and particularly about his time in the north just by the Russian border. 

The walking is not very difficult with frequent (but not so frequent you feel “stuck” in an area) stops and Martin is deceptive to questions. I did the English tour and just like everyone else in Norway Martin is fluent. If you go with Martin you are in for a treat; we’re very glad we did!

reviews.title: This was a great walking tour to introduce us to Bergen
reviews.text: My husband and I took Martin's tour on a cruise ship stop in Bergen.  This was our first visit and we learned a lot on the tour.  It was raining off an on and was quite cold but Martin never let up.  Since it was our only day we were glad he kept to the plan and showed us everything.  He was funny and informative...his love of Bergen really showed.  Booking ahead is needed since he turned people away keeping the number to a small group so everyone could hear and keep up.  Take this tour!

reviews.title: Excellent walking tour
reviews.text: Martin’s walking tour was a great way to start off our visit to Bergen. The 2.5 hour tour covered many locations in central Bergen and the Bryggen area. Martin was very engaging, informative and knowledgeable. He provided a good overview of Bergen’s history and present day, which he knew very well. The groups are held to 16 people max so it is quite personal and we had lots of opportunity to ask questions. He even sprinkled in some helpful tips (e.g., wait until after 3:00 to take the funicular after the cruise ships have left). Well worth the price.

reviews.title: Informative walking tour at a great pace!
reviews.text:
Bergen is beautiful.   We had wandered around the day prior and it was only after we took part of Martins tour we knew how much we would have missed if we had roamed around by ourselves..

Super informative and friendly, can not recommend highly enough.

reviews.title: Very informative
reviews.text: Martin’s tour was a great way to see a big chunk of Bergen and learn heaps of things about the city.

reviews.title: A great tour in a beautiful city
reviews.text: The two and a half hour tour seemed to fly by as Martin had so much to show us and so much knowledge to share with us! Would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Bergen as we would have missed so much of the culture and history had we not met Martin.

reviews.title: GREAT!!
reviews.text: Martin is outside of the tourist information office at 10 AM and collects anyone there who is interested in taking his 2 1/2 hour trip. We felt it very worthwhile and enjoyed the information he shared as well as places he took us. We were a group of three and one of us was a wheelchair user. The cobblestones fwas a bit of a challenge but other than that the tour is very user-friendly for full-time wheelchair users.  It rains almost constantly in Bergen… Several times during the day so be sure to pack rain gear and an umbrella.

reviews.title: Many thanks for a great introduction to Bergen
reviews.text: Martins was well informed and entertaining in sharing the history and life in the city. The pace of the tour was perfect.  Martins was also helpful in suggesting restaurants and how best to spend our time in the city.  The tour is well worth the time to get orientated in Bergen.

reviews.title: Informative way to get to know Bergen
reviews.text: I was very lucky as there were only four of us on the tour. I am not usually a fan of walking tours but the guide paced it really well and it did not feel like a three hour walk. The German guide had brilliant English, not just the language but the cultural nuances. He was able to adapt really well to the mood and interests of the group, giving us lots of information and answering all and any questions, He also gave some good general suggestions about Bergen including a restaurant recommendation which proved to be really good. We went from Grieg to A-ha and had an invaluable orientation of the city, spanning many centuries. It really helped with the rest of my visit.

reviews.title: Great introduction to the city!
reviews.text: We did this walking tour a few weeks ago on a delightfully sunny day and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Martin was an excellent guide, we appreciated the restaurant recommendations he made along the way (which did not disappoint) along with his deep knowledge about the city. We saw (and understood) much more of the city than we would have if we just wandered around on our own, it was well worth our time.

reviews.title: Great introduction to Bergen!
reviews.text: Incredibly knowledgeable and engaging.  Shared the well know facts along with some of the lesser known history.  Thanks for a great tour Martin!

reviews.title: Get an insight into this fascinating city and its history
reviews.text: Martin gave us a wonderful tour of Bergen covering aspects of food, history, culture, industry and tradition. Nicely paced with time for questions. Many thanks for sharing your love of Norway in a light and welcoming way.

reviews.title: Worst walking tour I have done
reviews.text: We found it hard to find the usual free walking tours in Bergen. Most of them were paid and we were unsure which one to pick. We went with this one eventually because it covered both the new areas of the city and Bryggen. The guide was the worst I've had and failed to engage the crowd. Bad decision. Reading a Wikipedia page would leave you with more information. Go with some other tour.

reviews.title: Excellent, interesting tour
reviews.text: Martin gave the best walking tour we've ever been on.  He fit a lot of intesting and varied info into the 2.5 hours without overloading us.  The pace was calm but the coverage thorough.  We would highly recommend this tour to everyone, whether you are short on time or not, it is well worth it.  And a very reasonable price too, good value.

reviews.title: Easy to understand and great information
reviews.text: Easy to understand and great information.  Martin was very nice, started on time and limited the number of guests. He gave good info, but not too much, moved the group along and I really enjoyed checking out Bergen.  He also gave info on non-tourist food spots and answered lots of questions I had on hiking, festival and other areas in Norway.

reviews.title: Fabulouz !!
reviews.text: Highly informative tour laced with humor. Had a whale of a time. Gr8 value for $$. Would highly recomd.

name: The Room Bergen
description: Real life escape game in Bergen. The Room is an interactive adventure game, ideally for groups of 4-10 persons. Explore your surroundings, find the clues, solve the riddles and crack the codes; to finally open the last and most important door! Attentiveness, tactical thinking and team work are skills you will need! Have you got what it takes to escape The Room? Price: 300 NOK per person if you are 4 people or more.

reviews.title: A great gift
reviews.text:
We were given tickets to this as a gift. We were one adult and two children, 11 and 14 and we chose the speakeasy room.

We solved it with two clues and ten minutes to go and it was an exciting activity that we were all part of.

name: Fonnafly Helicopter Sightseeing Bergen
description: Norway MUST be seen from the skies. See beautiful Bergen and its surrounding areas from a birds eye view. Located a 15 minute walk from the harbor. We do everything from local flights, to longer custom built flights. Our most popular tours are 45, 60 and 90 minutes sightseeing tours. This gives us the possibility to show you what Norway and Bergen have to offer. See our NEW online booking on our website to see more of our offers and prices. We advise everyone to order the tours directly from our website to get the best experience ant price. We also recommend that you read the information provided on our website. If you do not find them, please send us an email.

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Fonnafly Helicopter Sightseeing Bergen tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Great experience! Loved it!
reviews.text: We took a tour to Troll tongue and we are absolutely happy! Our pilot Kasper showed himself as a very professional and super easy-to-talk person. Views were breathtaking and  all route was fantastic. Kasper made a circle around Tongue, so we could take pictures and video. But, to tell the truth most wonderful views were not the from above the Tongue, but during the way there and back. I definitely recommend everybody to try - unforgettable experience!

reviews.title: Expensive but totally exhilarating!
reviews.text: Our cruise ship stopped in Bergen for a day and I searched Tripadvisor for a local heli tour.  There is actually only one shop in town, about eight min drive from the Bergen center.  We were lucky to secure a spot in the afternoon, a 1.5 hr flight over fjords, mountain, and glacier.  The weather could not be any better, supposely the warmest day in history.  The area the flight covered would have taken us more than a moth to drive, and most of the area even not accessible by car.  It was truly a breathtaking trip!  Very expensive, but a life time experience if you are lucky with the weather.

reviews.title: Amazing flight!
reviews.text: Worth every penny. The pilot Kasper was very professional and had a good sense of humour. Did the trolltunga tour up over the glacier and was in the air for what felt like ages. Would 100% recommend if you visit Bergen

reviews.title: Spectacular views!
reviews.text: We flew with Ivgne over the fjords and glacier outside of Bergen. It was the most gorgeous flight ever!  The amazing beauty of Norway is even more spectacular from this view and the ride was smooth and comfortable. This is a must-do when in Bergen

reviews.title: Sunny Day Delight
reviews.text: A simply incredible 90-minute flight in the mid-afternoon on a sunny day.  We had an incredible tour of the area including the glacier and many other sights.  I/we cannot recommend this flight group any higher - the service and friendliness of the staff made for a great experience.

reviews.title: ‘Blown away’
reviews.text: I’ve been in plenty helicopters, but it was my kids first. Did the research and was thrilled with everything. Super accomodating, great piloting, great views. Absolute must for anyone visiting Bergen wanting to see the ultimate perspective of the Fjords, Bergen and Norway generally. Was difficult weather but they boys knew the best time to fly and nailed it. Great flight, great memories, smiles all round 🙏

reviews.title: Bird's Eye View
reviews.text: Our flight with Fonnafly was the experience of a lifetime!  We were picked up by Henry, our very kind and friendly driver who is studying to be a pilot himself.   His enthusiasm for flying was infectious, so our time in the van was the perfect precursor to our flight.  Once we arrived we met our pilot Yngve and got our first glimpse of the beautiful red bird that would carry us through the skies.  We had booked the 90 minute Trolltounge tour, but there was bad weather approaching so we trusted Yngve to adjust our flight path to both keep us safe and wow us with beautiful sights.  He did not disappoint!  Thank you again Henry and Yngve, we loved every minute of our adventure!!

reviews.title: Fonnafly the only way to see Norway!
reviews.text:
My wife and I had the great fortune to travel from Bergen to Storfjord Hotel by helicopter today with Fonnafly. 

The transfer from the city center to Fonna’s helipad was about five minutes, rather than 30-40 minutes to go to the airport. 

We met our pilot Ingvar, his crew member Damon and Henry who we booked things with.

We had amazing weather and an incredible flight! Ingvar was an exceptional pilot with an excellent knowledge of the landscape and the various villages and Fjords we flew over.

We highly recommend Fonnafly and they will be our go to company next time we are in Norway!

Thanks to Ingvar and Damon for an excellent transport!

reviews.title: Best Experience in Norway
reviews.text:
It is the best way to have a view on Bergen, fjords and Pulpit Rock.
The whole trip in the helicopter is quite steady although the weather is not good. Very experienced pilot.

reviews.title: A Must-Do in Bergen!
reviews.text:
My wife and I did a 90-minute flight with Fonnafly out of Bergen this morning and it was TERRIFIC.  Driver picked us up alright at our cruise ship and took us straight to the heliport. Flew the fjords and up to the glacier.  The pilot (Kjell) had lots of experience and made it a great flight, pointing out interesting locations.  The time flew by (sorry for the pun) - we got to see Norway as few do.

Its not an inexpensive outing, but is worth every penny: in part because when flying helicopters you want the best (not the cheapest!!), ands in part because it’s truly a once in a lifetime experience.

Highly recommended, without reservation.

reviews.title: A day to remember!
reviews.text: I surprised my father with a 45 minute helicopter ride. The pilot was really good and gave us a flight that will stay with us for all the years to come! It was amazing to see our hometown from another point of view and the nature was simply breathtaking. If you are able to go on a ride like this, you will really not regret it!

reviews.title: No better way to enjoy the natural beauty of Bergen and Surroundings...
reviews.text: Great machine, Great crew. Great overall experience. We opted for pickup from the hotel, so everything worked out perfectly. We, a family of four does helicopter tours on all our trips and this was the best ever.  The view of the glacier lakes and fjords from a helicopter is something to remember for a long time. Thank you Fonnafly.

reviews.title: Amazing flight! Yes, it worth it!
reviews.text: Amazing crew, flight and machine! Our best helicopter flight ever!! It was highly expensive, because we choose the EC-120 to fly, of course the R-66 would be cheaper, but you forget about the money after viewing the Fjords from above, can't describe it... The bird was the LN-ODF and we got very luck there because the weather helped a lot with  clouds scattered and high, with a great view of the landscape. Thanks for the ride FonnaFly!!

reviews.title: Fantastic helicopter tour of Bergen
reviews.text: From start to end this was a fantastic morning. From chatting about the equipment, to the tour, commentary and the lovely friendly pilot and assistant. Made feel at ease immediately. A first time but definitely not the last! We have the bug! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

reviews.title: Great trip.  Loved it.  Boys gave two thumbs up.
reviews.text: Take the 45 min flight (or longer).  Great view of the fjords.  Won’t forget it.  Do it when the mountains are snow dusted.  Great views and photographs.

reviews.title: A MUST DO.
reviews.text: This trip was spontaneous, unplanned.  Called and reached pilot about 16:30. Entire company was on holiday trip to Poland and he was last pilot leaving next morning 06:30. We met just in time for lift off. The trip was the 90 minute and was spectacular. We viewed sunsetting above clouds for an unforgettable experience. Flight was comfortable, and pilot was extremely friendly and hospitable. We have flown on many heli rides but this was the BEST! Highly recommended.

reviews.title: The best way to see Norway
reviews.text: My husband and I took this heli-tour as part of our honeymoon. It was brilliant. We love helicopters and have done tours in numerous places in the world but this one was really special. Casper (sorry if that's not how you spell it!), our pilot, was confident and a really lovely guy. He made us feel welcome and relaxed. The tour itself was incredible - we flew over the glacier and up to Trolltunga, and Casper pointed out an eagle. If you can afford this tour then definitely do it. If you can't afford this tour, then save up and do it! Worth every penny. One of the most beautiful places on Earth and one of the best ways to travel combined - what's not to like? If we are ever in Bergen again we would do this again. Simply awesome.

reviews.title: Worth doing it
reviews.text: We just enjoyed the tour. Casper the young pilot is very good and experienced and showed us great views. If you want to have an idea of the fjords’ shape that is the best way . We highly suggest it

reviews.title: Experience of a Lifetime!
reviews.text: If I could give 6 stars, I would! What an unbelievable experience and the staff was tremendously accommodating to my requests; I asked for an alternative drop point to Cornelius Restaurant, rather than back to Bergen, and they had no problem making it happen. This was worth every last penny and recommend taking a longer trip for the full experience (we did the Trolltunga/Glacier full 90 min. tour). Later that evening, I actually randomly had drinks with a few pilots stationed in Bergen later that evening and even they reiterated Fonnafly is the top company to use for helicopter rides. Don't hesitate, book!

reviews.title: Ride of a Lifetime
reviews.text:
We had an amazingly positive experience with the staff. They accommodated our travel schedule and we’re trying to help us as well with incoming poor weather. 

So we left a day early on a 90 minute ride of a lifetime. The pilot was patient and courteous. We are not big talkers, and he ensured we saw all the pertinent details as he flew us over the most lovely sites imaginable. 

I want to send a hearty Thank You to the staff and pilot for making this an experience of a lifetime!

reviews.title: EPIC Helicopter Ride
reviews.text: Our Pilot Casper was supernconfident and made us feel totally relaxed. It was a long flight time 90 mins and he made it really special. The Fjords, the Forrest’s, the Glacier! Thanks so much from my Wife and me!

reviews.title: Excellent views
reviews.text: We took the 90 minute run from Bergen to the glacier, and Trolltunga.Casper (the friendly Pilot) was very polite, knowledgeable about the area. Professional in every way.I would highly recommend this tour. As in everything in Norway, it is expensive. But worth every penny!

reviews.title: helicopter ride in bergen fiords
reviews.text:
the helicopter ride was amazing eventhough we did not make it to the glaciers because of low clouds.
we took the fiords cruise by the sea a day before, but this one is much more exciting.

reviews.title: great bar and very friendly service
reviews.text:
was here for the week bar manager was super friendly and very good to talk to ,
he has alot of experiance and is well travelled try thier clover club you will fall in love.

reviews.title: Best bar ever?
reviews.text: Went here for a quick drink after seeing great reviews and was greeted by a really friendly bartender handing us menus and giving us cucumber water(how great is that??), the menus are really easy to understand and descriptive of the ingredients and the staff is super friendly. After a while the owner came in and shook everybodys hand, i've never had an experience like this and we came back again a few days later to the same great hospitality tho a bit more busy, but that is expected with such great cocktails. Next time we return to Bergen we will definitely be back, 'cause ive never had any better!

reviews.title: Best cocktails super friendly and Nice atmosphere
reviews.text: Definitely a must visit place in Bergen! Very tasty cocktails and super friendly welcome in the bar!!

reviews.title: Must-visit, generosity and hospitality in Bergen
reviews.text: On our last night in Bergen, we popped in after eating at Litteraturhuset down the road. It was very early on a Wednesday night, so we weren't expecting very much action, but we were wrong! Roberto immediately welcomed us with a big smile and introduced us to the menu. Not only did he recommend a fantastic local Gin, he made fantastic conversation with us for 30 minutes about his life in Norway and in Spain, and his love for his work came through very clearly. Many times, bars can be boring or uninspired but Last Monkey felt warm, welcoming and (especially for Norway) well worth the money! Thank you Roberto for making our last night in Bergen end on such a great note!

reviews.title: The most genuine, amazing atmosphere
reviews.text:
We landed in Bergen at midnight and went to this bar at 1am on Friday evening (Saturday morning) 
We were welcomed by Roberto and he was amazing. So welcoming. So genuine. So helpful. 
He automatically smiled, welcomed us, explained the bar and spent time expanding the city to us. 

He would amazing and it made the experience of last monkey one we will not forget. And we will be going back again! 

The yummiest cocktails and made me love and passion!

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.text: Fantastic cocktails, and the bartender is incredibly friendly and helpful. The chilly gingertini is superb. Definitely come here!

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Norway Active tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Biking and hiking oh my
reviews.text: Norway active was incredibly helpful in setting up a number of activities for me and my family. Particular shout out to Knut at Bergen Bike rent who arranged for me to have a bike for four hours so I could explore Bergen on my terms. They also conveniently had a couple of great maps which made it easy to find my way around. Will definitely use them again if I come back to Norway-which I absolutely hope to do!

reviews.title: AMAZING way to experience Norway
reviews.text: We had 1 day in Norway (WAY to short)  Norway Active put together an amazing day.  Train from Bergen, Flam railroad, Fjord safari and back to Bergen.  I would suggest adding a kayak or a river raft!  I wish I did - I wanted more Norway.  We had water and snacks with us in case the schedule got tight.  But ended up having time in Flan to grab a coffee and snack.  Be ready for a full day!

reviews.title: A beautiful and fun day!
reviews.text: Me and my gal did the train, bike, speed/safari boat, kayak version and had a great experience with very good guides.  Read what they send you and be prepared because it is a busy day with excellent views, a fun easy 11 km bike ride, a fast and interesting safari boat ride, and an easy paddle if the wind is not blowing.  Rain is common in Norway so bring good gear and some snacks as it is a full day. The food break during kayaking was very good and the guide was very informative and also gave good advice on a nice place to stop for a beer when they give you a ride back to Voss.  Remember its Norway active and not Norway coach potato so be prepared by having a good breakfast and bringing some snacks and water and read what they send you. A great value for the cost.

reviews.title: Full Fjord Experience
reviews.text: We booked a full fjord experience consisting of Flam train, mountain biking, Fjord Safari and rafting with Voss Aktive. The all day was quite busy but perfectly arranged. Quality of the activities was very high. All in all I would highly recommend it. The experience is not cheap but in my view of good quality price ratio. Thanks Norway Active for making our stay really memorable.

reviews.title: Nice biking tour
reviews.text: I had a lovely day biking.This is my third time in Norway and first time to Bergen. This was fun, informative and Knut was awesome. I would recommend this experience for all!

reviews.title: Worst organised tour. Poor value for money.
reviews.text:
I wanted give some feedback regarding the standard extra fjord tour that my friends and I participated in.

We were extremely disappointed by the level of organisation of this tour. Throughout the entire day we found ourselves confused due to the lack of communication from the company and found ourselves unprepared for the activities of the day. 

We picked up our train tickets from Bergen the previous day to depart at 6.51am the day of the tour. Despite having read all the guidance materials we were shocked to discover that we wouldn’t have a chance to eat anything until 3.30pm. This is completely unreasonable and a prime example of a poorly structured tour experience. 

We’d have happily purchased some food in Flam but did not have a chance as we were told we were late to each place and asked to rush from one activity to the other. After meeting our “guide” in Berkevam we were assigned our bikes and given some vague instructions on how to get to the meeting point in Flam. However we didn’t receive any further information on how the day would be structured/how we would be transported or how we’d collect our luggage. The lack of direction from the guide was appalling. 

Upon arrival in Flam we were pointed in the direction of the Fjord Safari, again, with very little information or communication.

The worst part was when we finished the fjord safari, now starving, and were told we didn’t even have time to go to the toilet because we were late to the kayak briefing. The kayak instructor was initially quite annoyed that we were late - even though this was in no way our fault. He was more understanding when he realised it was Norway Active guide that delivered us late and gave us zero guidance.  

We were in no way prepared for the kayak expedition (as no information on what to wear/bring along was provided). By the time we started we were wet and hungry - definitely not how you want to feel after spending so much money. 

The kayak instructor pulled us over for the “BBQ lunch” we were told we’d receive which turned out to be some grilled chicken on a portable cooker and some wraps with a few cookies. We would have been fine with this food, however what we don’t appreciate is the misleading information from the organisation that a BBQ lunch would be included. 

Even the final leg of the journey for us (to get back to Voss) was not at all clear as we were told we’d get a mini van but had no idea with who or where to meet them. Even the tour instructor who suggested we take their van back to Voss didn’t seem to know they were responsible for us. We only found out our luggage had been stored in a specific place because our friend went hunting for it. 

My understanding of this tour service is that they assist us with aggregating these activities from different tour providers, yet we were made to feel like it was our fault for being late or not eating - even though this was due to poor organisation from their team. I actually don’t have any complaints to each of the individual operators of the tours - only with Norway Active’  service which was to help us organise the day smoothly. 

This activity was by no means a cheap one for us and for what we paid we expected an exceptional standard. In Australian dollars this was over $500!!!  What we received was completely underwhelming. 

I wrote this feedback to the company as they asked for it and their response was equally terrible. Defensive response written in barely discernible English. They passed blame to all their operators and told me they don’t normally get complaints implying it was our fault. 

Save your money and don’t use them!

reviews.title: Enjoyed the tour, customer service was lacking
reviews.text: I did the full tour so rafting, the trains, Fjord Safari, biking, all that jazz. I had an amazing time, the activities were fun and we'll organized, however I did have one issue. Because no one else wanted to do rafting on the same day as me I had to switch my day, that's fine I didn't mind but I asked if I could switch my tour to a completely different day and Knut (the booking manager) has a habit of not answering every question if you send multiple in an email an he also doesn't proofread his emails before sending them so if you ask the same question more than once he gets annoyed at you. I asked if I could switch the day of my tour he did answer but I couldn't understand what he said so I asked again and he sent a very passive aggressive email that was not appreciated. Also I was under the impression that the bike tour was to be guided and it wasn't and the directions were vague. We didn't get any time in the Viking village which was disappointing. All my complaints aside I would definitely do the tour again, I did have a blast.

reviews.title: Biking in Bergen
reviews.text: I had a lovely day biking with Knut.... I have been to Norway a lot and also to Bergen, but have never taken a tour.  This was really fun, informative and Knut was awesome.  I would highly recommend this experience for all!

reviews.title: Excellent Coffee
reviews.text:
We stopped at Kaffekompaniet after returning from Mt. Fløyen.  We got a couple cappuccinos.  They tasted great and gave us a much-needed pickup.

The drinks were available in to-go cups, and the barista was friendly.  We definitely enjoyed the drinks and only wished they were larger.  It was great to be able to enjoy them while exploring the city.

If you are looking for some good coffee in Bergen, Kaffekompaniet is an excellent choice.

reviews.title: Good Coffee
reviews.text: We stop by after our funicular ride.   Good coffee and cake.  Sat outside to enjoy the fresh cold air, a real delight.

reviews.title: Lovely hot drinks and cake, relaxed and cosy atmosphere
reviews.text: We came here twice on our 3 day trip to Bergen, as the cake and hot drinks were so good and it is so close to the Floibanen Funicular. While a little pricey, the drinks were lovely, the staff are very friendly and the carrot cake is a must! This makes it definitely worth your time and money. A cosy place to get some shelter from the rain. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: The place is cozy and inviting, especially on a wet foggy day. The mocha latte with oat milk and biscuit with sea salt and dark chocolate were both divine.

reviews.title: Lovely!
reviews.text: Lovely cosy little cafe just off the beaten track. Food simple but delicious! Definitely worth a visit!

reviews.title: Best coffee in Bergen
reviews.text: Had a really good flat white and cappuccino, skillful bariastas. If you are looking for a good coffe I recommend this place.

reviews.title: Cute coffee spot
reviews.text: Cute and cozy little coffee spot. Had a great cappuccino and cheesecake while enjoying a rainy day in Bergen. I come here every time I’m in town.

reviews.title: Great coffee and cakes
reviews.text:
Loads of great reviews for this little place and deservedly so.
We popped in on the way down from Mount Fløyen. One tip I'd give is, when finished, turn left out of the café and have a walk around the residential streets of Bergen. You may find a little gem!

name: Apollon Platebar
description: Norway's oldest independent record store also containing an unique cafe, bar and pub.

reviews.title: Great beer, records and atmosphere
reviews.text: Whether you're there for the beer, the records or both, it's always a chilled atmosphere with great music and beer on tap. My go-to place when in Bergen.

reviews.title: To beer or not to beer
reviews.text:
One of the coolest bars in Bergen. Good beer menu. It is also a store where you can buy records . And they have cool 
arrangements. Music bingo for example!

reviews.title: Great beer
reviews.text: The bar has a very nice atmosphere. We had a few different beers that were all good thanks to bartender's recommendations. I also bought a vinyl.

reviews.title: Best beer in Bergen
reviews.text: Great beer. Passionate and friendly owner and staff. A must do if you like music or beer. Even better if you like both.

reviews.title: Record store/bar
reviews.text: Great vibe, casual environment, good beer selection and lots of vinyl to browse. Check out the bulletin boards for local events.

reviews.title: Vinyl and Craft Beer a winning combination!
reviews.text: The owners passion for both strands of his business is infectious. The range of Norwegian craft beers is extensive, with other international beers available....but why would you! The vinyl collection is impressive, and if like me you listen to BBC 6 Music in the UK, here’s where to find a number of those artists you rarely find in music stores at home.

reviews.title: Interesting place
reviews.text:
Good atmospehere with the bar one side and records the other.
We had a slider of small beers (5) for 250 kr so around standard price. There was a wide variety not all to our liking but thats person taste.
Worth a visit

reviews.title: Try one of the 7 fjells!
reviews.text: I definitely recommend this place if one is in the vicinity. It's fairly close to Bergen city center. It has a good mix of beers on the tap. They sell vinyl records and the selection was pretty vast. The ambiance is nice, music is not too loud, so it's easy to have conversations. Good to visit in small groups.

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.text: A great bar for drinks before or after dinner. Named for the mistress of King Christin II of Denmark.

reviews.title: Wonderful Historic Pub from the 1300’s
reviews.text:
We visited this pub during our trip to Bergen.

The lower part dates back to 1305 and was why we wanted to visit.

We arrived right before the lower part of the pub was open to the public.

The bartender was kind enough to let us downstairs while she was working to open the pub.

We had the whole pub to ourselves which was amazing!

The downstairs was the original part of the pub and retained its medieval character and charm. 

The ceiling was low and covered with the original wood beams. The walls were thick stone.

The room light was low with the pleasant ambience of candlelight.

We felt like we were back in medieval times.

We ordered a beer. I recommend the local Hansa beer.

The bartender explained the history of the pub to us while she worked.

A special thank you to her for making our afternoon there memorable.

This is the oldest remaining pub in Bergen, and a definite ‘must see’ for history lovers. 

I highly recommend a visit to this pub if you have time!

reviews.title: Atmosphere plus
reviews.text: Reported to be the oldest pub in Bergen set on the narrow original main street and dating back to 1300.  We enjoyed a few wines on a dark and cold afternoon.  I just wish we had a pile of Bergen friends to really enjoy what this old place had to offer.  Good beers and wines, Huge partycellars and iive music on Thursday nights.  For one drink or 100, be you local or a tourist you JUST HAVE TO VISIT this pub.

reviews.title: På konsert
reviews.text: Nice and relaxing place With  good wines and nice atmosphere.The service is good and smiling bartenders.

reviews.title: Great Bar and Close to Harbour Area
reviews.text: We visited this lovely bar twice during our weekend in Bergen.  The barman was very informative and friendly and the atmosphere cosy.  It was a short walk from the harbour area and it provided a lovely break from the cold of a December visit.

reviews.title: Great bar
reviews.text: Visted here twice recently and really like the place. I was lucky with the weather so could sit outside but inside the bar is really cosy. Drinks aren't too expensive and the service was good.

name: Grieghallen

photo.caption: The best place to enjoy concerts in Bergen - tunliweb.no

description: Norways largest combined cultural- and congress venue. A meeting place for the best possible experience - with a personal touch. With its diversity, flexibility and the high quality of its facilities and technical capabilities, Grieghallen represents the top of the market in staging cultural activities, trade fairs, conferences, receptions and fine catering. Our aim is 100% satisfaction amongst our clients, no matter how large or small. Grieghallen is probably best known for its main stage, where audiences have had close contact with some of the greatest performers of our era over the past 40 years. But the entire Grieghallen complex offers so much more, with spaces suited to a wide variety of functions. We take pride in the high quality service delivered by our catering and technical partners. Grieghallen is centrally located, so the bus and train stations, the Fish Market, historic Bryggen, in fact all of downtown Bergen is within easy walking distance.

offer_list.title: Bergen actually, city tour

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Grieghallen tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: 9th
reviews.text: Fabulous choir and lead male bass baritone made this a truly fabulous performance of the 9th symphony combined with beautiful female choir section boosting the whole show to a world class show. Worth the trip from Australia!

reviews.title: Love this place
reviews.text: The outside of the building is not so attractive in my opinion but at night when one is inside there is a great atmosphere from all the light bulbs hanging up. And I like the concert hall and have been to many great concerts here.

reviews.title: National Brass Band competition.
reviews.text: Refreshments excessively expensive.  Annoying to find that many seats covered with coats to save seats.  Empty seats in middle of rows but some people not willing to move.  When there are so many patrons, it would be helpful to ask seated patrons to move in so that unseated patrons can sit together instead of separately.

reviews.title: Great acoustics
reviews.text: Attended a concert with Bergen Philharmonic Orchestra the other day. On the program were music from horror movies and tv shows thru the ages. The main concert hall has great acoustics and is not too big so you get a great view of the stage.  in the foyer there is a bar and seating arrangements, the bar is somewhat pricey but you're not there for the whole night so it`s ok. Grieghallen is also an ok venue for conferences, and they do catering.

reviews.title: Great building, mostly good for conferences
reviews.text: Good conference venue.  The big rooms are excellent, and the main hall is amazing.  Some of the smaller rooms have inadequate ventilation, so conference organisers should be careful in which rooms they choose ("Bekkelokken" room had no fresh air at all that we could tell).  But overall a fantastic place for a conference in a wonderful cultural place.

reviews.title: Amazing building with superb acoustics
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to attend an afternoon concert by the Bergen Philharmonic.  The performance included Peer Gynt and Benjamin Britten's piano concerto.  Real goose bumps experience.  The architecture is amazing too.  The equivalent venue in Oslo is no match for the Grieghallen.  If you get the chance do go.

name: Ovre-Eide Gard - Farm

photo.caption: Welcome to Øvre-Eide Farm in Bergen!

description: Øvre-Eide Farm is idyllically situated just five minutes from Bergen city center. The farm dates as far back as the 1500 century, and has a very interesting history. In these historic surroundings we would like to welcome you to all kinds of gatherings, tours and dining. If you have particular wishes, please do not hesitate to contact us – let us create the perfect setting for your visit. We look forward to see you!

animal_welfare_tag.msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: Visiting this farm, meeting the farm family, learning the history and having a mouth watering traditional Norwegian dinner was the highlight of a nine day tour with Trafalger.

reviews.title: A Very Educational Visit
reviews.text:
Our tour visited Ovre-Eide Gard. Since my maternal grandfather (morfar) grew up on such a farm before emigrating to Minnesota in the 1880s, I found the discussion of farm life extremely interesting. We were told about both their horse and sheep operations. Then we went into the house for lunch.  I very much enjoyed the lunch. 

Towards the end of the lunch one of our hostesses came into the dinning room dressed in her traditional dress (Bunad). Among other items she told us how their stocking color revealed marital status. I would have liked to have included picture of her but she requested I did not.

I was also very impressed by the young student groups who were leaving the farm as we were arriving. I was particularly surprised to see the diversity of the children.

reviews.title: Outstanding experience
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience here. Our guide Ina was so wonderful. The horses were outstanding. We traveled from Boston to Bergen and took the Hurtigruten up the coast, and this really was one of the highlights of our trip to Norway, even with all the other wonderful things we did.

reviews.title: A shore excursion
reviews.text: We visited here on a shore excursion. It’s a beautiful working Norwegian farm. Our host is also a pastry chef  and provided us with a sampling of his wares. They were friendly and gracious, answering questions most diplomatically on a range of subjects. The farm has sheep, chickens and horses (Icelandic and Fjord). Very picturesque.

reviews.title: One of very favorite excursions of all time
reviews.text: After a brief tour of the town we drove to this beautiful farm.  The owner is wonderful and shows you all around the farm and answers any questions you have.  He shows you all the animals and tells you all about family farms in Norway and the challenges they face.  Then one of the ladies brings the sheep and lambs up for you to interact with them.  We were able to hold an adorable little black lamb.  After that you are invited into the dining room for a treat of amazing pastries and the best hot chocolate we have ever had.  We loved this tour and would recommend it to anyone.  And if we are ever back in Bergen we would definitely go back again.

reviews.title: What a little gem
reviews.text: Just returned from a fabulous visit, it was well organised, the owner is passionate about his farm ,the tour was interesting and informative, the guides were brilliant and the food and drink amazing. Thank you so much for making us so welcome in your beautiful country.

reviews.title: We had a fantastic time visiting with the family and farm animals.
reviews.text: We had a fantastic visit to the farm to visit the family and the animals.  Enjoyed a refreshing glass of juice before being invited into the main house for coffee, tea or hot chocolate with home made pastries.  Unique view into the family farm, very close to Bergen.  Thank you very much.

reviews.title: A lovely way to spend the afternoon!
reviews.text: We made a reservation for a 2-hour horseback riding tour into the mountains around Bergen. Three of us with varying skill levels went and enjoyed the beautiful scenery, the ride, the farm experience, and our guide, Karen. It was a lovely afternoon! I would highly recommend any opportunity to venture out to the farm.

reviews.title: Definitely Worth a Visit!
reviews.text: We just returned from a trip to Norway and have to say one of the highlights was a visit to Ovre-Edie Gard.  This is a small but beautiful farm just outside Bergen that sits above one of the fjords.  We could not believe how close to Bergen a working farm could exist.  The staff explained the various duties associated with the animals and then we were treated to lunch there.  They took the time to explain the prepared dishes and afterwards the owners joined us in their traditional costumes along with one of the staff.  Again, they took the time to welcome us and explain the various parts and differences having to do with the costumes.  If you ever get a chance to visit this farm by all means take it! Their website is: ovre-eide.no

reviews.title: Well worth the visit!
reviews.text:
We came to the farm as an excursion on a Viking Cruise - what a good choice we made!  We were delighted to see this farm - even though we were in near "civilization", it seemed as though we were out far far from the city.  The setting is beautiful!  
]
Best though, was listening to the everyone tell about the livestock (especially seeing the horses!) and hearing the owner talk about the trials and the joys of owning a family farm in Norway.  Questions were encouraged.  The refreshments were delicious and it was such fun to see them in costume and dancing.
If you are trying to decide whether to make this visit, we HIGHLY recommend it.

reviews.title: Great tour!
reviews.text: My wife and I visited the farm as part of our visit to Bergen via Viking Cruises.  We had a fabulous visit.  Strongly recommend this to anyone visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Excellent Trafalgar arranged excursion
reviews.text:
Great hospitality and a warm and genuine reception accompanied by a wonderful meal along with a wonderful insight into agriculture and life in general in Norway.
Thank you!

reviews.title: Excellent “Hygge” Experience
reviews.text: Had the opportunity to visit Ovra-Eida Gard as part of a Be My Guest dinner with Trafalgar.  We were given a tour of the farm complete with an explanation of the area and farming in Norway.  We were treated to a sampling of traditional Norwegian food and homemade pastry in the main house.  The night was finished wIth a show of traditional national costume and music.  Best experience so far in Norway - this is a must!

reviews.title: Wonderful Taste of Norway
reviews.text: The owner of this farm, like many other farmers, wears many hats.  The view he gave us into his life was frank and informative.  He also made the pastries we enjoyed while he played Edvard Grieg much to our delight.  In addition, he and several of his staff showed us their authentic Norwegian costumes that cost around $6,000 a piece.  This was a very relaxed, laid-back tour.  Highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Great excursion
reviews.text: Loved this excursion on our Trafalgar tour. The descriptions of life on a Norwegian farm were great and the meal was delicious. Then finished with the national costumes and some piano.

reviews.title: Farm visit in Bergen
reviews.text: Fantastic hospitality and food. Charming host and staff. Loved seeing you he fjord ponies and the beautiful farm.

reviews.title: Delightful excursion from our Viking cruise
reviews.text: We visited the Over-Eide Gard farm as part of an excursion from Viking cruises.  The owner/farmer met us at the ship and was our guide to his farm which is near the city of Bergen, Norway.  He gave us a background and history about the farm which he said is about 160 acres.  He explained that farms in Norway are controlled and subsidized by the government, depending upon needs.  He served our group delicious apple and raspberry cider before taking us to an older house on the property where he served tea, coffee and hot chocolate, along with delicious pastries, some of which he made himself.  We were treated to an explanation of the traditional Norwegian costumes which he modeled for us and then he played a tune from the piano and danced a bit.  Quite a charming farmer and a very interesting tour.  I enjoyed hearing this thoughts on the economy and his interest in everything from farming to the price of oil, etc.  A very relaxing trip near the end of our cruise.  Highly recommend visiting this farm. Bergen is a very beautiful city.

reviews.title: Outstanding visit!
reviews.text: The host was very informative of his farm life and life in Norway in general!  His property is beautiful sitting on the lakeside.  It was a thrill to see the fjord horse up close.  We appreciated the sweet snacks/drink and seeing them in native costumes.  Just more lovely than we anticipated!  I highly recommend this experience.

reviews.title: Fabulous Experience
reviews.text: Enjoyed the owner and his telling us about the farm.The sheep were bleating which was quite entertaining. The talk in the barn of the history of the farm and Norway was good. The owner was quite entertaining himself. He was asked where his greatest source of income was and he said ‘Trafalger’. I was on a Trafalger tour of the Scandinavian countries. The Raspberry apple cider was delicious. Entering the house we experienced a beautiful evening. The table settings were lovely and the Norwegian food delicious. Later the owner and girl servers dressed in authentic Norwegian costumes and the owner played the piano. What a fabulous experience. We were made to feel warm and inviting.

reviews.title: A Fun Visit
reviews.text: This small farm at the edge of Bergen has been in the same family for several hundred years.  The owner is a farmer, baker, entertainer and delightful host.  It is a great place to see Norway, old and new.

reviews.title: Must see this local farm!
reviews.text: Visited this lovely farm with a Gate1 Travel group on Aug 25 and were treated to a wonderful view of local history and culture.

reviews.title: Norwegian farm life
reviews.text: As part of our Viking cruise, we visited this charming farm. We were greeted by owner Arild Nydegger Ovre-Eide who was very interesting and informative. A short walk took us to his main "crop", sheep. The whole herd came running to meet us! We learned a lot about raising sheep. We went into a barn where we enjoyed Raspberry Juice, and he answered questions about life on the farm and Norway in general. We then moved to the main house for coffee and delicious pastries made by him. We saw several national costumes and were treated to a short piano recital of a piece by Grieg. The farm sits by a lake so the setting was idyllic. Overall it was very enjoyable and educational.

name: Susan Fosse Knitwear

photo.caption: The outside of our boutique. Find us in Jacobsfjorden in Bryggen!

description: Discover our beautiful store filled with an exclusive collection of knitwear for men, women & children inspired by the landscape of the West Coast of Norway and the vibrant city of Bergen.

reviews.title: Susan Fosse Knitwear
reviews.text: We went there after reading so many great reviews on TA especially those who prefer Susan Fosse over Dale of Norway. To be fair Susan Fosse have a good product but I think it's not even close to Dale neither in design nor in quality. And their prices are not that much better. Besides prices in Bergen tend to be higher than in other parts of the country. We made most of our sweater purchases in Trondheim and Alesund at 40 to 50% discount.

reviews.title: Beautifully Designed
reviews.text: While in Bergen, Norway we happened upon a beautiful knitwear store in the "World Heritage" section of the city.  These garmets are designed by Susan Fosse so they are very unique.  They are well made of 100% wool and should last a lifetime if handled with care.  The staff member in the shop was most helpful as she was very knowledgeable about the items for sale. Needless to say I made a purchase and now await the cooler weather so that I can wear my beautiful Norwegian sweater.

reviews.title: Fabulous sweaters and knitwear
reviews.text: Beautiful sweaters which are locally made in Bergen. Love the different designs and patterns. Definitely recommend for anyone visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience during our visit to Bergen
reviews.text: We visited Susan’s store on our last day in Bergen, after I had read about her and her knitwear online. Susan was extremely attentive and helpful to us as I tried on almost everything in the store and agonized endlessly over the options. My husband also tried on a fabulous sweater which he purchased. Susan’s knowledge of the styling, fit and function of each of her individually designed knitwear pieces allowed me to purchase two very different sweaters which I am looking forward to wearing as soon as we get cold weather. The items are beautiful and unique and they will be wonderful mementos of our visit to Bergen and our visit to Susan’s store.

reviews.title: Beautiful norwegian sweaters
reviews.text: Visited Bergen and was looking for a nice sweater which was locally made. I found Susan Fosse and i fell in love with the sweaters. Great service and gave me good tips for things to do in Bergen. Definitely recommend visiting Susan Fosse for anyone visiting Bergen.

reviews.title: No Service. Walked out.
reviews.text:
Walked into this store.
No one even acknowledged us.
Workers were too busy talking in the back.
Walked out.
Terrible service.
Sweaters are not that great. There are nicer ones in other shops.

reviews.title: Beautiful high quality knitwear sweaters from Norway
reviews.text: Had a lovely visit to the shop during a very brief visit to Bergen. Found it by accident while we were walking around some of the alleys off the main street. Enjoyed speaking with Susan and hearing the stories behind the creation of the sweaters. I looked for sweaters in several shops in Oslo and Bergen and this was the best one.  I highly recommend it for the original designs, high-quality construction, and comfort of the sweaters.

reviews.title: Beautiful unique Norwegian designed knitwear
reviews.text: We found this small boutique in Bergen’s Bryggen. The designs of the pure wool garments incorporated Norwegian patterns in both the usual fair isle design as well and the actual knitting stitches. The prices were more than favourable when compared with that of other producers. The service in the small shop was.excellent, friendly and helpful

reviews.title: Gorgeous sweaters, friendly service
reviews.text: I knew I wanted to buy a Norwegian sweater while in Bergen and settled on Susan Fosse's shop after reading all of the great TripAdvisor reviews, especially since I wanted something made locally. Although the shop can be hard to find using Google Maps (tip: it's down an alleyway between the historic buildings in the harbour district), it's worth the effort. Susan's sweaters (and scarves and mittens and headbands!) are gorgeous and beautifully crafted, combining traditional Nordic patterns with a unique artistic point of view. Susan's mother was working in the shop during our visit, and she was a delight: friendly and welcoming and knowledgeable. We were lucky enough to meet Susan just as we were checking out and so had an opportunity to tell her how much we loved her work. The only challenge you'll have is deciding on which of the beautiful pieces you'll want to take home. We'll cherish our sweaters as souvenirs of our time in Bergen.

reviews.title: Beautiful, traditional jumpers made in Norway
reviews.text:
I spent my whole time in Norway searching for a traditional jumper but finding lots of extremely expensive ones, most of which appeared to have been made abroad.
When browsing the beautiful buildings of Bryggen I stumbled across Susan's shop and I am so happy that I did. If you are looking for a beautiful, traditional jumper that is made in Norway, this is absolutely the place for you. These jumpers are by no means cheap, but you get far more for your money.
I was lucky enough to meet Susan herself and learn a little about the jumpers she makes, so now I can tell admirers a little more about my beautiful new item.

reviews.title: Beautiful sweaters
reviews.text: I didn't want to buy the typical Norwegian sweater. I have trouble wearing wool because it makes me itch. One of the ladies on my trip went to this small establishment which can be found at the end of a narrow alley. She brought back a devine white sweater so a group of us went to see what was there. Fortunately for me on a rack they had a grouping of lovely cotton sweaters with Norwegian designs which fit perfect. I bought a sky blue zip sweater which I plan on wearing for transition into fall and winter and spring.   Prices range from $150 to $225. Check out the fingerless gloves.

reviews.title: stuffed full of
reviews.text: Knitwear all authentic made in Norway and at a good price.  All sizes and styles from simple to traditional complicated patterns also handmade Christmas ornaments.

name: Norled

photo.caption: Spectacular fjord view with Norled ferry

description: Norled offer tourist routes on three of the most famous fjords in Fjord Norway: Lysefjord, Hardangerfjord and Sognefjord as well as several coastal express routes. Norled is one of the largest transportation companies in Norway with 50 ferries and 30 express boats operating along the whole coast of Norway, from the Oslo fjord in the East to Troms in the North. Tickets can be purchased at norled.no, at our customer center Strandkaiterminal in Bergen or on board. We wish you a pleasant journey.

reviews.title: TIME CONSUMING BUT  VERY NORWEGIAN
reviews.text: This is the leisurely way to Bergen, taking some 5.5H. It stops in many little towns [many more like hamlets] to [dis]embark passengers. The Fjord holds 295 passengers. There are two interior decks. A cafeteria serves mostly snack food. There is a dedicated play area for children. The seas might be a little rough at times but generally we had okay to good weather. Most seating was forward but there were some areas with tables. You could take in the pure air on the outer deck.  The television screen closest to where I was sitting did not work. It was showing mostly the route. I was not able to connect to the wifi at all while others said it was quite slow. I was going from Flam to Bergen so this option is a) more expensive than land transportation and b) takes more than twice as long as overland. If you have the time and like the open water, consider this route.

reviews.title: Most Scenic Fjord Tour
reviews.text: We did the Flam to Bergen Express Ferry in two segments,with a two night stop in Balestrand.The trip takes you the entire length of the Sognefjord and the scenery is awesome the entire way. Many waterfalls and small scenic towns. We did this as part of a Norway in a Nutshell Tour and it was definitely the best part of that 3 day trip. The entire trip is over 5 hours but the the Ferry is comfortable and offer food services.

reviews.title: Great option to go into the Narrow Fjord
reviews.text: Nice comfortable and clean boat. The team is welcoming and nice. The trip offers majestic views on the norwegian landscapes. I really enjoyed the experience and for sure recommend it.

reviews.title:
Comfortable, on time service.
A picturesque journey.
reviews.text:
We travelled on a Norled ferry from Bergen to Flam. The boat was comfortable, clean and well appointed. The service was on time and efficient. The captain kept eeveryone informed throughout the journey, including given some history and topographic advice to tourists, over the sound system, as we travelled along the beautiful Sognefjord.
A great way to travel in western Norway.

reviews.title: An absolutely wonderful experience.
reviews.text:
Our travel plan called from going via fast ferry from Bergen to Leikanger where we would rent a Hertz car and drive from that point

We purchased our tickets online well ahead of time. The boarding dock is in central Bergen near the fish market. There were plenty of comfortable seats and the opportunity to go onto the outside decks. On board was a very nice food vendor with sandwiches, soup and beverages.

reviews.title: A comfortable journey through the Sognefjord
reviews.text: Took Norled ferry from Bergen to Flam, was comfortable, food and drinks on board and plenty of space for luggage at the rear.

reviews.title: Fast Ferry to Maloy
reviews.text: Great service going through stunning scenery at about 30 knots, sit back and take in the scenery! If it’s a nice day sit on the upper deck

reviews.title: Professional Ferry System
reviews.text: Took the Norled ferry from Balestrand to Bergen; it was a beautiful trip and the ferries were clean with luxurious leather seating and full windows to view the trip. Special area for luggage and a small family area for strollers and children to play. Very nice surprise!

reviews.title: Super comfortable ride from Flam to Bergen
reviews.text:
Price for value is great. 
We taken the 5h fjord cruise from Flam to Bergen. 
The breath taking view is stunning. The captain haben in English and Norwegen some information about each place. We even stopped at a couple waterfalls. 
Worth the money and view. Recommend very much

reviews.title: Brilliant helpful and accomodating crew
reviews.text:
We booked tickets aboard the MS Vingtor Bergen to Flam route. Unfortunately we missed our boarding, but the crew were very understanding and accomodating allowing us to use our tickets for a different boarding. 

The route itself is absolutely stunning and very much recommended. MS Vingtor is a very comfortable ferry and smooth journey. Will be back!

reviews.title: Flam to Bergen by boat
reviews.text: It took about five hours on a Sunday afternoon with punctual arrival to Bergen. Bought the tickets in advance online, everything went smooth. Comfortable boat, not overcrowded, good choice of food on board, good coffee.

reviews.title: "Ferry Nice"
reviews.text:
Caught the ferry on a return journey from Balestrand on the Sognefjord to Bergen.Took 4 hours in total,each way, with all its stopping points along the way,but we found it to be a pleasant way to spend the day,having 4 hours in Bergen itself.
    Found the ferry was clean,clean loos,plenty of "power points" for those that needed to look/charge up their laptops/phones etc.,staff we came across were friendly,just doing their jobs,reasonably priced(by Norwegian standards)snacks,hot/cold drinks,we enjoyed the hot chocolate,can't see we had anything to moan about personally.

reviews.title: Not worth the price tag.
reviews.text: my friend and i booked the Go Hardangerfjord & Vøringsfossen fjord cruise hoping to experience 11.5 hours of beautiful Norwegian fjords. However, we weren’t able to sit by one of the windows, so we weren’t able to enjoy the view, and it was freezing cold outside, so walking around the outside of the boat was not possible for more than 10 minutes at a time. The staff leading the cruise was rude and unfriendly the majority of the time, making it an altogether unpleasant experience. we also paid for the additional nature museum and waterfall hike and again, definitely not worth the price tag. the museum was overall not engaging and was a waste of time, the cafe across the street was full of cheap souvenir gifts and there wasn’t enough time to eat, even if you hadn’t eaten all day. the time at the waterfall was pitifully short, and we had hardly any time to explore at all.

reviews.title: Staff is scamming and lying
reviews.text:
When we took the ferry from Stavanger to Tau in order to go to preikestolen, the staff on the boat claimed that there is no public transport bus and he said that we need to buy the   combo ticket of GoFjords that contains the ferry+bus. We had to pay 40€ each person.

When we got out of the ferry, the public transport bus was already waiting. A lot of people were really angry as they were scammed too and payed too much for the bus ticket.

The worker on the boat also said that this is the cheapest way to get there and that there is no discout for students. 

The cost for the public bus would have been 2.90€ and it drives as often as the bus from GoFjords. 

I am not even mad beause i wasted about 20€. I am mad because the staff lied to me and my friends.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: If you are tourist take a trip whit one of this boats, i can reccomend vingtor, its a beatiful sightseeing.

reviews.title: Good tours
reviews.text: If you are on day trips, this is probably what you will take. Check the routes to make sure you are taking the correct ones. Also check hours and which pier they are taking off from.

reviews.title: No competition, makes you better than your competitors...
reviews.text: Norled has in reality a monolopy on their stuff, and, are therefore without competition. They are also in the same sense, the best, since they have no competition.

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.text: The route is very beautiful and worth it! It's warm inside and it's also super fast, but doesn't make you feel uncomfortable at all. The staff is very helpful and kind.

reviews.title: express shuttle through the fjords
reviews.text: We spent two days in the Norwegian fjord country, and wanted to end it with a long trip through the fjords to Bergen, which was our final destination before our flights home.  We had magnificent views, in very comfortable seats, with helpfil staff.  This was a trip of a lifetime!

reviews.title: Wonderful trip up a fiord
reviews.text: I chose this one on line for our own nutshell tour. Ferry from Bergen to Flam, then Flam railway to Myrdal, then train from Myrdal back to Bergen, all outstanding. Ferry was great, saw a lot, enough commentary, food available at kiosk on board was good. Very comfy trip. Fiord was just beautiful. Both in rain and mist, and when the sun came out pm. 8am from Bergen, several stops at quaint towns, Flam about 1 pm, which gave us time to look around before staying the night in the lovely hotel. All booked on line.

reviews.title: Wonderful service - Bergen to Flam Expressboat brilliant Norled
reviews.text: My journey from Bergen to Sognefjord was the highlight of my Norway trip.  The boat was very comfortable, I spent a couple of minutes in the seat and then was out on deck for about five and a half hours making the most of the stunning scenery.  The boat was very comfortable fast and as it was relatively small it went through some very narrow channels which added to the enjoyment.  It provides a great public service, stopping at some quite small places but there is also commentary about places of interest along the route and this plus the stops to see the waterfalls add so much more.  The boat was of course in immaculate condition and the crew really helpful and pleasant in the way that they dealt with the passengers.  If visiting Bergen this is a must do and if not visit Bergen for this trip.  Well done and thank you Norled for such an outstanding service.

reviews.title: good trip but a bit expensive
reviews.text: I took their boat from Bergen to Flam. It's a very pretty ride. Getting on and off was easy. There's a nice little snack bar with sandwiches and other things to eat if you get hungry (prices reasonable for Norway). The cost of the ticket itself was a bit high, but it was a nice way to travel between places.

reviews.title: Excellent in every way
reviews.text: I took the express boat on 3 different occasions last week around the fjords. Each time I was very impressed. The boats are very clean and comfortable. There are 2 outdoor areas if you get great weather like I did so you can stand out and watch the breathtaking scenery pass by.
