reviews.title: Best Transport in Norway
reviews.text: We had used norled express boat between sogndal to bergen.It was a rainy day at few places in fjord but the service of transport was outstanding.Views of fjord during trip was too astonishing it keeps changing every time keeping us hooked to the vuews around ys during journey. Ride must if you are in norway to explore fjords.

reviews.title: Bergen to Flam express boat
reviews.text:
This really is the way to see the Fjords, with travellers, locals and real people. Stopping off at the villages is a real highlight and of course you get to see the views and wow they are worth seeing.

On board the cafe is good a cheap by Norwegian standards and staff are friendly.

The seats are comfortable and varied in layout, toilets are ferry toilets but clean, kids play area is poor.

There is a managed suitcases / bags area with places allocated for each main stop so that you can easily get you bags when you get off.

The windows start clean but spray can spoil the view if you are unlucky where you sit. There is a sheltered outside area at the back and a windy smaller area at the front for you to get good pics. The boat even stops off at good waterfalls for you to take pictures.

More real and better views than a cruise ship any day!

reviews.title: Excellent cruise
reviews.text: Did the cruise from Flam to Bergen (5 hours) on the express catamaran boat as part of my 'Norway in a Nutshell' tour. The cruise was excellent. The boat is state of the art, very fast, has a small kitchen, open deck at the back. It can move in all directions (even sideways) which is needed to manouver through the islands. Stand in front of the bridge and feel the heavy wind as the boat is at full speed. Beautiful scenery in the fjords, small typical norwegian settlements, high mountains, small islands. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Good boat spoiled
reviews.text:
We used this service as part of a tour
Although not the fault of Norled it was sold as a cruise - it's an express ferry
Flam to Balestrand takes around 1.5 hrs
The 4 hour Balestrand to Bergen trip was completely spoiled by the procession of nicotine nazis inflicting their habit on the 99%

reviews.title: Absolutely rude, no manners
reviews.text:
We boarded the ferry from Kinsarvik to Utne and were told we had to change ferry in Utne to reach Kvanndal. We got of the ferry and as there was no car waiting for the next ferry we parked in queu number 1. Cars began to arrive and parked right next to us. When the ferry arrived a very rude man ordered us not to advance when we had arrived first! He wouldn't listen to any explanation and made us go to the end of a line of more than 10 cars. The ferry was the 17:35 Utne /Kvanndal on August 24.
It is impossible to know where to wait if there is no information. And rudeness is never a good way to treat your passengers

reviews.title: Try multiple tours
reviews.text: We used their express boat but there are many other tours to take advantage.  Breathtaking scenery, with a friendly crew.  What more could you ask for?

reviews.title: Sognefjord - magnificent!
reviews.text: I booked a trip from Bergen to Flåm up the Sognefjord online with Norled, and it was great. The ticket I printed had the details I needed to get to the right wharf at the right time and board easily. The crew were polite and available to help when asked, the seats were comfortable, and there were both fore and aft viewing decks. The view itself was magnificent, and well worth the trip. The on-board cafeteria had a nice selection at reasonable prices.

reviews.title: Very scenic, if long, trip up the Sonjefjord to Flan and back to Bergen
reviews.text:
120 miles (~200km) in 5.5 hours. Wow!
We went on a rainy/cloudy day, with sunshine occasionally peeking through. The views were still spectacular, especially during the last two hours of the trip, when the mountains rise almost vertically from the sea. The boat actually did a 360 degree pivot to give everyone on board a thorough of a particularly famous waterfall. 
Hint: get on the boat as early as possible--the window seats and front row fill up fast.
Flan was surprising. More of a destination than we expected--there are several hotels and even a bit of shopping. The half-hour train ride to Mayen has more spectacular vistas, The train itself is kind of an antique, but in very good condition. There's one stop where everyone disembarks at a waterfall. A stone ruin overlooks the viewing platform, and a Norse maiden does an ethereal dance to some slightly spooky music. Nice interlude. 
From Mayen back to Bergen is around 2 hours on a modern, comfortable train. Again, seating can be tight when it's crowded.

All in all worth the price (around $175US pp at the time we booked it), but be prepared to make a day of it. We left Bergen at 8AM and returned to the railway station just before 6PM.  
It's better to pick a sunny day, of course, but those can be difficult to predict in Norway.

photo.caption: Not used to seeing snow in June

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Bergen to Oslo Train Ride tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: SOAK UP THE SCENERY
reviews.text: The Bergensbanen is one of the world's great train trips, whatever direction you do it. It is a long trip of some seven plus hours, making it worthwhile to consider an upgrade to the comfort class carriages, offering free coffee. You will appreciate it more reading up on the engineering feat just to build the highest journey in Scandinavia. Completed in 1909 after thirty four years of work, there are over 180 tunnels. When not in one of them, there are glacial waters, rustic scenery and a good deal of very small town living. The train connects to the famed Flam Railway at Myrdal, the line climbing to 1,222 meters. As a passenger train, it may be late, always playing second fiddle to commercial freight trains. Train shots are only so good due to movement so the trip is best appreciated putting the camera down to look upon the bounty of Mother Nature.

reviews.title: Slow and unhelpful
reviews.text:
Let’s forget the people who cannot find a reserved seat, that’s not NSB’s fault ... but what chaos, it was quite funny.
The 3 hour delay with no information while we enjoy the wonderful platform at Gol (amenities zero) makes this a 9.5 hour ordeal ... a pleasure you will never get back.

Leave this public service to service it’s locals ... it does not care about a tourist. Fly or drive for your own sanity.

reviews.title: Very scenic journey.
reviews.text: We travelled from Flam to Myrdal by train and from there boarded the train to Oslo on 5th of June. The journey from Flam to Myrdal was scenic as expected. The land scape around Myrdal was fabulous. The journey from Myrdal to Oslo was comfortable. But the land scape and scenery was fantastic. I did not expect such a wonderful ride. The first part was snow clad landscape with lakes and scattered wooden cabins. The later part of the journey was full of greenery and farms. It is a worthwhile ride during the visit to Norway. The train has a pantry/ dining car serving a variety of dishes. The 5 to 6 hour journey passed very fast.

reviews.title: Oslo train syndrome
reviews.text:
Our family travel by train from Oslo to Myrdal for the scenic Flamsbana train. The seat is very uncomfortable. Five-hour journey in a very narrow seat is terrible. I am afraid of getting a deep vein thrombosis. I sit in my seat only during the first hour. For the rest, I wander from an exit seat to another exit seat.
The scene is beautiful but not a unique. You can see the same scene or even better in many countries such as New Zealand, Japan, China, etc.
If I have a chance to make this route in Norway again, I will rent a car instead.

reviews.title: Spectacular scenery
reviews.text:
We took the 15:57 Vy (formerly NSB) train from Bergen to Oslo. What a terrific way to travel between these two cities. The train stations on either end are very centrally located in the hearts of both Bergen and Oslo. Norway is such a beautiful country and this is a lovely way to see a lot of the countryside. The scenery along the way is spectacular as you experience much of Norway’s natural beauty.  

I recommend paying the extra 100 NOK for the Komfort car where there is extra leg room and small tables for all seats. It was very comfortable. 

On the trip to Oslo, I recommend seats on the right side of the car (when facing the direction of travel). While there are enjoyable views on both sides, the most spectacular scenery is on the right side. This includes beautiful mountains, lakes, rivers and glaciers. The Vy website is very good and makes it easy to select the seats you want.

reviews.title: Worth the time
reviews.text: We were transferring from Wales to Bergen to join a cruise. Flights to Bergen were tricky and we discovered this train as an alternative. We flew to Oslo, spent one night, then caught the train at about 3pm. It got into Bergen late, but it was still light. The first hour or so is suburban and not very interesting. But the next 6 or so hours makes up for it. In late May there was still lots of snow on the mountains and wonderful waterfalls. The only downside is the food; if you think you might be hungry, pack a picnic

reviews.title: Stunning railway
reviews.text:
I traveled on this railway on a early day of June.
Weather was quite good, sunny, just few clouds.
The ticket is expensive (approx 100£) but worths every single penny.
It takes 7 hours that you will spend starring out of the window.
Crossing amazing fjords, valleys, a stunning mountain pass, riding next to foamy water rivers, waterfalls and high snowy peaks. 
The cars are very comfortable, power socket on every seat but no wifi is available (however you really don’t need it), bar is available in the middle train car and seat are like sofas. 
I do recommend to choose a window seat on the right hand side (facing the direction of the train to enjoy the best views.
For anything on the right you can sit in the bar car by the window and enjoy your coffee with a view.
I don’t post any picture because you need to ride this train and enjoy the views.

reviews.title: 14 hours of beauty!
reviews.text: I booked the Norway in a Nutshell from a friend's recommendation and never really looked into what it was all about.  I was so pleasantly surprised by the efficiency of the Norwegian transit system.  The commuter train from Bergen to Voss left right on time (make sure to use the restroom on the train because there is no time in Voss and there is no restroom on the bus!).  The bus to Gudvangen was an experience with roughly 10 very tight switch backs on an 18% gradient with exquisite waterfalls from start to finish.  The ferry from Gudvangen to Flam was our favorite part of the trip.  It's on an electric ferry that is so quiet and relaxing with the best opportunities for pictures.  Then you get on a scenic train that brings you up into the mountains. We were there at the end of the May and it was snowing so dress warm.  Also, have a quick layover at Myrdal because it is tiny with one little cafe and not much to see or do especially because it's freezing!  The final part of the journey is by train and lasts roughly 4 hours.  We splurged for the first class seats and it was great with lots of room and very comfortable seats.  There wasn't food or beverage service (I was surprised by this) but the bar car had food and beverages.  Don't wait until the last minute if you are hungry because they run out of food.  As an FYI - all alcoholic beverages must be consumed in the bar car and not at your seat.  It was a fun adventure!

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: You need to make the time to take this train ride. You can purchase your ticket at the Olso centre station.  Pay a little more and get the komfort seating. From Oslo to Bergen sit on the left side-not the right. Phone charging outlets at your seat.

reviews.title: Wow spectacular scenery
reviews.text:
We travelled on this train with my elderly mother-in-law after arriving in Bergen on the Hurtigruten coastal cruise from Kirkenes. I have given 4 stars primarily for the scenery however the Norwegian trains need a big redesign.

The first strange and irritating thing you will find is the number of steps into the carriage from the platform. Why I ask? The carriage lines up with the platform but you need to step up into the seating area and lugging baggage makes it difficult for the elderly. No problem for the young and able bodied but I can’t see and reason for it.

Second issue is the permanently fixed table along each of the two seats. There is ample leg room which is great but then the designer thought placing a permanent table with a very large thick center leg makes it very cumbersome to move along to the window seat and I would think this would be a major issue if needing to vacate the seat due to an emergency. They advertise that these trains are great for using a laptop to do work but the table is useless and inconvenient for anything else. 

Third issue is that each side of the carriage faces the opposite direction. Which means half the passengers are traveling backwards and the seats can’t be turned around. Very strange. 

Fourth issue is that when selecting seats online don’t expect the seats to face the way shown on the online diagram. I was expecting to travel backwards but the seats were facing forward. No problem for me but it would be a shock for those on the other side of the carriage that were expecting to travel forward but ended up traveling backwards.

Although there were issues with the train (besides also being delayed) the scenery was spectacular and I didn’t find the cost expensive at all. 

I would highly recommend the trip just for the scenery as it goes up onto the top of the mountain range in amongst the ski resorts.

reviews.title: Great way to travel!!
reviews.text: Family of 4 on NSB from Oslo to Myrtal. Left side of train is best for views. Reserve your seats. Very comfortable. Good cafe car. They have wi-fi but it is spotty. Seats have outlets for electronics.

reviews.title: Winter wonderland
reviews.text: A lovely trip through the Norwegian countryside, covered in snow, with frozen lakes and cute villages - this is great way to travel from Bergen to Oslo

reviews.title: Incredible scenery and comfort
reviews.text:
On this 6.5 hour train journey, time flies, because the ever changing scenery, especially in winter, takes your breath away. You wins through mountains and along side fjords and through rural hamlets. We saw cliffs covered in blankets of white and giant icicle fountains hanging from dark granite walls. We also saw the sun rise at about 9 am over hills and water. Cue Edward Grieg. Breathtaking. 
Comforts on board include quiet, stable carriages, (including a dedicated children’s carriage with a playroom and secure locking devices), friendly and helpful staff, clean toilet facilities, and a quite well stocked dining car. We paid extra for the Komfort class, in which the seats reclined comfortably. There was plants of storage. Why can’t train travel be like this everywhere? It was exceptional. Highly recommended. 
You could break this trip to catch the Fløm railway and then continue your journey if you want.

reviews.title: Comfortable ride with magnificant scenery
reviews.text: My wife and I did the return trip from Bergen to Oslo then back.  The train was comfortable and quiet. and lives up to its reputation as one of the most spectacular train trips in the world.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell
reviews.text: Not long back from a wonderful trip to Norway. This ended with "Norway in a Nutshell" (trains, bus, ferry, more trains Bergen into Oslo). We were concerned about managing this journey with our large luggage cases! Why I write this review! To let people know that it IS certainly MANAGEABLE!!! We made sure we boarded first train (your particular carriage#) as soon as possible, found luggage compartments just inside, rolled cases in, found our assigned seats few rows away. Perfect! Was a little dark first leg. Next train same, although no assigned seats. Bus ride cases went under bus, nearly everyone had cases!! Nice bus commentary as we passed the most spectacular scenery. Ferry we left cases (with all others) downstairs, proceeded upstairs, all good. Then last 2 trains same as above, last train being assigned seats. Yes, we had cases but certainly did manage fine. We are mid 50's. Don't stress! Enjoy!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text:
We took the Oslo to Bergen train and it was awesome. We went from Oslo so from there the best side to sit on is the left side. The train journey takes about six and a half hours, so it is not excessively long. We caught the 8.25am train so our entire journey was in daylight. The first hour or so most of the scenic action is on the right side of the train as it follows a river up into the mountains. Once in the mountains though the left side gets all the really exciting views. 
We went first class, the seats were terrific and we had loads of space. The tinted windows are large and there are several windows without passenger seats so it is easy to go to the other side to capture the view. There was also free tea, coffee and hot chocolate throughout the journey. 
If you have time, end your journey at Myrdal and catch the Flamsbana train to Flam, stay overnight and then catch a ferry from Flam to Bergen along the fjord. The Flamsbana Train trip is more spectacular than the Oslo/Bergen and Flam is gorgeous.

reviews.title: great ride 7 hours but the time went by quickly bring a book and a sandwich .
reviews.text: Very nice 7 hour ride, it went by quickly and very comfortable ride. Looking out the window at a wonderful countryside was very relaxing.

reviews.title: Bergen to Olso
reviews.text: This is certainly a scenic train ride from the fiords of Bergen overland along fiords and glacial mountain pass rivers and lakes. At the summit of the ride is a number of ski areas with hotels and single cabins for people to stay. The eastern line of the railway descends from the summit to the lowlands of Oslo with more fabulous lakes, river and beautiful townships along the way. There are however many train tunnels along this route, a total of 187. It is still very much worth seeing this amazingly beautiful country.

reviews.title: Beautiful train ride
reviews.text: This has to be one of the most scenic train rides on the planet. From the moment you leave Oslo it is beautiful and it only gets more so along the journey. I would highly recommended for anyone visiting the south of Norway.

reviews.title: Nice trip.
reviews.text:
We booked this journey in oder to see the mountains  en route to Oslo.
Booked two Comfort , ( 1 class ) , honnør ( Pensioner ) 
Bergen to Oslo airport 1178 NKR , actually half price.
Easy booking on NSB.com
Nice train , power for the electrical equipment at your seat.
Restaurant Waggon where you can get a meal and a drink, beer wine must be consumed there, not possible to bring it back to your seat.
Easy luggage racks in each end of the Waggon.
Free warm drinks in the comfort Waggon , coffee, tea and chocolate 
Craft beer available in the restaurant (dræsine øl ) ( trolley beer ).
If you love tunnels , this is the journey you should take , as I gave up counting those tunnels up there.
Very nice scenery up in the hills.
Snow , glacier, rocks, sheeps , woods nice , very much like Scotland but the hills are higher here.
You will have to change train in Oslo in oder to travel the rest distance up to Gardemoen Airport , a journey 20 min , leaving from track at the same platform as you arrive from Bergen.

reviews.title: Scenic trip
reviews.text:
As train journeys go this is a pretty stunning one.  Book well in advance and pay the small surcharge for the Komfort carriage.  There are good views at different points of the journey from either side; lake views are probably better on the right-hand side (facing the direction of travel) as you leave Bergen.  But you'll get waterfalls, rivers in spate and lakes on the other side too.  Even in mid August there were snow patches on the highest ground.  

We did take books but didn't read much.  It certainly didn't feel like a seven-hour trip. Well worth doing.

reviews.title: Overnight Train So-so
reviews.text:
To save travel time, our family took overnight train ride from Bergen to Oslo, one day before our flight home. That means two consecutive nights of awkward sleep. Not a very good idea, I must admit. Remember to make use of the earplugs (as supplied) during the night ride. 

We didn't expect that there was no water supply in the washroom (and the tap of our compartment), at least during the first half of the night trip. The design of electronic device charging inside the compartment, nevertheless, is exclusively convenient. Electric supply, perhaps, is more important than water supply. Is it? 

When I asked my eight-year-old daughter the next morning, she answered, "That isn't a good sleep, but the experience is interesting."

reviews.title: Good Experience
reviews.text: As another traveler mentioned, only take this train ride if you have time.  It's about 7 hours long and there is no way you will be focused on fjords, mountains, glaciers for 7 hours straight.  You will end up falling asleep a good part of the ride.  However, it is a good experience because nature never stops to amaze.  If you travel on a day with good weather and depending on where you sit, you will see amazing views of the fjords, mountains, glaciers, and greenery.  Depending on what class your purchase you get free coffee.  I heard there was food for purchase in the train, but we brought snacks, sandwiches, and drinks that we bought before boarding.  The bathroom was OK. It was worth the seven hours ride. We got to appreciate a beautiful and majestic part of the world.

reviews.title: Great Scenic Views
reviews.text: Only do this if you have time. It was a great way to see the coutrside of Norway. If you are a senior citizen your ticket is 1/2 price. That was a pleasant surprise. Lots of tunnels and snow still in June.

name: Statsraad Lehmkuhl
ranking_subcategory: #4 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #4 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #4 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
description: Join a voyage on one of the biggest and most beautiful sailingships in the world. On board you participate on the daily rutines of the ship alongside the professional crew, staning lookout, steer the ship and set sails. Come sail with us for an unforgettable experience. We also have afternoon cruises in Bergen during Mai and June each year.

reviews.title: Great sunset sail.
reviews.text:
While we would have like to take the 4-day training sail, we still enjoyed the evening cruise. The food was a bit limited (shrimp you tear apart and bread), there was a well-staffed bar.

One of the members of the non-profit board that runs the ship gave a tour including the  captain's quarters (very luxe) which was a lucky break. We also were able to talk with the captain who has been with the ship for decades.

name: Magic Ice Bar Bergen
description: Magic Ice is a wondrous winter wonderland constructed from several tons of ice. Inside you will find of course a fantastic Ice Bar, but you will also find some of the most popular, renowned or famous artists from Norway. You will get your welcome drink served in an ice glass while looking at great art. We provide warm poncho and gloves before you step inside the ice bar!

reviews.title: Miss
reviews.text: Wasn’t sure what to expect - if you are looking for really tacky, then it’s a hit. Not much to see, rushed through too, however, 15mins is all you’ll need ! Welcome drink was good but to pay as an experience errr nope,

reviews.title: Not much to see
reviews.text: We went here around 4 pm on a Monday, so there was only us and another couple and the bar staff. It felt a bit awkward, but not surprising - maybe it's a bit more crowded at the weekend or later in the evening. The place was quite small and had a few ice artworks which were kind of cool. We kinda suspected that it would be a bit overpriced and not much to see but went there anyway, since we had seen most other sights. We had our included drink and was there for like 20-25 minutes, but the entrance was not worth it, really. Maybe you appreciate it more when you have already had a few drinks and are out doing several pubs already on a Friday or so.

reviews.title: A big hit with family
reviews.text: This place is quite small and requires under an hour to cover. But surprisingly it was a big hit with the family. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel very comfortable. The teenagers thoroughly enjoyed this place. The drinks are delicious and are served in glasses made of ice! I've included a picture of the glass.

reviews.title: Ice to see you
reviews.text:
From the outside the place looks like a 70’s office block but once inside you are kitted out with a protective coat and gloves.

When you enter the bar you are immediately met with a fine display of ice sculptures, murals and furniture.  Even the glasses you drink out of are made out of ice.  The centrepiece has to be a magnificent throne made out of ice, fit for the snow queen herself. 

You can try a range of drinks, but with the tour I went with we were given some sort of spirit.

Its not the biggest or coldest ice bar I have been to but the sculptures are pretty, staff friendly and it kills an hour or so in Bergen.

reviews.title: a total rip off: expensive, not worth it
reviews.text: not many scuptures, basically a glass of coke and 2 statues. A joke. Do not go there, not as a family.

reviews.title: Disappointment with Magic Ice, Svolvær, revisited
reviews.text: Two year ago we visited Magic Ice and found it an amazing place. Yesterday we made a revisit with a bigger group, finding the place not only with the very same display: same sculptures, ornaments,  pictures etc, but they have all declined in size and sharpnes due to evaporation over the years; the staff did well, but we felt let down and the ‘magic’ was not magic att all. So the 225 NOK per person was a mere overprizing.

reviews.title: Fun and cool experience
reviews.text: Interesting ice sculptures and scenes to sit around or in. Friendly staff let our small group in even though they were updating area and some ice sculptures were being created/sculpted.

reviews.title: Enjoyable
reviews.text:
Got here nice and early about 19.15 put the protective coat and gloves on, I got two tokens one for a fixed drink, and one for a drink of my choice, which I told the guy what I liked, and he made up a superb Strawberry based drink for me, I then bought a beer.
Time to go after that, I had a great time on there

reviews.title: A Terrible RIP Off.....
reviews.text:
Whilst in Bergen we visited the Ice Bar which sounded kind of fun at the time.
The entry fee was steep at 390 for two. The girl at the counter said there were “some ice blocks” inside for remodelling work. When we went in (9 pm) the room was small & you could see all the sculptures that were there from the door. (There weren’t many) The ice blocks took up a lot of the space & meant there was VERY little to see..except for a lot of blocks of ice!!!  In 2 minutes you had seen everything. Other than us there were only two people & the barmaid  present! We had our (included) drink & left after 15 mins. This was the worst experience whilst in Norway by far!! 
In fairness, having remonstrated with the girl at the door & demanding to see the manager, she finally relented & I received a sizeable refund. But, quite simply, they should NOT have been open to the public as the place was basically a storage unit for ice blocks with nothing of note to see!
Quite simply if in Bergen don’t waste your time here...unfortunately we did!!!!
Baffles me how someone could ever give a 4/5 star review.

reviews.title: cool place to have a drink
reviews.text: Fun ice bar to have a drink in.  Your admission includes one drink and a heavy coat.  You can also upgrade or get more drinks.  There are many ice sculptures and places to take photos.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience! The staff went above and beyond
reviews.text: Wonderful experience! The staff went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. The bar was closed for renovations, and we were only in Bergen for a day and were looking forward to seeing the bar. The staff members, Paulina and Nicollet, opened up the bar for us to make sure we didn't miss out and had a chance to experience the bar. They were so lovely, making us drinks, turning on the music and showing us the place. The ice bar is very well made and a great place to visit. Definitely a night we will never forget!

reviews.title: Magic times in magic Ice bar
reviews.text: Utterly amazing experience!!!!!. Just loved the idea and atmosphere. Even tried aqivit.loved it. After a couple of drinks the walk through Bergen was an interesting one.

reviews.title: Ice bar Bergen, Norway
reviews.text: Had a good experience in the ice bar . Took photos while cradling a cocktail in my hand.  Fun to be in sub zero temp for a while.

reviews.title: A great experience
reviews.text: We headed off to Magic Ice Bar feeling a bit silly about doing something like this - after all we are in the later years of middle age. But it was a great experience. The ice carvings, set off by changing lighting are very impressive. We did the two drink option, which was good value. A bonus was that we went early for in the evening - missing the cruise ship crowds and the young party goers - for most of the time we were the only ones there; giving us a great opportunity to move around and see all the sculptures as the lighting changed.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant fun and good drink choices, particularly the white wine and fruit liquor. Really good value for money. Very friendly staff too. We loved it.

reviews.title: Great fun to visit the Ice Bar
reviews.text: Not been here before and wasn't disappointed. Great fun. Built inside an office block, the ice bar has walls of ice, seats of ice and a bar made of ice. It's -5C inside. Great fun.

reviews.title: Visit to Ice Bar off P&O cruise
reviews.text:
Had a great time & the staff were excellent, nothing was to much trouble.
It cost about £17 each but I thought it was worth the money

reviews.title: Good value for money
reviews.text: Visited the ice bar after visiting Mount Floyen and looking around Bergen. Lovely, friendly staff. Price for entrance was good - we chose the equivalent of £25 each. This included two large cocktails, paid £16 in London which only had one small cocktail. There were some very interesting ice sculptures. The seats had sheepskin on and the ice tables had a runner to stop glasses sliding off. Worth a visit 😊

reviews.title: A bit different
reviews.text:
Thoroughly enjoyable visit and an interesting experience.
Pricey but it can't be cheap running a place like this.
You are fully kitted up and drinks are good.

reviews.title: Brilliant!
reviews.text: We had been looking forward to visiting the ice bar for quite a while as stopped in Bergen on cruise. Never been to an ice bar before but it was really good fun - and very cold as you’d expect! Would definitely recommend a trip 🥶

reviews.title: A bit of a one trick pony but still fun
reviews.text: Maybe it's a gimmick but it's a fun one never-the-less. You get a big coat and a drink and it's good for a laugh or two.

reviews.title: Fun  ,different experience
reviews.text: Friendly, fun staff. You wear a poncho and gloves for warmth but it is not too cold to enjoy the experience. Interesting ice sculptures. Good music to sing to. Drinks served in an ice glass.

reviews.title: Surrounded by ice
reviews.text: Interesting experience. We got gloves jackets at the entrance. Interior is like in winter  mansion that made from ice, benches tables, sculptures, all!

reviews.title: Very very cold - But worth it.
reviews.text: This is located along the harbour front (opposite the historic old town),  Its about 15 minuites walk from the Bergen tourist information centre).   Of course there are ice bars but this is an ice bar in the right location.   It's like most ice bars and very cold but totally enjoyable.   I would recommend the second ticket option they have on their list as not only do you get a free drink in the bar but also a free cocktail of your choice and given Norways sky high prices for drinks, this is very good value.   We stayed about an hour and then walked back to the hotel (in what felt like a sub-tropical 3 degree temperature after being in the bar).    Ice scupltures are interesting!   Not a big place though but a great place to go and recommended.

reviews.title: A hoot..something different
reviews.text: Sure there are ice bars around the world..but BERGEN must be one ?  Of rhe mosy credible locations..great bit of fun an ad friendly staff.

reviews.title: Magic Ice Bar
reviews.text: During a recent break we came across the Magic Ice Bar on Trip Advisor and decided to take a look. We were welcomed on arrival and given the ponchos and gloves. Boy were they handy, -7c inside but amazing ice sculptures. Would recommend a visit.

reviews.title: Visit to ice bar
reviews.text: I went to the ice bar during a visit to Bergen, the cost was 250 NOK for entrance and two drinks. The temperature was -5 C,  they supplied a poncho and gloves. This was a good experience, there were some very interesting ice sculptures. Well worth the cost, staff were friendly. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Ice Bar
reviews.text: Very over rated, small inside so cramped. Drink was nice. We were given very heavy capes and gloves to wear, still freezing after only ten mins.

reviews.title: What fun
reviews.text: I hate the cold but this was so "cool". Great welcoming drink, warm cape with hood and gloves, sixties rock music - the Monkeys, I'm a Believer being played - I was in 7th heaven. Finished off the visit with a couple of Aquavit! Ice everywhere including an insert into you glass. Didn't feel the cold at all.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: A nice little place with ice sculptures, ice stools, ice tables, an  ice bar and ice cold drinks Nice and friendly staff.

reviews.title: Great Place!!
reviews.text: The place is amazing and definitely worth the visit. Michael and Angela were nice and friendly, making the whole experience that much better! Would definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Cool!
reviews.text: We visited the ice bar with our 3 kids - I know, who goes to a bar with 3 kids?  But, it was fun!  We showed up really early (like 5:30pm) and were literally the only people there.  The staff was very nice to the whole family.  Hooked the kids up with nonalcoholic drinks and even played some "Frozen" music for my daughter.  Everyone loved the cups made out of ice, the ice sculptures and the fuzzy ponchos.  We took silly photos.  A fun, but expensive way to spend 30 minutes.  Trust me - you won't last any longer.....it's COLD!

reviews.title: Ice around
reviews.text: It was our first experiece in visiting ice bars. All is made from ice - benches, tables, scultures. Staff of the bar will give you gloves, hats. not very comfortable because of low temperature

reviews.title: we loved it
reviews.text: The place is cold but the staff is welcoming you with a warm smile and the welcoming drinks with the ice are so nice.

reviews.title: Cool sensation
reviews.text:
It goes from "if", you want a fresh drink? You put your hand in the fridge and get the beverage! What about entering yourself in it?
Out of curiosity and enjoyment, not founding in every city a sort of Magic Ice Bar, been myself in Bergen, one place where it is, I thought this is the opportunity to visit the one.
Greeted at the entrance by two girl, one was the barmaid, after a chat, away from the turnout of the cruise visitors, who give the highest attendance, paid the admission, with consumption, about twenty €, wore the warm poncho with hood and gloves, we entered in the actual local with a temperature of minus five degrees.
The atmosphere is really "cool",  led lights, dim and changing colours.
 The environment consist of sitting areas with fur cover seats and the walls are decorated, like an art gallery but using a mixing of snow and ice.
The drink, with is also served in a ice glass, well, not  something special,  but we 
can't say isn't  fresh!
Expensive? maybe, but after the experience, and considering that  can't stay for a long than half an hour, and supposing not coming again, I find anyway worth it and beside, putting you in a good mood.
If you remove a glove, to make photos, and fill the hand freezing, don't worry, at the exit there is a small heather!
One more thing: during the visit, only a couple come to "warm up" the environment; yeees: good thing  finding the right time!

reviews.title: Memory will never forget!!!
reviews.text: The staff were great made us feel welcome explained everything. Made it so fun for our son 8 yrs old this is a must do. Kids can go too they get served their drink non-alcoholic in same ice glass as adults and musics playing skin furs to sit at tables just plain lit fun. You get gloves and a poncho to keep u warm.

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: We visited here in September, it was a little pricey considering most people only last about 20 minutes ourselves included. Glad we did it, nice bar & sculptures.  Gift shop not very good could do with something that actually relates to the Ice Bar.

reviews.title: Interesting bar to visit
reviews.text:
Bar made entirely out of ice, including the cups! Sculptures and carvings of paintings are interesting to look at. 
It’s pretty cold (-5 degrees) but they provide a poncho/jacket and gloves. 
A fun place and novelty thing to do with friends.

reviews.title: A must see attraction
reviews.text: An amazing place that has to be experienced.  Fantastic atmosphere and the most wonderful carvings.  Sit at an ice table and enjoy a drink from an ice goblet - one of the many highlights of our trip to Bergen.

reviews.title: Has to be done
reviews.text: Well could you really visit Bergen and not go to the ice bar - No. It was fun and we were just wrapped up enough to enjoy it rather than freeze.

reviews.title: Ice, Ice, Baby!!
reviews.text:
Ice Ice Baby!!  Call me strange, but I have always wanted to have a drink at an Ice Bar.  So what is an ice bar?  It is a drinking establishment where just about everything is made out of ice! 

Finally got the opportunity to visit an Ice Bar.  Of all places, this first experience took place at Magic Ice in Bergen, Norway.  Our timing was perfect because we beat all the cruise ship tourists so no waiting!  

Had a super FUN experience!!  After putting on one of their ponchos, into the freezer we went!!  As expected, there were plenty of ice sculptures.  All the walls, seating areas, shelvings, bar, etc. were made out ice!!  Oh yeah, it was very chilly inside as well!  Most folks weren't staying too long inside the ice bar before leaving for the warmth outside.

I enjoyed everything about the visit.  The ice sculptures were creative.  Especially the frame where you can poke your head through, and the throne where you can have a seat!!  The Norwegian alcoholic drink (cannot recall the name) which was included with the entry price was quite good.  Drinking it from the frozen ice glass made it even more chilling!!

Prices for the various packages were very reasonable.  Staff was terrific.  There shop even sells affordable Norwegian souvenirs.

reviews.title: New Experience
reviews.text: You can read about an Ice Bar, but one has to visit to gain any real appreciation. The ice carvings are spectacular. The atmosphere, to say the least, is "very cool". The included beverage was a delightful addition. It is a place that needs to be visited.

reviews.title: I’ve bar
reviews.text: This was excellent we did the trip independently, was very easy to find and reasonably priced and includes first drink. Staff are very friendly and more than welcome to talk to you about the ice and its life spam Would recommend a visit. Sorry can’t remember name

reviews.title: Something different whilst in Bergen
reviews.text:
Bergen was one of the ports we stopped at on our recent cruise, and we decided to visit the Magic Ice Bar as a family group.  We had to wait a short time for the bar to empty, as a group had gone in prior to us.  Outfitted with large thermal Parka to wear over your clothes and warm gloves into the freezer you go.

Your free welcome drink can be ordered from the bar, which is served in an edible ice glass, in a holder for convenience.  

The sculpting is very well done, with some items you can take pictures with your family on/in.

Normally there is a time limit due to numbers of people wanting to visit.  However, we arrived as the last organised cruise group arrived in the early afternoon, and were allowed as much time as we desired.

Nice to visit once, but doubtful we would do it again.

reviews.title: It's a limited bar located in a freezer.
reviews.text: Visited here while on a cruise stop.  We had never been to an Ice Bar and wanted to give it a try. REALLY, this was nothing special. It’s a small-limited bar in a walk in freezer. You pay a lot, get a thermal parka, gloves and a drink of some sweet national wine. There are some interesting ice sculptures and throne chair. Benches out of ice around the edge of the room. Located on the edge of town in the port area. Worth doing once so we can say we have, but we certainly don’t need to visit this location again.

reviews.title: Something for all the family
reviews.text: We were visiting the Norwegian fjords whilst on a cruise, we had booked a excursion called Bergen on your own which allowed us to go up the funicular and have a sandwich of your choice. Before leaving we had researched the area of things to do and our daughter had put this on her list. It was easy to find. It was very organised our tickets included a drink be it alcoholic or soft drinks we all chose soft drinks. Before going in staff helped us to get on ponchos which were incredibly warm and we were given gloves to wear. The sculptures and the designs were very clever. Well worth the experience.

reviews.title: Went on a cruise on Thomson discovery to Norway and called into Bergman were there was the most expensive fish market I
reviews.text: Then I went to the ice bar  which was a  good. Everyone should try it, when you get inside you have to put a coat and gloves on   Which they supply,  and you get a free drink .

reviews.title: Brilliant / different / Cold !!!
reviews.text:
Visited as part of a Fred Olsen Cruise walking tour 

We really loved it - you get a poncho and a pair of gloves - and we got a free drink included drink too !

A few people on our trip were surprised how cold it was (really !) - so if you don’t like the cold this maybe isn’t for you

We liked the sculptures, the music and the atmosphere 

A must visit if you’re in Bergen

reviews.title: Something different
reviews.text: Having researched the ice bar before calling at Bergen on a cruise, it was somewhere we put on our list of attractions to visit. We timed our visit to arrive at the opening time of 11am so it was reasonably quiet, but when we came out there was a queue in reception waiting to go inside. The bar is not too big, so I would imagine there is some control on how many go inside. We all thoroughly enjoyed our visit, was able to take plenty of photos, and enjoy a drink out of the ice glasses.

reviews.title: Worth a visit for its' "uniqueness"
reviews.text:
We visited Bergen as part of our Norwegian Fjords cruise.  We didn't book Magic Ice in advance so turned up on the day and queued to get in.

Magic Ice is expensive (as is everything in Norway) and the price seems a lot for what would only realistically be a half hour visit.  But it is worth it.

reviews.title: Worth a visit.
reviews.text: First time to an ice bar. We were in Bergen for one day during a cruise. The ice bar is quite small and can get busy at times. The tour had booked ahead so we did not have to wait long to get in. You get an insulated poncho and some gloves to wear before you enter. An alcoholic drink is included. It is about minus 5 degrees inside. The bar has ice sculptures and there are places to sit. Photos are allowed. We had about 15 minutes inside . So worth a visit if you have not visited and ice bar before.

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.text:
As I was spending a week in Bergen with my 19 year old daughter I fancied trying something a bit different. We didn’t book and just turned up on a Saturday night. It wasn’t busy and no need to book. We did discover that in Norway they are not allowed to serve alcohol before midday so if we had gone when it opened at 11am we would not have been able to have any alcoholic drink despite the ticket price being the same.
The staff were very friendly and attentive. We were provided with well padded ponchos and gloves and it was really cold in there so dress appropriately! The ice carvings and sculptures were really good. I had expected the place to be bigger but there were still several booths which each had ice carvings as well as there being sculptures around and a big ice chair which guests can sit on. We paid for the second drink - it didn’t add much to the overall cost but if we hadn’t have already paid for it we might not have bothered as we were quite cold and we went back into reception for a warm up before going back in which apparently very common and perfectly acceptable.
All in all it was an interesting and fun experience.

name: Fjord Tours

photo.caption: The Flåm Railway ©Paal Audestad / Fjord Tours

description: Choose Fjord Tours for great deals on vacations in Norway! Book fjord tours, hotels and exciting activities - all in one package! We offer a wide range of tours exploring some of the most popular tourist routes across this spectacular country. Whether you’re planning a long holiday in Norway or just a short break, let Fjord Tours be your expert guide - all year round. Fjord Tours combines beautiful fjord cruises with spectacular train and bus journeys. Enjoy a daytrip or a longer trip with stops in fairytale villages along the way. And thanks to the currently favorable exchange rates - there's never been a better time to visit Norway!

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Fjord Tours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell - Not recommended for groups
reviews.text:
We booked this tour for a group of six people (four adults and two children).

If you book in advance the first train ride has assigned seats but be prepared to race the crowd to the busses and get split apart between buses.  The busses are packed full and I ended up getting a broken "Jump seat" in the wheelchair cove of the bus.  My kids were stuck in the middle seats on the back of the bus and literally fell asleep as they did not get a chance to see anything from their position.

Next comes a ferry ride that is again open seating.  The ferry is all electric and very nice but you are lucky if you get a seat on the 2+ hour ride.  This is about the only opportunity to really see anything as you can walk out on the open deck and take pictures of the Fjord.  I would recommend just doing the ferry ride and skipping the rest of the tour.

The ferry drops you off in Flam which is a complete tourist trap.  You can shop and stroll around but you better get in line early as the next train is open seating.  If you are a couple it is probably fine but we had difficulty finding seats and could not sit near our in laws.  The train is not air conditioned so it was quite stuffy on the warm summer day that we were there.

The final train had assigned seats and actually had some of the best views of the trip.  If you are a photographer this trip will frustrate you as there is glare from the train windows so you will not be able to get any good pictures during the trip.

Overall I would not recommend for groups over four people.  The tour is fast paced but still boring.  The logistics were chaotic and stressful.

reviews.title: Eidfjord Waterfall and Nature Centre Tour - Cheaper than Cruise
reviews.text:
Very basic tour - some audio tracks played whilst on the coach, coach driver not a tour guide, may as well use a shuttle service to the waterfall (270NOK instead of 410NOK)
Nature centre - unnecessary addition to the waterfall and tour spends too long there ~1:15 mins 
Waterfall - 45 mins was not enough time to appreciate the site, all felt rather rushed 
Although the price was £20 cheaper than the exact same tour offered by the cruise line (CMV.

reviews.title: A beautiful start to our holiday.
reviews.text: We booked the three hour tour to Mostraumen. We were incredibly lucky with the weather and enjoyed watching the fantastic scenery from the comfort of the top deck. The highlight was reaching the end of th fjord and seeing the beautiful  village and waterfall close up. Would thoroughly recommend the trip if you only have an afternoon.

reviews.title: Spectacular scenery but poor execution
reviews.text:
The scenes are stunning but the tour was missold in 2 ways:
The traditional Norwegian buffet lunch was non existent

The cruise back to Bergen was on standard ferry with no seats for us - 3 hours.

Lovely coach driver and coach but very expensive in light of the misdescriptions.

reviews.title: Picturesque but boring
reviews.text:
Took the Norway in a nutshell tour, which includes train, cruise and bus rides and started our trip in Bergen. We first took the train ride which was smooth and the views offered were superb. The 2 hours cruise from Flåm was rather boring albeit the (repetitive) scenic views. Before boarding the cruise, our rather long wait (4hours) at Flåm was also dull. As I believe it’s catered to predominantly tourists, souvenirs and food stores set up sell reallyyyy expensive food. During the wait, we simply bask in the sun and spent 2 hours napping on the grass since the sun was out and the weather was perfect to sleep in. Not far out in the corner, a kayak rental store is available but I think you have to catch certain time slots in order to row into the waters with the instructors.

Finally, the 1 hour bus ride to Myriad to catch the train back to Bergen was the least enjoyable- views are nice but again, repetitive to a point where you’d doze off. Think this package would best suit retirees who want to enjoy what nature offers while sipping a cup of coffee; not so much to millennials who want to spend their time productively.

reviews.title: Very rigid
reviews.text: We are on the Norway in a nutshell tour and are booked on an afternoon train back to Oslo but asked if we could take a morning train instead.  We had experienced some delays on our way out of Oslo so thought it would be good to give ourselves a bit of a cushion in our schedule.  We were told it wasn’t possible because we had to make any changes 10 days before the departure.  We were even willing to pay any difference in price but were told that our only option was to buy new tickets!

reviews.title: No wifi, No electricity, No stopping at the great views
reviews.text: This includes UNESCO Fjord Bus tour. We got no wifi or electricity in the bus. More importantly the bus quickly passes through beautiful sceneries and only stops at two of them, which is a real pity.

reviews.title: Rainy but awesome sights
reviews.text: So glad we stayed an extra day in Norway to do the 10-hr Songesfjord (?) in Nutshell tour rdtrip from Bergen. Boat was very comfortable, fun, on time to all ports incl final stop in Flam. Views along fjord & on Flam train were so beautiful. Final activity during 2 week tour in Baltic & Russia. Norway is definitely the most picturesque!

reviews.title: Go on a fjord tour to experience Norway
reviews.text: Heaps available but essential to understand and see the beauty of Norway. The Geiranger Fjord is close to Bergen and is very special.

reviews.title: A Dream comes true !
reviews.text:
Cruising along the fjord in Bergen at the night of Chrismas. Truly special and dream comes true especially for us from tropical island of Indonesia in search for nordic holiday.
It was the last fery before closing for XMas holiday. Cold and windy outside at the fery deck. But couldn’t help it to get better pictures. 
It gets dark when ported. We closed it with a nice seafood dinner at the Resto Pier.
Nice...

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell is really worthwhile
reviews.text: We booked a Nutshell trip to finish a 4 week northern European holiday and it was a great thing to do. Day 1: Started at 0830 in Oslo and traveled by bus to Nesbeyan (as train line under repair) then train to Myrdal. Next was historic train to Flam followed by electric boat to Gudvangen where we stayed the night. Day 2 we caught the bus to Voss and then the train to Bergen where we stayed 2 nights before catching the train direct from Bergen to Oslo. All the changes in transport worked well with many stunning highlights & no lowlights. I appreciated the many practical suggestions from other TA reviewers like which side of the train/bus to sit for the best views & avoid taking your suitcases if at all possible. We managed with a backpack each.

reviews.title: Hardangerfjord - heaven on earth!
reviews.text: We were blessed to get a chance to go here....one of the most beautiful parts of this globe. Be it the bus drive to Norheimsund, the ferry thru Hardangerfjord, the quaint and gorgeous Eidfjord, this 12 hour trip shall stay with us for a lifetime!

reviews.title: Water Water Everywhere
reviews.text: There are several fjord trips ranging from all day to 3 hours. We did the three hour trip and it was beautiful but rainy. You see a fjord and waterfalls and small isolated towns and the way out is great but then you turn around and go back which is slightly boring. I think the 12 hour may be a bit much but I know others do not agree.

reviews.title: See a good slice of Norway via Public Transportation!
reviews.text: I did the Norway in a Nutshell tour that included the 5+ hour passenger ferry ride from Bergen to Flam. This journey included about five or six stops along the way. The boat has a first and second floor. In Bergen, I showed up to board the boat 15 minutes prior to departure and there was already a long line waiting to board. Get there early for good seats. The boat has a front deck with very little space for people. The big deck is at the back (where passengers are allowed to smoke; albeit just a few). Everyone on this boat LOVES waterfalls. When you hit the waterfall, everyone is at the back taking pics with their phone. There is a small cafe on the boat. The beauty around the water is great but is best in the last hour of the boat ride. Once in Flam, you take the Flam railway, which is an old style rail-car that is cool! Some of the trips were booked so buy in advance if you can. After the Flam railway is the Tram to Bergen. All of the tour is on public transportation so you could do this cheaper if you bought tickets individually, but honestly, it was worth it to me to have all the tickets in advance and hop from boat to train to tram without worry. In the end, it was great to see the Norwegian landscape during a short stay in Norway.

reviews.title: Beautiful setting
reviews.text:
Beauty every direction you look... couldn't ask for a more relaxing setting
Catch the Flam railway to see some breathtaking waterfalls up close winding through the mountains.
Stay at Balestrand to just chill out from this busy world.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Bus replaced train, total chaos at oslo station as people trying to understand which bus. Poor bus drivers inundated with same questions. No one in charge to direct. Bus to nesbyen SIT ON LEFT OR YOU MAY AS WELL SLEEP.  Right hand side hugs mountains so no views. Left has fantastic views and the people asleep in these seats will just frustrate you.  Train, although i must have been one of the first people who booked and i am travelling alone, i was assigned a seat in a group of 4, facing the opposite way the train runs AND with a bulkhead next to me rather than a window. To anyone booking this expensive tour early, make sure you insist on a seat that is appropriate to you and do not depend on any sensible allocation from fjord tours.

reviews.title: Hectic crowd; recommend smaller private tours
reviews.text: The transportation itself is well organized. The crowd management is terrible. On the fjord cruise part, there were tourists playing loud music as if it was their own private boat, feeding birds even though there were large signs saying don’t feed them, then way too many selfie sticks and people acting like they’ve never been outside of their homes. Ridiculously crowded and unruly people acting like drunks. There was zero control over crowd and tour operators could not care less. Highly recommend seeking smaller, private tours if the price is right. Unfortunately we had not done enough research and clicked on the first thing we saw.

reviews.title: Leisure
reviews.text:
Rodne fjords cruise is excellent relaxing and unrushed cruise 
It’s a quite and well maintained cruise with clean bathrooms and tidy spacious sitting area 
I highly recommend it, very enjoyable

reviews.title: Wonderful !
reviews.text:
We chose 7-Night Aurora Pass because we wanted to have as much chances to see the Northern Lights, because we were travelling with children.
We've enjoyed every moment of our chasing which includes voyage etc. , 1 night was 3 hours long in each directon.
The bus was very comfortable, maintained temprature, we could see a beautiful Arctic landscape although it was a little dark outside, listening to some good music was very great experience. 
We've had a different guide and different driver every day. 
Marius, Bert, Justyna, Jonny,  Marcin, Meda and Elisa, they were all really kind and joyful.
They took really nice pics and they gave us a lot of interesting information about the Northern Lights, constellations and other near places.
Thank You all guys. We will be in touch . 
We wish You many good and successful chasings.

reviews.title: You can book it yourself.
reviews.text: We did the whole trip from online at home before going. It’s wonderful. The highlight for me was the electric ferry through the fjords and for my husband the flam railway in the mountains. We had sunshine all the time in Norway but hoping up the flam railway it was snowing. Dress accordingly.  Start from 8 in the morning back at Bergen by six. Well worth the effort.

reviews.title: BAD EXPERIENCE WITH HARDANGERFJORD IN A NUTSHELL
reviews.text:
Hello,

I booked a tour for 2 persons on March 14 for the Hardangerfjord tour for May 11, 2019.  

I am extremely dissapointed as we were missed almost half of the tour due to a bus that was not at the station at the schedule listed on my tour booking.

This is what happened.  We disembarked from the train from Bergen at 09:53 on May 11 in Voss station.  We walked to the bus stop as indicated in the travel plan AND THE PDF and waited for bus 990 to take us to Ulvik (change at Granvin to use 945).  The bus was supposed to leave for Granvin at 10:05.  THE BUS DID NOT ARRIVE UNTIL 11:15.  We finally reached Ulvik at 12:30 missing the boat to Eidfjord.

Because of this, we were not able to utilize the tour to go to the Nature Center and the Voringfossen.  We got stuck in Ulvik and waited for the 15:15 boat to take us to Norheimsund where  the bus would take us back to Bergen.  

The problem is they do not have a customer hotline number and a Saturday as their office is closed on the weekends.

This was supposed to be a memorable trip for us but it ended up partly affecting my positive impression of this beautiful and friendly people of Norway.

reviews.title: Fullday Fjiord trip to Flam .
reviews.text: Our trip along the Fjiords was amazing. Breathtakingly so. The captain of the ship gave good commentary in several languages. Turned the ship around for us to get good photos of waterfalls etc. A fabulous day in the fjiords.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell trip super
reviews.text: We did Norway in a nutshell in a day and loved it. It was super easy to do and the scenery is wonderful. The weather is very changeable in Bergen so suggest you leave it to the last minute to book as you really want decent weather to enjoy the trip.

reviews.title: Enjoyable trip
reviews.text: The Ford cruise from bergen will take you close to the beautiful fjords up and close. It's a fantastic way to explore the fjords and the spectacular scenery it offers. There are several boat cruises available from bergen and is highly recommended during your stay.

reviews.title: Awesome tour, including a very convenient mistake
reviews.text:
We went on the Sognefjord & Nærøyfjord in a nutshell tour. 

We started in Bergen. After a day getting used to our surroundings, we embarked from Bergen train station. We left the majority of our luggage in the lockers which are relatively cheap and I would advise you do the same. We had planned a single overnight stay so we didn't need to carry all that much. 

The train to Voss was amazing, there wasn't a single bad view. Both sides of the train are as good as each other. I would recommend getting to Bergen train station early as the queue was massively long and we had to walk up the carriage to find two seats together. It wasn't overcrowded, but I'd suggest getting yourself comfortable before you get going.

At Voss, we were met by many tour buses to take everyone to Gudvangen. Again, go for the buses at the back. All the tourists seemed in a major hurry and crowded to the front buses in a big old hurry. As a result they looked really full. Ours was just over half full and far more pleasant. The trip down the Stalheimskleiv road is incredible! Amazing bus driving skills for sure; our bus driver deftly navigated her way around at least two cars parked in very silly ways. But the views of the waterfalls and cliffsides are majestic. This part of the tour is simply incredible.

We decided to spend our overnight in the Gudvangen hotel. Although (in 2018) the place felt a little unfinished, once the gaggle of tourists had headed off on the boat to continue their tour, it was very quiet, serene and picturesque. The rooms are really well laid out and decorated with Viking accoutrements throughout. Over the bridge was the Viking museum which was sadly still being built when we were there. However there are plenty pleasant walkways leading away from the hotel. The food hall and gift shops were brilliant and a perfect place to grab a souvenir if you aren't too fussed about the authenticity in terms of mass manufactured. There is a really sweet little pebble shop in Gudvangen where my partner decided to stock up on gifts for her daughter. They really were very pretty.

We could see that there were caves nearby, however it didn't seem that there was any reasonable way of accessing them for a visit. In my opinion, this is a very missed opportunity by the Gudvangen hotel as I would have loved to have gone.

The night in Gudvangen was excellent, we slept well and got a decent breakfast before making our way to the boat onto the Nærøyfjord. As well as scenery, there is plenty of sea life popping up to say hello and a little cafe on board to grab a coffee. This was a long part of the cruise and while picturesque, I would suggest that the boat itself isn't the most comfortable in the world. But it's a good time to sit back, relax and chat. 

Arriving in Sogndal, we took a series of buses to make it over to Leikanger for the expressboat on the Sognefjord. However, this is where we made a mistake. We sadly got off of the bus too early and ended up being about a 20 minute walk from Leikanger for an express boat that was due to show up in far less time than that. Upon arrival, of course the boat had left and we were technically stranded. Hot tip, when the bus sign shows Leikanger, this isn't your stop. You need Leikanger Kei! If in doubt ask the driver; the second bus we got the driver was very helpful and sympathetic to our plight.

The hotel right by the Leikanger Kei had a room left which is where we spent the night, phoning ahead to our next night's hotel to cancel. As it turned out the hotel ahead only charged half of our missed night as they had a last minute guest pop in. Lovely people, the Norwegians and beats having had to pay out full costs.

I have to say, the mistake actually turned out good. The hotel in Leikanger Kei is amazing. It overlooks the Kei with the mountains in the background. I'll warn, there is absolutely nothing in Leikanger other than a small churchyard that we found ourselves in with some sort of significance. But really the views available from the hotel were definitely the highlight of the trip. If I were doing this again, I would actually take the night in Leikanger Kei. It a really nice chilled out stop over, the food available is really good and it doesn't cost the earth. 

The next morning we got our express boat back to Bergen and realised that had we left on boat the previous afternoon, chances are it would have been dark and we would have missed the amazing scenery down Sognefjord. Hence, if you can, catch a morning boat trip! The expressboat is also seriously comfortable and if you fancy a nap, now's your time. You have plenty time and the scenery down the fjord is awesome! I would suggest bringing snacks and/or coffee in a thermos!

I loved the trip so much, we are intending on doing it again (albeit a slight variation) next year. Now that I have done it once, I would do the following in preparation:

- Arm yourself with a coffee flask and buy sandwiches in Bergen before you go. Once in Gudvangen, pretty much everyone is stacked by the food hall to buy lunch and it's a nightmare. It reminded me of the black friday sales footage. This is an ideal time to sit by the lock or on the little island across the bridge and have your own lunch and then wander around the gift shops.

- Our trip next year looks like we will be stopping in Sogndal. From the few minutes I saw Sogndal, it did look a lot better kitted out in terms of things to do and see. Although the Gudvangen hotel was beautiful (and I hope it's finished now) I think I would opt for Sogndal just to see the difference for myself. Again, stock up on coffee and lunches for the next day too!

- Leaving the bulk of our luggage in the train station locker was a good plan! Travel light. While you can feasibly take it all with you, it's just a pain in the behind to be that guy lugging all your gear on every step. A simple rucksack with a couple of days changes in is all you need.

- Definitely try and organise your trip so that the Sognefjord express boat is a morning boat. By the time 6pm rolled around, it was quite dark and I imagine would have been even darker on the Expressboat. The Sognefjord is far too pleasant to miss!

- I fully recommend boots for the trip! I'm glad I had mine as did my partner as you will most likely want to go hiking or rambling. The terrain is not too friendly to light shoes or canvass shoes (just something I remember some guy on the tour moaning about)

- Bring a zip hoodie or a fleece with you; the boat on the Nærøyfjord can get a little cold. Basically something with a hood that you can stash easily when you don't want it. 

- Where you get the opportunity, fill up your water and/or your coffee flask. You will thank yourself later!

reviews.title: Sognefjord and Vik tour
reviews.text:
On 19.4 we took the Sognefjord and Vik tour with Gofjords. We went with the Fjord boat to Vik where our great guide Tord showed us around and told us interesting facts about the beautiful town and the viking churches. On the way back we went by bus and stopped on the way a few times for some great moutain views. We can highly recommend this tour.

Regards,

Lucas and Myy from Finland

reviews.title: Expensive to cancel
reviews.text: If there is a chance you will need to cancel, I would not recommend booking. It is NOK 600 per person to cancel, and they are not very helpful. Really disappointing to have to pay a huge fee when we won't even be on the tour. Also, the website does not make it easy to cancel. You have to email the company and wait for them to respond to you.

reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK AT ANY COST
reviews.text: Tour was cancelled with absolutely no communication what so ever. Traveled all the from Bergen to Voss only to found out from a very kind hotel staff who was willing to call on our behalf that our tour was cancelled. Absolute scam. Do not book!

reviews.title: Excellent introduction to the fjords and mountains and all in one day
reviews.text: We booked the ‘Norway in a nutshell’ tour a day or two before arriving in Norway after consulting the weather reports for the next few days. Luckily these were accurate and we experienced stunning weather especially on the fjord trip which was on an amazing award winning electric boat. It is a self guided tour so you do need to be prepared for this, no-one helps you to get from one form of transport to the next but it is easy and well signed. The very helpful information office in Bergen did give us a booklet which had extensive detail of places visited on the tour. I do think this should be more readily available to download online if you purchase tickets.

reviews.title: Eurorail’s ‘Norway in a Nutshell’ Pass
reviews.text: I was looking for a train tour of Norway and in google search  this tour came up. Decided it was a good way to spend 8 days in Norway. After getting pdf tickets for all travel in one day, which was not what we wanted, I tried to change. Not possible. Had to cancel, pay huge cancellation fee including currency exchange $100., and $40 for handling, on top of $120. Cancellation Fee. The small print for what you’re signing up for is very unclear until they alert you to what they need to do to get your choice of travel.

reviews.title: ‘Norway in a Nutshell’ self tour
reviews.text:
What a day! We absolutely loved this trip. 
Recommended to us by a friend, we booked this online before we arrived in Bergen for a three night stay. 
I have to say I was slightly anxious when I realised it was a ‘self tour’ but actually it was so straight forwards. Everything ran exactly on time (unlike trains in the UK!) as your agenda shows you. Between stops and change overs it was easy and ran smoothly. The fact that it was a self tour actually made the whole day very relaxing. 
The scenery is breathtaking, we were very lucky to not have a cloud in the sky on a cold, snowy day, however these views even on a miserable day would look stunning! 
All transport was clean, the staff were friendly and were there if you needed to ask any questions. 
It’s a great way to see Norway in a snap shot if you are only there for a short period of time. 
We took a picnic with us for the day as we travelled in winter time so wasn’t sure what would be open, however there are cafes along the way with time to grab something to eat/drink even in these periods. 
Sailing down the fjord is simply stunning and the caption ‘one of the worlds most beautiful train journeys’ on the Flåm railway wasn’t lying! I couldn’t recommend this trip enough! Well worth the money.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: The fjords should be on everyone's bucket list. So beautiful and loved the small towns. We went in September which was nice, not too cold, but October would be great to with the changing leaves

reviews.title: Family day trip
reviews.text: We booked online for Norway in a Nutshell, from Bergen on a train, then a bus to the fjord ferry, which is electric and really comfortable, then onto Flåm Railway-amazing, then back onto a train to Bergen. Great, easy self tour, all transport ran on time, everyone friendly. It’s a long day, bring snacks and drinks and your camera amazing country!

reviews.title: 3 Hour Tour From Bergen
reviews.text: We did the short cruise from Bergen To Monstraumen.   Boat is excellent and very stable for those who don’t like sailing.  Scenery was amazing despite lousy weather on the day we travelled.  Only improvement would be the staff aren’t particularly friendly.

reviews.title: Fjord Cruis over Safari Fjord
reviews.text: We did the Fjord Cruise and booked it thru visitflam.com - this was way much better and convenient that the Fjord Safari Tours. Trust me, you won’t go wrong with this! It has very comfortable seats, a lot of space for viewing decks and you can order snacks onboard. If it gets windy outside you can go indoor for a bit to warm up unlike the Safari Fjord which doesnt give you much option. Ferry is eco-friendly too. We got the one that takes you to Gudavangen from Flam and you take a 20-minute bus from there and back to Flam.

reviews.title: Booking response
reviews.text:
Tried to book this tour on the back of reviews. Called into Bergen Tourist info. Office
and was told that they wouldn't be happy to take booking at weekend as support systems could not be guaranteed on a Saturday so tickets could not be guaranteed.However was informed that I could book online. I told them that I was under the impression that I had to book 2 days in advance online but was assured this was not the case. When I tried to book online sure enough I was offered Weds. as earliest day I could go. The message I'm getting here is " sure you can go but only when we have our act together". Disappointing response for me.

reviews.title: Just right
reviews.text: An excellent experience.  All the arrangements, information and details we needed, no more, no less.  Thank you.

reviews.title: Good one day trip
reviews.text: We did this from Bergen and come back to Bergen. Some tourists doing this were ending in Oslo, thise you could see them dragging their luggage in the snow on the ice, no fun at all. It was snowing that day, so we had very chilly and foggy boat ride, it's eerily pretty.  The photos taken that day  are in black and white.

reviews.title: Bergen to Bergen Norway in a Nutshell
reviews.text: DO IT! Well worth the money. Spectacular views you wont get anywhere else. I was a bit worried when I booked it about finding the transfer points but it was really easy, the transport was clean and comfortable. It is a long day, but dont let that put you off, i would do it all over again in a heartbeat. The cruise and the Flam train were my highlights! AMAZING! I did a totally different fjord cruise the next day, and it just couldnt compare to this.

reviews.title: Lookout for the dancing lady - Flam Railway
reviews.text: We made our own "Norway in a Nutshell" tour! From Bergen to Flam by train/bus and a bot ride down the fjords. A night at Flam and then a ride on the famous Flam Railway to Myrdal where we caught the main-line train to Oslo. Each part of the journey was very picturesque, but the main idea was to take a boat ride through the famous fjords.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell - an excellent trip!
reviews.text: We booked the train from Oslo to Myrdal, followed by the Flam railway, overnight in Flam, fjord trip from Flam to Gudvangen, then bus to Voss and onward train to Bergen.  This is a self guided tour and yes, you can book each section on your own and probably save about 1/3 in cost, but for the ease (collecting all the tickets in 1 place) and organisation of connections I think it is was worth it and it all worked. The normal Oslo-Bergen railway sections are fine, nice scenery from Oslo towards Flam, but nothing spectacular.  The highlight begins with the Flam railway which is a great adventure although there was a lot of mist and we sadly missed some of the spectacular views.  Flam in mid winter is a surreal place to visit and well worth the overnight stop over particularly as it means you can do the whole trip in day light. The fjord journey the next day from Flam to Gudvangen was spectacular.  There were only about a dozen of us on a large new stealth like electric boat they have doing the route.  Really incredible.  Apart from the scenery, it was interesting to see how people live out in these remote parts with the boat acting as postman and transport.  Finally connection by bus to Voss and onwards to Bergen by train.  All in all an incredible trip and if you don't want to go to the time and agro of finding and booking each section yourself, then booking the whole thing through Fjord tours is an excellent option.

reviews.title: The fjords in a nutshell
reviews.text: The whole tour gives you the most spectacular views from the mountain tops (the Flåm railway trip), the fjords themselves (the cruise to Gudvangen), and around (the bus trips to Voss and Eidfjord). In Eidfjord we had the most amazing experience with "Hardangerfjord in a nutshell" - the trip to Vøringsfossen waterfall, walking with snow shoes, learning about the history of the region from the amazing guides and enjoying the treats of the local culture. We strongly recommend visiting Eidfjord in the winter and participating in the aforementioned "winter activities". The Nature Center is another wonderful place to visit and get to know the wild life and history of the region.

reviews.title: Excellent fjord experience
reviews.text: We took Sognefjord in a Nutshell and Osterfjord tours. Wonderful experience, a must do in Bergen. But please be advised that this is not the organized tours you are probably got used to. You will be handed tickets and provided very friendly guidance (when asking for it), but nobody will nurse you. Pack your bag with some refreshing drinks and sandwiches, look through your route in advance to make sure you don't get lost at connections and you will be ready for a lifetime experience.

reviews.title: Flam andFjord
reviews.text: We started our train journey from Oslo to Flam early in the morning at 8:30am, 28th Nov. We totally enjoy our approx. 4.5 hours train ride - the seat is large and very comfortable and the train is very clean. Along the way, the  snowy white scenery is just beautiful. The next time, I would love to take the same train journey BUT will be in Summer and I am sure it will be very colourful and beautiful too.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell
reviews.text: I really enjoy this tour from online ticket booking, printing all tickets at the train station, explanation from officer who printed the ticket, leaflet containing the schedule and itinerary are clear and easy to understand. This trip starts by train from Bergen train station to Voss continue by bus from Voss to Gudvangen harbour, very beautiful scenery along the way. From here the journey by boat along Nærøyfjods the narrowest, most famous of the fjord arms and UNESCO World Heritage Site begins. Nice and clean boat, magical atmosphere created from high mountains that surround it.  Anchored on Flåm fjord cruise terminal and continue the journey on Flåm Railway to Myrdal, the journey up the mountain passes through several tunnels with views towards mighty waterfall and mountain peaks. Train stop at Kjosfossen for 10 minutes to give opportunity for passangers to take pictures with background of the waterfall. Watch out for the slippery stops during winter.
