Trains stop again at Vatnahalsen where the passangers can enjoy the spectacular view over the valley. The trip continues to Myrdal where the Flåm railway and Bergen railway meet. We moved to Bergen railway to return to Bergen. Truly a beautiful and unforgettable journey.

reviews.title: Wonderful Views
reviews.text: Great experience. We went from Bergen to Oslo. First leg was the 1hr train which was in darkness for most of it. Second leg was the bus and it was nice with the sun coming up. The third leg, the fjord cruise, was incredible. By far the best part of the trip. The fourth leg, the Fram railway, was nice but not comparable to the Fjord cruise. The waterfall was frozen (who cares, I’ve seen plenty). We took the earlier a Flåm railway train. You must do this in winter otherwise you will see nothing. The fifth leg, the 4 1/2 hr train to Oslo, was in complete darkness and was exhausting. Not fun at all, but the day was well worth it. Highly recommended, but you will be exhausted by the end.

reviews.title: Flam railway worth it, but short daylight hours left us wanting
reviews.text: Our trip from Oslo started in the dark, but we got some nice views near the end and the Flam railway was wonderful. The third boat was good until the sun went down, then the rest of the trip was just darkness. Not a lot of fun.

reviews.title: Fjord and Flam
reviews.text: The Norway in a Nutshell tour started in the dark with train from Bergen to Voss. Daylight had arrived for the hour long bus trip over snow laden hill and dale to Gudvangen. There were a number of decent views but none like what awaited on the rest of the day. The Ferry ride through the fjords to Flam was spectacular but if doing it at this time of year make sure you rug up! Then the Flam Railway to Myrdal was unbelievable. We sat on the right hand side facing backwards. This provided some extraordinary scenery but to be fair, everyone on the train would have been in awe! Myrdal to Bergen provided some more wonderful scenery until darkness descended.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell disappointing
reviews.text: We opted to do this tour based on the reviews it received. However we found that for most of the time you hopped on and off transport and sat around. There was limited information provided along the route. Most of the group had to lug around suitcases. The fjord ferry ride was good (2h) but there could be more information given as you journey through the fjord. The TV screen information doesn’t do the experience justice. Flam was a waste of time. Most places were closed including the pub. The cafeteria had limited stock and poor service. Shops were closed. There is the option to take the train to a hotel. Some said one should and others said we shouldn’t. We should have. We felt like all we did was sit around for the whole tour. The train to Myrdal which is supposed to be a “must-see” was done in the dark!!! We saw nothing of the scenery. There was an earlier train to Myrdal but then you would have to wait at a station with no caffe for over an 1.5h. Options to be explained clearly and other options should provided over the winter season. Yet on another train for four hours in the dark back to Oslo. Disappointing and expensive.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell tour, simply superb.
reviews.text: Luckily for us a waitress at our hotel strongly recommended this tour. We are so pleased that we decided to book. The whole day was a wonderful experience. The boat trip on the ffyord was beautiful and travelling in December the boat was relatively empty. The scenery was stunning. When we thought it could not get better we went on the Flam railway, absolutely breath taking !

reviews.title: NO SERVICE@premium price-"robot" seat selection and no one can change it
reviews.text: 2140 NOK ($350+US) for 1-day unguided tour on public transport. Problem is, some 'new automated' seat selection that gave me not only the worst seat on the 'comfort' carriage (you pay more and it is the only reservable part of the trip). I can see the whole rest of the train is empty, but both Fjord tours and NSB (train) will not lift a finger to assign me a seat I can sit in (i.e. not a backward facing one). Not only zero customer service for a tour you can put together on your own, they are discriminating against a person with a medical disability, rather than simply issuing a forward facing seat. I asked them to refund that portion of the journey and I would go into the NSB web site and select the seat, but they wont do that, either. What a racket. Should have just booked it on my own. Waste of time and money. Save yourself a lot of aggravation and just make your own arrangements per the many DIY Norway in a Nutshell blogger articles. P.s. This trip is scheduled for March 2019 so perhaps with another 3 months of time and effort and VISA, tourism agency, etc. involvement it can be fixed by then. Hope you have lots of time on your hands!!!

reviews.title: Fjord experience
reviews.text:
We went with the Rødne tour to Mostraumen for our fjord trip. It was a cold day but the scenery was so nice most of the passengers were up on deck. 
It’s a 3 hour trip, which seemed much more reasonable than the 11 hour fjord trip to Sogneford, which requires an overland journey in order to get the the fjord and then a boat trip. 
We had a great time. The other passengers were quite friendly, and the cocoa was hot as we returned home as the sun set behind us.

reviews.title: Fjord cruise
reviews.text: We cruised to Mostraumen. It was stunning on boat for 3 hours . Amazing views . Would highly recommend

reviews.title: A Great Way to See Norway!
reviews.text: We did the Bergen-Voss-Gudvangen-Flam-Myrdal-Bergen trip and it was amazing.  It was in December and parts of the train rides there and back were in the dark, so in the summer months, the scenery would have been even better!  As it was, the train to Voss and the bus to Gudvangen offered great views of the mountains and once we were on the boat along the fjords, the views were spectacular.  The train up the mountains from Flam to Myrdal was very enjoyable also.  Would highly recommend this company for a way to experience Norway if you are limited for time.

reviews.title: Unforgetable Journey
reviews.text: My husband and I did the train to Bergen then the bus and fjord tour.  It was spectacular!  For a truly magnificent experience, don't miss this one of a kind oportunity in Norway!

reviews.title: EXCELLENT TOUR!
reviews.text: If you want to see Norway, this is the best way to do it. I suggest staying in the small city stops to get the whole experience of Norway. Prepare to take lots of pictures. Various waterfall views. Breathtaking views from each side of the train, you can't go wrong. Enjoy! Take everything in.

reviews.title: Beautiful day on the Fjords!
reviews.text:
NB: We travelled Bergen-Voss-Gudvangen-Flam-Myrdal-Bergen. 

This is a great day out. Booked as a package, the component travel parts ran smoothly and didn't require us to overstay in any spot. The fjord we travelled upon was stunning, the Flam railway idyllic and the Norwegian train service efficient and clean. 

Worth every penny!

reviews.title: Low to zero visibility during the winter time
reviews.text:
I did a DIY Norway in a Nutshell via Myrdal since the date I was choosing (19 November) was unable to be clicked which I am guessing because it was sold out. Then I took the ferry cruise from Flam to Gudvangen at 3PM. After waiting at Flam for a good 4 hours (since there are no earlier departures), the views were quite underwhelming since it gets dark at 4PM and from 3-4PM the fjords were covered by fog. I wish there were earlier departures being offeres during the winter from Flam since otherwise the earliest one was at 10.30AM and we havent gotten off from our train yet at that time. We barely get any good photos or views of the fjord.

Please don't repeat my mistakes and use the via Voss route instead!

reviews.title: See so much!!!
reviews.text: Such an enjoyable day and you get to see quite a bit.  For me personally, while the views on the train were stunning, just hope you don’t get rude people who constantly cut in front of you and obstruct your view.  Other than that, it was truly an amazing day.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell - Bergen round trip - one day
reviews.text: We really enjoyed this day out from Bergen, and although expensive considered it worth it. The views are breath-taking and it is difficult to know which way to look. Other reviewers have mentioned that there is a lot off hanging around between transportation however we did not find this to be the case. The longest halt was at Gudvangen for about an hour. This time can easily be filled taking in the scenery. There is a shop and café also. Several braziers were lit outside too if you felt chilly. Our tour used the winter Classic boat, which whilst not modern has a lot of charm. There is lots of outside seating and deck space however inside is small and tired. The fjord is stunning, the water is like a mirror glass.  Flam is beautiful although there is not much time to explore it. I would advise boarding the train early to get a seat on the right for the best views. The sun went down on the journey back to Bergen with the best views from the left.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell
reviews.text:
Must see trip. Awesome and most beautiful 
There are various combinations in it-

1. Oslo to Bergen 
2. Bergen to Oslo 
3. Bergen to Bergen 

We did the Bergen to Bergen 

In the tour you do the train first, then the bus , then the boat and then the flam train after that the train back to Bergen 

You will start this tour at 8:43am and ends back in Bergen at 6:00 pm

Lovely way to see Norway

reviews.title: Waterfalls Galore
reviews.text: Hands down, the best thing to do while in Bergen. The three hour tour was perfect. Amazing views. Beautiful landscape. Friendly boat staff. The waterfalls and plentiful and just spectacular to see.

reviews.title: Scenic
reviews.text:
We started from Bergen and spent the first night in Gudvangen. Next night was spent in Flam and the on third day travelled from Flam to Oslo.

One definitely needs to do the trip over 2-3 days to enjoy the train/ferry/bus rides and soak in the beauty of the area.

This allows one the opportunity to stay in places other than the major cities of Bergen and Oslo.

Also did not buy the Norway in a Nutshell tour. Did the train and ferry tickets online and bought the bus tickets when boarding it. Worked out 30% cheaper and gave us the possibility to set our pace.

reviews.title: Magical ❤️
reviews.text: Would absolutely Recommend it to every one .. the cost of the ticket was 600 NOK , almost 60 Euros  But its totally worth it .. a 3 hours trip ❤️ Loved it .. everything was perfect.. and you get the chance to taste the water from the waterfall 👌🏼

reviews.title: Super gyönyörű.
reviews.text: Norway is an amazing country to visit during winter. The colder climate is calm and crisp, the nature and fjords are exceptionally beautiful and there are far less crowds. Fjord Tours offers several different and diverse trips for the winter season, check out all of our winter tours here!

reviews.title: Fantastic tour
reviews.text:
We did this as part of Norway in a nutshell. We did it in Autumn and colours were spectacular. We stayed overnight in the town of a Flåm which was a great place to stop.

Meal was great and some of us chose to experience the local cuisine

reviews.title: Chasin’ Waterfalls
reviews.text: In an absolute torrential downpour, the lady friend and I went venturing into the fjords 😅. From Bergen wharf we boarded a gigantic catamaran which took us through an abundance of the beautiful scenery which this part of the world has to offer. Spotting Europe’s 2nd largest floating bridge (not sure what HSE would have to say about that 😳) and a multitude of waterfalls - the highlight of the trip was tasting the fresh mountain water straight from the Mostraumen waterfall!

reviews.title: Loved “Norway in. Nutshell” Tour
reviews.text: My wife and I and another couple booked the “Norway in a Nutshell” Tour as a way to travel from Bergen to Oslo following a trip on the Hurtigruten.  The trip was wonderful and allowed us to see up close what we had seen from afar while on the ship.  Still, there are things a person should be prepared for:  (1) Bergen train station was quaint, but standing in a large crowd waiting to board the train was not fun; (2) While they are redoing the transportation center in Voss, right now walking from the train to the buses with a few pieces of luggage is also not fun; (3) Waiting to board the ferry outside on the dock would normally be okay, but if there is a drenching downpour like we had, you better have an umbrella; and (4) If you are booking online have the tickets sent to you rather than electing  to pick them up at the train station which was a bother and necessitated a taxi ride.  The ferry ride on the fjord was beautiful, with the ferry slowing down at major waterfalls.  Flåm is quite lovely and in a beautiful location, but expect a lot of people and tour busses.  The train ride to Myrdal IS the most beautiful ride in the world.  You need to do this if you are visiting Norway!

reviews.title: Rønde Fjord Tours
reviews.text: Stunning 3 hrs round trip from Bergen and back. Words can’t eve do it justice if your here just do it!

reviews.title: As others have said, absolutely spectacular!
reviews.text:
I can't recommend this tour highly enough- no matter how you want to do it.  We used the fjord tour as a single day trip to get from Oslo to Bergen and we enjoyed every minute.  We started off this journey on a rather long train ride from Oslo, but the further out into the country you get, the more beautiful the scenery becomes.  Each one of the stops is very convenient, well marked and easy to navigate.  It's also very convenient that no long distances are required to be walked, making it very easy to travel with your luggage.  We took the train from Myrdal down the mountain to Flam, an absolutely stunning ride where they stop and let the guests get off and see one of the larger waterfalls.  

We chose to do the premium boat cruise tour and loved it.  The boat was very nice, premium seating and plenty of outdoor space for everyone on board to sight see.  

After that, the bus ride back to the next train was nice- although I didn't read closely enough that they take you up a huge mountain so they can bring you down a road with about 13 switchbacks... that was quite a ride.  If you have any fears of heights, don't sit near the front of the bus!  

This was a long day that got us into Bergen at about 9pm, but we enjoyed it very much even though it was technically a "travel" day. Couldn't recommend this more, they make planning so easy!

reviews.title: Spectacular!!
reviews.text: The fjords are a must see if you visit Norway, you’re lost for words at the sight of this wonder.  The boat is very comfortable and it’s not crowded, there’s commentary not very in-depth but you get some idea of the name of some of the villages that the boat passes. When you get to the end the boat stopped for awhile to plenty of opportunity for taking photos. The boat also sells refreshments on board. But the view, oh my goodness! What a sight! Wow!

reviews.title: Wonderful day kayaking the Fjords
reviews.text:
There are many options for tours - active or more relaxing, but I chose the kayaing tour out of Bergen.  You can book online at fjordtours.com or at the visitor center near the wharf.

The tour company picks you up outside the visitor center at 9:30am and the mini bus takes you 45 mins north to Herdla. You park at a house where they have you sign forms and change into kayak gear. They provide all of the outwear you need and many layers of waterproof gear, so just wear something comfortable for the bus ride, and if it's super cold, maybe a wool base layer.  

We happened to have a mild sunny day, but they provide neoprene booties, a sleeveless wetsuit, neoprene shirt, and a really nice kayaking windbreaker. you are on open water the whole tour.

They have mini lockers for valuables, and you leave your clothes in a dressing room. Bring dry underclothes for after the tour because yours will be wet and you’ll want a fresh set when you’re putting dry clothes back on. They have showers and towels too.

Once you are suited up you gather your kayak “skirt” dry bag and paddle to walk down to the beach. It’s about half a mile through a private farm, with breathtaking views of the water. On the beach there’s a quick tutorial and then you get into tandem kayaks. The site doesn’t say this anywhere but there are no single kayaks, except for the guide. 

The kayaks are beautiful high quality sea kayaks- nicest I’ve ever been in and made in Norway. Depending on weather and the speed of the group you are with you navigate around islands and stop for lunch. The tour company provides sandwiches and a delicious locally made apple juice. Gluten free requests were not met, so bring food in your dry bag if you have food allergies.  They do provide dry bags that you can keep in your boat storage area. 

After lunch, if there’s time, you visit an old tunnel on one of the beaches (the entire area was used as a base and a fort at one time), and then you head back to shore. The experience is very weather dependent, but the views are spectacular and on a clear day you can see all the way to the North Sea. The tour guide takes pictures of the group the whole time, so once you return to the house they can share the photos with you. 

Once everyone is ready you head back to town in the minibus. If you are traveling with a group that does not want to kayak they can sign up for the ropes/ zip line course - it’s the same bus and the groups are combined. 

Scandinavia is very expensive and this tour was a huge value for kayak rental, 6 hours of total 'tour' time, plus lunch. Excellent experience, friendly, laid back guide.

reviews.title: Absolutely great
reviews.text: I’ve done a lot of these tours and some are nice and some are not.  This one was great.  Well managed and the sites were great. The falls, then the boat ride, then the town. All were great.  The extra stop at the high overlook over the fjords was perfect.  I had a good day and this was amazing. Perfect.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell is a must!
reviews.text: During our stay we did both the Norway in a Nutshell tour and Mostraumen tour. Both tours were great, but the Norway in a Nutshell tour is an absolute must! It is a great way of seeing the many beautiful views of Norway! The coach ride through the hairpin bends is breathtaking! Also the premium boat is definitely worth it! Flam is also very beautiful! Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Bergen!

reviews.title: Expensive, 1750 NOK each person
reviews.text: We chose the round trip from Bergen. You catch a train to go to Voss, later a bus to Gudvangen, a boat to Flam, the famous train to Myrdal, and finally, another train to go back to Bergen. We spendt nine hours. We had a sunny day and saw the Fjords and the lanscapes in a wonderfull way. You collect your tickets at Bergen tourist Center, after a long wait, and nobody gave us the fjord pass discount card, which Fjord Tours web site offers when you buy this tour. It is so expensive, and more if you can not use the discounts!

reviews.title: “Sognefjord in a Nutshell”
reviews.text: A fjord tour is a must to see some of the best that Western Norway has to offer. We chose Sognefjord which included over 5 hours on the boat from Bergen to Flam. The Flam railway to Myrdal, returning to Bergen on a scheduled train from Myrdal. It is a long day, around 12 hours, and it is fairly pricey. However we felt it was value for money. The long boat trip disappeared due to the stupendous scenery, and you do travel in comfort. The Flam railway is a miracle of engineering with a vast number of photo opportunities in an hours journey. The train to Bergen takes just short of 3 hours, but again is very scenic despite being punctuated by numerous tunnels. A long but rewarding day to the Queen of fjords if you love incredible scenery.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell round trip from Bergen
reviews.text: We travelled (more like raced) through the Nordic cities with our 12 year old grandson, so the best we could do for all of us to enjoy seeing a beautiful fjord was to do the day trip trip from Bergen.   We chose to go via Voss because it arrives back in Bergen one hour earlier and we had much to see and do in Bergen that evening.   The forecasters said rain and we got a beautiful day.    From the moment I booked the tour online and we collected our tickets at the Bergen train station, everything went perfectly and we are so glad we spent the money to do this.   The drive down by coach from Voss to Gudvangen is spectacular;  the time spent walking around Gudvangen very pleasant, and the fjord cruise simply beautiful.   In Flam we just had time to visit the Train Museum, before catching the Flam railway to Myrdal.   That was very special, the surprise for our grandson was the "lady in red" which I had read about!

reviews.title: Norway In a Nutshell Tour-do the round trip from Bergen
reviews.text: Although the Norway in a Nutshell is exactly that, a way to see the highlights of Norway and the Fjords in a single trip, I would strongly recommend that this be done as a round trip from Bergen.  The reason is that if you do this trip as a tour through to Oslo you will have to drag your luggage first into a very crowded train, then across several parking lots to a bus, and then from the bus to the cruise boat, and then back to the train to Oslo later, after a long stop in Flam.

reviews.title: Haven't seen another place like it.
reviews.text: The best thing you will like is to take an early morning boat ride. The water is still. It is like an angel cleaned the glass for you to look at all the scenery in its glory and for you to enjoy all that reflection. OH My....!! what a place. Quiet. The boat we took was electric motor powered. So, no noise of anykind. Just imagine.... no sound, beautiful surroundings, early morning sun. Need I say more. It is the kind of place that poets describe. Quite awe inspiring.

reviews.title: Excellent Tour
reviews.text: Took a 'Norway in a Nutshell' tour as a round trip from Bergen. It started with the Bergen railway, onto the Flam railway and back with the express ferry from Flam to Bergen. You will see excellent scenery and landscape. Only one ticket for everything, you can book in on the homepage 'Norway in a Nutshell' or at the tourist information.

reviews.title: One day nutshell tour
reviews.text:
We did the one day trip from Bergen to Oslo.  We departed Bergen at 8:43 AM and arrived on Oslo at 22:35 PM, so it's a long day.  It was also our favorite day of the trip. 
Though there are lots of people traveling with you, there is plenty of room for everyone.
Though the cost seems a bit high, don't skip this trip - it was the highlight of our trip to Norway.
The initial leg, a train ride from Bergen to Voss is incredibly scenic. The highlight of the trip was the fjord cruise out of Gudvangen.  Bring warm clothes!

reviews.title: Sognefjord is the best!
reviews.text: We did it today and it was the best experience of my life. However it is August but it is cold on the boat so be prepared.

reviews.title: Don’t miss!
reviews.text: Taking a tour of the Fjords is a must if you are here.  Don’t miss the opportunity to see this wonderful site

reviews.title: It is what it says on the tin
reviews.text:
This tour is organised by Norwegian Rail

We went in mid August catching the 6.30 train from Oslo arriving in Bergen at 7pm It made for an exhausting day’s travel and might have been better split with an overnight stop at Flam. Ninety percent of the journey is the standard rail journey from Oslo to Bergen apart from the bit between Myrdal and Voss so don’t repeat our mistake of returning to Oslo by rail expecting something new!

The longest section is from Oslo to Myrdal (five hours) The scenery is spectacular.

It had been warm at Oslo but high up at Myrdal several extra layers of clothing were necessary.

The Fram Railway descends steeply to Fram at sea level. The scenery on this one hour journey put everything previous into the shade.

The rail trip is followed by a two hour cruise down the fjord which again was majestic though the second hour dragged a little.

The link between Gudvangen and Voss took just over an hour. Because it was summer we detoured by a precipitous road (thankfully one way only) with countless hairpin bends. I am sure that had the bus been two feet longer it would have been unable to negotiate them.  Unless you have a strong stomach and a good head for heights avoid the window seats.

The journey from Voss to Bergen took two hours.

If you add all these times together you will be well short of eleven and a half hours. This is because there is a fair bit of hanging around waiting foe trains etc.

‘Norway in a Nutshell’ will be the abiding memory of our holiday.

reviews.title: Being dumped in a sleepy town at 8 am is NOT my idea of a good time
reviews.text:
This review is specifically about the HARDANGER FJORD in a Nutshell. My husband and I together with another couple went on a 2-day version of this tour, where we took the 11 am boat from Bergen to Rosendal, the were taken to Odda to stay the night, and the following day returned to Oslo via Hardanger Fjord.

The tour looked wonderful. Unfortunately, it became a chapter of accidents that were so farcical that at one point I turned to my friends and told them that I felt as if I were in Fawlty Towers.

It started well. The boat trip from Bergen was lovely, and we arrived at Rosendael on time at 1:00 pm. However, no-one had informed us that it takes ONE HOUR to get up to the castle garden PLUS ONE HOUR to get down again. As the bus was due to leave at 2 pm, it was impossible to enjoy this part of the tour (the reason I'd booked the tour in the first place.)

But worse was to follow. Someone remarked that the bus was NOT coming at 2 pm (as WRITTEN on our instructions) but was actually arriving at 1:38. Where to wait? Our instructions told us the bus would take us from the quay where the boat had left us. 

This turned out to be NOT true. Instead we had to walk to the road, cross over it and wait for the bus there.

However, the bus arrived and took us to Odda, where my husband and our friends stayed at the Hardanger Hotel (which was fine.) One problem with touring around remote regions in Norway is that it IS DIFFICULT to find ANYWHERE DECENT to eat. The possibilities near our hotel were not what we wanted, and so we HIKED THIRTY MINUTES UPHILL to get to the Trolltunga Hotel, where we had a wonderful evening.

The next day, however was NOT so good. For some reason, this trip DEMANDED that we get on the bus that LEFT Odda AT 7:25! This meant that we had to get up EARLY and eat a quick breakfast to make sure we were on it. (As there was ONLY ONE a day, we would have been stuck in Odda if we'd missed it.)

We duly got on the bus, and it took us to Loftus, arriving at 8 am in the morning. Places such as Loftus, while charming to look at from a boat, are NOT the most exciting places to be at that time. The town was asleep. There were no cafes open. The grocery store was shut. There were no bathroom facilities. And a VERY COLD WIND was coming off the lake. The bus (a public bus, commandeered by the tour planners) deposited and LEFT.

While we were wondering what to do, we met some of our fellow travelers, including a charming young lady from Spain who informed us that she had MISSED the bus the previous day, having thought it would leave at 2pm (when it actually left at 1:38.) She said she was obliged to take a VERY EXPENSIVE TAXI RIDE in order to get to her hotel for that night. I REALLY REALLY HOPE THAT YOU REFUND HER MONEY AND APOLOGIZE TO HER.

Finally, after hunting around, we found a hotel that allowed us to use its facilities and sit by its fire in exchange for our buying coffee and snacks. 

We had to wait TWO AND QUARTER HOURS for the boat to arrive to take us to Ulvik. The 10:15 bus arrived on time, but I couldn't understand why the tour planners had roused us from our beds so early to deposit us in the back of beyond to wait over 2 hours for a boat that wasn't going to depart until mid-morning. 

The rest of the tour was fine, but we were wiped out from having to get up at 5 am in the morning, and from all the changes we had to make from boat to bus to boat to bus to train. It was an exhausting trip, and after the way we were treated I WOULDN"T RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell......Spectacular
reviews.text: This is an ALL day trip from early morning to about 8PM.  You can begin in Bergen to Oslo or the reverse.  I have taken the trip 4 times and all Bergen to Oslo.  It is a VERY GOOD IDEA to have your hotel check your luggage in Bergen by rail and pick it up at the end of the trip at the train station in Oslo.    The trip:  train from Bergen to Voss,  then a bus to the village of Gudvangen (God’s Garden),  a Fjord Boat sailing the Naeroyfjord and Aurlandsfjord and they are indescribably beautiful!!!!  Ending in Flam and if the old hotel is open (seasonal) have lunch.  Delicious and fresh foods, very fresh. Then the famous Flam Railway up and up and through mountains and more mountains to the village of Murdal.  Santa probably lives close by!!  Then a fast train to Oslo.  The scenery for every segment of the trip is amazing and fun and amazing.  Make sure you carry a bag with your passport, medications, cameras, iPads, change of clothes,  local cash and credit cards.  Once in Oslo,  a taxi or pre-arranged driver to take you to your hotel.  Take a raincoat and layer, even during summer.

reviews.title: Would not recommend Rib-boat Fjord Safari in Bergen
reviews.text: I did a similar tour in Stavanger which was great and so I thought this would be a good present for my mums 50th. Unfortunately the guides in Stavanger are much better than Bergen. Whilst we enjoyed our time in the water, the trip is quite expensive and advertises that you will get 50 minutes at sea. We started 20 minutes late as the guide decided to wait for two people who never showed up and cut our time 20 minutes short, meaning we only got 30 minutes in the water. We we were very disappointed by this and when we raised it with the guide he shrugged and said they had another tour after us. For what you pay for this activity, I would not recommend doing this trip in Bergen.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell - Bergen - Flam
reviews.text: We booked the 1 day Norway in a nutshell trip (round trip from Bergen) and my husband and I loved it! It was really easy we started at Bergen station first thing in the morning with the train times that had been booked. We then took the train to Myrdal and got the Flam railway - it take about 3 1/2 hours but the journey is really lovely and very scenic. Once in Flam we had a few hours, there are places to eat and walk in Flam and it's a pretty little town. We then headed on the Fjord cruise, it was quite busy but we managed to get good seats. Once the boat had finished a bus is waiting to collect you, and you get the train back to Bergen from Voss. The whole day went really smoothly, there transport runs to time (unlike the UK) we were advised to bring food with us on the trip, but there was plenty of places to buy stuff as well. I couldn't recommend this trip enough, It's a great way to see the start of the Fjords. I would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Not to Be Rushed
reviews.text:
We booked our Norway in a Nutshell transportation through Fjord Tours.  While I realize we might have saved a few dollars if we'd booked on our own, I thought the ease of doing it through Fjord Tours was worth it.  My advice to anyone doing this is to take several days to travel between Oslo and Bergen.  I can see how it would feel rushed and chaotic doing it in one day.  We chose the Sognefjord tour and would recommend it. This was our schedule which worked well. 

Oslo - picked up tickets at Oslo Central Station the day before.  Each person had a packet of tickets already assembled which made it easy. 

Finse - traveled four hours on the Bergen Railway and then got off at Finse to stay at FInse 1222.  Fantastic old hotel where scenes from Hoth (Empire Strikes Back) were filmed.  Very remote and beautiful. 

Flam - left Finse on the Bergen Railway, changed to Flam Railway at Myrdal.  This can be a little confusing, but all you need to do is walk through the station to the other side where you'll find the Flam Railway.  No assigned seating, but they take your luggage at the end of the platform and you board the car you want.  It was busy when we were there, but not crazy.  No problem for our family of four to sit together.  Got off the Flam Railway and spent the night in Flam.  We did book the Fjord Safari with Goat Cheese tour through Fjord Tours. Do it if you are staying in Flam.  This was a highlight. 

Balestrand - took the express boat from Flam and got off in Balestrand.  Beautiful fjord village with a historic hotel.  We stayed at the Balestrand Hotel and highly recommend it.  Get a room with a balcony and fjord view. 

Bergen - took the express boat from Balestrand to Bergen.  It's a four hour boat ride, but very enjoyable.  We loved being on deck to see the fjords.  It was raining on and off, but that didn't detract from our experience.  With periods of rain and sun, we saw multiple rainbows. Spectacular!

reviews.title: Rødne Fjord Tour
reviews.text:
This was pleasant but certainly not amazing. The old crate(ship) they use has seen better days and isn’t really designed as a tour vessel. (We did a tour from Flåm and the ship there is fantastic) Make sure you’re early as the space isn’t great everywhere and it’s a bit of a battle to have the family together. 
Take your own snacks and drinks with you as the kiosk is not very well stocked and only opens when you are on your way. 
The scenery is fantastic and in spite of certain negative things it’s worthwhile. 
The staff are friendly and really make a effort. It helps if you speak Spanish as the member of staff we spoke to is Spanish and he’s great.

reviews.title: LOVED Norway in a Nutshell
reviews.text:
I researched this "tour" for MONTHS. The main reason I made my family fly into Bergen rather than Oslo was to be closer to the fjords. I looked into buying the tickets myself so we could save money and I know tons of other people do it this way, but I didn't want to take any chances on doing something wrong or missing one of the modes of transportation. Everything was self-explanatory and smooth, besides some delays (because I bought through the company, I didn't have to worry). 
My trip was the first week in June, so it wasn't as crazy busy as it can get during peak season. If you do travel during peak season, my advice would be to relax and try to go with the flow---everyone is trying to enjoy their time. A lot of negative reviews for this tour seem to be related to being disgruntled because of crowds. If you travel at this time of year, don't expect to be alone!
I took SO many pictures during the tour, especially on the boat. I paid extra for the premium boat and it was very nice. We were staying in Bergen (LOVE Bergen! It is very laid-back compared to other Scandinavian cities) so we did the roundtrip Bergen-Bergen. It was the perfect amount of time. I have the best memories of Norway, and it is because of this amazing day!

reviews.title: Great experience on the Hardangerfjord in a Nutshell tour
reviews.text: Very well organized 11-hour round trip journey from Bergen. The trip involved various forms of transportation: bus, boat and rail; however, it was very easy to navigate and the transfers were very close in distance. I booked through the Fjord tours website, and I picked up my tickets and itinerary from the visitors center in Bergen two days prior.  Unfortunately, the weather was rainy the day of my tour, but I still enjoyed the scenery throughout the day. The pinnacle of the tour is the Vøringsfossen waterfall, which was beautiful. A few tips: wear sturdy shoes (sneakers/ trainers) to better explore Vøringsfossen, bring the itinerary provided by the visitors center (there is a map of the path for the final transfer from the bus to the Voss train station), pack snacks and/or lunch.

reviews.title: Operators of the Norway in a Nutshell tour
reviews.text: I took the Norway in a Nutshell tour, which is organized through Fjord Tours. I had to cancel back in May for.health reasons, and they were very good about honoring the refund - absolutely no hassle. Three months later, I was back, and had the good luck of a day without rain on the itinerary from Oslo to Bergen. I know that I could buy all of the tickets individually and save some money over paying Fjord Tours for the service of packaging the trip, but I couldn't have bought the trip insurance that way. In addition to the Nutshell tour, I also bought Oslo and Bergen city passes through them; everything was waiting for me as expected. I checked on getting my hotel rooms through them, but the rates were nothing special for my preferred dates and places, so I booked those independently. They did everything right for me, which is why one pays a travel agency for its services.

reviews.title: Poor and over exaggerated
reviews.text: Starting with a clear message "it's not worth considering the company's business practices". On their website they will keep showing that its fully booked but my one and last experience says that it's not the fact. We were charged double the amount because we asked for a cabin (due to poor health of our son) while checking in. To be noted that all 4 weeks prior to the trip it was showing fully booked while it wasn't as evident from open window curtains showing clear signs of non-occupancy in many units. They reserve some cabins for last minute and in order to charge double the price. Unethical but a fact.

reviews.title: GoNorway
reviews.text: My son and I visited Bergen this summer. When you go to Norway everyone says you must visit the fjords. We chose a tour from the visitors centre to see the Sognefjord. We started with one tour bus for about an hour and a half. There were plenty of stops to see waterfalls and lovely countryside. We then switched to another bus which took us to the fishing town of Vikk.  It’s too bad that no one told us that everything in Vikk is closed on Sundays.  In fact nothing is really open in Norway on Sundays. We had three hours to waste in Vikk before boarding the boat to see the Sognefjord. There was one fast food restaurant open near the dock. My son and I had a very expensive, horrible hamburger. What could we do? There was nothing else open. The bun was old and there was corn in my burger. Who puts corn in a hamburger? Once the ferry arrived we were excited to see the fjords. Once on board we were extremely disappointed to find out there were no assigned seats on the ferry. If fact, people took up seats with their luggage and belongings. We didn’t have a seat at all for the whole duration of the trip! There was also no commentary on the fjords either. The trip turned out to be about 12 hours long, and extremely expensive! I would not recommend this trip at all! So disappointed!

reviews.title: Partly a huge muddle, partly a little underwhelming, but partly fantastic which saved the day
reviews.text:
Fjord tours seem to sell the tours and that is it.  Thereafter it’s left to the railway companies and staff and the ferry operators to pick up the pieces. 

Chaos at Bergen station today with insufficient carriages available. Unfortunately groups from the end of the queue were allowed to queue jump and generally the situation was a mess. Fjord tours reps nowhere to be seen.  

For those who got on, train was packed, standing room only for many. Many disembarked at Voss for a different tour, rushing for buses. At Myrdal The flamsbahne was less busy but no time to take the scenery at the top. The descent is impressive but I’m glad our train was not full - maybe there were spaces as many people had  been prevented from starting their journey in Bergen. 

Good views of the fjord from the marina but then joined boat queue early to make sure we got on! You are not guaranteed a seat and as the whole point is to see the view you need a window seat or one outdoors if it’s dry, so another scrum...... but the boat trip was really worth it especially the last hour or so and the arrival in Bergen. 

I think I would recommend doing the trip but making your own arrangements and booking directly with ferry or using a car.  Go to the Tourist info centre in Bergen or the railway station to see what you can do on your own. I think the ti Centre is no longer selling fjord tours for the company due to recent problems.

reviews.title: VERY TOURISTY, spoiling nature
reviews.text:
Don't go June-Aug loads of Asians waving their selfie stick...horrible
I would suggest taking a kajak or go off season. It really is spoiling the whole experience with busloads of tourists being waved around like flock of sheep.

reviews.title: 3 hours tour
reviews.text:
We had just a day in Bergen and the Rodne 3 hours tour was a great choice. 
The boat is nice, clean, has wifi on board and a small coffee shop. The staff were nice too. 
Remember to check the weather and dress accordingly.

reviews.title: A tour to go once in ur lifetime
reviews.text:
Overated tour in a big boat...dont get over exited..it is just a boat ride across the waters with hills n waterfalls on both sides..for two hours or so...the Milford Sound tour was better..to me.
There is a small restaurant for coffee n tea..with tit bits...
Good ride to past the time.

reviews.title: Overcrowded, shambolic
reviews.text: The fjord cruise from Flam to Gudvangen as part of the Norway in a Nutshell package will be remembered for all the wrong reasons ... disorderly embarkation -  pushing and shoving to get on board; overcrowded with insufficient seating for the number of passengers creating unpleasant altercations; no public address announcements (what are the safety procedures and location of life jackets?) until the end of the arduous 2 hour journey to disembark from the bow (announcement given in English only); no boat crew in evidence to raise concerns; a crushing queue to disembark with no advice on where to find the bus for Voss causing confusion with fellow passengers becoming frustrated. The boat not only has insufficient seating it also lacks shelter from inclement weather that was experienced throughout the trip and as a 70+ year old  passenger l should not have been expected to stand for the entire journey -  this was totally unacceptable. Yes, the scenery is spectacular but the Fjord Tours boat journey leaves a lot to be desired.

reviews.title: Well arranged Pulpit Rock & Norway in a Nutshell Tour
reviews.text:
We were so pleased with how Fjord Tours arranged our Pulpit Rock & Norway in a Nutshell tour. All information were accurate - from booking to executing the tour. They’re easy to reach too for any clarifications on the booking. We had the best time in Norway - thanks to Fjord Tours! 

Highly recommended and we’ll book another tour when we’re back in Norway again.

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell
reviews.text:
We recently completed a tour from Bergen to Sognefjord and Flam then on to Myrdal on the Flam Railway. We also did the side trip UNESCO bus tour to Gerainger. This side trip should be  must. It was spectacular! Our driver Morten was so informative which made the trip much more enjoyable.

The whole thing was very well coordinated.

Our only criticism was the hassle picking up the tickets at Tourist Information in Bergen. There is only one line so you have to queue up with all those discussing booking trips. They really need to have a separate queue for just picking up tickets. We waited an hour!

reviews.title: Excellent organization
reviews.text:
We had a trip with Rodne company. 
It last just 3 hours. Money & time with spent! 
The departure   it’s twice per day and it start close to the fish market.

reviews.title: Must do
reviews.text: 8.25 am ,train from Oslo to Bergen.confortable cars, with a family of four try to book the four seats configuration.after a couple of hours the  Hardangervidda rugged landscape kicks in gorgeously. stop in Myrdal, on the opposite track you board the old train to Flam ,slowly winding down mountains gorges and stopping at the waterfall to take pics,wonderful views. Once In Flam,at 15,30 you board a fast,quiet ship that cruises beautiful Sognefjorden ,finest scenery you can imagine. Boat arrives in Bergen at 20,45,just in time for dinner.

reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery - Need to break up the journey
reviews.text:
We got on the train in Bergen.  It's a super crazy itinery, so we broke up the journey.  We got off the ferry at Aurland and stayed the night in an Airbnb.  It was easy to catch a local bus to Flam, and reconnect on the train on the way to Oslo.

The scenery is beautiful and any photographer would love the nature, the fjords, the waterfalls and even the birds.

It can get crowded and you have to be mindful of your luggage as you switch from train, to bus, to ferry to train again.  It was easy to bring about snacks and drinks.  It's easy to build your own itinerary as you choose when you get off and where you stay.

reviews.title: The poorest way to organize a tour
reviews.text:
Norway in a Nutshell is a day tour to visit a fjord on a premium cruise boat. This tour on July 26 was as poorly organized as I could imagine. There was a rail outage that occurred on July 24, as far as I could tell. We were not informed until we arrived at the train station to pick up our tickets. The information was shared with us by the rail employees. No one from Fjords tour appeared to be present. There was a lot of speculation as how we were to get to the dock. It had been scheduled to include rail and bus. Because of the rail outage, another method would be needed to get us to Voss. The way to get us to Voss would be either by bus or by taxi.
 It appears that the one bus that was present would not load passengers as they had not had authorization from Fjord tours. Everyone was left to manage on their own. My family, 6 of us. went with 2 cabs which we organized. When we got to the next stage (Voss) there was no transport to take us to Gudvangen. Again there was a bus there but it was at least 45 minutes before he had authorization to take us to Flam. When we arrived at the port, the scheduled boat had left and we made the decision to go on a converted ferry boat to do the tour. All of this was done without any identifiable Fjord Tour representative. The return was equally frustrating as again there were 2 buses but they waited for at least 40 minutes before they had authorization from Fjord Tours to load passengers..

Those of us who have travelled a lot know that there will be unexpected glitches and when they are explained, most people will accept this. What is unacceptable is total silence from the organizer. 

We have heard nothing from Fjord Tours. Another disappointment.

We were told by some people in Bergen that Fjord Tours WERE good at one time but that their business has out gown their ability to manage.
Fortunately, the fjord is beautiful andf the weather was wonderful.

reviews.title: Solid but nothing more
reviews.text: The well advertised tour is not much more than a public transport tour. We went during the high season, but did not expect to wait in line and had to rush in the overcrowded train to find a nice seat to actually see through the window. There was no tour guide. However, thescenery is fantastic. If we would go again, or make a recommendation, it would be renting a car in Oslo/Bergen and visiting some of these sights alone, and avoiding the crowd.

reviews.title: Beautiful scenery - but lots of people
reviews.text:
I went on the Sognefjord in a Nutshell trip during August 2018. Overall the trip was exceptional due to the incredible scenery and wilderness of Norway, however it was very crowded and a lot of people on the trains/boat. 

I booked a few weeks in advance, it fit in really well with the limited time I had available in the South of Norway. I picked up my tickets the day before at Oslo airport, and they went through the details about which trains had reserved seating etc. I was a bit anxious that I would miss a train or not be able to find where to go with all the trains etc, but it was very easy to follow and everyone is very helpful!

The day started off early in at Oslo Central Station departing on the train for Myrdal. If you can, I would highly recommend a window seat for this train, as the scenery, especially in the second half was incredible!! From Myrdal station we jumped on the Flåm Railway heading to Flåm, this train trip took around an hour with a few stops along the way. Which ever side of the train you snag a seat on (get a window seat) is incredible as you descent from 800m above sea level to around 20m above. 

You'll have some time in Flåm to wander around the gift shops, cafes, food trucks, and take in the incredible view of the fjord. Next we jumped on the boat for the 5 hour cruise through Sognefjord. Again, grab a window seat on the boat, or one at the front of either the bottom or top deck to take in the incredible views of the Fjord all the way to Bergen. 

I would recommend a warm jacket for this trip as it was chilly waiting for the trains/boat, and it was summer! Also, I bought lots of food along for the trip but it isn't necessary as there are kiosks on the trains and boats and lots of great food available in Flåm. 

I took the overnight train from Bergen to Oslo due to time restraints, but would have loved to have spent the night in Bergen and seen it during the day as it seemed like a beautiful city!

Overall the trip was incredible, so much packed into 24 hours, I would highly recommend it to anyone who has a day free in the south of Norway!

reviews.title: Norway in a Nutshell - good but tight schedule
reviews.text:
We tried to book all the tickets on our own for this tour but found times that were incompatible to the cruise ride and other stops. So we booked it through fjordtours.com 
 The ride to Flam was full of photo opps and the train to the cruise boat was amazing.  There was one stop at the Kjosfossen waterfall was made more dramatic by a dancing siren in red that appears to grace the tourists with her dancing.  The cruise boat was crowded but we managed to get lots of pictures.  The fjords were majestic and the little towns along the way were quaint and looked just like a calendar. Gudvangen was where the cruise ended.  A picturesque town I wish we could have had time to explore. The tour includes a detour as the bus driver took us up narrow road that included hairpin turns on the way down.  It was a wonderful treat.  All the transportation were right on schedule and got us into Bergen to settle in.   So this is not a leisurely kind of tour and if you don't enjoy rushing ,  it may not be for you.

reviews.title: Great way to see the fjords.
reviews.text:
We recently did the Norway in a Nutshell tour and enjoyed it very much. We ordered tickets online and they arrived in the mail promptly. The ferry ride was very comfortable, and regardless of where you sit you can go outside either in the front or the back of the ferry for great views and pictures. Even on a fairly warm day it's quite cool outside, especially in the front of the ferry, so pack a jacket! There is a cafe on the ferry so you can buy food and drinks if you like. We had a little over an hour in Flam so got some lunch and then took the Flam railway which had wonderful views. The train trip back to Bergen was fine although there were no working restrooms on the train which was a problem as it was a two hour trip, plus the time on the Flam railroad. There was only one and it was out of order. There was a LONG line for the restrooms once we got to Bergen! 
You should know that this tour isn't really organized by a specific tour group - these are different modes of public transportation so you could buy tickets separately or customize the tour as you like.

reviews.title: Not as beautiful as I expected
reviews.text: Norway in a Nutshell is an easy way to quickly see the area but is very touristy with crowds of people. Scenery not as beautiful as I expected. Flam railway was very interesting but the Fjord trip was on a ferry that reminded me of a car ferry. Many coach tours. large tourist shops and then the actual Fjords were no where near as impressive as in New Zealand. A little disappointed.

reviews.title: Disappointing Sognefjord in a Nutshell Tour
reviews.text: Unfortunately, this ‘tour’ was not as we’d expected. We’d booked 4 months in advance, but discovered that tickets are sold but NO NUMBERED SEATS .... you have seats in a ‘first on, best served’ basis. Anyone who tried to board the Flåm Railway Train in the 15-20 minutes before it left (as we were advised on the day), had great difficulty finding seats (especially of there were 2 or more in your group). Not having window seats means you can’t see the views easily, nor take photos easily. People were angry at not having allocated seats. When we transferred onto the ‘normal train’ for the 2 hour trip back to Bergen, it was the same: no allocated seats. Lots of trouble. We’d suggest NOT paying the company to purchase your tickets (as you get nothing for this privilege), but rather look up the timetables yourself and just book (it won’t mean you’ll get allocated seats, but it might save you a bit of money)

reviews.title: Without a Hitch
reviews.text: Norway in a Nutshell is a great way to see Norway in a short period of time.  We ordered our tickets online in January for our late July trip.  We had them mailed to us and they arrived 90 days before- so mid April.  This is the second time I have done Norway in  Nutshell.  Last time was 17 years ago with just my husband and me.  This time, we took our teenage sons.  We chose to leave from Oslo, spend the night in Aurland (next to Flam), and then stay again in Bergen.  We booked all our hotels and train/boat/bus connections through them and it all worked out perfectly.  Our first night we arrived in Oslo we stayed in the Thon Panorama and had a nice room on the 6th floor with balcony- only about a 10 minute walk to Oslo Central Station.   The next morning our train left Oslo early (the train was about an hour late- not the fault of Fjord tours), but we had a beautiful ride to Myrdal.  Nice seats, food in the restaurant car, wonderful.   Switched trains for the Flamsbana and it was a beautiful ride.  When in Flam we took a city bus to Aurland about 10 minutes away.  We stayed in a fisherman cabin in the Vansgaarden.  It was so quaint and wonderful.  The scenery is breathtaking.  The next afternoon we took the shuttle back to Flam to board the fjord cruise boat.  Don't worry if you don't have a place to sit down.  People move all around and you will want to stand outside anyway.  It is a 2 hour boat ride and gorgeous.  We were lucky and had nice weather, but even if it rains you can sit inside.  The bus from Gudvangen to Voss is amazing.  Confortable seats and large windows- very relaxing and beautiful ride.  The driver takes you up to the top of a mountain to see the view of the fjord and it is a great ride- lots of hairpin bends and waterfalls.  When we got to Voss we were ticked to take the train to Bergen, but the train was cancelled.  Again, not the fault of fjord tours- electrical problems caused the shut down.  However, they sent busses to replace the trains and every things was just fine.  We arrived in Bergen at the same time and again the scenery was tremendous.  When we got to Bergen we stayed in the Thon Orion.  This hotel has an excellent location to sites in downtown Bergen.  The room was small, but adequate and it is nice they also serve a free dinner.  All in all, I would hands down book through Fjord tours to do all these connections and hotels.  If you order early enough and have it mailed to you you have hard copies of all the reservations, paper tickets, and a nice photo brochure that explains all the places you will see.  I don't know why people complain about this- I have done it twice (17 years apart) as a couple and as a family and both times it was super easy, effieient, and the way to go.  Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Must see!!
reviews.text: The fjords are defiantly on the “must see” list when in Bergen. I did a fjord cruise and then rode the flamsbana train back. It was amazing. Words and pictures do not do the fjords justice.

reviews.title: Tour
reviews.text: Very scenic and well spaced out tour. Along with the flame railway tour this makes for a lovely day long outing the views are spectacular and the little towns in the fjord are great. You see a lot of kayaking and other activities. Must do outing if you are limited for time. Not only the fjords but the drive to the piers is amazing

name: Hiking Bergen
description: Hiking Bergen offers guided hiking trips in the beautiful mountains and fjords surrounding Bergen. Why don’t see the real deal while visiting Bergen ? We offers guided trips for beginners as well as for advanced hikers.

reviews.title: Hidden treasure near Bergen!
reviews.text: I can't recommend Hiking Bergen enough! My tour guide, Vidar, was awesome. As a local, he was very knowledgable about the area and was able to share a lot about the Norwegian culture with me, which I really enjoyed. He was also very kind in going out of his way to help me when I was having trouble purchasing a train ticket and getting to the station. As for the hike itself, WOW! The views were absolutely out of this world! One of the best parts was that we only saw about 4 or 5 other people (all locals) during the entire hike. Definitely a highlight of my trip to Norway. If you're searching for a one-of-a-kind hiking experience that is tailored to your interests and needs, look no further!

reviews.title: Excellent guide, beautiful hike (Arnianipa)
reviews.text:
The guide was very knowledgeable, sociable and wise. He helped a lot with time management and slowed down when I was tired.
The hike to Arnianipa is very nice, I d say Intermediate to advanced level since there is quite an elevation gain.
You hike up, you stop 70% through, and you continue to the top. There are many options in the last part, depending on the physical level and your choice. The guide knows them very well and guides you through them.

reviews.title: The greatest hike!!!
reviews.text:
This was one of the best hiking I've ever done! The area is amazingly beautiful and Vidar is a friendly and knowledgable guide! He taught me a great deal about the area and life in Norway and offered me a very good Norwegian chocolate once we reached the top! 
I definitely recommend this company, it was really one of the best experiences in my whole life!

reviews.title: Hike in Bergen
reviews.text: Would highly recommend. Vidar is an excellent guide, extremely knowledgeable and polite and has great conversation. My girlfriend and I hiked Bergen last weekend and the experience was excellent thanks to Vidar. Great views overlooking the fjords. We will look to do another one next year when we return!

name: Bergen Escaperoom
description: Located just 10 minutes from Bergen city centre. We offer a fun activity for family and friends. The concept; use your head to escape the room in less than 60 minutes. The room is filled with clues, codes and riddles that you need to figure out. This activity is suited for; • Activity with friends and family • Teambuilding • Bachelor/bachelorette parties

reviews.title: Not bad - 3.5
reviews.text:
Lots of cool things in this escape room. There was two different methods to figure out one puzzle which was confusing because they weren't identical and we ended up wasting time trying to find the relevance of one of the pathways (I think one should be removed for simplicity as in the escape rooms I've completed previously they haven't offered two pathways). I read a review that too many clues were given, but I think it's gone the opposite way now. We were far from escaping without realising (can't elaborate or it will spoil it), so I think in this case (as we weren't to know how far off we were) clues should be offered (you can obviously always ask, but the problem is only they know if you need them based on how far through they know you are). Clues are typed on a screen so maybe to keep all clients happy, something along the lines of "do you need help with...?". Also we were told not to touch objects with a hands off symbol, but it turns out you need to touch a lock on one of these objects so that was also a source of confusion. The staff explained this in Norwegian to a friend in the beginning so it may have gotten lost in translation...  

Anyway, the staff were nice and there's some interesting things in the room. I imagine it will only get better!

reviews.title: Fun!
reviews.text: Second escape room I've tried and it was great, definitely recommended! Clever use of gadgets, challenging but not too hard. I also loved the science theme. There was an issue with one of the props where we couldn't get it open even with correct method, but the staff handled it very well and kept us going without too much interruption, and gave us extra time on the clock to make up for the (few) minutes we lost.

reviews.title: Great escaperoom!
reviews.text: I visited this escaperoom with my parents and teenage sister, and even though we failed and did not make it out in time to rescue the world from the virus, we still had a wonderful time! The room was appropriately difficult, the theme was science-y and the music was creepy. I'd definitely recommend it!

name: Vinol Tours

photo.caption: Full-day tours across Norway - fjords, fishing and waterfalls.

description: Vinol Tours is a tours provider based in Bergen with 8 years of experience in organising guided tours in Norway. We will help you to explore the medieval city of Bergen with its hanseatic quarters, narrow streets and musical heritage of Edvard Grieg and Ole Bull. With our licensed guides you can set on a tour to snowclad mountains, glaciers, deep ravines, raging rivers and picturesque fjords.

offer_list.title: Walking tour: Medieval Spirit of Bergen
Bergen: Excursion with a city view from the top
Bride's Veil and Steinsdalsfossen waterfalls with sceneries of Hardanger Fjord
Private Norway in Miniature tour with Stegastein viewpoint

reviews.title: Excursion and airport assistance
reviews.text: It was the last day in Bergen and Norway. ended our long trip consisted from five cities. I booked a guide and assistance at the airport. Many suitcases and connection flights home. It was great! Out strong guide was very experienced in guiding. Excursion ended at Bergen airport. Our guide managed to do all check in services using special devices at the airport and he did porter job also. Thanks a lot! .

reviews.title: Old Bergen and the stave church
reviews.text: We booked private tour 4 hours by minibus. Bergen was the capital of Norway in medieval centuries. Very important trading center. Hanseatic League from Germany open in Bergen its international trading office. Many years they exported fish and cod liver oil abroad and imported grain and fabrics. Fantoft stave church is a sign of unique construction technique. Our guide explained us why wooden buildings in Norway have so long life span and why vikings used dragon head as a symbol. At the end of the tour funicular trip and lunch on the fish market. Great!

reviews.title: three waterfalls
reviews.text: We stayed in Beregen after the end of Hurtigruten cruise. We spent 11 days on this trip. Unfortunately, Hurtigruten tour doesn`t include Bergen and Hardanger fjord. We booked private tour to Hardanger fjord in Bergen to popular waterfalls and the second longest Norwegian fjord. This is really unique to travel when it is winter in Norway. Fjords are not covered with ice. But to get to the Hardanger fjord we have passed mountain region with small cabins covered with snow. We enjoyed this tour. Recommendation to stay for your lunch in Hardangerfjord hotel. Location is perfect

reviews.title: Winter hike above Bergen
reviews.text: I discovered that winter hikes are great and winter in Norway is fine! We booked private hiking tour 6 hours. Program included 4 mountains and funicular trip. We were 10 people and vinol tours charged only per hour not per person. Finally each of us paid only 40 EUR for the almost whole day private tour. We started on Sunday morning from the mountain Ulriken and returned back from the city mountains back to the center by funicular. Amazing landscapes with frozen lakes and snow clad summits. Great!

reviews.title: Trip to the waterfall and picking up of edible mushrooms
reviews.text: We were going to get us much as possible information about Bergen and to set on a tour to the fjords and to do all these things in one day. In addition our hobby is to pick up mushrooms with later cooking and eating, For us it was a bonus when our request was confirmed and vinol tours elaborated the tour by minibus in the city of bergen with continuation to the fjords to see waterfalls and hardanger fjord. Plus we got experinced guide hwo brought us in KVAM moutain region to the birch tree forest to pick up eatable mushrooms. It was great Norwegian nature and later lunch that the guide cooked in the forest from nice high quality mushrooms. Notice! you have to know or your guide what mushrooms do not have poison.

name: Hoyt & Lavt Bergen

photo.caption: One of our 23 zip-lines. From 10 - 300 meters long

description: Western Norways biggest adventure park! More than 20 zip-lines from 10 to 300 meters. High ropes courses, climbing wall and loads of fun. Open from april to october. Weekends and holidays for drop-in, week days for groups. Opening hours 2019: Saturdays and Sundays: 11am - 5pm. Holidays: 11am - 5 pm.

reviews.title: Sister fun
reviews.text: I took my sister with me to Høyt & Lavt, and it was a wonderful experience. It was very fun, and challenging. There is different levels so you can have everything from zero experience to a lot. Do bring comfortable clothes and good shoes.

name: CityHunt
description: A new puzzle-solving city game brought to you by Escape Bryggen. Your team will be solving a story-driven mystery right in the streets of Bergen. Can you stop the mastermind villain before your time runs out? Only you will be able to identify the final outcome – you are the main characters in this story. Explore the city in a fun new way and you may find many local gems hidden in plain sight.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text: It's a puzzle hunt type game that lets you play detective in the streets of Bergen. The puzzles were good fun and it's a great way to explore the city.

reviews.title: Nice Idea, but needs improvement in detail s. Yet completely overpriced.
reviews.text:
Overpriced for what is presented.
Not comparable to an escape room. For a walk in the city, the number of riddles is way too less.

In other European cities, these walks/tours are for free and a small present is available when bringing the conclusion.

reviews.title: Great game with interactive puzzles
reviews.text: Exploring streets and grafitti arts in Bergen center. Nice story of the crime solving puzzle. Definitely worth to do.

reviews.title: A Must-Do to Get Acquainted with Bergen!
reviews.text: My partner and I did CityHunt at the end of our visit to Bergen, but wish we’d done it sooner! Even though we’d been there for a week, we saw parts of Bergen that we hadn’t encountered before and appreciated parts of the city we had been to before in whole new ways. The puzzles are solvable (we finished it with about 45 minutes to spare) but also challenging enough to be incredibly fun. The staff are also a pleasure to deal with and great to get recommendations from. Highly recommended, especially if you’re not in Bergen for too long or at the beginning of a longer stay!

reviews.title: Definitely make this part of your Bergen trip!
reviews.text: City Hunt is so fun - a definite must for anyone visiting Bergen! As tourists it was a perfect way to explore new parts of the city, the puzzles were really hard and so satisfying when you complete them, and the team behind City Hunt were so lovely and accommodating. Could not recommend it enough!

name: Arven As
description: The gold – and silverfactory Arven, has for nearly 150 years produced gold- and silverware in the center of Bergen. Here you can experience craftsmen at work, creating true pieces of art. Timeless silver-cutlery, beautiful interior decor items and unique jewelry, all created by experienced artisans. You will also find a beautiful giftshop, with all the items produced on site.

reviews.title: Beautiful place. Incredible silverware.
reviews.text: Very agreeable visit. Nice silverware. Combination of traditional and modern design. Warm and welcoming team. It is very interesting to see the workshops and the silversmiths from within the shop. Easy access from the historical area in Bergen.

reviews.title: Very nice place with real handcrafted silverware
reviews.text: Arven is a really nice place and worth a visit. You can watch them as they make this beautiful traditional handcrafted silverware. Nice staff in the shop and they explained the history of the things they made

name: Bergen Adventures
description: Guided tours in the surrounding mountains of Bergen, Norway.

reviews.title: Fish Market for Lunch
reviews.text: The fish market for lunch was a great experience, there's so many choices that it can be daunting to make a decision.  I had the Whale Steak for the first time in my life and it taste very much like beef steak.  After all, whale is a mammal, it just resides in the sea.

name: Lukket Selskap
description: A small bar with focus on high quality cocktails in a cozy atmosphere with nice, personal service. Downstairs there are two private karaoke rooms.

reviews.title: Svensk flaggpunsch!!!!!
reviews.text:
Probably the only place in Bergen who serves Swedish punsch!

He got it as a gift from a Swedish guest and he served it to us as a gentleman. 

Best place in Bergen with fantastic drinks in all flavors... a must for the interested one!

reviews.title: Hidden bar treasure
reviews.text: If you manage to find this well hidden bar in Bergen you are up for a treat. Here you will mainly find coctails combined with a very small serving of food. If you need more time to decide on your coctail you are offered a small «waiting beer» at a decent price. Love the concept, the drinks and the staff.

name: Bergen Searib AS
ranking_subcategory: #8 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #8 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #8 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen

reviews.title: Nice experience
reviews.text:
A beautiful hour with the team on a magic boat .
Sport and nature during one hour , you visit around Bergen

reviews.title: excellent boat tour
reviews.text: This boat tour was excellent. You get a waterproof suit from the company to wear above your clothes. Due to the speed of the RIB boat, you cover quite some area on the tour. The guide showed us different areas and islands and stopped from time to time that we could look around and take photos. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Worth every penny!
reviews.text:
An amazing way to sea Bergen and the surrounding archipelago. 
 
The guide was very professional and stopped regularly to make sure that everyone was comfortable. He also pointed out places of interest and showed us a sea eagle nest. We were even lucky enough to see one of the eagles.

The boat got up to quite a speed and we went out to the open sea where the waves were large enough to make our adrenaline rush.

Would definitely do the trip again!

(Too busy holding on for any photos from the waves bits).

photo.caption: Very sporty and very fun american runners!

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Bergen Jogging Experience tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Wonderful!!  I highly recommend the Bergen Jogging Experience.
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of running with Erik in Bergen on May 29, 2019.  We had some extra time, so he graciously extended our run to show me more of the city.  I highly recommend running with Erik (or any of his partners).  This was a highlight of my time in Norway.  Thank you, Erik!

name: Scandinavian Yachters
ranking_subcategory: #7 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #7 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #7 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
description: Experience Bergen from the fjord! A two hour sightseeing and fjord cruise onboard the beautiful and comfortable sail boat “First Player”, giving you an opportunity to view and experience Bergen from the sea. Departing Bryggen for a unique and personal guided sightseeing of Vaagen,the City Fjord,Sandviken,Old Bergen and the Pudde Fjord. Every day at 12:00 - 14:00.

reviews.title: A friendly guide
reviews.text:
We had an amazing time with Arve today! Not only did we get to see the fantastic views of Bergen but we learnt a lot about the specific histories of all sorts of interesting buildings and boats. 

Arve was a very friendly guide and even if I had a single day in this city, I would like to book his tour again.

name: JANDIS sightseeing and fishing tours
description: NEW THIS YEAR - 2017: We have purchased and will soon be the proud owners of a brand new Mercedes V Class minivan (7 passenger seats), in addition to our Mercedes Viano (also 7 passenger seats), which we have had for some time now. This new addition will make us more flexible to offer TRANSFERS, SIGHTSEEING TOURS and LONGER EXCURSIONS BY CAR. Book us for your next comfortable and reliable transfer or sightseeing in Bergen and Norway! GENERAL INFORMATION: JANDIS AS (Ltd) is a receiving tour operator in Norway. With our assistance you can make one of the most memorable journeys in your life. We have been operating in Norway for many years and have developed a close relationship with the local culture, and established an extensive network of contacts with a number of other companies providing travel services in Norway. Our focus is tourism in Western Norway. Western Norway has it all: high mountains crowned with glaciers and snow, deep fjords - ancient waterways of the Vikings, rough sea full of fish and, of course, Bergen - the pearl of the kingdom of fjords, mountains and sea, the most charming and quaint city in Norway. We offer a wide range of tourist services: guided city walks, sightseeing tours and excursions, sea, river and lake fishing, cruises, air sightseeing, transportation and accommodation, Luxury & VIP Travel, Business tours & Conferences. JANDIS AS is a member of Bergen Tourist Board. We offer a wide range of tourist services of high quality: - Accommodation in hotels - Accommodation in cottages and fishing villages - Sightseeing / guided tours - Ready-made and tailored tours - Luxury and VIP Travel - Business tours and Conferences - Road transport - Air Transport - Sailing and motor yachts - Sea fishing - Lake and river fishing - Active recreation
