reviews.title: Impeccable service! (2 full day tours and 2 transfers)
reviews.text:
Bergen, Norway was part of our North European Tour Adventures ( Iceland-Norway-Sweden-Finland- Denmark-Poland)
Planning: Email correspondence was quick and immediate. This Company was great in giving out suggestions and recommendations from the hotels to the places to visit in Iceland.
Our group: I am with Senior citizens who have slight mobility problems. I have made prior planning with JANDIS for making the tour senior citizen-friendly. They have exceeded my expectations in  this area.

Guide: Denis is a great guide. Excellent service. I have been organizing trips for almost 5 years now and I have had many experiences with coordinating and corresponding with guides, Denis is probably one of the most courteous guides I have ever encountered. In terms of knowledge, Denis really knows Norwegian history, geography and popular culture. We had him for 2 full days and we could not ask for more. Coming from the Sunny side of the Earth, we can definitely say that we learned a lot from him.

Also appreciate the short side trip after fetching us at the airport. Should have been just an airport pick-up but he went out of the way to show us the scenic road to our hotel. 

For this entire north Europe trip, Denis is the best driver we had. Great job. Would recommend this Company in a heartbeat.

reviews.title: Beautiful Fjords and Countryside!
reviews.text: We had a privately guided tour (Queen of the Fjords) end December for 6 hours from Bergen to waterfalls and around the fjords.  Our guide, Denis, was friendly and very professional staying by our side at waterfalls and other sites.   He even brought a fun picnic lunch for us, and gave us great information on Norway and the fjords along the way.  The whole 6 hour tour was thoroughly enjoyable and a highlight of our vacation! Highly recommended!

photo.caption: En nydelig august dag i Bergen by.

reviews.title: Best for the hot days
reviews.text: We got lucky to be in Bergen in the few very hot days during summer end of July. This saltwater swimming pool was the highlight for the kids (7 and 11). We also took advantage to swim in the fjord that was over 20 degrees warm and very refreshing. The place is small and can get crowded, but we loved it anyway. An easy 15 minutes walk from the city centre. There is also a nice playground close by with a few climbing walls and trampolines.

reviews.title: great place for kids and a family
reviews.text: hot pool, ocean and a sauna. The kids loved to dive in the cold sea and then go to the saune. For families with kids: combine this with the aquarium next door =amazing.

reviews.title: Had an excellent beer from their microbrewery
reviews.text: The beer that I had was quite exceptional, exactly to my taste, dark and sweetish, one to really savour and maybe my favourite beer this year.  The environment is pleasant and relaxed very much like the better sort of British bar where you do not have loud music and equally loud customers. I was very grateful for the recommendation from the tourist office when I explained that I was looking for good local beer, that was just what I got.  Great beer menu by the way such a wide range of choice.

name: Bergen Base Camp Day Tours
description: Bergen is surrounded by beautiful nature and mountains with a variety of hikes, bike routes and other outdoor possibilities only minutes from the center of town. You find our office at the UNESCO site Bryggen where you can start your adventure to explore Bergen.

offer_list.title: Food and Culture walk
Biking Tour and Grieg Concert in Bergen
Panoramic Hike Across Vidden: From Ulriken to Floyen
Zipline at Mt Ulriken in Bergen
3-Hour Mt Ulriken Scenic and Cultural Hike

reviews.title: Food and Culture Walk in Bergen
reviews.text: We were visiting as a family and scheduled a food and culture walk. As others have mentioned, we wish we'd done this the very first thing, since we had such a fantastic guide who told us about the city, its history, and about contemporary culture in Bergen and around Norway. Our walk was well paced for a family group (short distances with stops where some could sit down) and we enjoyed the food (snacks at the beginning and sit-down places with a substantial soup and drinks at one, sweets at another, and more drinks at a third) quite a lot. We also got a thorough tour of the historic trading quarter of Bergen. However, the best thing about it was our guide, Victoria. She was so knowledgable and enthusiastic, fully of great stories and happy to respond to all our questions.

reviews.title: Check opening times
reviews.text:
We where here on 12 june 2019.
Unfortunate during week days the zipline is not in work.
The views are awsome none the less

20 Apr 2018 - 23 June 2019

reviews.title: Food and Culture Guided Walk
reviews.text:
This is a must for first time visitors to Bergen.
We wished we had done this tour at the beginning of our stay in Bergen as we learnt so much about the city and what it has to offer.
A wonderful educational experience with a fantastic guide.

reviews.title: E-bike rental perfect way to spend some hours
reviews.text: We came to the city of Bergen early afternoon without any plans what to do. We decided to go up the mountain with the famous Floibanen but the ticket line was endless. We decided to walk around and see what comes our way. Accidentally we found this place and started talking with a nice young lady. Through her we got the idea to go up the mountain with e-bikes. So we did and I believe it was a much better way then going with Floibanen. We could stop wherever we wanted, take in different views and riding through endless rows of old wooden houses. The e-bikes were great and it was so much fun! There is many different ways to go up and down. Forest trails or perfect asphalt. We went up the forest trail and down the asphalt way. No problem for the bikes.  No need to stand in any line wasting time. This was a perfect thing to do when having just a few hours. Thank you Base Camp Bergen for such a kind and helpful service and advice. We will be back, and then we do the zip line!

description:
We offer the original Norway in a nutshell® tour. Choose Fjord Tours for great deals on vacations in Norway! We offer a wide range of tours exploring some of the most popular tourist routes across this spectacular country. Whether you’re planning a long holiday in Norway or just a short break, let Fjord Tours be your expert guide - all year round.
Our employees know Norway.
address: Mollendalsv 1 a Møllendalsv 1 a, Bergen 5009 Norway

urgency_tag.tag_text: Tours from Norway in a nutshellR tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

reviews.title: Fjord Tours Norway in a Nutshell
reviews.text:
Overall, our experience with Fjordtours and the Norway in a nutshell self-guided tour was positive. However, Their customer service certainly could be improved upon. I emailed them a few days before our trip, concerned with the fact that we did not have actual tickets or seat assignments. I was emailed another copy of what we had already printed out and  was told that that was all that we needed for the trip— still no seat assignments.  However when we arrived at the train station in Bergen Norway we were informed that we needed to have seat assignments. The ticket office  told us that the Fjordtours representative would be there at the station at 8am. We were there an hour early and had plenty of time to take care of any issues that might arise but we never saw a Fjordtours representative.  
However, we learned by email later that the representative was there  wearing a similar yellow vest as the security personnel and did not make her presence known. Therefore, when we boarded the train we had to go from seat to seat until we were not bumped  by someone who actually had that seat assigned.  We also did not have a seat assignment for the train from Myrdal to Oslo. When I contacted Fjordtours about the issue, the emailed response was cavalier and very defensive.
 Although the lack of seat assignments was stressful, the scenery was breathtaking and the trip, although long, was worthwhile. 
 Be advised that that final leg of the trip might take longer than the train schedule indicates. We arrived at the Oslo station almost 40 minutes late and did not get to our hotel until nearly midnight. A long day for us!

reviews.title: Good tour
reviews.text: Able to see all the amazing nature that Norway has to offer in a day in Norway in a nutshell. However, it might be a bit rushing for each stop. It was a bit pity that we are unable to stay longer during the stay in gudvangen for the Viking market which was the last day. But overall we did enjoy the tour and following it was easy. however if it rains it will be more ideal to engage the luggage porter service that the fjord tour has offer. As it will be easier to travel around. Even though it is still accessible to carry the luggage with you around the whole trip. But without it, you will enjoy the tour better.

reviews.title: Very good tour
reviews.text: This is a very good tour. We left Bergen on the 06.50 train and it was an easy transition to all the following stages with only 30 mins or so between each and then an hour in Voss before catching the train back to Bergen. It was surprisingly quiet on the trains and boat, this was a Saturday so perhaps that helped. Travelling in Bergen’s heatwave we were delighted to find comfortable air conditioned transport and the premium boat was lovely.

reviews.title: Excellent Tour! Worth every cent!
reviews.text:
My 7 year old son and I did our Norway in a Nutshell tour last year for my birthday - *May 2018 (forgive the late review). I spent months researching for my trip and was immediately drawn to this tour - based on their site and other online reviews. While I was extremely intimidated at first (no personal guide)... it all worked out seamlessly. 

We did Oslo to Bergen - round-trip..and we spent 5 glorious days in Bergen...after a very hectic.. but fun week in Oslo. This is not a journey for the faint of heart...it is indeed a LOT to cover in one day.. I even met people who did a full turnaround back to Olso on the overnight train... While I wouldn't recommend that... for those that are short on time... it's a great option. You must understand that you can stretch this journey out to YOUR LIKING....so really think about the stops and if you want to spend a night or 2 in various locations. 

The train ride from Olso to Flam was just incredible... there aren't enough words to describe the beauty....Even at the end of May, we were still able to see wonderful glaciers....just starting to melt...along with such picturesque hills...rivers...farms...small homes... It was truly breathtaking. A few of my photos look like they belong in a Monet watercolour collection...it was that amazing... 

Transferring to the Flam Railways was a great ride....very steep train ride... and high! just amazing...Waterfall stop was quick.... but good photo opp! ... I booked so that we had a nice 3 hour break in Flam... before our Fjords tour in the afternoon..and it was so needed....Despite the Flam visitor center being a bustling grand central for all travelers/other cruise passengers.... we were able to have a great lunch and a nice nap!.(the chairs were all couches with cushions)....We had time for ice cream and got  to stretch our legs....take in the views...and not be rushed.  Many other travelers were running for their boat straight after our train ride...I'm so glad I booked with a break instead. Our Premium fjord boat was beautiful! Gorgeous leather chairs everywhere.. luggage storage..immaculate bathrooms....Be prepared for multiple temp changes and high wind!.... We stayed outside for the entire ride to take it all in! and it was beautiful.....We went from our tank tops and hot sun in Flam..to our coats/fleece sweaters/scarves in about 30 minutes ha..Some people preferred to sit at the back of the boat... while most of us were up front for the best pictures.  Bus to Voss had some hairpin turns! .We had an incredible driver.......by this time....we took another nap... Be prepared for a 10 minute walk with your luggage to the next train..(strong luggage! no cheap wheels)...

Our final train to Bergen from Voss got us there by 9pm....with the sun still out...of course... and from there...we really enjoyed ourselves in Bergen..so much to see and do...I highly recommend a stay here if you can fit it in....We had a fantastic Airbnb... walked everywhere each day.. best seafood at their market...hiking. on Mount Floyen... take your kids to see the Troll Forest there.. really fun .. Took our train back to Oslo the night before our departure home... and it was perfect.

Note for PARENTS -

PS - the food on the NSB train is actually really good! Have the meatballs with potatoes and gravy :).... Also the snacks and chocolates as well....great treats to have while in the dining car. Also - there is a Family car on the NSB train - which has a small room for kids to play and watch movies... They also give out a cool Kids Kit to each child with crayons/drawing books..etc.... We enjoyed spending an hour in there....then went back to our seats....- If you have small babies and/or loud children lol - you can request seats in the Family car. Otherwise, QUIET in all other seats/areas on the train.

Do pack light...1 suitcase or backpack per person...make sure each child can carry/roll their own bags...or consolidate as best as you can....Hauling luggage on/off trains/boats/buses all day is exhausting ..so make sure you've packed as light as possible.

ALSO - note - if you are picking up your train tickets from the Airport in Oslo - check for public holidays!  We arrived on one (May 21st - 2018 - Whit Monday)...and they weren't there for almost 3 hours after we arrived from our overnight flight...You can pick them up at Oslo Central - but just something to keep in mind if you want to get them straight after you arrive by flight.

I wouldn't hesitate from booking this tour again on our next visit....and we'll stop off in other places...

Highly recommend! Enjoy Norway!

reviews.title: Great tour except for train down to Flam
reviews.text: Everything was great about this trip. You self guide but have the pre planned bookings of all of the transport and hotels. The only bad thing about this trip was that the train down to Flam was overbooked, possibly because there was a cruise ship docked at Flam and many of these people had trained it up to the top station.

reviews.title: There's a Reason Everyone Does This Tour
reviews.text: This is a wonderful way to see Norway. There are many options for side trips and overnights. We stayed in Flam for a night, and took a rib boat fjord "safari" while there. It was a hoot and the scenery is gorgeous. The Flam Railway is an amazing trip, with incredible scenery.  There are several options but we went Bergen to Oslo over two days. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Good But...
reviews.text: We enjoyed the day long self guided tour. The scenery from Oslo to Flam was spectacular. The cruise from Flam to Gudvangen was great with amazing scenery and waterfalls. The Bus from Gudvangen to Voss was entertaining with good scenery. The Train from Voss to Bergen was also good. The Flam was somewhat disappointing. Expectations were high. The Scenery was great in some spots but there was significant time spent in tunnels. Reviews suggested that the left side of the train had the best views but we found that the scenery was probably equal on both sides of the train. If you have limited time in Norway then we would recommend this tour but we did find that there is better scenery if you explore further.

reviews.title: Excellent overall experience of Norwegian landscapes.
reviews.text: This self-guided tour is an exceptional way to see the best of western Norway's scenery in a day. There were only two slight hic-coughs which did not mar the day. The first was the transition from train to bus at Voss; the bus is a standard service bus (I think it was the 460) and there was only one at the bus station (adjacent to the train station) when the train containing the hordes of "Nutshell thing" tourists arrived. Chaos as there were hordes of us, many with voluminous luggage as obviously breaking the trip into a couple of days. Fortunately three more buses showed up quite quickly and everything settled down. The bus ride down the Stalheimskleiva was great fun, the driver stopping at several turns for the photo opportunities - a highlight of our two week sojourn in Norway. After transferring to the 'green' ferry at Gudvangen, the trip to Flam was brilliant especially down the Naeroyfjord, do enjoy the coffee and snacks available as you view the many waterfalls as the cafes in Flam get really busy. The ferry is very quiet and has plenty of space so all can get good photo opportunities. The train from Flam to Myrdal is spectacular and again provides good photo vantage points, perhaps seats on the right hand side of the train facing forwards are best. The second hiccough was the train back to Bergen; according to our tickets we had to change at Voss, however it was the same train despite having seperate seat reservations for the two sections Myrdal-Voss and Voss-Bergen! The conductor enligtened us to this fact when he checked our tickets. A really enjoyable day; a must do from Bergen if you have the time.

reviews.title: Norway in a nutshell
reviews.text: Excellent way to visit Norway.  This is a self guided tour which can be done in one day or several.  We started with 2 nights in Oslo  then train to Flam where we had 2 nights at the excellent Flamsbrygga hotel then a 2 hour ferry trip in the Fiords to Gudvangen where we spent one night in a unique room with a grass roof.   Both places lovely to be at in the evening & early morning before and after all the tourist busses & ferries.  Spectacular scenery right on the Fiords.  This followed by a scenic bus trip to Voss then train to Bergen where we spent 2 nights at the Thon hotel Rosenkrantz which was excellent.  Thoroughly recommend this trip.

reviews.title: Expensive but worth every cent!!!
reviews.text: Norway has the most exceptional scenery. We caught two trains, the first Bergen to Mýrdal followed by the Flam railway which stopped at an amazing waterfall until we reached the fjords. We will never forget the lushness of the countryside and the little villages dotted around the fjords. On our return we caught a bus which went on a picturesque route to Voss and from there we trained it back to Bergen. All in all the trip was 11 hours. No food was provided so for just over 320 AUD we had tickets for the trains and the bus which were all co-ordinated. Had you purchased tickets on your own for each leg of the journey you’d be slightly in front but I’d say this is the way to do it. Tickets for this trip can be purchased from Bergen’s information centre.

reviews.title: Tour for a nice impression of Norway but all on the automatic pilot
reviews.text: Fine trainset from Bergen to Voss. Station under reconstruction. What chaos at the buses. Then the bus tour: impressive route with the steep slopes and tight hairpin bends. The fjord trip unfortunately in the rain, and not everyone has an optimal place to good to see everything outside. No explanation or information along the way what there is to see in spite of the beautiful large TV screens, only news in Norwegian. Strong negative point.

reviews.title: Beautiful views, but understand how it works so that you can enjoy it.
reviews.text: I saw very mixed reviews about the Norway in a Nutshell Tours so I had some concerns when we chose to take a tour.   I am glad that we did the trip as we saw hundreds of waterfalls and the fjord had some wonderful scenery.  We had expected a guide who would give us information about what we saw. Instead, the tour seemed to be just a series of tickets that got you where you needed to be.  We did not see a guide and never heard any commentary, except that the Flåm Railway that had an audio-visual slide show at certain points and one bus driver gave us some information.  He was good. The materials we received  when we ordered the tour had a spot for “Practical Advice,” but for the most part offered none.  So if you go, be sure to print your tickets ahead of time. Go early enough so you can work out any questions you have.  Be self-sufficient.  Know where you need to go and if you are confused, the locals at the stops seemed to know where the Nutshell tours should go.  Our trip was Bergen-to-Bergen loop.  Our route had two places where you could get some food, but the food was about as good and economical as you would expect for places that serve visitors who have few options.  My suggestion would be to take some food with you.  I think the ease of having the tickets arranged for you was worth it.

reviews.title: Touristy but worth it!
reviews.text: The tour starts in a ferry which travels through the fjords, then you disembark and take the historic Flam railway which twists and turns up the cliff-sides and finally on the scenic Bergen railway back to Bergen.  Beautiful view after beautiful view.  This is expensive and touristy but well worth it.  PS - there is a weird moment on the Flam train where a surprise dance performance takes place near a waterfall.

reviews.title: scandinavia
reviews.text: this is a must do if you can afford it -- it is pricey -- and it takes ALL day to accomplish.  In hindsight we wished we had stopped and stayed in Flam or one other stops that had a hotel in.  the whole of the trip was breathtaking.  you start on a train out of bergen, then they transfer you to a bus which takes you down a steep, curvy road (I mean steep) past a waterfall, then to the ferry which was big and wonderful.  then you catch 2 more trains .  It is an 8-9 hour day schleeping your suitcases around.  .... but I'm glad we didn't miss it.

reviews.title: Unbelievably beautiful
reviews.text: The train down to the fjord and the boat ride are overwhelmingly scenic! Initial train ride is a great way to see the variations in topography in southern Norway. Last leg of the trip is a bit boring but it gets you to Bergen which is a lot of fun...just don't book the Grand Terminus hotel, get the modern one next door

reviews.title: Norway 🇳🇴 in a nutshell
reviews.text:
It was a beautiful trip from Oslo to Bergen via Flam.
The scenic beauty was amazing.Its a combination of Bus,Rail and Cruise trip and organized by Fjords tour. We stayed at Flam overnight so it took nearly 36 hours but we loved the trip.Must see in a lifetime.

reviews.title: Backwards View Was Less Than Awe-inspiring
reviews.text: Did this tour in 2 days rather than one. Train from Oslo to Myrdal was canceled due to track work. Had to transfer to a bus. So the train to Myrdal was late and the Flamm railroad cars were already crowded when we arrived. Had to see this scenic portion of the trip riding backwards. Pouring rain in Flamm but the tiny town was very scenic- including a MSC cruise ship. Took the boat the next day- it was okay but not breathtaking. The pictures you see are from above, so that gives a completely different viewpoint. In Gudvangen we had to stand around and wait for a bus. This large bus had to navigate some very tight turns- the waterfalls were gorgeous but there could have easily been an accident. Arrived in Voss just in time to wait for the train to Bergen. Too much traveling and changing modes of transport for the scenes you saw.

reviews.title: Lovely and worth the money
reviews.text:
Went on an organised trip from the P&O Cruise ship. It was very interesting and with a local on board the train giving us details of what we were seeing made it very worth while. At the summit we changed trains and went down into Voss. En route we witnessed a waterfall in the making. Water was running over some rocks that was covered in snow. A large piece of snow fell off to reveal more of the waterfall, with another crack in the snow/ice opening up.
Thoroughly enjoyable

reviews.title: Best of Norway
reviews.text: I was quickly able to locate Norway in a Nutshell on google and purchased a ticket via my phone, but while it was shoulder season,  the  itinerary was sold out a few days ahead. The tickets were emailed to me within minutes containing both a barcode and a time line. There was never any question about where I should be or which mode of transport I was to board. It is much cooler in the mountains and a warm jacket is a must. I took the Bergen Railway to Myrdal, the Flåm Railway to Guduanger (the Fjords via boat), a bus to Voss and the Bergen Railway back to my origination point. All transportation was clean, included restroom facilities and most had snack or food options. Exiting the Flåm Railway for the ferry provided a larger selection of restaurants, with a variety of food options such as snacks, sit down dining, or take a way meals from vendors and several quality souvenir shops.  Additionally there is a small complimentary museum on the Flåm Railway’s history. A mind boggling scenery with waterfalls, mountains, wildflowers and rivers everywhere you look - not to be missed.

reviews.title: Tempo muito curto nos fjords para o tempo de viagem
reviews.text: Fizemos um dia de Bergen a Oslo e ficamos um pouco frustrados. Apesar da exuberância das paisagens, foram apenas 2 horas nos fjords, muitos túneis que dificultaram apreciarmos a paisagem e o trem de Flam a Myrdal em um dia de verão estava um verdadeiro inferno, pois estava lotado, nao tinha ar condicionado, poucas janelas abriam e a velocidade baixa (20km/hr) não possibilitava muito vento pata aliviar o calor. Não acho que valeu a pena.

reviews.title: Vale cada centavo
reviews.text: Pegamos o passeio em Oslo e finalizando em Bergen. Apenas que é INCRÍVEL e vale cada centavo, sem dúvida. Todos os trajetos são incríveis e fizemos os deslocamentos com mala, mas sem problemas. O passeio de barco é lindo, é possível andar na parte interna e externa (recomendo levar um casaquinho mesmo no verão).

reviews.title: Sehr lohnenswert, auch wenn der Preis hoch ist
reviews.text:
Unsere Tour führte zunächst 5 1/2 Stunden durch die Fjorde.
Von Bergen aus geht es mit dem komfortablen Express-Boot nach Flåm. Wenn das Wetter gut ist, kann man die ganze Zeit auf dem hinteren Bootsteil von oben an Deck die Landschaft genießen. Ein tolles Erlebnis und auch die Verpflegung an Bord ist gut. 
Im Anschluss geht es mit der historischen Bahn 1 Stunde von Flåm nach Myrdal und von dort im normalen Zug dann 2 1/2 Stunden nach Bergen zurück. Gerade die erste Stunde ab Myrdal ist landschaftlich außergewöhnlich schön. 
Die Reisezeit im April bei gutem Wetter ist sehr empfehlenswert, da man von grüner Landschaft bis weitreichend schneebedeckte Berge alles sieht.

reviews.title: Excelente planificación
reviews.text: Un súper tour . Es guiado por ustedes mismos pero todo está súper bien organizado . Se aseguran de hacernos ver todo lo más hermoso de Noruega y no tiene desperdicio . Fuimos de Oslo a Bergen por tren, barco, bus y sin detalle . Muy bien planificado .

name: Bryggen Walking Tour

photo.caption: Our guide on the Bryggen Walking Tour

address_obj.street2: Connected with the Bryggens and Hanseatic League Museums

address: Dreggsallmenningen 3 Connected with the Bryggens and Hanseatic League Museums, Bergen 5003 Norway

reviews.title: Amazing tour!
reviews.text: This was such a fun tour and one of the highlights of our time in Bergen. I wouldn’t have gotten much out of Bryggen without the tour since it’s a bit of a tourist trip. We learned so much and got a great sense of the area while also having fun. Our guide was very familiar with the history of not only the area, Norway but all of Scandinavia. He spoke perfect English, gave great recommendations and even saved a baby seagull we found during the tour. Can’t recommend enough— more than worth the cost.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.text:
This guided tour really is a must do whilst you are in Bergen otherwise you will miss so much of it's history.

Although the weather was extremely wet our guide walked us through the old buildings and narrow alleyways finding places to shelter whilst she revealed how Bryggen came to be built and what it was used for. We learned about things that we had spent the last couple of days walking past unobserved.

As part of the tour we then visited the Hanseatic Museum which recreated the life and living quarters of those original traders.

Brilliant!

reviews.title: Wonderful way to start off your time in Bergen
reviews.text: I really liked the fact that the guide could walk and talk to us due to the ear pieces she gave us.  I hadn't experienced that before. I knew exactly how far the range to hear her was when I would linger too long when taking a picture.  This tour took us to a basement that isn't open to the public.  The main museum was under construction, but they replaced it w/ a chance to see a nearby castle. We learned a lot about the history of Bergen.  It's no wonder that this is a World Heritage Site.  Highly recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Great tour
reviews.text: Based on our Rick Steves book we did this tour and we’re so glad we did. It’s very informative, just the right length and provides excellent context for self guided sightseeing afterwards. Definitely recommend this.

reviews.title: A must while in Bryggen
reviews.text: This tour takes you through the bylanes and old city of Bryggen. It goes at a calm pace and allows enough time for photo shoots and insights into the area,

reviews.title: Bryggen walking tour
reviews.text: A fascinating insight into the old port area of Bergen and how important the mediaeval Hanseatic league was to the North sea region. Our guide, Dane, was full of amusing as well as interesting anectodes and it was his first day too!! Well worth the 90 minutes

reviews.title: Informative and interesting tour
reviews.text: The tour covered a lot of the city and plenty of information was provided about each landmark or area including history, interesting facts and current state/use.

reviews.title: Great walking tour and it includes admission to museums
reviews.text: Upon Rick Steve's advise, we signed up for this tour and it was well worth it.  The guide showed us though the Bryggens Museum, along the wharf and through the Bryggens area, and then to the Hanseatic Museum which was our favorite.  Unfortunately, the cruise ship left early that day and we didn't have enough time in the Hanseatic Museum.

reviews.title: excellent overview of the Bryggen!
reviews.text: The Rick Steve's guide so highly recommended this tour that we had to join, but it was even better than we expected.  Our guide Torbjörn was fantastic - full of information and answers to people's questions, entertaining and just an overall gentleman.  We thought for sure he was a student of architecture or history and were surprised to learn that this area is simply his passion.  He spoke at the three museums and described the building exteriors and Bryggen environment as we walked.  By the end, participants really have a full idea of the history and importance of this beautiful area, all the better for appreciating a visit to Bergen and the west coast of Norway.  So glad Rick Steves sent us to this tour!

reviews.title: Just the right amount of tour and info!
reviews.text: A very informative and interesting tour of the old wharf section (Bryggen) of Bergen. Beginning inside the Bryggen Museum, we were able to get a good overview the city and the archeological finds of this oldest part of Bergen. The tour took us through the old Hanseatic buildings and our guide gave us a fascinating understanding of life during those times. Cod was king! So glad we were able to take this tour.  We were lucky, we in Bergen in late August and took one of the last available tours of the season. Don't miss this tour.  One grumpy older man from a cruise ship was annoyed there wasn't more walking involved and demanded a refund after 15 min in the museum. His loss!  It's not a nature tour (was that what he was expecting??)  but those who take it do need to know there are some stairs involved and you do walk a few blocks. Ric Steve's was right on this one.  Book early, it fills up.

reviews.title: We liked the Hanseatic museum the best
reviews.text: This tour gives you a good overview of the Hanseatic past of Bergen.  We like walking tours that give you the history of an area, so we did enjoy this, but it was very hot inside the museums.

reviews.title: The best way to get to know and see the beautiful city of Bergen
reviews.text: The best way to get to know and see the beautiful city of Bergen. Our guide was very friendly and his local knowledge of living in Bergen and its history was very good. Friendly and informative.

reviews.title: Excellent Bergen Introduction
reviews.text: We took the Rick Steves recommended Bryggen Walking Tour from the Bryggen Museum on the first morning of our visit to Bergen in June 2018. It was the perfect way to get a sense of Bergen’s history. Our guide was excellent and over the course of about 1.5 hours we made our way through three nearby museums and walked through the Bryggen district. The tour ticket also allowed for a same day return to each of the museums for a longer visit. It was an enjoyable morning and made the rest of our visit to Bergen more meaningful.

reviews.title: All the Must with No Fuss!
reviews.text:
With this 90-minute-must tour you get all the history of Bergen and the Hanseatic League.  It’s a great way to start your visit.  Otherwise, you won’t know what you’re looking at.  Arriving early morning, we walked 15 minutes from our ship’s berth at the Bontelabo Dock to town and visited St. Mary’s Church (Mariakirken).  When the Bryggens Museum opened at 10:00 a.m., we bought our tickets for the 11:00 a.m. English tour.  The museum employees suggested walking through the neighborhood of old wooden houses located not far behind the museum before the tour started.  The costumed museum guides give the important points and are happy to assist.  However, they don’t project loudly so if hearing is a problem, consider hiring a private guide for a Bergen city walk.  (You can find one through the Official Bergen Guide on the tourist website.)    The Schøtstuene Assembly rooms and Hanseatic Museum rooms are small.  It was difficult with a group of 30 to get good pictures so right after the tour I went back into the Hanseatic Museum and did reshots.

Other Notes on Your Bergen Day:

The Fløibanen Funicular was overcast so we walked through the Fish Market, Nordnes, and Sentrum (The Center).  Heading back from the Lake (Lille Lungegårdsvana), we stumbled upon the cute cobblestone street of Marken.

Check out my photo mapping a walk of old wooden houses in the Nordnes area given to me by a local guide.

As a note due to construction, the Bergenhus Fortress can only be visited on a tour right now.  There isn’t much you can do on your own.  The Bergen Cathedral (Domkirke) is also being renovated.

reviews.title: Excellent value for money. Fun and Informative.
reviews.text: Informative 2-hour tour providing interesting history, stories and commentary. The tour started inside the BRYGGENS MUSEUM where our guide touched on several exhibits important to the history of the wharf area. We didn't see everything in that museum but the Walking Tour ticket includes re-entry to all of the museums included in the tour (on that day only) so we went back later in the afternoon. At the SCHOTSTUENE  (the Hanseatic merchants meeting rooms) we learned more about the history of the Hanseatic trading community; I didn't know anything about this bit of history and found it well worth hearing about. After walking past the wooden houses we finished up the tour going through the HANSEATIC MUSEUM which was the home and warehouse of one of the merchants.

photo.caption: Det eneste som er i vater hos er vår flotte bardisk:)

reviews.title: Bad
reviews.text: This is a bad place, don’t go here! My friend got a really bad treatment last night, and she got really hurt.

reviews.title: Three nights in Bergen
reviews.text: Such a great bar!  Outdoor patio was buzzing and the selection inside was fantastic. We would highly recommend. Ambience is VERY Norwegian and you feel like you’re traveling on the open seas. A must see for a drink, or ten.

reviews.title: Great service
reviews.text: We were here a few times. Very reasonable prices. Good, polite plenty of seating outside. Great for people watching and relaxing. Wife loved their Cappuccino. Toilets a the back of the just walk through and you’ll find them.

reviews.title: Do not enter
reviews.text:
We dropped in here for an afternoon drink and should have left when the only bartender working told us it was her second day. 

We ordered a cosmo, old fashioned, rum and Diet Coke. She told us she couldn’t make any of those as she was not yet trained. She kept pushing us to beers as that she could do. We didn’t want beer so we kept pushing back.  We ended up ordering double shots of rum and vodka and a hard cider. Then one of our party ran a few doors down and bought a sprite and a Diet Coke to mix with our shots. 

I don’t blame the bartender for this. She only knows what she has been trained on. Management and Ownership are responsible. You lost money on us as we went in search of a real bar instead of us having a few drinks. You frustrated a new employee and didn’t give her any tools to do her job.

reviews.title: Old-Tymey New-Tymey experience
reviews.text: A perfect mash-up between old world Bergen and Bergen 2019! Did the original inhabitants imagine a building or a bar lasting this long? Even if they did, I doubt that in their wildest dreams they’d picture the crowds of people, live music or free WiFi. A Friendly staff just adds to the experience. Whether you live here or are just visiting, you need to stop here, sit down, drink a local beer and breathe it all in.

reviews.title: Super friendly staff!
reviews.text:
Nice atmosphere, great staff - very friendly!

Clean, good location and good selection of beer.

Patio has plenty of room during summer.

reviews.title: Utepils
reviews.text: Sjøboden is the perfect place for you and your friends to meet in the sun for a beer or a glass of wine! The bar has a lagre area for outdoor seating and inside you Can often listen to live music. A great place for a beer

reviews.title: Cosy bar on the Bryggen
reviews.text: Popped in here for a drink on a wet day in Bergen. Lovely bar and a great place to escape the rain. Nice in the afternoon but even better at night I would suspect.

reviews.title: Relaxed pub in Bryggen
reviews.text: Beer is expensive in Norway so no surprise there. A really nice relaxed pub in Bryggen with great live music. And the bartender was pretty cute!

reviews.title: Great Place!
reviews.text: This atmospheric bar is perfectly located for enjoying drinks any time of year.  The friendly bartenders are amazing!  Enjoy the live music at this quintessential Norwegian bar.  Best bar in Bryggen and perhaps all of Bergen!

reviews.title: Fantastic nights at Sjoboden.
reviews.text:
I was on this wonderfull bar with a friend about by chance my first night in Bergen. The staff and the enviroment surprised me, and I came back again the night after with more friends and family.

The staff is amazing and they have a lot of locals and internationals beers. And the prizes are good.

I have noo one bad word for this bar.

I completely reccomend this place and when I will come back to Bergen this bar will be the first one I will visit again.

reviews.title: A great pub with charm and good vibes
reviews.text: I have been at Sjøboden several times, and i always enjoy. This is a place where you can bring both family and friends! The live music is great and the bartenders are deliverying Good service. You really have to see this place!

reviews.title: Great authentic pub at Bryggen in Bergen
reviews.text: Great authentic pub with a very good selection of beer and drinks. Very professional and service minded staff

reviews.title: Exòtic and cute pub
reviews.text: In front of the harbour in the old town a wondeful location to drink a beer. Nice atmosphere with a friendly service and high hospitality

name: Den Nationale Scene
description: Den Nationale Scene (The National Stage) is Norway's oldest permanent theatre with roots dating back to 1850 and the Norwegian violinist Ole Bull. The theatre was founded to develop Norwegian playwrights and Henrik Ibsen was one of the first writer-in-residences and art-directors of the theatre. The theatre is situated in a beautiful Art Noveau-building, from 1909, in the middle of Bergen.

offer_list.title: City Sightseeing Bergen Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour
Bergen actually, city tour

reviews.title: One pearl in Bergen
reviews.text:
I think the quality of the ticket inspectors could be better to meet the audience. Some of them have been rude, and some of them have been really friendly to me. It is the ticket inspectors which is the first impression of the theatre, so I hope they can change.

I have seen a lot of good theatre plays in this theatre, and looking forward to see what the new theatre boss will change here.

reviews.title: Definitely worth a look
reviews.text:
This is impressive building is the largest theatre in Bergen and is one of the oldest permanent  theatres in Norway.

It is situated in the heart of Bergen and faces Ole Bulls Plass and the City Park.

In its grounds are statues to commerate 2 of Norway's literature greats. To the front is a large statue of the famous playwright Henrik Ibsen. To the side is a staute of Bjørnstjerne, who won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1903.

name: Julehuset - Christmas Shop
description: Julehuset in Bergen is an all-year round Christmas shop. In November and December the shop has 3 floors of Christmas products. The rest of the year there are Christmas products on the top floor only. The shop has everything one needs for a traditional Norwegian Christmas celebration. We sell: baubles, Christmas lights, angels, Christmas tree stands, "nisse" figures, napkins, textiles, Christmas nativity scene and many other decorative items.

reviews.title: Christmas all year
reviews.text:
This is a lovely Christmas shop! 3 floors filled with ornaments and and Christmas figurines. A few other Norwegian souvenirs too. 

This is no Dollar store, but not the most expensive Christmas shop either. It is a good place to find that one new ornament to add to your collection each year. 

The Christmas house is so crooked, you should visit just to experience the stairs and old style house at Bryggen. 

No elevator.

reviews.title: 2nd visit
reviews.text: Second time for us here and still a charming place to visit whenever you are in Bergen. Stacks of Xmas goodies to choose from with 3 floors to explore. Staff are good and helpful but the prices are quite high so take plenty of money with you. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

reviews.title: Expensive
reviews.text:
Monday 3rd September and we were out and about exploring and sightsing in Bergen, we visited the historic area of Bryggen where this store is located.

The store is over a number of floors and there was much more that Christmas ornaments and decorations on sale, there was a plethora of other tourist souvenirs.

Thought some of the Christmas stuff was very nice, but was not prepared to pay nearly £10 for a glass bauble that was made in China. Thought everything was expensive so we just had a browse and left.

The building was more interesting than the store.

reviews.title: One of Several Local Shops
reviews.text: The Julehuset - Christmas Shop is one of several fun nearby wharf shops.  They do have a good selection of Norway hats and other items but this is not a must-see, gotta go-in shop.

name: God Tur
description: Friendly guiding and coaching. 15 years experience. Guided sea kayaking trips. British Canoeing Advanced Water (5 Star Sea) Leader. 1-3 Star award Assessor, Moderate Water Sea Kayak Kayak Leader (4 Star Sea Leader) Assessor. BC/Sports UK new Level 2 Moderate Water Coach. NPF Veileder. Nigel Dennis designs kayaks, Kokatat and IR drysuits, Celtic & Werner paddles. Pick up at Hotel. Speaks fluent English.

reviews.title: A Better Kayak Tour
reviews.text:
Many of the kayak outfitters you will find along the coast of Norway are offering the same bland experience of 2-3 hours of follow-the-leader in big yellow tandem kayaks. Ronny and the crew at God-Tur are skilled kayak instructors and guides and will customize your tour based on the capabilities and interests of your group. 

As an experienced paddler, Ronny took me on a trip through the rocky archipelago of Glasvær that met and exceeded my expectations for a short kayak trip on the west coast of Norway. Ronny was highly knowledgable and genuinely enjoyed sharing his love of the sea with the group.

If you're looking for a quiet tour, some advanced sea kayak instruction or would like to try a multi-day adventure, Ronny will work with you to accommodate your needs and realize your dream of exploring the coast by kayak.

name: Kava Roofgarden
description: Kava offers a spectacular experience of international class, wonderful cocktails and one of the city's finest roof terraces. It’s a home for design and musical expression, but above all a uncensored playground. Our main goal is to bright up the Norwegian nightclub scene - down to earth but still on the 7th floor.

reviews.title: Ypperlig sted
reviews.text: Good service, good music and very good drinks. I would recommend Kava for everybody that likes a more high end club. They also serve shisha which is hard to find in Bergen.

name: Fabelflora
description: Fabelflora is an arts, crafts and design store situated in the heart of Bergen. We offer exclusive interior products, jewellery and more from reknown small scale european designers/makers. The Fabelflora Store owners/designers offer a large collection of limited edition graphic prints inspired by nordic nature designed and made in Bergen. The store also host a showroom for internationally reknown Scandinavian Surface wallpaper designs wich can be purchased world wide. Come visit us at the arts & crafts museum KODE 1!

name: Tandem Paragliding Bergen
description: Enjoy a nice flight from Mt.Ulriken with sertified tandeminstructors One flight is 1700 NOK and must be payed in cash,since we dont have a credit card option

reviews.title: Birthday present
reviews.text:
I arranged this as a surprise birthday present for my brother and it all went really well. Easy to deal with the pilot over email from abroad before the day, good communication with company. A hassle free experience and the paraglide was a great success - it’s such a beautiful location.  Very easy to access, our pilot Vincent met us just outside the cable car building and then a short walk to the spot
On the mountain where they took off from and we could all watch. They swooped past many times giving lots of opportunities for us on the ground to wave and take pics etc. thoroughly recommend. They landed at the football stadium and drove their guest back to the cable car car
Park where we met up again after the rest of us had a lovely walk down the mountain (3.3km).  Fun to watch and fun to do!

reviews.title: Awesome paragliding experience!
reviews.text: Vincent and Dale were very friendly and experienced, and explained what we had to do very well. They were very flexible and pretty much let us run the day. There were four in our group, and we all had great flights. Also, the view from the air of Bergen and the surrounding area was unbeatable! 5/5.

name: Gunvor Handmade Illustration
description: Hello! I am an illustrator & small business owner from Bergen, Norway. Besides running my own shop & studio at Bryggen, I work as an illustrator for organizations, publishing houses and magazines.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.text: Great shop in a beautiful neighbourhood. Defenitely worth visiting, especially if you are interested in art or just like beautiful drawings. Great artwork.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.text: Worth checking out Gunvor's store especially if you are interested in exploring/collecting artwork. Fun, quirky illustrations of magical creatures and things. Its a nice little studio/store in Bryggen, you may find some nice gifts for Family & friends.

reviews.title: Handmade illustrations
reviews.text:
Gunvor makes fun greeting cards and pictures, a few with a fun (hilarious) almost sarcastic humor, a few classic nice ones. I found fun gifts for people who have everything.. 

A small store, well worth a visit when walking around at Bryggen!

reviews.title: Great art
reviews.text: We happened to find the shop by chance and are very glad we did. The T-shirts we bought are the highlights of our trip! The artwork we also purchased are fantastic. Great place to search for while in Bergen. Gunvor was wonderful to talk with as well

reviews.title: Scandinavia Tour
reviews.text:
Great excellent tour with great local tour guide in  Bergen.Hi Gizel, how's life there. Thanks for the hospitality and friendship. Glad to meet you and hope to meet you again in future. Thanks a zillion.
Apprentice it.

name: Escape Hunt Bergen

photo.caption: Escape Hunt Bergen has 2 different games, but 4 rooms altogether - you can book the same kind of game with your friends and compete which team makes it out of their room first!

description: We're proud to be the premier escape room in Bergen. Escape Hunt Bergen is the city's newest exciting escape room-experience! We offer two different games: Escape from Akershus Fortress-prison break and The Central Bank robbery. We have a duplicate of each room, making it possible to compete against another team who plays an identical game at the same time as you. Are you up for the challenge to rob a bank or escape from prison in 1h? Book now!

reviews.title: So good!
reviews.text:
Amazing room, perfect feel, great sound and very friendly and professional crew!

Definetely coming back for another room shortly! :D

reviews.title: Truly a remarkable experience!
reviews.text: Incredibles rooms, we got fully into it.  We tried both the bank and the prisen rooms, both were of an extremely high standard both techincal and immersion-wise. We absolutely recommend this for anyone looking for a good, adventurous time.

reviews.title: Great fun for team building.
reviews.text: This is something that should be on everyone's to do list if you are in the area!! The place was in the center of Bergen.

reviews.title: Worth a visit!!!
reviews.text: Really fun and exciting rooms on great location!! Great for teambuilding, would definitely recommend

reviews.title: Vi storkoste oss:-)
reviews.text:
Vi var 14 stk fra jobben som dro til Escape Hunt og fikk to kjempe kjekke timer:-)
Alle var fornøyd med både stedet og folkene der. Vi planlegger alerede å komme tilbake:-)

reviews.title: Ikke anbefalt med rullestol
reviews.text:
Jeg synes opplevelsen, og historien var spennende, og ikke minst underholderne. 
Men jeg har dessverre litt kritikk. Jeg er en som har gjort en del erfaring med Escape room tidligere, og på grunn av dette synes jeg det ble litt lett. 
En annen klage jeg har er at som rullestolbruker, føler jeg at jeg må påpeke at rommene var litt små, og trange dette gjelder også dørene. 
For ordens skyld var det DNB jeg prøvde. Men håper å få tid, og ikke minst en gruppe venner med så jeg kan prøve festningen snart :)

reviews.title: Veldig artig!
reviews.text: Flukten fra Akershus festning. Spennende escape room hvor det var veldig spennende å løse oppgavene for å komme seg ut. Anbefales!

reviews.title: Flukten fra Akershus Festning
reviews.text: Kjekk underholdning og man får testet sine kreative evner og samarbeid med andre. Vi var 2 stk og det fungerte veldig bra.

reviews.title: Innbruddet i Norges bank
reviews.text: Det var morsomt, vi var 9 stk fordelt på to like rom. Anbefaler ikke å være mer enn 5 personer på dette rommet, ganske trangt, vi greide det med 26 min igjen

reviews.title: Teambuilding
reviews.text: Vi var 20 stk fordelt på 4 rom. Morsom aktivitet som virkelig setter hjernen i høygir. Om du ikke har prøvd dette før, er det på tide.

reviews.title: Morro og underholdende
reviews.text: Verdt et besøk :-) Krever ingen forkunnskaper, og morro å måtte finne løsninger i felleskap. Vi kommer til å prøve flere spill :-)

reviews.title: Morro, morro, morro
reviews.text: Veldig bra opplegg.  Krever det beste av detektiven i deg og kreativiten din.  Spennende og engasjerende.  Vi var en voksen familie på 5 stk og hadde det kjempegøy.  Anbefales på det varmeste.

reviews.title: Bra underholdning
reviews.text: Var ein gjeng på 10 stykker som blei delt opp i 2 grupper og konkurrere mot kvarandre. Veldigt bra opplegg og veldig bra underholdning.

reviews.title: Resepsjonen gjengen, 2 stk på 22-43 år
reviews.text: Utrolig artig og spennende opplevelse for en gjeng på 22-43 år. Hadde det kjempekjekt hele gjengen. Tusen takk for gavekortet Escape Hunt😊

reviews.title: Vennegjeng, 4 stykk, alder 19-25år
reviews.text: Likte oss veldig godt! Fint for rullestolbruker å ta seg fram. Vil annbefale å ringe først for å få det største rommet.

reviews.title: Innbrudd i Norges Bank
reviews.text: Morsomt og underholdende. Vi var ca 30 sek fra å klare det. Gjør det gjerne igjen. Sentral beliggenhet gjør at det enkelt kan kombineres med andre aktiviteter

reviews.title: Moro, moro
reviews.text:
Familietur, med barn i alder 11-17. Veldig moro og kjekt å oppleve sammen. Vi valgte "Flukten fra Akershus". Det var gode oppgaver, gode muligheter for samarbeid, og mye adrenalin. Anbefales for familier som har barn som liker litt gåter. Aldersspenn gav fordel i møte med utfordringene. 
Dette var vårt første besøk i et Escaperoom så vanskelig å vurdere både oppgaver, vanskelighetsgrad og design opp mot tilsvarende rom. Lander derfor på en 4-er for å ha noe å gå på. :)

reviews.title: Innbruddet i Norges Bank.
reviews.text:
Innbruddet i Norges Bank, 3 personer. 

+ Hyggelige ansatte og fine lokaler 
  med mulighet til å låse inn 
  verdisaker.

- Har man vært på Escape Room i 
  Bergen/Norge før, så er det ikke 
  noe som skiller seg ut i forhold 
  til konkurrentenes tilbud. 

- Rommet manglet en ledetråd. Når man 
  betaler nesten 400kr så forventer 
  man at ting er på stell. Kom oss ut 
  innenfor tidsgrensen, men et klart 
  irritasjonsmoment.

reviews.title: Kjempe gøy!
reviews.text: Her får du testet logikk og samarbeid under tidspress. Vi var på Flukten fra Akershus festning og kom ut på 47 min. Kjempe gøy. Anbefales.

reviews.title: Anbefales!
reviews.text: Vi var en voksen gruppe på 3, som valgte Akershus-spillet. Bra laget, med lydeffekter og spennende rom. Man kjenner helt klart adrenalinet på slutten, når klokken tikker og tyskerne står på døren. Kjempekult!

reviews.title: Sykt gøy og spennende!
reviews.text: Veldig vellaget og gjennomført spill/bane (Akershus festning)! Vi var 2 stk og hadde det kjempe kjekt! Anbefales!

reviews.title: Sykt gøy!!
reviews.text: Jeg har spilt både Norges Bank og Akershus Festning, og jeg må si at jeg var mektig imponert! Rommene var spennende og relativt vanskelige, alt man vil ha fra ett Escape room!

reviews.title: Gode konsept, noen tekniske feil, kanskje litt for lett?
reviews.text:
Vi valgte «bankran» rommet.
Her er det visst bare 40% som klarer gåtene/«fullfører». 
Vi opplevde to tekniske feil som førte til et noe lettere løp, men ellers gode gåter.

«Ut fra Akershus festning» skal visst være noe vanskeligere ifølge verten.

reviews.title: Ginial is Quite the Genial Bar
reviews.text:
This great bar is attached to an equally great and popular restaurant,  RoykBBQ.

It offers a dozen draught beers and 2 dozen or more in bottles and cans, but the major attraction is their large list of gin based cocktails.  Choosing from a wall of gins from all parts of the world, you can get any cocktail you want or choose from a bunch you have never imagined.

I even tried to confuse them by asking for a Sazerac cocktail when I saw that there was a bottle of Sazerac Rye on the wall.  The bartender did have to look it up, but did a good job on this New Orleans favourite. 

Great drinks, friendly service made for a very enjoyable evening out with friends.

Very highly recommended.

reviews.title: Gode drinker
reviews.text: Var ute med kollegaer og skulle ha noe drikke før maten. Når vi kom var det 1 hyggelig dame bak baren og hun fikk hjelp av en bartender som ikke var på jobb. Veldig bra at han kunne hjelpe siden hun var usikker på drinker. Men, når han gikk ble hun stående igjen med alle oss og andre gjester som kom til både bar og restaurant. Det ble da vanskelig å få servering og vi ble stående lenge å vente, det ødelagte litt for den hyggelige opplevelsen. Håper de ikke lar 1 person være alene på jobb flere ganger, spesielt nå i julebord sesong.

reviews.title: Nyte en gin
reviews.text: Denne baren er perfekt for å nyte et bredt utvalg av kvalitetsgin. Det har noe for hver sin smak! Øl av god kvalitet, men definitivt gin som hovedfokus. Man får valuta for pengene.

reviews.title: Under middels
reviews.text:
Vært der et par ganger 
Utvannet martini hver gang. 
For dårlig for en plass som markedsfører seg som en gin- plass. En martini bør kunne lages med bind for øynene.
Ellers helt ok utvalg av gin, men det er vel det.

reviews.title: Wow what a place
reviews.text:
Du går inn og 5 min så føler du at du er bestis med alle som jobber der, ny opplevelse absolutt. 
Bartendere er av den ordentlig typen som sørger for spennede drinker med gin og hyggelig stemming utover kvelden 
Her MÅ du innom og opplevele

name: Bergen Hammam
description: Please note that we can open anytime if you make a reservation. All info is to be found on the website NB! Saturdays 12-16 are Ladies Only! All other days are mixed. Cash/VIPPS only!

photo.caption: "Fra fjord til munn" – the concept of fjord cuisines

reviews.title: Three hours of stunning scenery
reviews.text:
This Fjord Cruise departs twice a day, even in winter, and is well worth the trip. Friendly staff and recorded commentary ( that is not intrusive) enhance the natural beauty of the scenery that unfolds as the cruiser speeds ( and sometimes slows down in the narrows) through the fjords outside Bergen. There is a sun deck and, downstairs, passengers sit in warm comfort. There is an on board kiosk for snacks and even a beer for those so inclined. 
We were fortunate in that we went on the 10 am cruise and had good weather, before the Ellet and rain set in. I recommend you take the opportunity if the weather is fine and don’t put it off.

reviews.title: Fjord cruise Bergen - Mostraumen
reviews.text: Nice three hour cruise to Mostraumen with beautiful scenery; however, unsure of value for price ($49).  Very convenient departure from fish market in Bergen. Recommend if time is limited; otherwise, recommend 11-hour Hardangerfjord in a nutshell tour.

name: Bowling 1 Vestkanten
description: Bowling 1 Vestkanten has 18 Brunswick lanes, several arcade machines and a varied food and drinks meny including pizza, hamburgers and lots more. We are located at Vannkanten just 8 minutes from Bergen.

reviews.title: Expensive fun.
reviews.text: The bowling itself was great. The place also had arcade games, plus there was a 5D cinema and minigolf close by. Bowling was fun and the place offers both beverages and food plus the pizza restaurant upstairs offers delivery. However this place is rather expensive at 86 nok per person per game, and two bottles of coke cost almost as much at over 35 nok per bottle. They offered free water, but it was lukewarm at a hot summer day, so not very enjoyable. All in all though, it was a fun time and we will be back (partly due to few other bowling places in Bergen, partly because of good service).

name: Elmoving Segway Bergen
description: Our tours begins from our location at Nøstegaten 41. From there we take you around to the splendid sights that Bergen has to offer, including the UNESCO sight "Bryggen". You will find our mobile unit right on "Bryggen" next to Bergenhus, and we will offer you an excellent way to do sightseeing. Segway is easy to learn and fun to ride!

name: USF Arts Center (Verftet)

photo.caption:
The venue has its own bar and restaurant with a large space for outdoor seating

Photo by Agnieszka Iwanska - Aga Visuals

description: USF Verftet is a major co-location and cluster for art, film and music and creative enterprises in Bergen and Norway, with five venues for presentation of music, theatre, films and contemporary art. It is the one of the biggest cultural arenas in Bergen with the best location, located at Georgernes Verft by the seaside in central Bergen. USF aim to collaborate, strengthen and participate in the development of cultural matters and the creative industry in Bergen.

photo.caption: 來到卑爾根 主菜當然是鮭魚

reviews.title: What a surprise!
reviews.text:
It is one of the best whisky list I have seen in years: there are some forgotten labels still available in a perfectly matched room. The staff gets a bit confused when you ask for something peculiar, but they were very helpful and were very keen to accommodate my requests (a Lowland malt triple casket and a Port Helen). 
Definitely recommended.

name: Bergen Guide Service
description: Bergen Guide Service has 80 authorised Bergen Guides at disposal who together cover more than 20 languages. Walking tours, city sightseeing, day-trips, teambuilding? Just contact us.

reviews.title: Bergen walking tour
reviews.text: Our guide, Urte, was prompt, knowledgeable, and well versed in all things Bergen.  We immensely enjoyed the 3-hour walking tour.  Tickets for the funicular were included in the price; by afternoon the lines were exceedingly long.  She recommended that we wait until after the cruise and tour company passengers departed before we attempt the ride up to enjoy the view and she was so right!  The views in the evening are wonderful. She also recommended a great restaurant.  I would highly recommend a walking tour with this company.

reviews.title: Private guide service
reviews.text:
Our party of four senior travelers (one in a wheelchair) enjoyed our experience with the guide service.  The service provided us with a very knowledgeable and considerate personal guide, and also contracted a van for transportation to the many sights that Bergen has to offer.  There were four cruise ships in town on our day, and the guide used her experience to help us navigate the city and avoid long lines at some of the sights.
While some reviewers felt that the service was a bit pricey, we were not uncomfortable considering the we also had to pay for a car and driver.

name: CitySightseeing Bergen
description: The hop on, hop off sightseeing bus takes you around Bergen passing many famous attractions and places to visit, including; Bryggen, The Fish Market, Bergen Aquarium, Bergen Museum, The Grieg Hall, The Fløibanen Funicular, St. Mary's Church, Old Bergen Musum and many others. Explore Bergen at your own pace. Simply hop off at any of the stops.Our tour provides local information by ear phones, and you can choose from the following languages: Norwegian, English, Spanish, French, German, Russian Italian and Japanese.

offer_list.title: City Sightseeing Bergen Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

reviews.title: Poorly Managed.
reviews.text: I would not recommend this garbage tour for anything. The day I used it, the company decided to change one of the stop locations without telling anyone. I waited for an hour before going back to where I bought the ticket. No refunds either

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: Cost about £42 for two with head phones for the 1 hour journeymost attractions are within walking distance from the cruise port. Busses every half hour once you have taken this trip you certainly can walk back to cruise terminal, overall it’s good to get your bearings

reviews.title: As expected
reviews.text: We always do this Hop On Hop Off Bus when visiting a place for the first time. It gives you an overview of where you might want to spend your time. This tour was about 50 minutes. Commentary was hard to hear at times. You can basically walk to many points of interest from the cruise ship port but it is pleasant to sit and be chauffeured around.

reviews.title: Not Worth the Money - WiFi an Issue
reviews.text: The major stops are near the cruise terminals and can be easily reached by foot.  We were assumed that their WiFi worked but it did not.  The password noted on the bus was wrong and not told the correct password until our return.  Also good WiFi located at visitors center.  Staff at port rude and very unfriendly.  Bus driver pretended ignorance about WiFi.  We rode several buses in the Baltic but this was the worst.

reviews.title: Hop on. Hop off
reviews.text:
Hop on - hop off bus tour Bergen Norway 
50 minutes complete city tour
Best way to see city faster ;)  Departure every 30 minutes every day from9 am to 4 pm

reviews.title: Just do not do it
reviews.text:
After a nice trip on Hurtigruten, we thought a two hours city trip - 590 Kr per person - around Bergen ending at our hotel near the train station would be a good idea with all the luggage.
After endless time of waiting the microphone still did not work and 19 of us changed to an other bus for 47 people. Meanwhile it was almost dark and we started listening to all the ehms and ahms and a view facts. The bus moved into a small road showing a sign for max. 12m. Construction work made the road even narrower and to reverse back out was the only option. An other 30 minutes. A 25 minute stop for sights in pouring rain at Bryggen made us leave the bus and catch a taxi for 184Kr.

reviews.title: If you do not want to walk, good way to see city
reviews.text: The hop on hop off runs during tourist season. My wife and I enjoy taking a loop checking out what is what and then making our decisions. One loop is supposed to take 45 minutes with buses running every 30 minutes. We departed our cruise ship (NCL Jade) and along with a quite a few other people sought out the bus. The bus was parked just down from where the ship docked. The first bus filled up right away and another bus pulled right up. We save time by already having purchased the tickets, so it was quick to get on. The most popular stop it would seem it is the Mt. Floyen Funicular. We actually walked back (downhill) from this stop and we were fine.

reviews.title: A great way to see Bergen
reviews.text:
Date of Visit:  Friday, Aug 31st, 2018 

We take the City Sightseeing worldwide hop on hop off bus tours in MANY cities we visit across the globe, and for the most Part I am a huge fan. I recommend it all the time when you have limited time to spend in a city.  We often only have 48 hour itineraries (or less) in many cities and it is a great way to see a city and get an overview of what it has to offer. You can then get out at the spots that are of interest, you learn a little about the different stops, and the city you are visiting. 

If you plan on taking one of these Hp on / Hop off bus rides in multiple cities during your vacation - save your receipt - they give you a discount for multiples. 
We took this in Bergen because we were with someone with slight mobility issues, and Bergen was a desitination of great sentimental value to her. So we wanted to see as much as possible. However, if we were alone - we would have just walked around.
I didnt get a lot of value in this trip that I couldnt have done walking. 

If you are a good walker - I suggest a self guided walking tour of Bergen - if you have any mobility issues - the bus is the way to go.

The bus is double decker - and the top floor is great for people who want to get photos that are not through a window - if you sit on the top - please note that it is either open air - or the windows will be opened by other passengers. This is very common - so people can get their photos. DO NOT come to the top level and start closing windows or complaining it is too cold - that is what the lower level is for. 

The Cost of the Bus is about $50 USD per person. This is a very common price - mostly because it is the same company in many many cities. 

As I reviewed on other city Sightseeing buses - They advertise "free WiFi" on the bus, at each seat, on the brochures, and even in the advertising of the voice guided tour.  
However - this is such a joke. I have never had reliable wifi on any of these buses. 
It sometimes logs in /connects, but it is so spotty, sketchy and unreliable - I wouldn't even waste your time trying. It is so frustrating. 

The Seats are adequately comfortable - they do not make them more comfortable because they expect you will get up an Hop off periodically. 

The ear plugs - wow - the cheapest things ever - they hurt. A Lot. 

This is one city where I would recommend NOT taking the Hop On Hop Off if you have the ability to walk around.

reviews.title: A waste of money
reviews.text: Expensive trip- over £100 for the four of us which wasn't very long as Bergen is not a particularly big city. I would not recommend it. The highlights in Bergen are the harbour area and the view from the top of the funicular railway which can all be done independently.

reviews.title: Don’t bother
reviews.text: What a waste of £30. Seriously just use google and walk around as Bergen isn’t that big. Poor commentary and buses not that clean. If you need to use a bus use the other tour company in blue buses. Don’t waste your money on City Sightseeing (Red buses)

reviews.title: Great inexpensive way to see and learn about the city
reviews.text: We try to take the Hop on/Hop Off buses everytime we can.  It provides an overview of the city, shows places of interest, locates restaurants, and provides inexpensive transportation.  Bergen was another of those cities that off this great service.  Buses have earphones and offer information in many different languages.  This faclitates our plans for seeing the things that are important to us and provides reliable transportation

reviews.title: Worth taking when time is short
reviews.text: We took this bus tour despite having read comments that one could easily see the same sights on foot.  We could not have!  The bus scaled narrow, mountainous roads, past old wood-framed houses, showing views better seen from a higher angle.  It was not a long trip but very pleasant and worthwhile.

name: Kjerstis hudpleie
description: This is a Beauty Salon in the centre of Bergen, with professional therapists who take the profession seriously. We offer high quality treatments with products as Dermalogica, Academie, Aesthetic line, Glo Minerals and Skin Tech. We also offer waxing, massages, manicure, pedicure, brows and lashes.

photo.caption: One of many cool lamps in this bar

reviews.title: Quirky Bergen bar
reviews.text: Found this place walking through Bergen. Great vibe and Norwegian beers available. Full of unusual lamps and the owner was happy to explain the origins of his collection.

reviews.title: Great bar off the beaten path
reviews.text: Quiet little bar with cool decor and good drinks. Great to stop in for a beer between all that Bergen has to offer

reviews.title: Very cool bar
reviews.text: Just a 5 minute walk away from the touist grid, you'll  fint this bar. Great service and cool interior......this place looks like one the coolest "indie-places" to visit in Bergen.

reviews.title: Just a great neighborhood bar
reviews.text: Just a great neighborhood bar with good service.  Cool design with focus on vintage lamps. And solid beer selection

name: Bergen Boblefotball
description: Play Bubblesoccer in Bergen! This is the perfect activity for both children and grown-ups! Welcome!!

name: Hyperklikk Studio
description: Record your own music video or your own action video with lots of special effects in our greenscreen studio. Or record some songs in our sound studio. Are you ready for a new experience? Hyperklikk got banquet facilities, lobby, stage, dancefloor and a bar. We are most famous for our fun greenscreen musicvideos and karaoke in our recording studio. Come and visit us for loads of fun and a good memories. We can take pictures in our photostudio, record music video with costumes in our videostudio - or just record some classics in our music studio.

photo.caption: The fasade of our shop in Lille Øvregaten 12, Bergen.

reviews.title: Excellent !!!
reviews.text: A nice small store where you can buy original art and illustrations and chat with the artists themselves. Everything from stickers and pins to cards and posters. Very inspirational and fun. The staff is very friendly and accomondating. :-)

name: Oleana A/S

photo.caption: At Oleana, we invite you to an eventful journey through the factory following the production process from yarn to finished product.

description: At Oleana, we invite you to an eventful journey through the factory following the production process from yarn to finished product. Our commitment to quality and authenticity have earned us status as an Economusee. That means our production is open for visits. Guided tours are given for groups by appointment. Our factory shop is an opportunity to buy from our current and past collections.
address: Ivar Aasgaards veg 1 Ytre Arna, Bergen 5265 Norway

name: Ole Bull Scene
address: Ovre Ole Bulls Plass 3, Bergen 5012 Norway

reviews.title: Konsert
reviews.text: Var her på konsert, helt greit lokale, men utrolig varmt. Lite «intimt» lokale. Helt greit utvalg i baren.

reviews.title: Kulturhus
reviews.text: Ole Bull-huset i Bergen er et unikt kulturhus. Restaurant i første med ypperlig mat. Stor teaterscene med landets aller beste skuespillere på scenen til enhver tid. Liten scene i kjelleren med foredrag og jazz, og andre aktiviteter. Bar og stor uteterrasse i andre etasje. Liten scene der også. Og snart bygges det en ny stor takterrasse.

reviews.title: show
reviews.text: Var på Herodes Falsk show her, veldig bra lokale intimt og varmt, rask service i barene ryddige toaletter og ikke minst veldig god service  fra en kom inn til en gikk.

reviews.title: Middels show. Flott sted
reviews.text: Johan Golden på Ole Bull Scene var helt ok. Effektiv servering i baren. Litt kjedelig utvalg av øl på fat.

photo.caption: Enkle og greie klatrestativer og seilbaner

name: Gulating Olutsalg avd. Vestkanten
description: One of Norway's largest bottle stores with roughly 450 types of beer from Norway and the rest of the world. The bottles are sorted and categorized after the style of beer.

name: Friluftsglede As
ranking_subcategory: #10 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #10 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #10 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen

name: Rush Bergen
description: In our park, you can practice jumps and tricks, throw yourself into foam pits from high towers, play basketball or dodgeball on trampolines and fight as a gladiator. You can challenge yourself i Bergens coolest Rubiks Cube and compete against others in Survivor. This park is a challenge for everyone, no matter what age or skill level. The park has its own cafe with a great view of the park.

reviews.title: Får barn i bevegelse
reviews.text:
Våre barn (9 og 7) var begeistret. Vi var der to ganger for hver en time. Jeg hadde ikke anbefalt å være der så mye lengre om gangen, barna svettet veldig og var ganske slitne etter det.
Det kunne ha vært litt bedre muligheter til å sette seg ned for foreldre/følge. Å sitte der med en baby på fanget i en time var ikke særlig komfortabelt.

reviews.title: Sånn passe gøy!
reviews.text: Vi bestilte 2 timer hopping. Det var altfor lenge. Det er en liten trampolinepark og en går fort lei. 1,5 time hopping er mer enn nok. Men alt var rent og pent og nytt. Hyggelig betjening.

reviews.title: Gøyt men dyrt
reviews.text:
Veldig kjelt og stilig konsept som endelig er komt til Bergen. Litt skuffende at det ikke er flere storetrampoliner og altfor mange regler som fører til at man ikke kan utfordre seg selv.

Stiv pris, men ellers verdt besøket.

name: Bergen Free Guided Tours
description: Welcome to Bergen! Bergen Free Guided Tours presents you Nicholas and Viljar, two local guides who would love to show you their beautiful city! The tour is free of charge - we don´t want your money unless we provide value! Tips is appreciated both by us and UNICEF which we give 10 % of our earnings. Let´s explore the city together! Practical information: The tour can be experienced between 10th of June and 7th of August this summer. We do tours four times a day: 09:00, 11:00, 13:00 and 15:00. Maintaining high quality tours for all our participants are our main priority. Due to this the tours are limited to a certain number of people. Private tours can be arranged on request. Reservation for the tour can be done by sending an email to bergenfgt@gmail. com with your preferred time and date, name and number of participants. The tours are done in English.

address_obj.street2: front of Bryggen just by Radisson Blu Royal Hotel

address: Dreggsallmenningen front of Bryggen just by Radisson Blu Royal Hotel, Bergen 5003 Norway

reviews.title: Free walking tours of Bergen
reviews.text: Website said there were free guided tours of Bergen and told you where to meet. Got to meeting spot and there was no one there and no one had any idea about any free walking tours in Bergen. We even asked at the Tourist information. Disappointed l

reviews.title: No response to email for tour
reviews.text:
It looks like the overtly aggressive email filter is active again, as I received no response to my email. My email provider didn't indicate a bounce-back!
Hopefully this can be sorted out soon.

reviews.title: good drinks look for espen
reviews.text: had a lovly time here when i was visiting for the week . great location and always livly and fun .they have cool promotions and are walking distance from the train stop

name: Landmark Bar & Kafe
address: Rasmus Meyers alle 5 Inside Bergen Kunsthall, Bergen 5015 Norway

reviews.title: Cultural pause
reviews.text: Want a break during your KODE day visit ? Search no more, this is the place. Calm, smooth music, welcoming staff, small menu but warmly served, tons of infos on cultural events in the surroundings ... definitely a good place to have a pause. Perfect to have rest and get ready for another round of exhibitions !

reviews.title: Nice Cafe and Helpful Staff
reviews.text: We went to this cafe twice on our weekend visit to Bergen, both times for a beer and a snack.  The barman was very helpful when I said I had a nut allergy, and even phoned the baker to check that the croissants would be ok!  Nice location overlooking the lake and very relaxed atmosphere.

reviews.title: Cafe bistro - not a night club
reviews.text: This place has a relaxed studentship vibe.  The menu was reasonably priced.  The do dishes of the day; we had fish of the day (hake in a herby broth) and meat (beef brisket braised with chanterelles), plus some bread and drinks for less than 400 NOK.  The food was delicious and the service friendly.  The mains are 138 NOK each and you can help yourself to water, so it is a bargain.

photo.caption: Koselig rimelig plass med gratis wifi

reviews.title: Spot on
reviews.text:
