A bit hidden away this place caters mainly to students but is also popular amongst other clientel. Drinks are very affordable, the place is cozy with dimmed lighting. 
Definitely worth a visit without breaking your wallet on a night out. Recommended.

reviews.title: A great little place off the main drag
reviews.text:
We only had a couple of drinks in there and admittedly there was a pub quiz on (Sunday night), but it seemed to have a lot more atmosphere than a couple of other recommended bars.
Had quite a 'young' feel based on the others in there.

name: Vaskeriet
description: Vaskeriet is a playground for those who like cocktails, ping pong or dancing. At daytime we always keep our ping pong tables out for your enjoyment and at nighttime we pull of the most amazing parties with great DJs. We serve our own home made slushes and cocktails made with only proper ingredients; Fresh fruits and such.

reviews.title: Perfect night !
reviews.text: So glad I went to this bar! Bouncers are nice (a bit mischievous, one told me I was almost to old for the venue.. WTF saying that to a girl haha). They are really there to make you feel safe, don't hesitate to throw intoxicated or aggressive people. Barmen and barmaids are efficient and friendly (they even smile!). The DJ is soooo awesome : zero time-out, the playlist does the job : everybody dances! And if you don't want to, you can sit down and chat, plenty of seats to do so. I met some lovely people in this bar too :) To sum up : perfect night for me, thank you!

name: Beffen

photo.caption: Beffen boat to Norwegian Fishermans Museum

ranking_subcategory: #11 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #11 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #11 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen

reviews.title: Historic little ferry
reviews.text: Nice boat trip across Vågen. Perhaps a little expensive and you don't necessarily save that much time compared to walking, but if your feet are starting to get sore or a sudden heavy rainfall is upon you, it is a great choice. The boat itself is a piece of Bergen history that is worth visiting and the service was pretty good. I recommend giving it a try, but at the same time, I am a bit unsure whether I will be aboard this boat again.

reviews.title: Wonderful - a real piece of history. NOT to be missed
reviews.text: This is a simply wonderful little ferry service across the little bay in Bergen. It's not so very easy to find but well worth the effort. I seem to remember the boatman told me that the service is coming up for its 125th anniversary - could be 150th! It's a real piece of history. I think they do tours around the bay but I didn't have enough time. Now that would really be fun!

photo.caption: The pedestrian heart of modern Bergen

reviews.title: A lovely space for all to enjoy
reviews.text:
This square is lined with shops, a huge pedestrian walkway and green space in central Bergen...so something for all.  Go shopping or sit to eat/drink something while people-watching.  There are many pedestrians just strolling around.  Festivals and concerts, even protests are held here.   In the middle of the main square  is a sailor's monument/viking statue...pic attached.  Everything seems to be within walking distance.  There are many side streets filled with lots to see as well...on one I discovered a Gazebo surrounded by beautiful flowers, of course, depending on the season.  There are water fountains filled with children jumping around.  This square basically begins/ends by the Fish market, depending on your perspective.  It is also very close to Floibanen Funicular, which would take you up to Floyen mountain. 

Quite easy to get here from the cruise port, where we disembarked a ship.
Exit port, take a right, pass the sightseeing buses.  There is a signpost which, points the way to the City..."Sentrum."  Once you get to fork in the road, stay to the right and this leads to Fish market, which would be to your right.  To your left, if you go up the street between the two big buildings, the one on your right says: "Ann Madam," you will come to the Floibanen Funicular.   Beautiful ambience!

reviews.title: Large pedestrian zone in the heart of Bergen
reviews.text: This is a lovely pedestrian gathering space in the heart of Bergen. The wide space was originally built as a fire break as Bergen experienced many fires over the years with its many wooden structures. The seafarers (sailors) monument is in Torgallmenningen. The top end of the pedestrian area ends at Ole Bulls Plass, which is a lovely street with a grass lined boulevard and several statues along the way.

name: City Sightseeing Bergen
description: Bergen Hop on Hop Off Open Top Sightseeing Bus Tour

address_obj.street1: Skolten Cruise terminal & Norwegian Fisheries Museum

address: Skolten Cruise terminal & Norwegian Fisheries Museum, Bergen 0978 Norway

reviews.title: Convenient but not always in schedule
reviews.text: We rode the bus to view Bergen. It is a convenient way to see the city and hop off at any site you want to spend some time at. Since we were on a cruise and they have stop #1 as the cruise terminal it was very convenient. It is a typical bus with ear buds they supply to listen to the taped city information. On this day there were 4 cruise ships in port. But I only saw 3 buses being used on their app. This caused us to wait about 45 minutes for the next bus at one stop. With a route of only 60 minutes I would have thought they could have kept to their 30 minute schedule.

reviews.title: Don’t buy advance tickets for tape recorded guide
reviews.text: This tour takes you to all the sights in Bergen so in that sense it’s good. We were really disappointed that the tour was a recorded voice and not a real tour guide. We have been on a number of these type of tours in the past and this was the first time it was a recording. In addition we had to wait about 30 mins for the bus near the fish market and in that same time we saw 3 buses going the other direction. It seemed like a long wait. My biggest feedback is to tell travellers not to buy advance tickets. They say you’ll get 10% off so it entices you to buy early to save money. When we got there the tickets were 50% off and we still had to wait in line with everyone else from the cruise ship to change our online ticket to the ticket they needed. We felt ripped off.

reviews.title: Hop On Hop Off
reviews.text:
The HoHo stops are very conveniently situated around the city allowing easy access to the major atractions. There are several companies running these and prices do vary so check out the costs actually with the tour operators rather than at the tourist information. We found that the double decker route was offring all fares for childrens' prices which turned out to be over 100NOR cheaper than the rivals. 

Tickets are valid for 24 hours from purchase which is helpful if you are staying in the city. The cruise ship terminal is only visited when there are ships in.

The socket for the headphones for my pre-recorded information was not working but that was not too much of a loss.

If you have the time this is well worth sitting down for an hour and doing the circuit to orientate yourself.

reviews.title: Beautiful historic city and waterfront
reviews.text: We took a hop on/off bus to see the city and decide where we wanted to spend out time.  The waterfront harbor had many wonderful restaurants and outdoor market.  The old historic port area and restaurants are all within walking distance to each other and make enjoying this wonderful city easy.  Fresh seafood is plentiful.

name: Bergen Fjordtours as
description:
Nearly 20 years experience with fjord cruise and fishing trips.
We do private and regulare combined fjord cruise and fishing trips.
We offer a lot of different boats. From the lowest price to the more expenzive luxury yachts.
Our area is the whole vest Norway with Bergen as main base.
We pick you up wherever you like.
See our web site.www.bergenfjordtours.no AREAS and OUR BOATS

offer_list.title: Private fjord cruise and fishing trips

name: WellMed
description: WellMed is a wellness and beauty clinic located in the heart of Asane, one of the biggest areas in Bergen. Clinic is operated by professional therapists offering a variety of massages, face and body treatments, waxing as well as luxury manicures and pedicures. Our everyday goal is to provide high customer satisfaction by rendering excellent service and quality products. Welcome!

name: VRmax
description: Vrmax is a place where you can enjoy virtual reality. We have a wide range of experiences and games, for both single and multiplayers. Enjoy a few hours of fun with friends or family.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text: So many games, so much fun! Tre people can play together. VR-masks connected to PCs. Hard to make the kids stop playing!

reviews.title: Super gøy
reviews.text: Utrolig gøy, mange spill å velge mellom for både store og små. Bør prøves. Selv om lokalet er lite så er VR verdenen stor så det var ingen problem.

name: Slit 'an! Vintage
description: Vintage and retro store run by top model Enok Groven.

reviews.title: Awesome Vintage Clothing & Accessorize
reviews.text:
I adore this shop. 

The venue is rather small, which gives it the "hygge" touch. Anyhow, the well picked selection is pretty big I'd say. Clothes are hanging from corner to corner, and from era to era. In "Slit'an! Vintage" you can get fancy little purses from the 20s, a cool suit from the 60s, an elegant blouse from the 50s or just generally cool clothes from the 80s +++. 

Enok, the owner is super nice, and not to mention helpful. He has a lot of experience from the fashion industry and will gladly help you find your way through this big little shop.

reviews.title: Inspirerende!
reviews.text: Bergens koseligste lille vintage butikk. Mye spennende å se på fra tak til gulv. God service. Vel verdt turen innom for alle vintage interesserte og de som vil kjøpe brukt!

name: Per Vigeland
description: Per Vigeland is a jewellery artist from Bergen, Norway. All the jewelries are handcrafted locally inside the studio store. The prices are from 280 Nok/30 euros and we have a tax free shopping@ Welcome to visit us!

reviews.title: Excellent , nice artwork
reviews.text: Nice staff , nice shop owner, great artwork , beautiful jewellery, excellent shopping in the shop, peaceful environment

name: Northern Exposure AS
ranking_subcategory: #12 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
subcategory_ranking: #12 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
ranking: #12 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Bergen
description: We are a Norwegian specialist in outdoor adventures with a natural and cultural twist. Our adventures include kayaking, coasteering, ski kite and mountain adventures. Our speciality is custom adventures, but we also do shorter length trips. Trips for any ability and ages down to 7 years old.

name: Fjordrive AS

photo.caption: Beatefuel day at the top of Stegastein

description: Guided Fjord Tour to Nærøyfjorden, Flam and Stegastein. Also including two hours cruice on the fjord. Is there anything more enchanting than the breathtaking beauty of Norwegian nature, fjords, waterfalls and mountains? On this round with Fordrive AS, you can experience this amazing scenery first hand on a private road trip, including a two hour cruice on the Nærøyfjord. The tour starts by mini bus at the Tourist Information in Bergen, before heading east, where our first sightseeing stop will be at the magnificent waterfall, Tvindefossen. The tour continues towards Gudvangen, where we will drive down the amazing Stalheimskleiva. This is one of Northern Europe’s steepest road sections and has a fantastic view down towards the Nærøyfjord. We will then arrive at Gudvangen, where we will board the electric cruise, and arrive at Flam two hours later. We will then head to Aurland, and up to Stegastein. Stegastein has a unique and spectacular viewing platform that hangs 30 meters out!

reviews.title: Fjord tour to Nærøyfjorden, Flåm and Stegastein viewpoint
reviews.text:
This tour is great, a lovely guide, with lots of local knowledge, who obviously loves his job! The tour was well thought out, with just enough of time at each stop.

The tour took in spectacular scenery along steep winding roads, not just the quick way through all the tunnels and the view from Stegastein was awe inspiring!

The air conditioned mini bus during a heatwave was really appreciated.

The Fjord cruise boat was breathtaking, on the "Future of the Fjords" boat which, being fully electric made the journey beautifully serene.

Overall, a wonderful, personal tour, supporting a local small business. We would highly recommend this, a day well spent!

reviews.title: Excellent small group tour!
reviews.text: The Nærøyfjorden, Flam and Stegastein tour is absolutely breathtaking. We were looking for a day trip with a pace that was less frantic than the Norway in a Nutshell ones and found this. The groups are limited to 15 people which is the best size in my opinion, and Geir, our guide, runs his tours like clockwork. Everything went smoothly, the cruise is a highlight of the day and the landscapes alone are bigger than nature and well worth the price. The mix of road travel and cruise is great. A little more stories/facts on the region while on the road would be a nice addition I think but other than that it’s a perfect score for me. I’m surprised there isn’t more reviews on this little company because it’s a gem.

name: The Spy Game

photo.caption: Secrets being shared between the players...

description: The year is 1950. The tension of the Cold War is escalating. One wrong move could result in nuclear war - but something is amiss. Follow the trail while it’s still hot - and a spy you shall become. Are you able to keep the bartender distracted – while your fellow spies search the premises? Or to convince the enemy that you’re one of them? Take the challenge. You don’t play the game. You live it.

description: Fine large store for Scandinavian arts&crafts in the heart of Bergen, run by the Hjertholm family for 3.generations. Wide selection of handmade ceramic, studio glas, jewellery, textile, wood and metal crafts, all directly from more than 100 scandinavian small workshops. The best place to look for something unique and special. A dedicated staff will welcome you!

name: Norway To Run
description: Add some dirt to your trip to Norway! Norway To Run is running tours around the most iconic places in the Bergen area. Tour distances are between 10km and 35km. Terrain can vary from easy gravel to steep ascents depending on the tour. Our goal is for you to experience the true beauty of the Norwegian wilderness! Majestic fjords, snowy mountains... it's all there! Pick a tour and run with it!

reviews.title: A Walk around Bergen
reviews.text:
Nothing beats a well organised, scenic photo tour of a foreign city. Especially if I don't have time to research the city properly on my own or beforehand, it is worth my coin to book a photo tour to get the opportunity to take photographs as well as learn some historic facts about the place I'm visiting - be it for a few days or a week or even longer. Bergen Photo Walks's Iain is a knowledgable, witty and entertaining guide who took us on a discovery of this beautiful place buried amongst the fjords and mountains. 

At first glance it feels and looks like any Scandinavian city usually does - wooden buildings, scenic waterfronts, mountain backdrops... Bergen is so much more as we discovered on our tour. 

Expect the weather to range from cold to warm, dry to wet and windy. Come properly prepared to do this walk with your camera and umbrella. Dress in layers is my best advice to anyone thinking of walking through Bergen. Wear comfortable shoes, because the terrain is not always tourist friendly.

I've never been to Bergen before and Iain took us to some great spots for photographs, some off the beaten track as well as the more famous places. It helps that he is a keen photographer as well and he could assist with some of us not sure of ourselves. 

We also went to Mount Fløyen and walked down through the beautiful forest. Along the way Iain suggested various shots as well as giving us some background information and history of the places we visited. He was patient in answering our questions about Bergen and Norway, and with a witty remark here and there he kept our spirits high even if the walk became a bit stiff for some.

I include some of my photographs taken on this very memorable tour.

Thank you again, Iain, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend other tourists to contact you for their quick lesson in Norskie ;)

reviews.title: Norway Trip
reviews.text: Scandinavian Global Tours did an excellent Job in arranging this trip. Jose was very helpful and was following up regularly to ensure that the trip was progressing as planned. Starting with an Airport pickup in Oslo Airport and arranging a trip by road from Bergen to Geiranger all plans were executed well. We had a diversion for glacier viewing along the way to Geiranger. Jose arranged for a guide in Bergen and also got us a hotel accommodations in downtown Bergen as short notice. One of our rooms also was upgraded. Overall a very satisfactory trip and I would highly recommend using Scandinavian Global Tours.

reviews.title: Trip to Kerala, houseboat tour arranged by Scandinivian Global Tours
reviews.text:
We were in Kerala for a family gathering and I contacted John at Scandinavian Tours for a Trip to the backwaters. At short notice (John & Jose from SGT) they managed to make a program for us which accommodated our wishes and exceeding our expectations. They have personally arranged the houseboat which was of a superior standard and best service. Delicious food. A perfect trip, unforgettable experience for us and Scandinavian Global Tours has a big part in it. 
We highly recommend and will use their services in the future.

 They have also arranged a tour of Kerala for my brother- in -law & wife from Canada who was visiting India for first time. They thoroughly enjoyed the tour and were very impressed.

The service is still impeccable.

reviews.title: Great experience!
reviews.text: Sue met us in front of the tourist office (but will meet at hotel or other meeting place, too) and we walked a few steps to the fish market.  She explained how Bergen had been built on the fish business and how the market had changed over the years.  We then were given several different kinds of salmon to taste.  From there we walked to a "local's" restaurant and sampled some fish soup, fish cake and some salads.  Next stop was a hot dog stand for a reindeer hot dog with lingonberry jam.  I'm not a fan of hot dogs, but this was good!  Our last stop was at a bakery in the Bryggen area.  We were stuffed when we were done and had a good idea of Norwegian and Bergen foods and the city.

While enjoying good cocktails, quality coffee or handmade beer.

reviews.title: Godt utvalg, god smak
reviews.text: Henrik øl & vinstue er en rolig, behagelig og avslappende pub. Ikke ungdommelig mas. Ingen musikk. Rolig og voksent. Slappe av, nyte en god øl eller to. Knallbra utvalg. Hyggelig og kunnskapsrik betjening. God atmosfære.

name: Klubb KOK
description: You'll be surprised to find a club like Klubb KOK in a far away place like Bergen, but once you get to know the city, and it's vibrant music scene, the surprise just might wear of. Klubb KOK (pronounced with a long 'O', like in 'COOL') was named Bergen's Night Club Venue of the year in 2014, after only six months of operation. We are a leading supplier of high-quality cultural experiences, and have made a mark with quality events that usually fall under the genres of hip hop and house. We also arrange revolving art exhibitions, thus working closely with both the local music and art scene. We are open Tuesdays, Fridays and Saturdays - every week. Tuesdays we have the concept of "Tirsdagsterapi", or "Tuesday Therapy" in English, which opens at 21:00. We make the club smaller, cozier and more intimate. These evenings have become popular among young, creative people, and you meet a varied and interesting clientele. Fridays we open at 23:00 and we often start the weekend with a concert or a DJ-based club concept. Saturday is the great Party Day. We open at 22:30, and local, national and international DJs of world class standard play the best rhythmic dance music from genres such as hip hop, house, afrobeat, grime, bass, two step and the like. Klubb KOK are open to 03:30 in the morning all regular opening days. We have, among others, arranged concerts by artists such as: - Lars Vaular (NO) - Stormzy (UK) - Emil Stabil (DK) - Finnebassen (NO) - Gilli (DK) - Sebastian Ingrosso (SE) - D Double E (UK) - A-laget (NO) - Axel Boman (SE) - The Magician (BE) - Chopstick & John Jon (DE) - Daniel Bortz (DE) - General Knas (SE) - Klumben & Raske Penge (DK) - Ralph Myerz (NO) - Store P (NO) - Total Freedom (US) - Drippin (NO) - Lord Sivas (DK) - Unge Ferrari (NO) - Arif (NO) - Joddski (NO) - Sinjin Hawke (CA)

reviews.text: Greie rutetider og bussforbindelser i Bergen. Fine busser, men for varme om sommeren. Mange sjåfører er også lite informative. Sannsynligvis pga. språk og mangelfull ruteopplæring.

name: Vestkanten 5d Kino
description: Vestkanten 5d Kino is an amazing attraction for all family members. You can experience a movie here - it is a fascinating mix of 3d cinema together with moving chairs and real effects as wind, water spray and touching. Ride a virtual roller-coaster, fly with a spaceship or go into a scary movie. You will be definitely amazed there!

reviews.title: Super-nette, sehr kompetente Beratung!
reviews.text: Habe mir einen "Festdrakt" machen lassen und bin total begeistert! Ich wurde vor der definitiven Bestellung mehrmals wirklich sehr nett beraten, alle meine Fragen wurden geduldig beantwortet und bei allen Anproben herrschte eine so freundliche Atmosphäre, wie ich es selten erlebt habe. Die zwei Frauen, die mich ausmassen und bedienten hatten wirklich Ahnung von dem was sie sagten und machten und es ging jedes Mal schnell und problemlos. Nicht einmal versuchten sie mir irgend etwas aufzuschwatzen, ich fühlte mich völlig frei und tritzdem gut beraten in all meinen Entscheidungen. Die Tracht werde ich mit Stolz tragen und viel Freude daran haben. Herzlichen Dank!!

reviews.title: A breathtaking place
reviews.text: All of Norway is lovely.  It is amazing to me to see a place like this that began as a fishing village and still holds the beauty of the past.  It is the second largest in Norway with about 260,000 people.   Oslo is the largest

reviews.title: Elendig Tur med Official Tours
reviews.text: Ikke anbefalt å kaste bort pengene på denne måten. Guiden på øret kommer med feilinformasjon om Norge og lite informasjon om stedene vi passerer, eks Nordneset....

name: Wasteland

photo.caption: Lasertag arena with different light and smoke effects

description: Wasteland is an entertainment complex in Bergen city center that offers lasertag for people of all ages. This is a guarantee fun experience is not harmful in any way. For those who haven't played before this is a brief introduction to the game: You will firstly be given a small training and briefing session on the essence of the game. Each player is given a west and a gun that has sensors on it and the objective of the game is to hit these sensors with your gun. Players are divided into two teams that compete against each other and after the game each player and team is given a score in order to determine the winning team and player. Prices start from NOK 90 per person per mission and good discounts are given for multiple missions. We can also offer a pizza and ice cream buffet in addition to a fully licensed bar. If you require additional information please visit our website or contact us by email or phone. We are looking forward to welcoming you to Wasteland! :)

name: Tre 23 Bar
description: We are a Cocktail Bar with a great variety of local and more beers, we serve also wines & Bubbles, non-alcoholic cocktails & Beers. We do serve Bar Snacks, bear in mind we are not a restaurant. Our focus is in Hospitality as our logo says(Pineapple), so YOU are our main focus. Our bartenders are focused to provide you with the best service experience this town can offer in addition to our drinks.

reviews.title: The best Cocktail bar in Norway
reviews.text: Antônio, the owner, is a brasilian guy wich takes care of each bar detail. There are amazing cocktails and the bar atmosphere is unique. If you are in Bergen you should visit and live the experience. Me and my wife recomend strongly. My wife loved the “Bed of roses” and we also had the famous “Maestro” and the refreshing “Italian spritz”. Dont miss!!!

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.text: Was welcomed at the door, drinks were really good, they seemed to care a lot about that. Really fun when late when it got busy. Got to try a lot of interesting stuff I haven't seen before.

reviews.title: Amazing experience
reviews.text: The best bar in town! Tre 23 Bar in Bergen is a top pick option in Bergen by the drinks selection, atmosphere, staff, and location. As a Brazilian person, Antonio knows how to handle with customers from different nationalities and profiles, to prepare really nice drinks, and how to leave bar environment an unforgettable experience for everyone. Definitely, I will come back in this bar.

reviews.title: Ooo...la...la
reviews.text: When I die scatter my ashes in front of the Tre 23 Bar in Bergen. Not only is this perhaps the greatest bar I have ever been to but it certainly has the friendliest bartender I have ever met. And the most knowledgeable when it comes to the art of mixology. My family went in for one drink and we left 5 hours later ...wow! When we left we felt we were already part of the family! HONESTLY THE BEST BAR I HAVE EVER BEEN IN! (And I am 62 years old)!

reviews.title: Unforgettable experience!
reviews.text:
The BEST bar in town! Definitely worth your time and a great evening guaranteed. 

This bar is run by an experienced bartender that not only knows how to make high-quality cocktails, but also how to create an amazing atmosphere for his customers. No other bar in Bergen will make you feel as good as this place does. 

You really are missing out on something good, if you dont experience this place during your time in Bergen.

reviews.title: ... must go when in bergen!!!
reviews.text: .... there is no better cocktail bar in bergen! as we are from chicago and love the innovative cocktail scene we were beyond blown away by TRE 23! ridiculous cocktails, atmosphere and truly a home away from home ... really, we visited every night while in bergen! .... and if that’s not enough the owner antonio welcomed us with a huge smile, wonderful conversation and blew us away by his infectious passion of cocktails and making everyone happy and comfortable who walks in. you don’t get that kind of personal attention and service at most bars and it truly made our experience memorable. when we are in bergen again, no doubt we’ll be there! thank you antonio!!! 🙌🏻

reviews.title: Best bar in town
reviews.text: The place is great, the vibe is excellent and the drinks are the best! You get all fresh ingredients in your drink, either it is with or without alcohol! This place can’t be described, it needs to be tried out :-D

description: Heidi's Bier Bar was started by four friends who got inspiration from a skiing trip. They opened the first Heidi's in Denmark in 2004, and in 2015 they opened in Norway. reviews.title: Fun Bar with Music
reviews.text:
It was a bit of a labyrinth to get into this bar, but once inside, it was really fun. 
Table service in Norway (at Heidi's at least) consists of giant beer towers or shots lined up on skis delivered with sparklers. The prices weren't terrible divided among the table. I think the beer would be a better deal than the shots. The shots seemed like liquer rather than hard alcohol, and were a bit of gamble as to whether you would get one that tasted delicious, rather than medicinal.
The music was great, and everyone was dancing on the tabletops.

name: Fjordcharter Norway
description: Opplev en 3,5 times World Heritage Tour mellom bratte fjell og dype fjorder inn gjennom det gamle vikingland og den berømte tidevannsstrømmen, Mostraumen. Turen går fra Zachariasbryggen, like ved det berømte Fisketorget i Bergen. Videre går vi inn til vakre Modalen, landets nest minste kommune med bare rundt 380 innbyggere før den returnerer til Bergen. På vei ut fra Bergen passerer vi Bryggen som i dag er inkludert i Unesco’s liste over verdens kulturarv, gamle Skuteviken, Sandviken og forbi gamle Bergen. Så på denne turen får en også oppleve Tørrfiskhistorien i Bergen og de unike bygningene. Det er guide med på turen i juni og juli. (etter dette kan det bli endringer). Landskapet inn via det gamle Vikingland til Mostraumen er vilt og vakkert. Enda mer vilt og vakkert blir det etter at vi har gått oppgjennom den berømte tidevannselven Mostraumen der majestetiske fjell stiger bratt opp på begge sider av Mofjorden til ca 1200 moh.

reviews.title: Great cruise to the fjords
reviews.text:
Fjordcharter is a smaller boat than Rodne, but quite comfortable. Most of the seats inside have a table, and when we did it (Sunday on July) if was not packed.
Another difference is that this boat has a live tourist guide, quite knowledgeable of the area. Pay attention on your way in, you can rest in your way back.
The fjords do the rest... they're incredible!!!

name: Fjord Lake Crossing of Norway
description: FJORD LAKE CROSSING OF NORWAY invite you to experience an unforgettable-lifetime journey and discover two of the most beautiful areas of Norway. Telemark with its breath-taking lakes, charming channels, amazing hikes in tall mountains and Viking legacy; and Hardanger Fjord with its dramatic fjord and impressive national parks. The perfect choice for your next active and relaxing holidays.

reviews.title: Fantastic spa
reviews.text:
My partner and me had an amazing and very relaxing time at the Metime Spa. We tried out the infrared sauna and the floating, great experiences ! 
Metime not only provides great treatment for your body and your mind but also has the excellent staff and the beautiful interior. 
We will definitely come back.

reviews.title: Total avkobling
reviews.text:
Dette var virkelig medisin for kropp og sjel, og en total avkobling fra den travle hverdagen. De ansatte var meget profesjonell og behagelig, og lokalene var meget lekre, med en deilig atmosfære. 
Kan virkelig anbefales!

reviews.title: Lin
reviews.text:
Koselig, lite sted med lun og personlig atmosfære. 
God opplæring i både sauna og flytetank. Rent og pent. Jeg kommer tilbake.

name: Guided Fjord Tours - Bergen, Norway
description:
We arrange private guided tours with train, bus, boat and car from Bergen to the fjords in western Norway. 
All our tours are with English speaking local guide. We also arrange daily fishing tours to the beautiful island of Solholmen in Alverstraumen. If there are other places you want to see and be joined by a Norwegian guide, feel free to contact us.

offer_list.title: GUIDED TOUR FROM BERGEN TO SOGNEFJORD AND FLÅM RAILWAY - NORWEGIAN GUIDE
PRIVATE FISHING TOUR TO ALVERSTRAUMEN - NORWEGIAN GUIDE
PRIVATE TOUR FROM BERGEN TO NÆRØYFJORD AND FLÅM RAILWAY - NORWEGIAN GUIDE
DRIVE PORSCHE FROM BERGEN TO HARDANGERFJORD AND VØRINGSFOSS - NORWEGIAN GUIDE
EDVARD GRIEG LUNCH TIME CONSERT AND SIGHTSEEING AT TROLDHAUGEN - PRIVATE TOUR

reviews.title: 美麗的教堂
reviews.text: 桑德維克斯教堂位於卑爾根的桑德維克斯區，那天從卑爾根市區去爬桑德維克斯山石梯的時候，來回都經過這裡，所以特別停下來拍照。

reviews.title: AN UNASSUMING STRUCTURE
reviews.text: The city’s principal Roman Catholic catholic church was locked, an all too familiar state of affairs in Scandinavia [whatever the religion or denomination]. I accordingly could only appreciate the architecture of this church competed in 1870. It is an easy walk from the wharf area and just several streets from St John’s Church.

reviews.title: 剛好有小嬰兒在受洗
reviews.text: 聖保羅教堂位於卑爾根市中心，那天去參觀完卑爾根大學後，要走回市區剛好都經過這裡，所進去參觀，剛好碰到神父幫小嬰兒在受洗。

name: Elefanten Bar og Cafe

photo.caption: cozy seating for groups of different sizes

description: Beer on draft//Bottled beer//Craft Beer//Wine//DIY Bar Cocktails//Boardgames//Cozy atmosphere//Quiz//Outside seating Snacks//Fun!!!

name: Ethical Travel Portal
description: Ethical Travel Portal is a leading provider of responsible tourism journeys, and we take great pride in our proven ability to customize perfect holidays using local expertise, and to share fabulous experiences we've created over the years

offer_list.title: Bergen - Walk with a local
Norwegian starter - Bergen
Oslo - Walk with a local

name: Mi Casa Tu Casa Tours
description: We recently started a guiding service that you'll love it. It's the most affordable in the city, and it's definitely going to make your experience in Bergen much better. We can currently offer guided tours in 3 languages: English, French and Portuguese.

name: Gallery Katrine Lund
description: Katrine Lund is born in Bergen in 1975. She runs her own gallery situated at Bryggen, in the heart of Bergen. The gallery displays her paintings, drawings, prints and posters. In addition it carries a range of handmade classic clothes for children and adults. The artist is usually in the gallery herself and is happy to tell you about her work or sign any of the prints for you.

name: Henrik Og Pernille
description: Cozy bar with large outdoor seating, in the heart of Bergen. Great selection in quality cocktails, wine and beer.

name: iBedre Helse
description:
Multidisiplinary clinic with muscle therapist, chiropractors, physiotherapist and acupuncturist. We can help with acute and chronic health problems pertaining to the muscle, nervous and skeletal systems. Our team of therapists provide passive therapies including spinal manipulation, shockwave therapy, kinesiotape and soft tissue work
Appointments within 24 hours

name: Take A Hike Bergen
description: Welcome to Bergen, the city surrounded by 7 beautiful mountains. We assume you love amazing scenery traveling here, and so do we(!). We are two young locals with a life long passion for the outdoors and we would very much like to bring you along for a hike in some of these mountains. We firmly believe that the experience at the top is THAT MUCH better if you earn it! * All tours start at the city center.

name: Indisk Emporium
description: 'Bringing you authentic India Organic salon in Bergen Organic personal care products Hand made furniture, decorative, jewelry & clothes.

name: Beleza & Beauty
description: Beleza & Beauty Spa er en skjønnhetssalong/ harstudio som holder til i Asane. Hos oss finner du alle behandlingene under samme tak. Vi tilbyr Slank uten kirurgi: Cryolipolyse, Vela shape, Lipo Laser og RF- cavitation Hair Extensions: Kreatin, Micro link og tape Brazilian Blowout Alle typer voksing Massasje: Hot Stone, klassisk, Lymfedrenasje mm Fotpleie Permanent Makeup Micro Blading Negledesign Ansiktsbehandlinger RF Facelift Anti Age Vippe extensions Farging av bryn og vipper Og mye mer Vi tilbyr skreddersydde og effektive behandlinger som utføres av vare erfarne medarbeidere.

name: Y.yoga
description: Yoga studio located in Bergen city centre, right behind Bryggen! We offer Ashtanga Mysore in the mornings, Vinyasa and Yin lessons. We also offer private lessons for smaller groups and family yoga. Come try us for only 10 euros if you need a relaxing break in between sight seeing or hiking! Contact us if you have any questions, and welcome to Y.yoga.

name: Lokalt - the sustainable experience
description: LOKALT is a place run by an NGO (Bærekraftige Liv Løvstakken) which is into Sustainable and Green Living, among other things. A bohemian artistic space that hosts a wide variety of events, partly thrift shop where you can buy any piece of clothing or a book for 5 kroners, or take part in our garden work, workshops, courses, movie / jam nights, social experiments, potlucks,parties and more. It

name: Bergen Floating

photo.caption:
This is one of our new float rooms.
Here we have the opportunity for music and star light in the ceiling

description: Floating is a unique experience for both body and mind. You get the opportunity to enjoy total relaxation and silence. The good feeling you get is long in the body. Experience weightless condition. We also do different type of massage.

name: Bergen Storsenter
description: Shopping center with 72 shops located in the heart of Bergen with bus station, railway station and car park as our closest neighbors. In the shopping center we also have a liquor store, a pharmacist and a dentist. Some of our stores have extended opening hours both on weekdays and sundays. Welcome to Bergen Storsenter

name: Bergendal gard
description: Bergendal gard is a small farm from 1918. It is run by and for the local community and is very proud of having one of the largest allotment gardens in the country, beehives, free range chickens and regular handcraft activites. The farm is located in a very scenic landscape that makes you feel like you have returned to the 50`s.

name: Vault Studios
description: Gallery and frame shop in the middle of Bergen. Largest private gallery in Bergen, with a focus on street art and contemporary art. Free entrance and everything for sale. Happy to help with shipping.

name: Hipp Hipp
description: The happiest, most energetic bar in all of Bergen. There's always something fun to do here, either you are up for dancing, beer pong, karaoke or just hanging out with friends. At Hipp Hipp the party never ends, and in this surprising venue you can find everything from pinata to cake, and a creative drink menu served by friendly staff.

name: RIBSAFARI Bergen
description: RIBSAFARI BERGEN View the city of bergen from a new perspective, on a high speed RIB adventure
address: Strandkaien 1A The Fish market, Bergen 5013 Norway

name: Fly 5d Kino
description: Fly 5d Kino is an amazing attraction for all family members. You can experience a movie here - it is a fascinating mix of 3d cinema together with moving chairs and real effects as wind, water spray and touching. Ride a virtual roller-coaster, fly with a spaceship or go into a scary movie. You will be definetelly amazed there!
address: Folke Bernadottes vei 52 Oasen kjøpesenter, Bergen Norway

name: Bergen Safari
description: Charter boat sea fishing “Experience the exciting sea fishing outside the spectacular coast of Bergen” North Consult ltd has created a unique fishing / trip concept that will lead to unforgettable adventures and memories. We offer you the best of Norwegian outdoor activities in the most exciting and beautiful landscape. We run the trips with our modern Beneteau Antares charter boat.

name: Hraun Art and Design

photo.caption: Jewelry and leather design on lava field sculpture

description: In Hraun art and design ideas flow in the works of multi artists Gudny Bjork Gudjonsdottir and Kristjan Logason. Nothing is sacred. Neither craft nor design, least of all the space. Shop is not a retail store but art space that still is a studio workspace where everything is for sale and everything is part of the work as a whole, but take on a new life as it is taken out of its context. Art creates space, space creates art.

name: Babu's Yoga House
description: Babu’s yoga house offers a wide range of yoga and meditation classes to cater for everyone without the borders of age, gender and physical conditions. We offer different genres of yoga sessions designed by different masters from across the globe while maintaining the traditional Indian roots. Our vision is to create a space where all can feel inspired to experience the joy.

name: Skin Fuel Tattoo
description: We are a little tattoo shop in the heart of Bergen. We are 3 well rounded artists who are ready to make your ideas into pieces of art. We tend to every style with high quality. Swing by and say hello or get tattoed. Best regards Skin Fuel Tattoo crew

name: Norsebound • Norwegian Motorcycle Ventures

photo.caption: Jotunheimvegen. Over 50kms of gravel deep in the Norwegian wilderness.

description: Discover the breathtaking scenery on the West Coast of Norway from the back of a motorcycle. Guided tours or private bike hire; the choice is yours. Ride main roads, back roads and gravel roads on a three-day fjord, mountain or coastal adventure or rent a motorcycle and explore this wonderful country for yourself.

name: Austrevagen
description: A small swimming spot south-east of Krokeide. A sandy beach, ideal for families. Toilet facilities. Take a left at the top of the hill, just before the descent towards the ferry at Krokeide.
